text: Cumple muy bien con sus caracteristicas, creo que tiene todo para ser una cerveza de venta global.
Bronze dark gold color. Sweet sugar faint caramel aroma. Malty, biscuits n maple syrup, grain, corn, caramel. Finish is somewhere between toffee and macrolager. Drinkable but nothing special.

0,33 l FLasche aus dem E-Center Schuller in Fürth. Orangegold, klar, mit mäßig Kohlensäure, einer cremigen Schaumkrone und eher weniger lacing. In der Nase habe ich Getreide, Malz, Brot. Im Geschmack minimale Süße, angenehm bitter, endend mit einer fruchtigen Hopfenblume
En bouteille de 35.5 cl. Une lager assez bonne qui je trouve ressemble un peu à une pale ale.

Not a great deal going on but absolutely fine for what it is. Faintest hint of malt in an otherwise very lager-y smell, clean, fresh, slight bit of soapiness from bubbles. Well-balanced bitterness and malt through the palate. Looks nice in a bottle, pours nice in a glass.

UPDATED: MAY 28, 2017 can. Poured clear amber with a creamy white head. Floral hop aroma. Light-medium body, creamy carbonation, finishes a bit flat. Malty base, a bit grainy with a sweet caramel flavour, herbal hops with a peppery note. A nice drinkable brew.
Bottle. Aroma is grass, hay, pine. Body is medium, rather sweet, lively carbonation. Quite bitter, a bit fruity. Rather dry palate. Not your European lager, but quite good.
Clear amber with a foamy white head. Yeast, malt and hoppy aroma. Tasteof yeast, malt and hops.
Nice creamy refreshing Vienna style lager. Malt forward with caramel throughout the tasting note.

I hadnt tried this in a long time and was super impressed. To me its much better than back in the day. Lots of good malt flavors, good hopping, almost an ale really. Reminds me of Sam Adams lager and a pale ale, like a combination of tastes of those. First class, it deserves all the success.

Full tasting Brooklyn style lager. Has no aroma, bold taste. Feels like I should be drinking this at a old pub. A beer you have in the middle of a week

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
bottle. not special, but balanced and very easy to drink. standart lager. refresher.

Can. Pours a clear amber with a big foamy white head that leaves a lot of lacing. Aroma of yeast and malt, crisp and floral. Taste is dry and sharp, of bready yeast, grains, and a bit of hoppy bitterness. Lingering malt and hops and ends a bit watery. Very refreshing and tasty.

Originally rated on 12/18/08. A rather strong floral hop presence for a lager, kinda unexpected and nice. Mid amber body, decent carbonation, with a thin off white head that left good lace. Flavors of some sweet malts with a slightly bitter hop finish. Overall it was better than expected and a pretty decent brew
Vollmundig und rezent. Dunkles Malz, leichte Röstaromen und eine kräutrige Hopfung.

12 oz. bottle. Clear amber, off white head. Nose is malt, floral notes, a bit a fruitiness. Taste follows nose, with caramel and some breadiness. Clean finish. Paired well with grilled fish and vegetables. Exceeded my expectations.

35.5cl bottle at home. Pours a clear copper colour with a medium off-white head which recedes to a thin layer and leaves a fair amount of lacing. Aroma of candy sugar, hay, caramel, toffee, citrus. Taste is fairly sweet, light bitter with a soft dry finish. Notes of caramel, malt, yeast, hay, cardboard. Texture is oily, light bodied with average carbonation
Pint from tap at the Lord Nelson (London). Possibly one the best lagers out there. Golden colour, excellent flavour and after taste

Pours amber with a beige head. Aroma and taste is light roasted malt, fruits, floral, hops, caramel. Medium body. Soft carbonation. Light bitter finish.

nice amber red color with a nice foamy head. dont know why bit the smell reminded me on oregano. the taste is fruity but not too much with a slight bitter note at the end. The hop and bitterness are not overlapping . a nice fine lager
Dark clear with thick white foam. Nice aroma of malt, grass and hops. Nice strong taste of hops, malt. Great lager!
Lovely amber larger with a little froth. A little carbonated but makes up for it in its floral taste. A classic that stands up on revisiting it. Lovely beer from a large brewrey.

16 oz can shared by ebone1988. The pourbisba darker golden amber with a bright white head that falls to a thick ring with a few spots of soapy lace. The aroma is sweet up front. There is a light hoppiness to it that is a little strange and lightly messy. The flavor is similar. Its got a sweet caramel maltiness to it and then a light bitter leafy hop. Its a little messy, but not terrible. The mouth feel is a little light and nicely carbonated with a lingeringly sweet finish. Its pretty good.

Can shared with koleminer20. For the book. Aroma is floral, toasty, potpourri, fruity, slight caramel, slight hop presence, sweet but nice. Appearance is amber, slightly clear, off white head. Taste is floral, toasty, sweet, fruity, potpourri, good. Mouthfeel is light to medium body, light crisp carbonation, fruity toasty aftertaste. Overall, this one is pretty damn good.

Can from local Yamaya store. Havent had this for a few years, Nose of caramel, mild floral hops, slight citrus blossom. Dark amber color, creamy white head. Rich caramel initial, mutes somewhat as herbal component takes over in mid palate. Orange marmalade and some pine. Light and pleasant bittering in finish. Well balanced, smooth, and easy. Very rich and malty lager.

12 ounce bottle. Bright Amber orange topped by a small creamy beige head with nice lacing. Nose is toasted malt with floral hops. Flavor is crisp, toasted malt. Faint sweet malt is balanced by spicy hops. Medium bodied with notes of toasted bread in finish. An outstanding beer that is easy drinking.

From a beer hawk mystery case. Pours dark golden. Thin head. Meaty lager. Medium hoppy. Almost like a nice light ale ! Very nice. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Warm dark amber / gold colour. Little head that dissapears pretty fast.
It smells nice and fresh. The same goes for the taste, nicely balanced with fresh hops and malt. Not too bitter, not to fruity. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Malty with light herbal hops and some honey in aroma. In taste sweetish with enough bitterness to balance it (but bit harsh). Nice easy drinking.
light lager aroma. dark gold and clear in color with light head. taste is balanced. faint pine and floral hop notes balanced with light caramel malt flavors.

This is a perfectly good beer-- easy to drink, pretty inexpensive, and frequently available. Pours golden with an aroma of hops- the taste has some very slight bitterness but mostly roasty hops and flowers. Great for Sunday night salad dinners with your boo, listening to the guy from Bobs Burgers parody Blood Sweat and Tears.

355 ml can from Tesco, London (UK). Golden clear colour with moderate white head. Aroma is malt and cereals. Taste is malt, light bitter. The body is light, thin texture. Lively carbonation with bitter finishing.
355ml can. Pours clear copper with a medium-sized white head. Aroma is brown sugar, grassy hops, bread. Taste is malt, caramel, citrus, light bitterness.

From the bottle poured into Lager Glass. Pours clear amber with huge white head and intense lacing. Nose is quite malty for a Lager, slight skunky notes and citrucy to caramel notes. Taste is fresh, clean and malty. Herbal hops that lead to an earl grey or iced tea Finish... I Like it!

The Pour: Pours a light honey-brown. Two finger head (it died down a bit before I got the lighting right for the picture), with nice lacing occurring.

The Bouquet: Smells sweet with caramel, brown sugar, and allspice, cinnamon, and nutmeg, with a touch of vanilla. Smells like what you would expect from a pumpkin pie custard. There is a certain sharpness to the nose as well. From the nose you can tell this beer has a little oomph to it.

The Sip: There is a burst of brown sugar that fades into the pumpkin pie spice and returns in the finish. There is a bit of alcohol bite that gives it a bit of bitterness, which is necessary to balance out the sweetness of the brown sugar. The roasted malt gives Punkin a woody vanilla quality that adds a certain warmth to round out the beer.

Mouth-Feel: Medium to full-bodied brown ale that doesnt overwhelm but still stakes its claim to the taste buds.

Overall: This is a solid choice for a pumpkin seasonal. I would recommend this with turkey or pastrami on rye, or watching the game with relatives on Turkey Day. A very well balanced brew, I would drink this year-round if I could.
Dark golden with a white head. Medium carbonation. Aroma of caramel, citrus and hops. Sweet and sour with a lightly bitter aftertaste. Good session beer.
Flesje gedeeld door Bart. Roodbruin, licht troebel bier met weinig schuim. Aroma en smaak is kruidig en fruitig. Smaak is kruidig en hoppig. Nasmaak is iets bitter.
Brooklyn was one of the first "craft beers" i tried. Dark with abit of a kick to it but very enjoyable.

Birra dal colore ramato. Schiuma fine e mediamente persistente. Allolfatto sentori di luppolo, maracuja, agrumi canditi. Al palato leggera note di luppolo, maracuja, ananas. Nel finale lievemente amara ed erbacea. Una birra che va giù con piacere.

Acheter à Auchan grande synthes (france).
Bouteille de 35,5cl.
Couleur ambrée reflet gold beaucoup de brillance .
Mousse présence mais peu épaisse et qui disparaît progressivement. 
Au nez : cest la levure en dominantes et le céréales ainsi que le houblon. 
En bouche : cest le corps dune lager, aqueuse MAIS de très bonne sensation.
Des notes de malts agréable , le houblon donne un côté aromatique, floral et fruité type poire je trouve .
Pour une lager le corps est parfait , la longueur également .

0.355l bottle. Malty aroma, caramel, hopy notes, light floral notes. Hazy amber color, beige head. Malty taste, hopy notes, medium bitter. Medium to full body, oily texture, soft to average carbonation and bitter finish. Very good.
Very nice deep copper colour and a surprising sweet APA style. A good cleanser or modest session ale.

Orange apricot color, slightly hazy, with medium white head; aroma is malty, pilsner, gentle hoppy floral, soft citric, a little tart; taste is sweet malty grainy and toasted, gentle grapefruit, herbal hoppy bitter, low to medium bitter finish; mouthfeel is slightly watery with medium carbonation

From the tap at Grub Burger, selected on a wing and a prayer. Turned out okay. It came in a pint glass a very cordial amber-red with a great head that laced well. Interesting first sample, malty, touch of corn, and a small hit of sweetness at the end. Good session beer. If this is Brooklyns top beer, they are doing it well there.

Bottle. Amber Gold. Tasty all-malt lager with floral bittering hops. Fairly astringent citrus hops over a buttery caramel malty base. More like an ale than a lager. Long bitter hoppy finish. A lager with a hop bite. Decent hoppy lager. (2008)
Pours a dark golden colour with a white head, aroma of citrus, fresh and Sweet taste, easy drinkebale but nothing special

classique. bonne amertume. couleur roussette.
accompagne aisément un repas ou un apéro au gout pas trop puissant

Clean dark gold. Medium head, medium retention. Aroma intensity 3.75/5. Cut grass and hay aroma. A bit of metal in the nose. Heavy bitter. Medium to full body. Fizzy carbonation. Bready aftertaste. The combination of the fizzy carbonation, thin texture and significant body gives it some roughness.
LCI. Bit watery lager, some hop in the flavour. Decent, nothing special, nice when served cold with some chinese food

tastes like dishwater that's been dripped through a box of pine tree needles, this lager disappoints me. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle @ Xian Craft Beer Festival. Pours a slightly hazy orange beer with minimal beige head. Aroma starts fresh with some citrus, then dominated by malty bread and caramel tones. Taste is fresh and sweet with a mild bitter finish. Nice beer, could do with a bit more body.

355ml bottle. Pours a deep amber with an off white head. Nose is roasted and sweet biscuit malt, with a bit of nuts and something spicy/aromatic. Get some hops on the aroma too. Great balance of malt and hops. I get a little hint of pecan pie in with the malts. One of the best Lagers Iv ever tried. Almost like an Ale, IPA hybrid, its certainly craft by any means. Very drinkable. Great stuff.
Aromas of hay, wet grass, and lemon zest. Taste is lemon zest and a touch of grapefruit peel, grassy hops, honey and biscuit malts; then a sweet citrus finish and grassy hop after taste.
A really easy beer to drink. Poured from the keg here in Australia comes out fresh and refreshing.

Strong hoppy aroma, for a lager. The colour, beautiful, is quite dark for a lager. Taste is nothing too strong, but quite bitter and pleasant, for a lager. Very easy to drink, the texture is thin and carbonation ideal, but it has an unusually bitter finish... for a lager. Overall a really well rounded beer of which you could drink gallons without getting tired of it, its pretty awesome. For a lager.
Weak aroma of spices and hops. Bold tastes of hops and bitter with a bitter finish. Decent lager.
Clear orange with a medium head. Hoppy, with citrus, mineral water, malts. Some banana, mango. Sweet lemon mineral in the finish. Good lager
Sald?iai citrusinis kvapas su lengvu kart?liu. Gintarin?s spalvos, putel? greit dingsta. Gaivus lengvu kart?liu pabaigoje.

Pours dark, coppery gold from the bottle. Overall the optic here is noticeably darker than a typical lager. We are left with a big, fluffy head that slowly fades amid evident lacing. The aroma reminds one more of an IPA with its notable floral and tropical fruit notes. Noticeable are hints of pear, melon, honey and caramel. An interesting boquet. Taste is fruity sour and finishes bittersweet with caramel notes. Medium bodied with adequate carbonation. Overall exceptionally well balanced, and a good companion with or without food. I did not think a lager could be this good. Excellent!
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer.
UPDATED: DEC 25, 2016 Bottle. Pours amber with medium white foam. Smells of hops, pine, resin, fruit, sweet malts. It tastes like no other lager I have tried. Delicious for the style.

Backlog. Synchronizing with notes and Untappd.
Strong american hops aromas of citrus fruit and resin, very nice bitterness level.

0.33 l bottle from local REWE, best before July 2017. Clear, amber with a medium large, frothy, almost stable, off-white head. Sweetish, moderately fruity, quite resiny and a bit soapy aroma of orange jam, mango and pine. Slightly bitter, a bit malty, fruity, quite resiny and slightly grassy taste of orange jam, mango, lots of pine, a touch of caramel and hints of straw, followed by a medium long, moderately bitter, quite resiny and a bit grassy finish. Medium body, smooth and slightly effervescent mouthfeel, average carbonation. Very tasty, a bit soapy in the aroma though. Still a very pleasant and refreshing beer!

Clear amber with medium white head. Aroma is some doughy malt, with lots of fruity hoppy stuff above, honey, maybe peach, maybe some slight flowers as well. Taste is medium IPA bitterness without the clogging resin, citrus pip sour/bitterness, and some fruity sweetness. Nice and balanced, easy to drink. Everything fine with this one.

Bright balanced beer. I like more malty beers but this was a good alternative for a warmer day. Nothing outstanding but it's quaffable 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Kinda shocked Ive never gotten around to trying this, but, then again, lagers generally arent my thing. Still, if Im gonna drink a lager, theres much worse to be found than Brooklyns. Drinks like the beer you wish you were drinking when you have an inferior American macro or crappy Euro beer. Workmanlike; no frills but none are needed. Bready, semisweet malts lead into a floral, easygoing but firm hop bitterness. What you want in a lager, no more, no less.

From 330ml bottle. Amber in colour with white head which soon faded. Bready, bit of citrus. Perfectly decent lager

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draft at Barcade, Amber gold clear appearance with a fitting white head and alright lace. Smell and taste of clean and corny lager, toast, grain, faint hops, and wood. Always liked this beer when Im in a pinch, its clean lager that does the job and isnt that costly.

Bottle @Cool Bun. Amber with tiny bubbly off-white head. Sweet sugary aroma. Medium full body, bitter-sweet taste. Ok for a lager, but nothing very special.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle from a tesco in Bristol. Pours clear Amber. Nose is faint citrus and bread. Low but long carbonation. Palate is bread, a bit watery. Finish is fruit and bitter. A nice Lager
Its unfussy. Nothing complicated but a really good beer that you know you will enjoy every time you have one.

Bottle from Coop.  Treacle aroma sweetening to Barley Sugars and finally Ice Cream Soda. Clear deep copper. Toffee apples and popcorn finishing on bitter hops taste. Smooth and creamy with high carbonation. A smooth and refreshing lager. Very nice indeed.
Nothing more than american lager. Nothing special similar to the budwiser and stuff. Maybe I dont enjoy american lager...

Brooklyn Lager is not a classic lager, that makes people think about a boring commercial pale lager. Its lager in the way is made. It pours golden/orange, minimal head. Floral hops aroma, with notes of caramel and citrus. Body is well balanced between maltiness (caramell, bread) and hops (floral, piney, dry). Easy to drink, perfect with a pizza, as I did, bitter finish.

330ml bottle. Nice amber-golden colour, fine white lager head, this is my imagine of right foam. Malty aroma, there is caramel and bitter aromas too. Flavour of starting bitters, continue some caramel, citrus and hoppy aromas and finnishing with bitterness and floral feels. Congrats US! Very good lager style beer!
Ljusgul med fint skum. Doftar malt och lite humligt. Smaken välbalanserad med finstämda malttoner. Eftersmaken hyggligt lång med fin beska. God.
Bottle- pours amber with a big loose head. Aroma is light sweet caramel malt. Taste is cereal malt sweet up front with a dryer caramel malt finish.

07/10/16 at a Brooklyn event, Wine Rack, West Byfleet. When this was rolled out realised the event may be less interesting than I thought it would be. Light sweet hoppy/malty aroma. Medium amber. Frothy white head. Bitter, hoppy. Sweet finish. Soft, lighy bodied.
UPDATED: OCT 6, 2016 Aroma: realy soft smell appear: light brown with almost no fome Taste: pretty dark for a lager. Platen: realy weak after taste.

Bottle @ home with Muts51. Aroma is quite bland and doesnt give much away about the beer. Looks clear but a bit cloudy with an amber colour, no head. Taste is quite bitter and not particularly outspoken otherwise. Quite heavy for a lager though. Overall, very unexciting but not bad either.

10/20 ok but a bit too malty for my taste. Tastes a bit better when it warms up a wee bit

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Nice bottle but without detail information about the malts, hops and drinktemperature on the labels.
Cloudy amber beer with a very nice cream-colored head, heavy bitter, the first smell is fruity, medium body, oily, light caramel and roasty, hops are dominated, long finish, very good, 
(I have 0.355l bottle)
0.5l on tap. Amber color with thick off-white head. Lots of lacing. Taste is mild.

Nez très caramel, quasiment barley wine mais en léger. Un très très léger fond houblonné plutôt agrumes mais difficile à réellement identifier.
Attaque maltée en bouche, rapidement plus sèche et très très légèrement amère avec les notes dorange amère. Longueur fine, discrète mais relativement du même cru.
13-09-16 // 330ml bottle. Orange colour, small head. Nice hoppy aroma, with some citrus and flower notes. Light body.
Flowery, malts, hints of caramel, beautiful amber beer with a good white head quite persistant, light body, very refreshing, perfect carbonation...a splendid dream in Brooklyn.

Tap @ Astrastube, Berlin - Golden color with a touch of copper, creaming, disappearing head. Thick body, aromas of red berrys, floral hops, a bit soapy. Medium bitter finish. Dull mouthfeel. I miss the crisp freshness.

12oz bottles and a few times draught near source 2010-2014. - Recently had the chance to revisit this at non-luxury ransoms now that Carlsberg Germany has taken over distribution from Radebergers swanky Braufactum and it has emerged in my local Edeka supermarket. - Cool copper pour, decent enough foam. Biscuity toast, wet spruce, woody bitter lemon and a thin layer of dry mineral toffee caramels poised against each other for excellent balance in aroma - a notch less malty (and geared more towards India Pale Lager) than Samuel Adams Boston Lager. - Thin toasted caramel biscuit body, all crisp for a session. - In terms of modern Viennas, Boston Lager has more caramel and rougher herbal hop edge, Berlins Lemke Original more malt character. Refreshing and crisp, excellent sessioner that appears to travel well despite the obvious IPA-dryhopping leanings.
Bottle. Orange to amber color, medium white head. Aroma of malt, caramel, citrus hops. Solid malty base followed by caramel with long citrusy hoppy finish. Easy drinkable, refreshing, nice balanced

Appearance : light amber color small white head
 Aroma : a little hoppy smell
 Taste : sweet bready caramel with hops citrus
 Palate : sweet and creamy mouthfeel light medium body average carbonation
 From Brooklyn Brewery in USA 
Amber Lager
Light amber colour. Small head. Hoppy aroma. Hoppy fresh taste. Medium to high bitterness for a. Lager like this. Nice

Piwo klarowne w kolorze bursztynowym z bardzo skromna piana tworzace ledwo co obraczke wokol szkla. W aromacie czuc lekkie owoce, troche kwiatow i trawy cytrynowej. W smaku bardzo lekko, troche karmelu i może rodzynek. Dosc slodowe z wysyceniem na srednim poziomie i goryczka na srednio niskim. Wyszlo naprawde dobrze jak na lagera.
Flasche, gibts jetzt bei Edeka im Bahnhof Friedrichstraße in Berlin. Bernsteinfarbend, etwas Schaum. Aroma Fruchtig, Mango, Mandarine, Geschmack: etwas herb, Koriander, Hopfen. Sahnebonbon

473ml can from LCBO. Pours a fairly large frothy off-white head and has a golden amber appearance. Has some nice sticky lacing. Aromas of earthy hops, caramel malt hints. Flavours are sweet, bready and caramel malts with some notes of earthy and resin hops. Nice smooth and creamy mouthfeel. Somewhat excessive carbonation. Medium bodied. Great retention. Pretty good.
From bottle in NYC. Golden, amber. Aroma of malt, and nicely hoppy for a lager. Not bad.

From bottle, pours a clear deep golden color with a bone white head. The smell is floral, toasted malt, little fruit hanging around. The taste is floral, citrus, grassy, toasted malt backbone ending crisp and a bit dry. Light+ in body and slightly over average as to carbonation level.

AROMA-Medium malty, light caramel, light maillard, light toasted bread. Hop aroma is mild floral. Light fruity.

APPEARANCE-Deep gold. Very clear.

FLAVOR-Medium-low malt sweetness. Light floral hop flavor. Light fruity flavor with prune. Medium bitterness. Balance almost even with slightly bitterness. Finish is light malty. Aftertaste is moderate malty, light alcohol and light bitterness last.

MOUTHFEEL-Medium body, smooth. Medium carbonation, crisp.

OVERALL-Refreshing.
Klares Bernstein mit reichlich Schaum. Malzig, etwas süßlich, ein wenig Karamell, leicht fruchtig, Orangen, würzig, leicht bitter.
330 ml bottle. Pours amber with a decent white head. Nice aroma with notes of peach. Taste malty with not much of a bitterness. Low carbonated. Very decent lager.
Kohtalaisen tumma väri vaaleaksi lageriksi. Paksu, pienikukkainen vaahto, hedelmäinen haju. Vahva maku. Helppo juotava, hyvä lager.
Tap. Orange with lasting head. Aroma is malt, sweet malts and some fruity hops. Sweet malt dominates the taste, but citrus hops present and a slightly bittter aftertaste. Very decent lager.

For me, this is a gateway beer to introduce a timid lager drinker to something with more hops and flavour. Out of the can it poured a clear medium copper colour. I experienced notes of caramel, hop aromatics, canned peaches, orange peel, and dried apricot, turning more biscuity in the palate. Creamy and refreshing.

UPDATED: AUG 6, 2016 355ml can BB 14/1/17
Grainy malt aroma,
Poured light amber gold with light head.
Mild bitterness is followed by a grainy malt finish with a slight metallic note.
Not bad at all.

33cl bottle. Pours a clear amber color with a white head. Nose is light malt, some floral character, some yeast, and some mild bitterness. Flavor is similar with malt, floral, some mild bitterness, and yeast. Light to medium in body. A very good lager.
Golden yellow on the darker side. As often in the Brooklyn-aromaa a touch of tropical fruit. Fresh and tasty. Bready. Great lager.
Bernsteinfarben mit leichter Trübung, perfekter Dreiklang aus Caramel-Malzkörper, Bitterhopfen und Cascade-typischem Grapefruit-/ Zitrusaroma. Leicht bitter und fruchtig erfrischend im Abgang.

In Mund und Nase ein schönes Spiel zwischen Würzigkeit und Blumigem Cascade Hopfen. Eine Karamellmalzigkeit lässt sich auch erahnen. Es ist nicht zu trocken aber teotzdem noch Lager... Für mich sehr gelungen ;)

Bottle. Pours a slightly hazy orange beer with a medium sized white head on top. Aroma of caramel, leafy hops, some grassy notes. Flavor is bittersweet, malty, hints of caramel again and some dried fruits. Some notes of biscuits in there as well. Softly carbonated, short light bitter finish. Decent.

Reminds me of a Northern German Pils Style. Pronounced bitterness, round body, golden amber colour with a white head. 
Malty noise with some fruitiness in the background.
Bottle at home. Pours hazy amber with a decent white head. Aroma is bready, a bit of caramel and hops. Taste has a little hint of sourness, bit of fruits and bread, malt and hops. Nice beer.
bread, resin, herbs, clove, soy sauce, pale, golden, amber, clear, frothy, tan foam, light sweetness, lightly bitter, salty, light body, oily feel, creamy, average carbonation, bitter,

On tap. Pours a slightly hazy medium amber with a large, creamy, long lasting, off-white head that leaves plenty of lacing. Sweet aroma of caramel malt, fruity hops and bread. Sweet flavour of caramel malt, citrus and bread with a dry, mildly bitter, hoppy finish. Light body with a watery texture and soft carbonation. Very good for the style.

Bottle 0.355L.
Slightly hazy copper body with a large, frothy-to-creamy, off-white head, mostly lasting with nice lacing.
Moderate-to-heavy hoppy (citrus) and light malty (grains) aroma with notes of fruits.
Moderate sweet and bitter flavour with some taste of bread the finish.
Light-to-medium body with watery texture; average carbonation.
Draft. Dark orange with no head. Aroma is mild, caramel, fruits, barley(?). Flavour of caramel malts, slight hops, earthy notes and some fruits. Light bitterness.

Orange, smell from honey and bread.
Sweet caramel taste, fine bitter hoppy taste.

33 cl bottle @ home. Orange beer, minimal beige head. Aroma starts fresh with some citrus, then dominated by malty bread and caramel tones. Taste is fresh and sweet, with a mild bitter finish. Nice beer, could do with a bit more body.
bouteille 33 cl - couleur ambrée, nez houblonné, goût fruité et houblonné, agréable
Sarà ormai diventata di moda e commerciale ma trovo che rimane una delle migliori birre da supermercato.

UPDATED: JUL 8, 2016 Golden colour, nice head and laces, clear.
Aroma: hoppy fruits/zest/spice balanced with bread/malt.
Taste: hoppy bitterness slightly upfront, some maltiness.
Palate: medium-dry, high carbonation, no excess alcohol.
Overall a very palatable hop centric lager.

UPDATED: JAN 17, 2017 0.33l bottle from kaisers in berlin/charlottenburg, 5.99/6pack. also from marktkauf/edeka.
aroma of caramel, fruity and woody hops. flavour of malts, bread, spices, citrus, spruce, wood. a bit sour. strong carbonation. quite interesting and complex vienna lager.

Flasche (33 cl) aus einer Kaisers-Filiale, Berlin. - Kupferbraun, klar. - In der Nase sehr angenehme Hopfenaromen: Harz, Erde, dazu Karamel. - Antrunk mild karamelmalzig mit schön hintergründigen herbfruchtigen, harzig-erdigen Hopfenaromen. Durchschnittlich rezent, schlank. Schön trockener Abgang mit milder aber aromatischer, leicht holziger Herbe. - Für ein Lagerbier außerordentlich aromatisch (wenngleich gar nicht sehr stark) gehopft, dabei leicht zu trinken; spritzig und enorm erfrischend. Klasse!
Bottle at bar. Sharp but inviting aroma. Hoppy, crisp, and refreshing while avoiding a watery palate, but perhaps a little one-dimensional.

Burk från SB. Klar bärnstensfärgad åt det lite mörkare hållet med högt blekgult skum som lämnar små rester på kanterna. En lätt och fräsch doft av citrus, lite kakdeg, citroncheesecake, eventuellt lite persika. Lätt kropp. Smakmässigt ungefär vad som förväntas. Lite blommig. Något fylligare än vanlig lager, även en lätt beska i avslutningen. Helt ok.

Well, its not bad, but after having my first lager in years yesterday (Ayinger dortmunder) and being super-excited about what I might be missing, this was a slight letdown. That stuff is fantastic btw. This pours a clear amber with almost-dissipated bone-white top that does cling a bit. Aroma is floral and slightly hoppy in a funky way, not what Id expected. Flavor is better with more malt getting a grip - a nice biscuit - but still slightly overbalanced by the hop. Finish is on the semisweet which is okay by me.

Clear deep honey/amber color with small slightly off white foam. Aromas initaly of light hops then malt in a way smelling like barley wine (smells like it would be strong beer?) although quite simple and resinous aromas but nice. Palate, medium body with mouthcoating texture leaving smooth maybe with hints of booze malty finish. Taste is sweet of malt with some hints of light malts being used, has somewhat stronger beer taste to it. Overall, not bad, interesting one thing that really threw me off it tasted like some beers of 7% and over that I had? There fore I am not sure and start to doubt my tastebuds.... But give it a go it is still nice! Although as geting through the bottle taste mellows out leaving afterteases of caramalt and biscuit malt.

Bottle from The Epicurean Hotel. Pours a clear amber color with a white head. Nose is light malt, some floral character, some yeast, and some mild bitterness. Flavor is similar with malt, floral, some mild bitterness, and yeast. Light to medium in body and nice lager overall.

F: huge, off-white, good retention.
C: amber, orange to coopery, clear with many small particles.
A: malty, floral hoppy, bready, caramel, light fruity.
T: malty, good floral grassy bitterness, hint of bready and biscuit, light citrus, tangerine, fresh and drinkable, medium body, decent carbonation, pleasant, well balanced and tasty, 355ml bottle from AH supermarket in Amsterdam.
355ml botlle from Asda. Pours a lively copper with a minimal off white head. Aroma is toasted malt. Taste is malty and earthy, a hoppy bitterness coming through. Very flavourful for a lager.

12 oz bottle poured into a tulip pint glass. Best by August 2016. Courtesy of my Uncle from New York. Clear golden orange with off-white head. Aromas of malt, wheat, some citrus, a little corn. Tastes of light citrus, wheat, malt, a little corn. Light body with a dry finish. Good lager.
Kind of a bogus review--I have notes from a quick trip to New York, but I cant really read them except low 3. Certainly didnt stand out, but nothing in the notes to say it wasnt good.
Bottle on the train home from PNE vs QPR. Aroma is is caramel, brown sugar, citrus. Taste us big sweetness, caramel, hoppy dryness. Hand down the best lager Ive tasted.

toasty malt and bread crusts at the front. Lime-like citrus then follows through to the back with earthy hop bitterness. Finishes fairly dry, dusty and slightly spicy. Its unlike any other lager Ive drunk, but theres nothing showy or flahy, its a solid meat-and-potatoes beer done really well.

Orange color with white head. Aroma is malty, earthy hops. Taste is malty, earthy-hoppy, but no caramel or other standard amber flavours. Refreshing, low carbonation. Admittedly good and well-balanced. Nice.
Vienna clássica e deliciosa. Aroma floral com amargor médio e agradável. Boa drinkability e ótima experiência!
Its a Lager by name. It tastes much more like an IPA to me. The bitterness is atypical in this style. I can see its popularity, but when I drink a Lager I expect it to be a little more rounded out.
Very complexed lager. Amber to copper color, white head. Start is loaded with malt, sweet, dry aftertaste.
Too light, too crisp, over carbonated. Never again. I will go back to Yuengling.
Clear copper color with foam layer. Decent malty nose. Calm earthy hoping, surprising fresh malt and a sweet finish. Light dry and malty aftertaste. Very well balanced.

Kolor: pomara?czowy, miedziany, klarowny. Piana w kolorze z?amanej bieli, sztywna, zbita i trwala. ?adnie zdobi szklank?.
W aromacie s?odowo??, karmel, lekka owocowo??.
Smak: karmel, skórka od chleba,  zbyt s?odko by piwo by?o orze?wiaj?ce.
Goryczka: lekka, sucha. Wysycenie: wysokie.

Poured from a 12 OZ bottle into a pint glass.The appearance is a amber to almost copper color with a large white head. The aroma was citrus and floral hops. The taste included a slight citrus and hop bite, really enjoyable.

Presenta bronce oscuro muy trasparente con media corona de espuma blanca de burbuja grande y aspecto jabonoso, buena retención; aromas a malta, ligera galleta, caramelo, herbal y pan tostado; en boca entrada media, refrescante con ligero amargor, que torna a seco en el retrogusto, cuerpo medio y carbónico ligeramente alto, interesante lager fácil de beber y ajustada a su estilo.
From bottle at Appellation Wines clear light amber. Floral nose with aromas of toast, resin and butterscotch. Taste follows nose.
Keg at spitfire. Pours clear golden, nose is floral, sweet toffee, grassy, taste is similar, dry.

Deep golden colour, tow fingers head that fades soon, leaving a good lace.
Aroma of herbs, citrus, fruits, notes of caramel. Medium body and average carbonation. Tasteof citrus, fruits, perpery, notes caramel. Dry finish.

Kolor: Piękny bursztynowy w pełnej krasie. W 100% klarowny. 
Piana: Biało-żółta zbudowana z drobnych pęcherzyków. Jak na dobrego lagera przystało biegnie w górę bardzo szybko i powoli opada. Lacing nieprzeciętny. 
Zapach: Wyraźnie słodowy.
Przypieczona skórka od chleba, karmel, delikatnie ciasteczkowy. 
Smak: W smaku jest podobnie jak w zapachu. Mieszanka słodowych akcentów z tymi chmielowymi. Karmel i skórka od chleba.
Goryczka wyczuwalna z chmielowym finiszem.
Profil bardzo czysty, orzeźwiający i bardzo gładki. 
Wysycenie : Wysokie. 
Podsumowanie:  

Browar Brooklyn Brewery z Nowego Jorku jest znanym na całym świecie nowojorskim browarem założonym w 1988 roku. 
Brooklyn Lager to jego flagowy produkt.

W serwisie RateBeer piwo znajduje się obecnie na 10 miejscu na świecie w tej szerokiej i chyba najpopularniejszej kategorii.
Jeśli ktoś chciałby spróbować jak smakuje prawdziwy Lager - to jest to doskonały przedstawiciel stylu.
Łączy on w sobie karmelowe i chlebowe aromaty z słodowo-chmielowym smakiem z wyraźną orzeźwiającą goryczką.
Zdecydowanie warty spróbowania!
UPDATED: FEB 13, 2016 En riktigt god lager! Snygg gyllenmörk färg. Lagom beska men god "clean" smak ändå med humle i förgrunden.
It is a nice lager. The color is copper typical than a pale ale and the hop is relatively strong for a amber vienna. The foam is weak and the sensation in mouth is nice.

Bottiglia da 0,355.schiuma scarna e poco persistente. Carbonatura appena eccessiva. Colore ambrato. Aroma penetrante e durevolmente aspro con forti sentori di arancio. Gusto leggermente affumicato e legnoso. Finale lungo ed amaro. Consiglio 6/10
Decent, dark orange lager. Nice mouthfeel, malty backbone. Could drink this all day long. Very nice.

Helder amberkleurig bier met witte snelzakkende schuimkraag.
Mout en hop in de neus.
Smaak is bitterder dan verwacht.
Licht mondgevoel met droge afdronk en bitterige nasmaak.

Every medium except for from a can somehow. This is my favorite beer though, my go to, probably my most consumed and purchased over the time Ive been drinking beer so far. Very attractive amber/dark gold body, creamy head, crisp and clean taste, good balance of caramel, roastiness, and floral hops. Much more colorful and flavorful and just all around way better tasting than most American lagers, especially the macros and standards. Fantastic.

Consistently competent. Brooklyn Lager is a mainstay for the fridge and rarely disappoints when you want a no fuss, honestly decent beer.

Hopp y enough to be noticable without taking itself too seriously, Love the nutty malts and the slight citrus finish.

Not a big hitter, but thats why I like it. Its basic and genuinely good for it.

Bottle. Slightly cloudy orange with thin white head. Not much for aroma, only some floral and malty notes. Medium body and medium-high carb. Fruity and slightly sweet with crisp finish. Very enjoyable lager.

12/30/15 - Chicago (Bottle poured into glass)

Golden pour with a generous white foam head and mild carbonation.Aromas of grass and hops. Carmel malt taste, very smooth and pleasant feel and easy going down. Overall very good beer.

Excellente lager houblonnée et superbement aromatique.Corps médium présent, belle robe ambrée limpide, arômes dagrumes et de fruits jaunes.

Sympa.

Not sure how Ive never rated this. Tap at Project Parlor, Brooklyn. Pours amber with a big frothy head. Aroma is citrus, and nice sort of German malts. Flavor is similar, great balance between malts and hops actually despite that cliché. Its good. Years ago, I loved this and then realized it wasnt great but its a solid beer. As far as a staple goes, much less a lager, its good. I still dig it. Its light, its very easy drinking.

355ml Bottle from Tesco, Dragonville, Durham. 

Coppery amber with a rocky, diminishing, off-white head and lively carbonation. Gassy nose with light citrus fruits and that slightly caramel noble hop-style tinge. Really crisp, bitter taste with a solid, beefy maltiness that sets it apart from many other lagers. Its not sweet, its not sickly and it strikes a good balanced of being refreshing and leaving the mouth wanting for more. Very light toffee, bread and citrus flavours. Lively on the palate. This is a rarity - A lager I will gladly go back to.
Clear amber pour with a short-lived white head. Smells malty, of caramel and mashed grains. The taste is more bitter than the nose suggested, but well within the amber ale style. A decent beer.

Złote, klarowne. Piana kremowa, drobna, dość obfita. 
W aromacie intensywne nuty lagerowe, plus trochę zboża. 
W smaku goryczka, na początku dość ostra, potem przechodzi w łagodniejszą. 
Nie jest wysoka, ale wyraźna. Nie dominuje, znów wyczuwalne słody, plus lekka nuta kwiatowa. 
Niskie wysycenie. 
Jak na lagera bardzo udane.

Light, crisp and refreshing. Hoppy for a lager. Sweet bready aroma followed by a light bitterness. Theres something about this that makes me actually want to drink a lager. Most are usually middle of the road to pretty bad but this one is definitely solid. The hoppier take on it definitely is a plus.

Bottle at Bromma airport 151217.
Dark amber with lacing white head. Malty nose. Sweet malty palate with bread and some bitterness. Not so hoppy though. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Flaske. Farven er kobber til gylden brun og skumkronen er hvid og let og flygtig. Aromaen er citrus, karamel malt og humle, medens smagen er græs, hø og let humle.

Clear orange-ish color. Low to medium carbonation. Complex aroma. Nice fruitiness from the amber malts, bready. Bright American hops. A bit of potato? Fairly dry, with a good dose of light toast. Nice grassy, hoppiness in the finish. Refreshing. A very good lager.
Fles van Albert Heijn. Zonnatura glutenvrij biologisch volkoren smaakje. Moutzacht en schuimig, met vleugje perzik.Backlog from 2015/03/25.

On tap at Cahilty Creek. Clear bright orange copper, firmer white foam settles and lasts. Solid toasted caramel lager malt aroma and taste, citrus hint, some grassy hop. Average carbonation, light bodied, lightly hopped. LF (Lagerboy Friendly)

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours clear copper. Aroma is malty, bready. Malty taste, some hop kick. Almost nutty. Not the most flavorful beer, but a solid lager.
Cest un truc un peu traînant, qui hésite, qui ne sait pas trop vers quoi aller. Vague et Lassant.

This is what a lager should be; light fresh refreshing and crisp. So no to corn syrup, rice, diluted hop extract and the skunk provided from green bottles. Instead enjoy the presence of hops and the crisp fresh bitterness they provide, enjoy a malt backbone that somehow is light; full and which allows the hops to shine, all the same time. I am prone to hyperbole: but this could be the best lager Ive had. The perfect recommendation to someone new to crafy beers

UPDATED: SEP 1, 2016 Re-Rate: Aroma of biscuit-dough, solid maltiness, a bit of caramel, some light citrus fruit, floral hops. Taste us  more sweet than bitter. I found that it leaves a kind of soapy aftertaste. Pours a nice amber, light medium body, with medium to stale carbonation. Solid, but could have been fresher.

330ml bottle poured a fine golden brown & frothy with a mild malty grassy aroma the taste is crisp citrus dry lightly hopped caramel malty quite a unique pleasant tasting lager finishing refreshing & quite dry
Bottle from Systembolaget. Golden pour with small white head that dissipates quickly. Aroma of citrus, grass, grain and hay. Taste of citrus, grass, hay and light grain. Well balanced and clean.

Pours clear amber with a frothy, yet stable white head. Nice lacing. Nice aroma of hops and yellow fruits, some raisins as well, yeasty, slightly malty. Flavor lacks a bit, compared with the aroma. It is a bit on the watery side of the palate and it tends to taste watery as well. Yet, it is not that bad. The hoppiness, mild bitterness and that slight fruity and yeasty kick have a beautiful thirst quenching character and it is actually pretty lovely to drink in comparison to other lagers. Texture is like mentioned before a bit on the watery side. Could have had a tad more body as well, but thats something which is common among lagers. But in general a well-crafted and well-balanced brew. Certainly enjoyable.

Bottle - A bit hazy orange colour, small but persistent ccreamy off-white head. Fresh hop aromas, lemon zest, grass, herbal notes with some cereals and bread. Taste is sweet malty with biscuit, honey, and a bit caramelly tones, then gentle hop bitterness comes. Fruity hops, grapefruit, mango, some grassy notes. Medium body and carbonation, slick texture, dry and moderate hoppy finish. A very nice easy drinkable hoppy lager.

This is simply one of the Best largers around! Fresh from hops but still malty

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
UPDATED: NOV 29, 2015 Bottle. 0,355l. Price 0.99 Geras, skanus, alus. Jeigu ne kaina būtų galima vartoti danai

14.11.2015-0,355L bottle. Orange to amber body with lively carbo/ huge white head. Floral/fruity aroma. Bit malty, floral with soft rising bitterness in the finish, great balance. Good and quaffable beer.
UPDATED: NOV 6, 2015 1Pint Flasche. Helles Kastanienfarbenes Bier mit beigem Schaum. Malz und Grapefruit Duft. Kräftiger Geschmack. Malz, Toffee und Citrus. Tolles Bier.
Deep amber to light orange in color and fairly cloudy. Aroma of citrus. Light, crisp, and tart mouth.

Med toasted malts and caramel aroma, stone fruits and toasted bread low. Low hops characters, hearty and herbal. Low dms, no diacetyl. Yogurt and lactic aroma. Deep god with ruby notes in colour. Below average and off white foam. Med low astringency. Too low aftertaste, and low malty-caramel notes. Dry finish and low in body.

Flaska brooklyn brewery nyc. Guldig vätska. Doft av citrus och gräs.
I smak känns citrus, lite tall och äpple

Una lager negli States? Non ci sono più gli indiani di una volta!!
Una birra ambrata con una schiuma fine, ma non presentissima. Al naso si sente luso dei luppoli americani, anche se il malto Vienna attenua un po lagrumato.Al palato è molto fresca e beverina con lamaro ed il dolce che vanno a braccetto, invitando a lunghe bevute. Buon prodotto, ma è lAmerica che non ti aspetti.
Bottle at home, thnx mom :), amber beer, small head, aroma is malt, caramel some fruit, taste is the same, not bad.

355ml bottle into schooner glass. Caramel malt nose, a little fruit perhaps. Hazy bronze beer with solid white head. Light and lazy carbonation. Crisp and hoppy at first then floral notes take over. Finish is cleansing resin bitterness with distant malt background. Very pleasant beer.

Draft 0.5l at the Belgrade Beer Fest 2015 Serbia.19.08.2015.Carlsberg stand.Pour it dark hazy amber color with small white head.Aroma of malt, caramel, spices, finished bread and malty.Noce balanced light and drinkable.

A somewhat cloudy, honey-colored beer with a compact firm layer of foam. It has an apple-sour aroma like that of an IPA, but with a fruity sweetness in the background. It tastes quite bitter, and moves on into a subtile bittersweet aftertaste.

Een ietsjes troebel, honingkleurig bier, met een compacte kraag. Het aroma is appelzuur zoals die van een IPA, maar met een fruitige zoetigheid op de achtergrond. De smaak is bitter, maar dit gaat over in een subtiele, bitterzoete nasmaak.

Bottle, 0.355l. Pours cloudy orange amber with thin creamy off-white head and average sparkling appearance. Aroma of cereals, toasted malt, nuts, flowers and citrus. Taste starts with moderate sweet toasted malt, follows grassy and mild citric with dry mouthfeel and moderate bitter finish. Medium body, slick texture and average carbonation in palate. Refreshing and malty lager...
Can 355ml. Amber with a thick white head. A truly good lager, one of the favourites. Balanced malty sweetness with quite hoppy notes. Long finish with flowers, fruit and bitterness.
Amber color, small head. Aroma malt, grain, hops, floral. Taste malt, peppermint, citrus, medium body, some bitterness.

Review based on the BJCP2015 guidelines (style 2B). Bottle 35.5 cl - Batch 0055. AROMA: moderate grainy, caramely-toasty aroma with a slight spicy hop note. clean lager profile. no DMS. APPEARANCE: golden ambar and slightly hazy. off-white head with average retention. TASTE: moderate caramely-toasty flavour with a slight herbal hop note. moderate-low bitterness, balanced with the malt. finishes slightly dry. clean fermentation profile. PALATE: light body with medium carbonation. OVERALL: a nice style example of a international amber lager.

UPDATED: MAR 6, 2016 Clean copper with a thin bubbly head. Floral grassy hops and caramel, toasted grains malty base. Medium sweet, moderately bitter and rather short finish. Prickly carbonation, watery to oily. Quite a good amber lager. And available in some French hypermarkets.

Bottle. Pours copper with a thin white head and lots of carbonation. Nice aroma, grassy and floral. A bit of sweetness up front and steady hop bitterness throughout finishing light, dry, and almost watery. A lot more flavor than the normal lager and lots of hops makes for an almost light pale ale.
Aus der Flasche, schöner hopfig fruchtiger Geruch, hopfig herb im Geschmack, für ein Lager richtig viel Charakter

Carrefour Grenoble 2.65. 
On ne sait jamais quoi attendre des bières américaines, mais celle-ci est intéressante. Le nez est puissant, le goût suit, très florale.
355ml bottle. Copper coloured, small head. Malty, caramel, hoppy aroma. Taste of malt and hops, caramel notes. Great American lager. 28th April 2015.
Pours a yellow glass of beer. A pretty decent Lager with a refreshing aroma of dry hops.

Pours a nice pale amber with fluffy off white head. Aromas are somewhat vinous, fruity, like a light barley wine. Flavors are roasty, slightly nutty, caramel, plus light hop bitterness that lingers. Mouthfeel is fairly thin, making it easy to drink. Considerably more interesting than I expected.
35,5 cl bottle from Vinmonopolet. Pours almost golden clear with a small white head. Aromas of malts and hops. Taste is medium bitter with a sweet aftertaste. Good lager from Brooklyn.
Pours golden medium white head. Taste is medium sweet. Medium body, light hop bitterness. nice lager.
Decent brew with a moderate amount of hops, some body and certainly a solid take on the style. If pricing has a part to play, this is also a plus...
Bottle. Pours dark amber with a foamy head. Aroma is of malts and a hint of caramel. Taste is hops and malts. One of the nicer lagers around.
Probably my fav beer, hoppy but not over the top good balance and refreshing.
I love this beer! My go to lager whenever I am at a liquor store. Delicious, smooth and refreshing.

- Look: Copper
- Nose: Hint of toffee; tiny hint of roast coffee grounds.
- Body: Nice amount of hop upfront, then mild lager malt.
- Finish: crisp but not-too-dramatic English-bitter style end. Slightly more herbal than Brooklyn East India Pale Ale.
- Decent, non-too-dramatic, copper brew that is possibly more Viennese or English bitter than evocative of Brooklyn, let alone lager! Nice #1001Beers
Draft. Pours golden medium white head. Taste is medium sweet. Mild aroma of grass, hay, and bread. Medium body, light hop bitterness. Overall nice lager.

Color naranja oscuro, con poca espuma. Aroma a cebada. Sabor en donde predomina la malta, con un pequeño toque amargo al final. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Pours Amber with off-white head. Aroma is malty, slight subtle hops, grain. Taste is sweet malty at first, nutty and light bitter finish. Malty and some toast and bread. Smooth and crisp. Light bitter hops in finish.

UPDATED: JUN 11, 2016 Best commercial lager in the world. Lager is probably the worst type of beer, but this one is more like IPA ora APA. Darker colour than any other lager in the world, red dark orange gold. Small light beige top. Nice taste, bitter finish. Also nicely carbonate. I do not know why it is called Vienna lager, because it is really good American type of beer. Sometimes Americans think that Eu name is something more precious.
Amber coloured lager. Dry hop taste, touches of citrus. Clear taste of malt.

0,355l bottle from beerbottle.eu. Flat taste, bitter finish. Not bad, but really no sensation. Overrated.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Vraiment pas hyper fan du goût, il y a un truc qui me gêne, bière bu à la pression...

Clear dark amber body, tiny white head. Aroma of citrus, flowers, light caramel notes. Flavour of citrus, grapefruits, flowers and caramel. Nice bitterness that stays for the whole sip. Medium crispy, bitter finsh that end up dry. Quite good.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pite na wyjeździe z butelki. W zapachu cytrusowe chmiele z kwiatowym tłem. Smak na początku lekki, zbożowy, potem przechodzący w ziołową, trochę cierpką, ale nie za mocną goryczkę. Dobry lager.

Pours deep amber with medium white head. Nose is citrusy. Aromas are sweet malts, citrus, white flowers and some caramel. Lively cabronation, light body. Medium dry and bitter finish. Very drinkable American lager.
Light hope aroma. Pours a clear orange. Balanced notes of caramel with a short lightly hoppy finish. Very drinkable.

UPDATED: DEC 8, 2016

Aroma:

Medium aroma of malts, caramel, fruit, grain, bread and hops.

Appearance:

Hazy golden/amber beer with a slight off-white head.

Taste/Palate:

Starts medium sweet with malts, caramel and fruit; ends slightly bitter and dry with grain, bread and hops.

Overall:

This beer is rather intense and balanced, but lacks complexity. Great for its style, but nothing unique in general. Really drinkable and does what it should do.

Love the label but cant say exactly the same for the bottles content. Budweiser style beer with slightly more flavor. Pours a pale color with thin white head that quickly thins out. Dont get me wrong this isnt a bad beer just not as good as I had hoped.

Bottle. 
L: pours a slightly orange gold, clear, small head. 
S: nice malt and honey sweetness, mixed with a grassy herbally hop. 
T: great taste, good malt body, herbally finish, sweet and floral. 
F: balanced from start to finish, nicely carbonated, lingering mild hop rising up. 
O: always my go-to lager. I love Vienna/Amber lagers and this has plenty going on whilst being easy drinking and refreshing.

Compared with the all star American water "Bud" is this Brooklyn Lager a brew of the gods!
This is a real fine beer!
God taste, sweet aroma and it takes you over the finish line with a long aftertaste!

UPDATED: MAR 12, 2017 I had it on tap.  It pours amber with some off-white head.  The aroma is caramel malt. The taste is the same with a nice balance of hops and bread. It is smooth with some carbonation. There is some bitterness on the back end. This is a good lager.
Poured from bottle. Light hoppy taste. Not a lot of taste, but hoppy and Vienna lager-ish nodes

UPDATED: OCT 30, 2015 Golden appearance with lots of foam. Tastes of floral, caramel, grass, and citrusy malt with a fair amount of hops. Medium body, lots of good carbonation, and grassy finish. Great refreshing lager.
Mild citrus aroma, medium golden amber pour, white head. Light citrus flavor, bland finish.
330ml bottle. Clear golden orange color with off white head. Malty and hoppy aroma, caramel, bready, grassy. Sweet and bitter taste like aroma. Medium oily body with soft carbonation
SB Oskarshamn, flaska. Frisk och uppiggande arom. Välbalanserad mellan malt och humle. Bra vardagslager.Annanas och tallbarr som vanligt...
As a good friend said, "If all lagers were like this, wed be fine".

Bottle.
Crisp taste, quite mild and easily drinkable. Not much Nose at all.
 Light body, average carbonation. Decent, but nothing special.

0.33 bottle at Spritz bar, Umag. Pours murky dark amber, small off white head. Aroma of pears, bread, malty, tropical. Medium carbonation, medium body, could have more body. Hoppy character well balanced. A good example how an American lager should be.

Bottle. Clear golden colour with a frothy white head. Hoppy aroma with notes of citrus and malt. Somewhat dry taste with medium bitterness and a bit of acid. Alcohol is noticeable. Light body with fizzy carbonation and a long, bitter finish. Good, but a little too dry for me.

Slightly hazy amber color with medium white head. Caramel malts on the aroma, quite sweet and slightly hoppy. Taste is much better than the aroma, it follows it, with caramel and some hoppy hints, but more intense. Nice bitter aftertaste.

When the bottle is opened, I sense that this lager have a very high level. There spreads a welcoming malty aroma and by pouring makes it a nice foam that keeps really long. Flower and fruit rises from the glass and the taste is rich in malt, fruit and a delicious rich hoppy bitterness. As in many other Americans the hops rich in this lager. Fortunately, the US Cascade hop gives the finishing touch in this completed lager.

Botella. Precioso color ámbar ligeramente turbio.
Mucha espuma... incluso se salió por el bocal al abrirla.
Muy cremosa y duradera.
Agradable aroma floral con toques especiados y a naranja.
En boca muy cremosa. Entra tipo lager y tiene final IPA. Toques de fruta tropical. Muy curiosa y sabrosa.

Deep golden-amber colour with a medium sized off white frothy head. Some bread malt aromas up front supported by light fruity esters. Light tangy even crisp with a light slickness and a medium body. Malt sweetness up front which lets the fruity hop bitterness shine through. Medium lasting finish.

355cc bottle. Pours amber clear with thin head. Some floral and resin hops on a slightly sweet caramely backbone. Finish is quite dry and bitter for a lager. Very nice surprise. It is not the typical lager. Thirs quenching and refreshing. Pairs nicely with light meals.
.33l bottle from somewhere Estonia. Pours clear amber with low off-white head. Aroma is hops, citrus, dried fruits, caramel notes. Flavor is mostly same.

Pours a frothy head with a nice mild hop nose. A great fruity hoppy taste with a clean finish. Remarkably drinkable!

12oz can - a very tasty lager , with floral notes and a slightly sweet caramel malt finish . A true go to beer .

Color ambar, aromas frutales, sabor maltoso, frutal.
The aroma is full of hops, pine needle, caramel and fruits. The color is golden and caramelish. The taste is full of hops, citrus, fruits and flowers. A nice beer!

LAGERS ARE HEAVY AND STRONG SO BE CARE FULL OR YOURE GET DRUNK REAL FAST I LEARNT MY LESSON BEFORE BROOKLYNS. LAGERS ARE EVEN HEAVYER THEN PLINY (ITS THE BEST MY FAVRITE) BUT NIT HOPPY. ITS GOOD TO DRINK SOMETIMES HAS DIFFRENT TASTE LIKE FRUIT AND SPICES. MOST BREWERYS DONT MAKE LAGERS BECAUSE THERE SO HEAVY.
Mouldy honey aroma. Sweet and slightly bitter flavour. Some malts on the back of the tongue.

Bottle.
Aroma: Caramel malt and citrus
Taste: Caramel, malt and slightly floral.
Color dorado con espuma de buena formacion y carbonatacion media. Una muy buena lager con aroma y sabor lupulado, refrescante, ligera y sabrosa.
Bärnstensfärgad öl med vitt skum. Doften är blommig, lätt maltig med lätta citrustioner. Detsamma återkommer i smaken. Balanserad beska.

Liquido âmbar levemente turvo,boa formação de espuma com boa duração,média carbonação,aroma maltado e cítrico ao mesmo tempo,sabor "potente" para o estilo,lúpulo em dose generosa(excelente),álcool perceptível,final seco,ótimo conjunto,excelente custo benefício,um exemplo de lager.

Pours an average frothybwhitebhrad that slowly but almost completely diminishes. Body is clear sparkling yellow.
Aroma contains light malts (light bread, cereal), light hops (flowers, lemon, orange), light yeasts (dough) and banana, grape, apple and some forest fruits.
Flavor is light acidic, then light acidic and light sweet, followed by light acidic, light swet and light bitter and finishing with light bitter.
Body is medium with creamy texture and soft carbonation.
A good lager with more flavor then many others.

Bottle. Poured a cleaer golden yellow with little head. Aroma was lager yeast, floral, and citrus. Flavor was typical lager yeast, but also had a bit of fruit in it with grapefruit and lemon. Nice little addition there. Light body and thin texture. Carbonation was average and smooth to finish. Nothing stands out, but easy-drinking if you love lagers.
A lager with slightly more complexity. Fruity with a touch of alcohol. A nice hoppy finish.

Copenhagen 13/6 2015. 35,5 cl bottle from Føtex. Pours slightly hazy golden yellow with small white head. Disappears almost immediately. Aroma is slightly fermented sweet fruit. Medium carbonation. Taste is fruity as well. You can sense a bit of alcohol. Not too strong - but nice - bitterness in aftertaste. Nice lager. More fruity than most Europeans lagers.
Tap at newsroom. Copper, more than expected, with white head. Smells very grainy. Nice sharp malt with some sweetness. Pretty good for a lager.

Bottle @ home. Pours with a dark orange colour, small white head. Aroma is medium malty, with notes of bread, and medium hoppy, with notes of herbs. Taste is medium sweet, medium bitter. Medium body, oily texture, average carbonation.

Bottle 355ml, Albert Heijn. Pours clear copper coloured. Beige head, bubbly. Nose of corn and noble hops. Aged hops / cheese over marmelade too. Quite monotonous, lacks malt character as well as true hop aroma. But certainly above average for a lager.

Color té oscuro, o ámbar, no tiene aspecto de lager. Espuma muy abundante, ligeramente manchada. No tiene aroma de lager convencional, muy aromática, predominando flores y algo de caramelo. Cuerpo ultra suave y cremoso. Sabor de ale, casi de IPA, de nuevo floral, a naranja, melón, malta Muy sabrosa. Muy buena. Deberían ser todas así.

Pours clear medium gold with one finger of medium dense white head, good retention and moderate patchy lacing. (4/5) Nose is caramel malt, grassy and floral, hint of citrus. (6/10) Taste is mild to moderate sweet, very mild bitter. (6/10) Medium-light body, moderate carbonation, short duration slightly bitter finish. (3/5)

Definitely a prohibition-era lager: much more robust and less crisp than todays typical light lagers, yet still easy-drinking and refreshing. Some of the hop flavours (especially the citrus) build and become more apparent as the glass progresses, making me like this a bit more than I first thought. Not great, perhaps, but worth trying, especially on a hot day. (13/20)
Bottiglia. Piacevole, beverina anche se non troppo complessa. Ottima anche durante i pasti.

Bottle. Pours light copper with a thin creamy head. Nice cling. Aromas of slight caramel, citrus, slight floral hops. Flavors are lemon peel, sweet malt, leather and cut grass. Somewhat thin; watery finish. Peppery mouthfeel. Not bad, but not outstanding.

5.3% ABV. Amber Ale. 

Tapped out a nice thick head of close, foamy, creamy bubbles for a beautiful head on a prohibition-era ale.

Color was a deep clear amber, likely closer to about 14ºSRM.

Nose is bold and full of roasted malty flavors.

Carbonation is pronounced and buoys up the bold malty flavors. The palate is all about these nicely roasted good quality malts.

There is some residual hoppy bitterness in the finish, balanced beautifully to be an awesome palate cleanser. You get more and more of the hops with each mouthful. A very pleasing lager and easy to see why this is a hometown favorite.

There are some nice boutique floral finishes which is a little surprising for a boiler maker type ale; lilies, orchids and a nice dry finish of chrysanthemums.

Goes on Favorites List

Bottle. Golden or light copper color with a small head. Aroma has malt and grass. Taste is malty with some bitter elements in aftertaste. Flavors of malt, citrus and grass. Slightly sweet and mild on hops.

Aroma: Beautiful: hoppy with flowery tones, delicious.

Appearance: Amber color, the foam head could have been a bit bigger

Taste: Deliciously really bitter with sweet overtones

Palate: Light and very fizzly very nice

Overall: Somewhere between a lager and an ipa and its great. The color is beautiful and I really like the flowery taste yet the body could have been a bit fuller.
Dark golden with 1 finger head. Tastes og creamy malt,flowers and little bit pine. Creamy feel. Some hop bitterness at the end.

T:
-very nice floral hops with oranges and tangerines upfront
-middling caramel component
-well carbonated
-thin with light hop bitterness,oranges and grapefruit on the finish
O:
Ive seen this categorized as a Vienna Lager,its not.
Theres a definite american touch to this and i love it.
Good solid beer. Not normally a lager fan but this steps up and tastes beautiful. Will buy again with glee.

draft that poured a mostly yellow to light orange color with long lasting white head. decent lacing and carbonation. the aroma was a mild malt and definitely could get the lager aroma. slightly sweet and mild on the hop. the flavor is a prime example of the this style. very smooth and almost creamy. just a decent overall flavor of the lager style.

On tap at beertemple, amsterdam. Body is slightly opalescent orange golden, head is medium, white, creamy, mostly lasting, excellent lacing. Nose is fruity, flavor is candy sweets, honey, fresh water, lime. Medium to heavy sweet, slightly bitter. Finish is short slightly hoppy bittersweet, light fruity sour. Light to medium body, sticky texture, average carbonation. Easy, refreshing, tasty one.

Licht troebel donkergeel bier met schuim. Smaak is fruitig, licht zuur en tovh ietwat zoet met zwarte thee en grapefruit. Lijtk sterk op IPA, alleen lichter van smaak. Smaak blijft redelijk lang hangen.

0.33 bottle. Clear, gold color and a small, white head. Fruity, flowery aroma, hints of gooseberry. Taste is quite standard with the floral notes shining through a bit. Light body, slick texture, and soft carbonation. Finish is medium long and reintroduces the gooseberry fruitiness. Overall quite a good beer, definitely a prominent brew in its style.
Never quite know how to describes lagers adequately but as they go this is good quite dark with a nice head that leaves lacing quite buttery on the tongue crisp and clean

Aroma is dry and woody. Taste is a good balance of dry rustic malt and bitter malts with a kiss of citrus. Taste is actually a little hoppier than a Boston Lager, and I think the malt mix here better. Im a fan of Boston Lager, but Bookyln takes this one by a little bit on taste. Unfortunately, in many area anyway, this costs more, so Boston usually wins the battle to wind up in my fridge. Finally on sale for less, though, so I revisited the Brookyln Lager for the first time in 6 or 7 years. They should make an effort to match Sam Adams price wise- its clearly the market they are going after outside of New York/New Jersey (Where its a local beer), displaced people from the New York area (Taste of home?), and the foreign markets that years of reading beer forums have indicated that these guys like to export to (I guess having an American craft beer from Brookyln creates prestige for stores and those drinking it in some countries overseas, and being in a zillion different countries even if only in token amounts creates prestige for the beer). I mean, those three audiences they are targeting arent small. Its a business model. But if they could bring down prices just a little bit, they could be competing for fridge space in the refrigerators of Americans who just want a decent craft lager and dont have any nostalgia for New York or Brookyln or anything.  I dont think most people who drink Sam Adams Boston Lager give a fig about Boston.
In bottiglia da 33cl. Aroma di malto, biscotto, caramello. Al palato corpo leggero, di nuovo biscotto, crosta di pane, finale secco, erbaceo
Fruity hoppy amber lager with a small disappearing head. Good carbonation. Makes for a tasty and easy-drinkable lager that is easy on the palate. Nice

355 ml bottle, pours a mid amber with a pretty stubborn off white head (probably aided by a good bit of swirling). Nose is floral and hoppy with a bit of light toffee. Good balance of sweet/bitter with a slight wheat beer medicinal quality. Nice bitterish finish. Is this a lager? Technically perhaps but it bears no resemblance to 99% of the guff that is labeled as lager.
Dark amber colour. Fruity and medium sweet aroma. Taste is pretty soft, a bit hoppy, balanced. Short finish. OK stuff!

Bruin, hoppend bier. Ik vond het niet lekker. Punt. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from de Albert Heijn in Hardinxveld. The beer is amber colored and pours a small and fast dissapearing cream colored head, carbonation is good. The aroma is hoppy, which gives it a nice fruitiness with citrus and tropical fruits, also spring flowers and a nip of caramel. The taste is pretty dry for a lager and in the background there is a light sweetness. Further its very refreshing. The finish is dry, nicely bitter and very refreshing.

355 ml/35,5 cl, flaske, 5,2 % ABV, BB: 31/11/15, købt i Føtex på Østerbro, 15. maj 2015.
Ravfarvet og klar Amber Lager/Vienna med pæn offwhite skumkrone på 3-4 cm, som svinder til overflade og et par mm tykkelse.
Aromaen er domineret af malt og humlenuancer af græs. Ikke vanvittig spændende, men ganske kendetegnende for øltypen.
Fyldig smag med god bitterhed og minimal sødme. Ølmæssigt er vi ovre i en typisk Classic, som er let drikkelig for de fleste. 
Øllets krop er middel fyldig, og karboneringen på et middel niveau. Olieret konsistens. 
På én og samme gang ganske velsmagende og lettere kedelig. Måske fordi jeg finder så mange andre øltyper mere spændende.
Nice Amber color. Frothy head. Fresh cut grass nose a bit of cardboard . Light refreshing grainy taste with a nice hoppy finish.

355ml Bottle. Almost clear copper colour with a thin white head. Malts, caramel and floral hops in the aroma. Average carbonation and light body. Taste is more on the sweet side with a nice bitterness. Overall, refreshing average beer.

Pours copper with a half finger off white head with some lacing. Aroma is of toasted cereal malts, citrus, floral hops, and some light pine. Taste is about the same as the aroma. Has a medium body with a semi creamy mouthfeel and a semi bitter, medium finish. Overall, a tasty, easy drinking, go to beer when in NYC.
0,355 cl bottle ( american measurements...). Pours a copper coloured beer. Taste is an easy to drink lager, nothing special.
Dorata, aroma di malto, tendenza dolce con note amare in retrogusto, lager di ottimo livello anche se un po atipica.

Pours a handsome copper body with thin white head. Nutty, malty aroma with subtle floral hop scents. Nice level of carbonation balances out sweet malt taste. Caramel notes, citrus and herbal taste with moderate bitters. Creamy smooth finish.
Pas mal pour une lager ! Peut être trop pétillante mais sinon le gout herbacé est réussi et la note de noisette présente.

Brooklyn lager blir man aldrig besviken på. Riktigt schysst lager! Lättdrucken och bra törstsläckare men ändå med lite smak. Malt, karamell, sötma, gräs, viss fruktighet. Bra kropp och en passande beska.

On tap at O?Leary?s OSL Gardermoen Airport. Clear dark golden to amber with off-white head. Medium hoppy aroma with notes of caramel, fruits, candy and hints of citrus and herbs. Moderate to medium sweet with pleasant malty and hoppy flavours and a nice bitterness. Tasty and refreshing lager!

Butelka. Barwa miedziana delikatnie mętna. Piana biała, drobna, szybko opada do nieznaczącej wielkości. Aromat owoców, W smaku dominuje świeżość, owoce, kwiaty. Wysycenie średnie do niskiego. Couleur ambrée légèrement trouble, mousse qui disparait. Nez houblonné fruité exotique. Gout fruité exotique citronné avec bonne amertume zeste dagrume et resineuse. bon corps. Fin assez longue amère fruitée. Vraiment pas mal pour le style et le peu dalcool.
Bottle at home, didnt pour it down. Sweet malted lager with a nicely floral and citrusy hoppy character. Easily drinkable but enjoyable. Medium carbonation and light bodied.

Pours a nice clear amber with persistent white head. Some floating particles (yeast?) are visible. Herbal and floral aroma. Taste is malty and light bitter, with long bitter aftertaste. Very light body, easy drinking.
Dourada e brilhante com uma bela espuma. Aroma pouco intenso de cereais. Bem leve, com amargor marcante e prolongado. Ótimo drinkability!
Kolor zloty. Piana gesta. Nasycenie srednie, tj. takie jak ma byc. W zapachu slod i owoce, w smaku zas duzo chmielu.
2015-04-18 - This is a famous beer, and it tasted really nice. But it was not so special.

Not a lager in the European sense of the word which is what I was personally looking for. More a beer because its quite caramel and fruity, though not as heavy with caramel and fruit as other beers. Youd probably like this if you dont like the strong flavours of beer. A surprising amount of fizz which I didnt find pleasant. A little watery at times too, but it would probably referesh on a warm day.
Mousse blanche, bière ambrée, une pointe damertume en bouche, une bière pression américaine au houblon fruité. Pression 25 Cl Brasserie Le Lakanal Paris

I bought this beer because I never had it before. Ill buy it again, because it impressed me so much. For a lightish lager, you cant go wrong with this.
Bottle. Clear amber color, fluffy white head. Aroma of caramel. Taste is subtle biter straw. Easy drinking.

On tap at Buffalo Bar, Brisbane. Beautifully rich amber colour with persistent head. Modest aroma with sharp flavour. However, this beer is a long way from home and my experience with vienna lagers is that they do not travel well. Hope to try in NYC some day to compare.
Amber, medium white head. Malty, roasty aroma - some hop notes. Light body, some bitterness, some malty notes. Finishes bitter and a bit malty. Quite good!
355ml bottle. Aroma of dark bread and sweet malt. Smooth taste of dill, caramel and light malts.

Color rame, media persistenza della schiuma, leggermente velata dai lieviti in sospensione.

Pours clear orange with medium white head. Pretty faint aromas of malt and caramel with some American hops also present. The dry-hopping coming clearly through with a taste of floral American hop nicely balanced with malt, roasted malt and caramel. Not sweet, just round. Slightly bitter, lingering aftertaste. More hops, more taste that most lagers and I like that. Another good brew from Brookly Brewery.

Aroma is a little flowery and grassy. Taste is at first a bit watery, but then juicy malts kicks in providing a nice body and when the hops takes over and leaves you with that hoppy medium bitterness its no secret why this is one of the most sold beers from Brooklyn Brewery.

Bottiglia, colore ambrato con un cappello di schiuma fine e poco persistente, aroma erbaceo e maltato, al palato entra dolce e si chiude con un finale amaro (ma non troppo) e secco, carbonazione media e corpo medio. Ottima birra per me

ASPETTO: ambrato limpido, poca schiuma. AROMA: smaltato, floreale, succo duva ed erbaceo. GUSTO: allabbocco è smaltato, abbastanza dolce. I sentori erbacei emergono soprattutto verso la parte finale del sorso (anche se è comunque sempre presente). Finale abbastanza secco (ma neanche tanto) che ripulisce comunqie la bocca. Carbonizzazione media, corpo tra medio e leggero
 CONCLUSIONE: birra pienamente soddisfacente, baverina, dissetante e gustosa. Ne avrei bevuta molto di più.

UPDATED: APR 12, 2016 Clear amber, fluffy, rocky offwhite head. Herbal, floral aroma with caramel and subtle citrus. Flavour is grassy, caramely with hoppy bitterness. Nice
