text: Really nice lager. Beautiful malty taste and aroma. Some faint citrus. Slight caramel touch. Beautifully balanced.

Nice lager. Amber with a small white head. Has some flowery citrus on the nose. Flavor is as any good lager. Some hops and malts. Nice to drink in Brooklyn but not special enough to ship across the ocean. We have plenty of local brews here in Amsterdam that are easily as good. Maybe they should open a subsidiary in Breukelen ( the original Brooklyn). I would be happy to drink that local beer.
Good amber lager. Nice hops, medium carbonation and pleasant malt character. I like it.
caramel, grass, amber, golden, clear, white foam, medium bitterness, average carbonation, medium body

12oz bottle from Masuyos. Poured into an english tulip pint. Amber color with a nice off-white head that hangs aroundonger than expected. Nice resiny aromas with caramel malt notes. Taste is more of the same. Well-balanced. Nice crisp and mildly bitter finish.

Belle couleur cuivrée, mousse blanche qui ne tient pas trop. Nez de caramel, biscuit. La bouche laisse appraitre un aspect houblonnée, pas tellement présent au nez, belle amertume, houblons herbeux et résineux, puis le côté malté apprait : caremel et biscuit encore. Légère sucrrée, corps interessant, un peu épais. Très bonne lager !

Can from swanbourne cellars into a glass. Amber pour with a nice white head. Aroma is sweet caramel malt. Mouth feel is fantastic with nice carbonation. Taste is so light yet complex with good balance between caramel malt and slight yet lingering citrusy bitterness. Tastes like lager should. A ripper

Pours oddly darkish browny colour with big fizz. Very low aroma of some malty sweetness and hints of hops. Taste is clean, slightly roasted maltiness and bittering hops. Missing the full fruitiness of some good lagers and tastes a little sterile. Have had much better.

UPDATED: MAR 10, 2015 12 oz. bottle from pretty fresh mix 12 pack. Into a chalice.
A: Average pour shows truly amber color with great clarity, tight knit head, decent retention and nice lacing. Looks more like a lighter IPA than a Vienna..
S: Light malty smell of medium dark bread and slight floral hop scent. Very light aroma overall. Gets slightly fruity after warming for a bit.
T: Wheat bread maltiness and the English hop flavor combine almost immediately for a nicely balanced taste. Classic Vienna style lager IMO. Very drinkable.
M: Medium light body with a nice amount of carbonation and dry but slightly sticky finish. 
O: Cant go wrong with this amber lager. Nothing special but beats a XX.
Worth buying and easily found in my area. A fine lager brew.

Perusing the LCBO shelves a little deeper with my RB app I came across this beer, from the maker of my beloved (thats right) Sorachi Ace and had to giver her a go. Pours a clear copper-caramel with bit of white head. Nose sweet malts mild bitter hops. The taste is a little thinner than I would have expected, but a good flavour, of malt with a mix of some mild bitterness, overlaying some malt sweetness, mild pine resin hops, with a lingering mild bitterness. Damn complex for a lager, and thats what wins the points. Solid.

Can't believe I haven't reviewed this beer. These dependable everyday beers often get overlooked by me. This is especially atractive now that it's available in a can here, which means you usually get them fresher. Pours amber with a finger of off-white and fluffy head, slight chill-hazing. The aroma is balanced with a malty backbone clad in an elegant east coast hop dress. Medium roasted and slightly caramelly malts, some pine resin, and herbalness. Light to medium bodied palate on the dry side, fresh, medium length with a perfectly balanced and refreshing hoppiness. This won't knock anyones socks off, but it's always a nice beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle at restaurant. Pours an amber gold with slight white head. Aromas are floral and green hops. Tastes dry and slightly bitter. Thinking of a grapefruit. Ok, a bit yeasty on the impression.

33cl bottle at home. Dark amber colour, limited carbonation, dry taste in mouth.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Amber with a medium white head. Aroma caramel, toffee, herbal and floral notes. Taste is bread, biscuit and herbal hoppy. Bitter aftertaste. Could have more maltiness in flavour.

Coloração ambar atraente, espuma densa e consistente. Olfato maltado, toffe bem carcteristico. No paladar achei que faltou intensidade, um pouco de cereal, seca. Fácil de beber. Aftertaste de baixa-média duração, adequado ao estilo. Bem equilibrada.

355 ml. bottle @ The Fiddle Brewpub sampled. Orange, white head. Nose is med. pine resin, hop oil, bitter but not overtly so, enough fruit character. Taste is bitter orange peel, caramel malts, light fruity orange hops, some malt base, caramel. Med. caramel body. Drinks pretty nice. Nothing overtly stellar but works quite well a satisfactory IPL.
An amber lager with white head. Aroma is hoppy, citric, malty, a bit caramel. Taste is bitter and light sweet.

355ml. Bottle. 
Pours clear yellow with white head. 
Aroma fruity hops, citrus, malt, biscuit, caramel. 
Taste caramel sweets, nice citrusy bitter. 
Mouthfeel thin. 
Great beer!

The looks will mislead you. Its not a smooth Vienna Amber lager, its a full throttle American style dry-hopped lager. They say its the original receipe of the pre-prohibition lager they used to brew. The body is thin, though, and the dry hopping gives not the same effect you might hope, having American IPAs in mind. But its not an IPA! Its a lager, dryer than European ones, a bit scratchy and unfortunately a bit too flat.
This beer is more a question of faith Its so much better than the thin Buds and Michelobs in the US. And that alon makes it loveable. But its not a top beer either.

Pours a clear copper golden beer with a big foamy white head.
Smells Hoppy, Malty, Flowery.
Tastes malty, hoppy and a little bit piny.
Tastes non alcoholic but has a big mouthfeel. Well saturated and really refreshing. Great lager!
dark orange 1 finger head. nose is a mild fruitiness. some tree fruit, kiwi and honey. Very weak taste. has a slight creamy last. orange like finish. not great.

Fľaa. Jantárová farba, biela pena. Vôňa kvetinová, trávová, jemne chmelová. Chuť na začiatku sladová, jemne karamel, kvetinové tóny. V pozadí jemná horkosť, dlho trvá. Stredná nasýtenosť, prázdnejie telo.

UPDATED: MAR 1, 2015 Bottle at The Green Dragon, Leek (JDW) Clear pale amber colour with a thin white head. Aroma is malt dominated with sweet caramel, toffee, straw, floral hops and orange peel. Taste is also malty and sweetish, with caramel and floral notes and a bit of orange and lemon. Slick texture and medium carbonation. A malty, bittersweet finish. Decent malty lager.
Descent lager. Easy drinking but really lacking an aroma. Pretty good for the style though.

Bottled, 355 ml.
Shows a clear amber with a creamy and lasting off-white headon its top, which remains finger thick and laces thickly.
Citrus fruity nose and aroma escorted by caramel, nuts and some flowers, mouthfeel is slick.
Fruity-nutty finish with orange peel.
Very good.

Ive had this loads but never rated it seems. The only lager I like really. Pours amber with a nice foamy head. Aroma caramel and malt. Taste has some caramel in the flavour and lots of hops. Not a boring bland lager.

opalescent amber colour, moderate sized off-white head; aroma of grains, floral notes, some raisin, resiny notes and herbal hops, too; taste is too hop dominant for a Vienna, otherwise really good beer

Awesome. 
Say it is larger buy turns more aleish. 
Soft but rich enough to deliver taste of hop. 

Works out best with hanging out on Friday. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Une ambrée au nez qui allie notes de miel et de caramel sur fond de malt. Bouche agréable avec une belle note caramélisée à l'attaque, de la fraîcheur en finale et un bel équilibre mais peu de longueur. sympa avec le burger.

Clean amber color, small white head. Aroma of caramel, hops, citrus, honey, grain, some floral notes. Dry and lightly sweet taste with gently bitter finish. Thin body and average carbonation. Nice refreshing beer.

Pour boucler le week-end, achevons le avec une Brooklyn Lager bien fraîche.
Arôme : Directement on sent que cette American Lager a un profil malté, combiné par des houblons floraux, citronnés.
Apparence : Un bel ambré avec des reflets doré avec un col mousseux très léger, pétillant qui glisse rapidement sur le verre.
Goût : Le malt caramel se marie à merveille avec les 3 houblons Hallertauer Mittelfrueh, Vanguard et Cascade. Cest rond en bouche, une texture résineuse, avec une carbonation légère, le finish est amer mais moins quune Bitter traditionnelle. La gorgée finie, le malt caramel reprend possession de votre bouche, le côté sucré se développe et lamerture toujours présente vous fait saliver.

La Brooklyn Lager est pour moi la bière de grande soif par excellente, elle casse les stéréotypes de la bière américaine de type Lager sans goût, ou peu charismatique. Celle-ci est une magnifique revanche et devient pour moi une référence dans lAmber Lager.
Mørk gylden med lavt skum. I aromaen er det malt og sitrus. Smaken er stort sett som aromaen. Mild bitterhet. Tynn konsistens.

Pour is light caramel with a fluffy white cap that sticks around nicely. Nose is honey and grain and faint flowers. Theres nothing complex here, but this is a really nice, clean, drinkable lager, with a nice bit of bitterness on the finish.
355ml bottle at Rhode Island, Cambridge. Pours clear, amber with a thin white head. Citrus, hoppy aromas. Very dry palate with sweetness and grapefruit bitterness
355 cl systembolaget. Känns märkligt att folk ger denna ganska trista öl så högt betyg.

Bottle. Pours a clear light amber with a fast white head, small bubbles. Light aromas of hop and honey, strong aromas of malt and earth. Excellent balance between sweetness and bitterness, followed by a perfect dry finish. Wonderful beer.
Smooth light Porter. Balanced, light chocolate tones, sandlewood. Very nice Porter. Must try.
Get little aroma. Looks handsome, brute, dark golden, white head, thin but creamy. Smooth. Gentle bitterness. Lovely silkiness.
UPDATED: FEB 22, 2017 How: Bottle Appearance: Amber, off-white head. Aroma: maple syrup, bread, citrus, floral. Palate: medium body, soft carbonation.
How: Bottle Appearance: Amber, off-white head. Aroma: maple syrup, bread, citrus, floral. Palate: medium body, soft carbonation.

UPDATED: MAR 30, 2015 Bottle, 330ml. Pours medium-light brown, clear, with amedium-short light beige head. Aroma is gentle: white whine, lightly hoppy and slight malt, somewhat fruity. Body is medium-light with soft carbonation but a strong tang. Mouth feel is slightly oily to watery, but not too thin. Tastes slightly sour, bu pleasantly so, slight sweetness and light hoppy bitterness, very well balanced. Flavors of light malt and strong american hops, herbal, lightly bitter, and quite citrucy, quite fruity. The sweet-sour-bitter flavors are playing well together, keeping each sip interesting and fresh tasting. The beer is refreshing, but not too light, its complex flavor prevents it from being drunk too quickly.
Floral aroma, bit honeylike sweet. Malty bready, bit sweet floral taste, bit of viola. The sweetness is well balanced with a noticeble firm bitterness. Dry and refreshing
Nice and malty, little to much grain taste on the back end but a solid Vienna lager.

355mL can from Beer Cartel BB 16SEP15
Clean golden body, holds a white head.
Low aroma, clean enough; floral hop, bit of spice, and grainy malt.
Medium bodied, soft carbonation.
Moderately sweet grainy malts upfront, subtle floral spicy (Noble?) hops. Restrained bitterness, clean overall.
Non-offensive, well made, not bad really.

355 ml, 5.2%, schenkt iets helder donker gouden met mooie kraag. Aroma komt vol binnen, stevig moutig, redelijk zoet, licht hoppig, iets caramel. Smaken zijn redelijk aan de caramel en moutig, licht floraal, zwak bittertje, redelijk glad/vol in de mond, iets gras. medium body, mooie co2, afdronk iets droog en glad. Is prima te drinken.

In bottle.White, frothy, rocky head, fairly ersistent.. Amber. Clear. Fairly intense, not very persistent at nose. Malt, honey, caramel, citrus. Good carbonation, watery. Malt and caramelization features in the taste.Good balance between sweet and bitter.
Aroma of hops and floral. Appearance is a goldish orange with minimum head and lacing. First taste reminds me of ipa with a clean sweet aftertaste reminisce of a pilsner.

35cl Bottle, thanks Marc! Clear golden amber colour, white head. Aroma of toast, caramel, pine, grass, some citrus. Flavour is medium sweet, malty, toast, caramel, grass and pine in the hoppy finish. Light-bodied. Ok stuff.
orange amber pour. Bready, doughy, floral, lime, honey. Refreshing but also pretty substantive for the size.

Sample at Horecabeurs 2014 Gent. Shared with Mathieu87.
APPEARANCE: clear darker blond beer, nice stable white head.
NOSE: sweet, malty, little fruity.
TASTE: somewhat hoppy, little bitter and malty. Decent in general.
Pours a dark copper colour with not much head and minimal lacing. Sweet, grainy with a dry, light hop finish. Very flavourful lager, almost like a hopped pale ale.
One of my favorite lagers. I have drinking this beer since my restaurant days in Norfolk, Virginia in the mid 1980s. A great full bodied lager with great color and taste as well.

Bottle from Seoul Plaza. Aroma floral, flowery, assertively and surprisingly hoppy. Light to moderate caramel. Clear amber colour. Okay head. Taste is simple, clean, light to moderate body. Hops shine, flowery and floral, but less than aroma suggests. That is a good thing. Moderate bitterness. Hops balanced with caramel malt. The caramel malt flavour is a bit too much for me to enjoy. This beer aims to pack a bigger punch than desired. Remains a good beer all the same, but not very sessionable.
Nice strong example of the style. Dark yellow orange color. Crisp, bready aroma. Slightly sweet, but nicely malty and doughy. Easy drinking.

Bottle. Clear amber with modest head and lacing. Nose has malt without sweetness, bready aroma that easily readies you for tasting clean and wanting that first sip. Dry with light mouthfeel, easy subdued low hop balance.

really well balanced crisp and malty
Always seems to be a better flavour in the bottle, perhaps the carbonation on keg is too strong?
delicious and widely available so always a good choice

Bottle. Clear light amber, dark orange. Lager aroma with grain and floral notes. The taste is crisp and malty. Very good lager. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Combines surprisingly strong flavorful taste and fresh lightness of lager. Safe choice.

Ambrée orangée, relativement limpide. Mousse peu persistante, par se dépose bien.
Aromatique houblonnée sur le fruit, un côté caramel avec aussi une pointe céréalée au niveau du maltage. Levures.
En bouche dentrée sucrée-caramel avec une petite amertume bien balancée. Fruitée, agrumes avec une pointe dacidité. Fin de bouche plutôt sucrée et levures.
Carbonatation moyenne. 
Vraiment très bonne Lager.

Pours from a bottle a slightly turbid amber with thin white head with medium bubbles, perhaps chill haze? Aroma is slight floral hoppiness, but not as much as typical with de rigeur dry-hopped, mouthful of hops, kind of beers. Flavor is a rich crystal malt, with a nicely balanced hoppiness. Thin mouthfeel. Perfectly drinkable.
0.335l Golden color, white head stays. Aroma: hops, caramel malts. Taste is hoppy, light body with light bitterness. Notes from malt sweeteness.
Amber with thin scummy white head. Full, round aroma, a bit fruity. Flavor is malt and a mix of sour and bitterness. Thin, peppery mouthfeel. Not bad.
Lager dorée américaine, pas fade, houblon léger, bien équilibrée, ai beaucoup aimé. Bue à la pression au bar La Tête à lenvers, Vincennes, France, première dégustation le 16/09/2013.
Red tasty beer. Not my kind of beer but yes my kind of lager. Easy to drink!
335ml bottle. Pours light amber, cream head with very small bubbles. Aroma is yeast, resin, and lightly citrus. Light body. Lively, but not overwhelmingly so. Dry, bitter finish.
From tap at university. Pours two fingers of head. Great aroma with citrus, taste is likewise great, not too light and still easy to drink. A beer that makes us believe in lager beers!

Un bel color ramato pulito con una schiuma poca ma persistente, al naso sentori di malto appena accennati (in fondo siamo al cospetto di una bassa fermentazione). La delusione arriva in bocca, dove si percepisce lossidazione del prodotto. Peccato perchè in partenza le aspattative erano ben diverse. Da riprovare e rivalutare, magari senza che abbia subito un viaggio transoceanico......
Not too bad. A pretty sweet and mellow bear. Above average amber lager. Caramel notes in the body and a sweet finish. Some hops but not much.

Bottle. Pours clear amber with small white head. Aroma is dried apricots, winegums, malt, caramel, flowers and lemon. Taste is medium sweet, light bitter and faint acidic. Body oily with good carbonation. Finish is long and light bitter with notes of caramel, malt, apples, grain, lemon, honey and flowers. Very nice lager.

have had this a few times on tap and bottle a very nice beer not like the other lagers that are available this has some taste very easy to come by they sell it in sainsburys one to have on hand for a hot summers day

Bottle 33 cl.
Amber, off-white head. Hoppy fruits, malt notes. Slightly thinner than expected flavour, but good, with malts, bread and dry bitter hops.
Medium white head, copper orange golden colour, caramel maple syrup creamy smell, medium carbonation medium bitter, caramel notes some pepper well balanced
Una buona amber lager. forse unica nel suo stile, è unamericana dalla bevuta facile e dalla buona persistenza

Bottle 35.5cl. Clear medium amber color, one finger frothy white to off-white head, good retention, nice lacing; aroma sweet malts, bit roasty, caramel, biscuit, bread, light floral hops, citrus; taste moderate bittersweet, caramel notes, ; medium body, oily texture, soft carbonation; finish lingering dry bitter, fruity citrus notes. Very nice Vienna lager.
0,5l tap. Lager? This is an IPA in disguise... Mild,sweet,hoppy,fresh. Really nice. Floral, citrus.
Faint aroma of malt. Clear copper colour. Clean flavour with malt and caramel notes. Light body and medium carbonation. Pleasant but not too interesting.

Drunk 03/11/14, bottle at wetherspoons in leeds. had loads of time to kill before my flight so i thought fuck it ill get drunk. got this 2nd. pours hazy orange with a fluffy head. smells pretty good. loads of caramel and malty mash. taste is similar, with banana, toffee, butterscotch angel delight. barely bitter nutty finish. cant drink loads of this shit but it was alright. some bitter to balance the malt woulda been better

An amber coloured beer with a slightly off-white head. The aroma is of biscuity malts and fruity hops. The taste has a biscuit-like sweetness, which is offset by notes of lime and mild grapefruit. Also hints of pine resin and a very slight soapiness. Very dry finish. A good Vienna-style lager dominated by citrusy hop flavours.

Slight hoppy aroma. Nice dark golden colour. Slight bitter flavour. Maybe Ive been spoilt by all of the super flavoursome American IPAs and craft stouts that Ive been drinking lately.....but this just doesnt cut it for me. Even this lovingly made Brooklyn Lager cannot convince me that lagers are worth going anywhere near. Why would I drink this when I can drink a super hoppy IPA or sweet malty stout/porter? Sorry lager, its not you, its me lol.
330ml bottle (or thereabouts) - pours dark golden with white head. Fresh - hoppy aroma and flavour. Medium body - good lager

This lager poured a medium amber colour with an off white, frothy head. A little lacing. Scents include lite spruce hops, cereal, dough and citrus. First sip was smooth with medium carbonation and a nice malt flavour. Other flavours of lemon citrus, bread and cereal. Light hop flavour with citrus lingering on the palette.
From tap, golden with medium head. Aroma mild with notes of grass and hay. Taste refreshing with noticeable bitterness and noes og toast and grass. Slight bitterness in the finish. Great lager!

33 cl. Pours a medium dense off-white head, amber and slighlty cloudy. Smells quite aromatic: caramel, tosted, malty, and with that typical citrus american hops note. Tastes caramel, orange, citrus, herbs; quite sweet and malty at the beginning, reveals a quite smooth hoppy character, with low to medium biscuity bitterness. Average carbonation, light bodied, dry finish. One of the best lagers/commercial craft I usually find the supermarket, has a pretty decent quality overall

UPDATED: JUN 6, 2015 355ml bottle

Apperance: A nice amber with low off-white head, with a good retenion, leaving n minor lacing spots
Aroma: Grass, Light Grapefruit, caramellised malts, biscuit, tones.
Taste: Starts with grass and orange zest, caramellised malts a light sourness, with a night little floral fruity hoppy bitterness.
thin body, average carbonation.
Starts with caramel and finishes with anlight little bitterness fruity and floral hoppy tones.


One of the best beers I had in this style.

Classic Vienna lager from New York apparently made to a pre-Prohibition era recipe. Pours a warm and pretty orange blonde colour, clear with very quiet sparkling on tiny bubbles, under a creamy, dense, yellowish, quite stable head leaving attractive lacing. Aroma is on the weak side and mostly reveals American hoppiness, with hints of grapefruit, orange peel, mango, caramelly malts, walnuts, biscuit, tobacco and perhaps a faint hint of iron. Smooth, slick palate with medium carbonation, soft onset of dried fruits and caramelly malts, nuttier in the middle, finishing in a citrus peel-like, somewhat peppery hop bitterness of relative length, through which the slightly toasted maltiness shows up as well. This style seems the bottom-fermented equivalent of the English pale ales and bitters, and this one is very true to it. Nothing extraordinary, just plain enjoyable. Could drink this all night.

22-OCT-2014, bottle @Taphouse, Brooklyn Night.
Very dark for a pilsener. Amber with low off-white head.
Very hoppy, fruity. Nice malt balance. A Little sweetness. Quite bitter.
Aroma much better than taste.

Bottle 0,355 l, Burger Shop, Bournemouth, England, UK.
Złote piwo z puszystą pianą oraz przyjemnym chmielowym aromatem. W smaku pełne, z wyrazistą, chmielową goryczką na finiszu
35 cl bottle. Amber colour with minimal white head. Fruity aroma, sweet nice bitterness
Malty and fruity. Full body, sweet, light sour with creamy mild bitter grapefruity finish. Very nice.

UPDATED: JUN 22, 2017 330ml bottle served in a sort of Pokal glass. 
A: Pours a nice clear dark amber color forming a medium creamy and aired tan head. Medium retention and lots of thin lacings formed and left in the glass. 
S: Toffee, fresh hops and malts basically. Pale and crystal malts. Hops have a grassy and flowery profile. 
T: Roasted malts, toffee and grassy hops in upfront. Slightly sweet. Citrus notes. Quite biscuity and a little bit earthy. Good hoppy bitterness for the style. 
M: Light body. Medium carbonation. Toffee and grassy aftertaste. 
O: Good drinkability. Quite refreshing and complex for the style. An Amber Lager with a strong and hoppy character. Brooklyns quality.
[ BA Review @ 2/19/2010 ]
Schön malzig würzig. Bitter im Abgang. Passt sehr gut zu italienischem Essen wie Pasta und Pizza. Sehr rundes Lager ohne zu Platt zu sein.

Pours a deep gold with a decent head that quickly dissipates. Light and fresh aromas of: caramel, grass, dough, cooked vegetables, and vanilla. Perfectly balanced flavor with a finish that nods to bitter. An excellent lager.
Nice amber coloured lager. Nice and hoppy. Light bodied lager. Pretty good for what is probably the grandfather of the craft beer movement.

Very fizzy and quite sharp on the palate. Slight caramel aroma and a very clear appearance but too lagerish for my taste. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Amber color with a fairly big off-white head that dissipates slow, leaving some lacings. Aroma is big on malty flavours, bread, butterscotch, marzipan and butter, also a fine citrusy hoppy tone hoovering above. Taste starts big and bold, big malty flavours with a nice balance of citrus and flowery hops, albeit the taste becomes thinner towards the end, ending slight bitter. Medium body, medium to soft carbo. Would love to try this super fresh from a keg.
"nice delicate balance of floral and citrus hops with a touch of biscuity malt. light and airy, this is a very nice session beer. looks typical for the style, but smell & flavor well above average."

Bottle from Waitrose. Irn Bru colour. Just makes it over the bland line by a tiny margin. Its modicum of flavour belying the 5.7% strength. Barley sugar and emptiness.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Tastes slightly fruity, bitter and is then dry. Nice hopped flavor. The color is a nice rich amber.
Orange-leuchtend im Glas, wenig Schaum. In der nase harzig, Pfirisch, herb. Am Gaumen herb, harzig, fruchtig, leichte BItterkeit. Etwas schmalerer Körper.
Had a sample, found this to be, for a lager, one of the best I have ever had. Lightly fruity, slightly hoppy, has flavor.....lovely stuff.

Bottle. Pours clear yellow gold with slight white head. Not much in the nose. Taste is light-bodied, lingering bitter finish lager. It does what its supposed to do. Nothing really stands out here for me.
So this is the father of the craft beer movement? Golden colour, lasting white head. Very hoppy aroma, with some citrus notes. Taste is caramel, with a smooth bitterness. Refreshing.
Bottle. Amber, clear, minimal head, white foam, medium bitterness, light sweetness, light body, slick feel, lively, & bitter finish.

Quite intense hoppy nose, pleasantly fruity, light malt background, sames goes for taste, thou finish is quite disappointing - thin and bit metallic, that goes in contrast with awesome start. Light sweet with moderate bitterness. Overall decent lager, good for its style

Aromats: Loti patikams iesala un apinu salikums, prieks lagera intensivs. Izskats: Gaistosa puta, kas atstaj baltu kartu par alu. Oranzs, dzintariigs. Garsa: Gazets, sausi rugtens, loti laba, bet udenaina pecgarsa.
Pours an amber body with a small head. Hoppy and somewhat funky aroma. Nice taste, but nothing special.

On tap at the Admirals Club in JFK. Sweet malt, orange blossom and soft perfume aromas. Pours a clear deep gold with slight amber hues. Full white head falls away to a wide collar and dusting across the top. Collar is of minuscule bubbles. Massive lacing down the glass. Taste is lemony and slight soap. Crisp and semi-dry. Medium-thin mouthfeel. There is an orange juiciness that pervades the back half of the taste. Excellent, but seems to lack the classic malt of the style.
On 355 ml can from systembolaget. Excellent lager. One of the best around. Read all others rewievs :-)

Bottle from Tesco. It pours clear amber with a thick off-white head. The nose is toasty grain, biscuit, brown bread, floral and light caramel. The taste is crisp, toasty grain, nice bitterness, brown bread, biscuit, light florals, caramel and pithy lemon with a dry finish. Medium body and moderate carbonation. Well rounded, crisp and crushable. Whats not to like?
Great lager beer. Best lager i had ever tried . Amber/orange in color , medium white head. Fresh aroma of malt and hop. Perfectly balanced and refreshing taste . Moderate bitterness , easy to drink.
The best American lager I had. It has complexity and aroma of an ale, crispness of a lager. Refreshing, simple, yet interesting and different. Far away from usual pale lagers out there.
Bottle. Blonde. Floral grassy citric aroma, like Tettnag hops. Floral, grassy fruity hopbitter flavor, lingering on in the aftertaste. Surprisingly good!

(Brooklyn Lager) Bottle 355 ml at home , poured into a glass tankard, ABV 5.2%
Clear body, deep golden orange in colour, with a thick soapy head, slightly off-white. Small but with a good retention, it leaves medium lacing on the glass.
Nice hoppy aroma, some caramel and peppery hints, with light floral notes.
Taste of light caramel, hops, grass, some spices but cant say exactly what. Mild bitterness on the aftertaste.
Medium body, nicely carbonated. Quite dry palate.
Pretty good.

Clear amber, minimal cream head
Caramel, sweet malts, honey, a hint of cloves
Malt, caramel, bitter hoppy ending

Bronze/copper colour with a slightly off white head. A nice whiff of floral hops - gentle but very forward. A nice sweet lager - hints of honey and beautiful malts. Floral hops also present. Good but not great density, nice light carbonation.

Drink cold (8°C)
Eye: pours a golden to copper, slightly hazy colour with medium size but rapidly dissipating white head.
Nose: hops, grass, spices such as coriander.
Mouth: red and black currant, herbal hops, grass, spices and citrus fruit but not acidy. nice bitterness in the end.
Palate: hops, grass, dark berries and nice bitterness.
Overall: very good, hopy beer. best to drink on a hot summer day. Nice amber lager, not as good as Sam Adams Boston Lager though..
330ml bottle at shanghai brewery ( china ). Amber colour. White head. First impression : little weed, pours of banana.
Pours a golden orange slightly unclear beer with a good white head. Smells fruity, malts and hops. Bit sweet. Tastes hops, malts, bit honey or caramel. Average carbo, thin body and a dry texture.
It has a nice look. Good thick foam. Caramell and honey aftertaste. I think it is a pretty good lager.
Bottle. Color amber with medium head. Aroma of caramel,and malt. Taste: the same +little bitterness+ honey afterwards. Medium body , well balanced. One of the best lagers I think.
Medium bodied, nice color. A solid lager but more interesting beers out there from Brooklyn
Drank straight from the bottle. Exhibited a slightly floral hop character coupled with some bitterness and minimal malt sweetness. Drank pretty good with BBQ. Clean finish and quite refreshing.

This is one of the beers that got me into seeking out a lot of new beer, and now here i am paying fucking $10 for a pint. Gee thanks. Anyways, a dark orange amber. Aroma is piney hops, taste is smooth caramel, mild bitterness and clean finish. A classic.

Appearance is amber, a white fizzy head which leaves a bit of lacing. Aroma- malty, caramel and toffee, hop hints. Taste- lots of caramel and toffee, some hop bitterness, creamy malt, biscuity, nutty, hint of zesty fruit towards the end. Very nice.

355ml bottle at home. Clear amber/orange with a medium white head with low retention. Light to medium body with moderate carbonation. Medium bitterness with some sweet tones. Citrus, grass, some hops and herbs. A tasty and refreshing brew.
De geur is heel lekker, schuim krijg je bijna niet als je uit schenkt, de smaak zelfs is nogal waterachtig

16 oz can poured into a shaker. The aroma is light, mostly sweet citrus and caramel with some bread crust. It pours a clear, dark shade of orange-yellow and has a thick white foam head. This reduces down to a thin ring with a light dust sprinkling on the surface. It leaves behind a light, fuzzy messy lace. The taste is a good balance between medium sweet and bitter. The medium bodied beer is fizzy with an oily, slick texture. The finish is primarily orange and caramel with a surprising amount of spice and a touch of resin. Its crisp and dry with an aftertaste of lingering spice, pine, and wood chips. Very clean.
I thought it was mostly a hype, but this beer is indeed surprisingly good for a lager. Fresh and quite hoppy. Good.
Heldere caramel kleur met een volle kraag. Ruikt honing, hop, fruitig. Smaakt fruitig, hop, beetje orange. Beethe honing en beetje ipa-achtig.
Good Lager with a slight taste of a pale ale. Had in bottle..........................

Pours a medium amber. Visible carbonation. Not much in the way of head or lacing.
Aromas are light. What is there is a blend of light citrus, caramel and wet cardboard.
Tastes are dry caramel, a bit of biscuit, a bit of citrus on the swallow.
Overall, this is a fairly mild beer. As a lager I give it credit for bringing more to the table than a lot do in this category, but the word "forgettable" keeps creeping into my mind when compared to most beers I drink..
Malty and citrusy taste. Deep amber color with a white head. A good pick if you want a malty beer wich fits perfektly to hot days in the summer

Transfer from BA review on 10-9-12-
 Poured from bottle into pint glass

 Appearance  The beer pours ac copper-amber color with a two finger white head. The head fades rather slowly to leave a great level of lacing.

 Smell- The aroma is of a lightly roasted malt with some caramel sweetness. Mixed with these aromas is a light but nice blend of a herbal and floral hop aroma.

 Taste  The taste started out on the crisper and breadier side. Quickly a caramel sweetness greets the tongue and sweetens the flavor. These flavors persist throughout the taste until more towards the end. At that point an herbal and floral hop flavor comes to the tongue. While they start lighter, they grow stronger and stronger, and in the end, leave a crisp and bitter flavor to linger on the tongue.

 Mouthfeel  The body is on the slightly chewy side for the abv. and style with a carbonation level that is rather average. The chewiness, while not characteristic of a lager, was actually very nice of the herbal and floral hop flavors. Overall the mouthfeel was great.

 Overall  A good herbal and floral lager that is crisp and delicious.

Bottle, 35,5cl. Clear amber colour with a small off-white head. Fruity amber lager aroma with red berries, peaches, citrus, herbal hobs in the nose along the typical biscuits, bready malty aroma. Flavour is initial shortly sweet, centred around the fruity sensations, as it quickly turns malty with clear a distinct hoppy bitterness. Ends dry in a long finish. Slick, dry texture with a medium body and average carbonation. A pleasantly surprise.
Aroma lupulado e caramelado, com corpo medio no sabor prevalece o lupulo. Refrescante
UPDATED: SEP 18, 2014 Highly drinkable, full flavored lager with a sturdy malt backbone and pleasant well bitter hop finish.
Poured light amber with an off white head. Aroma of sweet citrus and sweet malt. Medium body, flavour is medium sweet, lightly bitter.

Amber color, pungent aroma, grainy taste (maybe 2-row malt), i really like this beer for the balance between hops and malt, one of those true balanced beer, with the refreshing qualities of the lager style too.

This quite a surprising lager as it was quite tasty, it wasnt too sharp or bitter and it wasnt overly carbonated. It was quite smooth and drinkable. Not really any lacing with small amounts of white head in the typical lager yellow. Bottle at thomas Ingoldsby spoons Canterbury.

Bottle. Moderate hazy, amber body, with a medium, frothy, slightly beige head. Aroma of roast, bread, grains, flowers, some fruits like peach, red berries and citrus. Taste with the same aromas, but with the fruit notes more present and also some herbs. Mouthfeel is light, slick, with a lively carbonation and it finishes bitter, roasty and slightly fruity. OK. The balance between hops and malts is good, but overall pretty light bodied and Im missing some character. Ive had better Vienna style lagers.
35.5cl bottle poured into a tulip glass. Poured with a thick white head. Nice amber colour. Light hops, pine, malt. Little bitterness in the aftertaste.

Flaska från systembolaget. Klassisk lagersmak men med betydligt mer humle än dussinvarianten. Lite lite torr smak också, samt lite citrus. Känns fräsch och uppfriskande. Helt klart en ny favorit bland lagerölen!
The classic Brooklyn you can find: good to drink but anonymous, just a little bit hoppy and floeral, with a short malty taste.

From12 oz bottle. Clear amber with small white head. Clean classic lager aroma with hint of biscuit. Refreshing on the palate with medium/high carbonation. Nice balance of sweet and bitter with some hoppy hints. Medium finish, quite dry at end. Clean, refreshing - classic, almost German taste. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Hoppy aroma, more than the usual lagers, surely dry-hopped. Some discreet citric and herbal notes remind me an IPA but in a more elegant way. Not explosively fruity as I expect from a lager. Noticeable balance between the aromas and tastes which makes you desire one more bottle. Drinkable without being watery, light bodied, classy, a real good one!

473ml can. Pours a hazy, light orange with a one finger, white head that leaves a coating of lace. Aroma has nice lager yeast notes along with traditional hops and some grain. Very slightly fruity. Taste is well balanced. Very much like the aroma. Slight bread and grain with a smooth finish. Medium body and carbonation. Clean and crisp in the mouth. Refreshing and drinkable. Overall a well balanced lager. Clean and crisp with some ok flavour.

Bottle 033l @ home.; pours orange-copper with white creamy, good lecing and long lasting head. Aroma is pleasent sweety, toasted malt, bread, some biscuit and herbal - grassy hops. Taste is mostly like a smell, lots of malts and hops, with subtile bitterness at the and. Body is light to medium, lively carbonarion. Mouthfeel is smooth and feels more an Ale than Lager. Its quite simple, easy drinking beer, however its full of flavour and aroma and it is not as sweet as many Bavarian Lagers.

Draught @ BeerTemple, Amsterdam.
Clear hazelnut, fine white head. Round, caramel start, luckily handsomely dry-hopped for a bitter finish. Not one to drink a session of.
Flaska från Systembolaget. Klar bärnstensfärgad vätska med lågt vitt skum. Doftar vitt bröd, jäst och lite karamell. Maltig inte så besk smak. En god lättdrucken lager!

Excelente cerveja. Gosto e tonalidade bem no estilo larger. E uma cerveja q vê a pena tomar junto a um churrasco

-
UPDATED: JUL 26, 2014 Bottle from Fenwicks Newcastle. Lovely and malty. Relatively heavy but still very refreshing
Poured from bottle. A distant scent of wetlands in smell. Very mild taste. After taste almost the same. Looks good though.

UPDATED: JAN 1, 2016 Grassy aroma of biscuity malts, caramel, bready, light hoppy. Flavour is malty with a nice moderate hoppy bitterness in the finish. Not generally a fan of Lagers, but this one was just what I needed at the time.
Very nice lager with a dominating hop flavor, well balance, nice lacing & head, good carbonation, lovely lager beer

On tap @ Beer Temple, presentation of Brooklyn Lager in The Netherlands. Clear dark golden to amber color. Rocky, foamy head with good lacing. Aroma: grain/malt, fruits. Grain/malt, caramel and some red fruit retronasal. Flavor is lightly sweet, fruity. Light bodied. Long finish, but no new flavor. Clean, well crafted, but not very exciting.
0,35 pullo@ Kochi Ait Tallin. Pronssisen ruskea, hiukan samea. Tuoksuu jälkiruoka viinille, hedelmäinen makea, persikkainen? Maku ihan pikkuisen sauippuainen, kuitenkin ihan miellyttävä.

Gold-amber pour with a medium somewhat creamy head. Decent bubbly lacing. Aroma is caramel malts, resinous pine hops. Taste is decently bitter with some slight sweetness. Medium to light body with fairly active carbonation. dry finish. overall quite excellent.
I am normally an ale drinker, but got to taste some of this and it was quite drinkable.
On tap @ vg nation (student pub), Uppsala, Sweden. Amber colour, clear with small dense head. Floral and malt-sweet aroma. Taste is similar, with a nice clean malt profile and some hoop bitterness.

Bue en bouteille de 35cl, couleur blonde/ambrée mousse imposante mais peu deffervescence, une bonne bière de soif peut être houblonnée avec des produits assez peu noble ce qui lui une donne une amertume sympa mais peut être pas assez appuyée, on a des saveurs de fruits jaunes mais aussi une point de réglisse, vraiment sympa !

Eine bernstein fast rote Farbe und ein erdiger hopfiger Geruch mit leichten Fruchtnoten. Was will man mehr optisch und aromamässig als bei diesem Bier. Schaumkrone ist nicht doll, aber dieses Bier brauch keine optische Krone. Der Einstieg erzählt die Geschichte: lets hop. Hopfen bis der Arzt kommt, Körper und Abgang sind sehr geradlinig - wenn es Kritik gibt dann in Bezug das dieses Bier zwar einen exzellenten kultivierten Hopfenorchester spielen lässt, aber dieser allein das Bier ausmacht. Manch einer wird gerade Dieses an diesem Bier schätzten. Fazit: Bier der Sonderklasse.

Tap. Pale amber body, small off white lasting head. Aroma is sweet berries, strawberries, caramel. Sweet flavour, not "malt-sweet", but more of berries and cream. Light bitter finish. (New Orleans Bistro Bar, Arlanda, 08.07.2014)
Bottle (12oz): very nice easy drinking. Good pizza beer. Would buy again-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Fat på O'learys Norrtull. 
Klar men ganska mörk bärnsten med ett litet vitt skum. 
Doftar malt och lite fruktig. 
Bra kraftig smak, väl balanserad mellan sötma och beska.
Riktigt trevlig lager.
33cl @ enoteca. Classicone americano e non essendo io un grande amante delle lager lho trovata buona.

Âmbar quase cobre, turva para uma lager. Espuma de média persistência mas com via consistência. Predomínio do lúpulo, herbáceo e floral. Amargor persistente na boca.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
UPDATED: MAR 26, 2016 On tap at Ribs n Bibs, Lincoln. Pours golden amber with a white head. A fruity aroma with some malts. The flavour is sweetish malty with citrus, and a bitter finish.

UPDATED: FEB 25, 2015 Perhaps one the most affordable lager beers in the world.
Malt is dominating the aroma. Almost to the point that it sticks a little in the nose when you take a smell.
The taste full of hops in abundance with some flowers when the beer passes the palate. 
Brooklyn Lager reminds me a little of Falcon Bayerskt, but with 20 times more flavor and aroma.
Bottle 355ml. Clear amber with off-white head. Aroma is light yeasty and herbs. Light sour and herbal flavor. Light body.

Draught at B*Eat (33 cl /  4) in Torino, June 2014. Pours hazy dark amber; light head stays. Aroma is intensely malty: caramelly, earthy, grassy, with a tad of fruitiness reminiscent of rotten apples. Almost flat with minimal carbonation; light to medium body. Taste is sweet with some nice hoppy bitterness and a bit of sourness too; finish is dry. Much less sweet than I remembered. Im slowly starting to like it more and more.

Bona cervesa, equilibrada i gustosa.
Buena cerveza, equilibrada y sabrosa.

Pours a yellow color with a light flower aroma. Taste is simple, crisp and dry. No distinct flavor, just a simple malt mixed with a metallic watery film left on the palate. A decent beer that was glad I tried while out in NYC.
Clear amber appearance, medium head. Malty, citrusy and grassy aromas, quite sweet. Good amber lager style.
@ Röhällavägen. Bottle (355 ml) from Systembolaget (18:-). Fruity and hoppy, a little sweet taste, medium body and oily body. The finish is quite dry and bitter with hoppy notes.

Bottle @ home . Ambrata carica, limpida, schiuma beige fine e poco persistente. aroma maltato, di luppolo agrumato, un po di caramello. Secca, dal gusto fruttato, agrumato, poco acida, abbastanza amara bilanciata dallabboccato del caramello. Abbastanza carbonata, equilibrata, un filo spigolosa e più luppolata rispetto alla norma dello stile.
12 oz bottle. Pours amber with a small off-white head. Subtle aroma of caramel malt and biscuit. Somewhat sweet but well balanced with some hoppiness in the finish. Quite good.
330ml bottle, pours brown / amber with a foamy white head. Aroma is caramel malt, a little bit toasty, a little bit nutty. Dry to finish with a nice bitter hop balance. Very drinkable, tasty lager.
Bottle from Føtex, Denmark. Pours golden amber with a foamy medium and off-white head. Fresh dry bitterness, light bodied, easy to drink.

Pours amber with thick white head. Aroma of bread, hops and a bit of alcohol. Tastes bready, bitter, slightly sour and a bit thin with slightly oily mouthful and a lingering bitter finish. Pretty good.

UPDATED: MAY 10, 2016 12 oz. bottle from Liquor Barn (Jefferson Commons); shared with my Boo. Aroma: Moderate toasty malts well balanced by a floral/lightly lemony hop character. Appearance: Penny, clear copper pour with soft carbonation holding up a foamy tan head that settles into a skin. Flavor: Initially malty with a nice floral balance; lemony aspects come into play more towards the finish, which is abrupt. Palate: Medium body, sticky texture, soft carbonation, abrupt finish. Overall: As a versatile, well made Vienna, I cant imagine this has many peers.

Head: firm, off-white. Colour: clear orange golden. Aroma: floral hops. Taste: nice bitter. Palate: smooth, medium bitter finish, moderate CO2. Overall: nice.
I really enjoyed this easy goin yet complex beer, very drinkable and good for every occasion would buy again
Light amber. Clear. Minimal head. Hoppy & malty. Tastes like a pale ale. Good for a lager.

Clear amber colour, white head. Aroma of malts, light citrus, some straw. Malty sweet flavour. Malty sweet finish.
(from 355mL bottle shared @ home. Thanks for the bottle, tderoeck!)

UPDATED: MAY 27, 2016 From tap.
clean amber in glass. Aroma is very light floral.
No body and carbonation. Taste is not fantastic...

Lager di ottimo stampo leggera di poco corpo ma un buon equilibrio e molto profumata, una punta di miele si unisce ai sentori floreali. 

---Rated BY Italianbeer85

On tap at The Winston, Hobart. Pours amber with a copper hue. A decent caramel aroma with light hoppy notes. Taste is caramel, light malt, bread, light hoppy. Smooth and balanced, very drinkable, an accomplished lager.
good basic lager.really nothing special but beats the f**k out of basic lagers on tap.-- via beerbasher/winphone
On tap. Cooper color with one finger head. Slight grapefruit aroma. Similar taste and a little earthy too. Good beer.

This is one of those beers one forgets to rate. Been drinking it for years. Its a classic. Used to compare it with my towns local beer ( E. C. Dahls). But through the years the Brooklyn lager has held its own. While my local beer hasnt. 
weak aroma. Light malt. Little bit citrus. Feel i taste a bit cola. Good bubbles.

Clear amber/copper. Decent head and lace. Nose full of malt,caramel and some toasty notes. Medium bodied, some crystal malt on the palate with some caramel like toasty edges,with decent floral hop bite. Hightly drinkable and clean.
Bottle: clear burnt color with a small white head. Well balanced malt and boo aroma with some hints of citrus. Tangy citrus notes wth an aftertaste of grains. Not bad for a lager.
sweet malt and bitter hopsy aroma, amber orange slighty cloudy colour, good frothy head that leaves a nice lacing. medium bitter taste, light sweet, smooth. Very nice
Amber beer with thin lacy head. Nose of candied peel. Taste medium sweetness and bitter. Lively CO2. Mildly astringent. Finish is long and refreshing. Beautifully rounded.

On tap. This was a very good lager. I do believe I could even taste hops in it. I wasnt expecting much, but it delivered a great refreshing floral hoppy flavour, low on bitterness, It was a quaffable enjoyment.
Pours a nice amber color with white head. Bread, floral notes, and some malt on the nose; follows onto the palate. Finishes with a bread note.
473ml can. Clear orange with a foamy off-white head. Flavors are biscuit, caramel, citrus, pine and grass. Medium body, moderate carbonation, creamy texture.

Boa formação de espuma, coloração levemente acobreada e brilhante, aroma floral do lúpulo e um leve caramelo do malte, no sabor vem o dulçor do malte bem equilibrado com o amargor. Paladar com final seco, mas suave, no geral, uma excelente cerveja.
What a bottled lager should be. Dark orange/amber. Slight spice, very malty.
Bottle, courtesy of Miro. Pours amber color, white head. Aroma is citrus, malty, hoppy. Taste is medium bitter, hoppy, citrusy, hints of caramel.
Humlete lager. Friskt pust i Tom Waits løpetid pilsner. Drukket sv flaske, ikke innspisert farge og skum så godt.

355 ml bottle @ Uppsala castle. Pours amber with a white head. A citric fruity aroma with some malt as well. The flavour is sweetish malty with medium bitterness and citric and pine-like elements. The finish is slightly malty and moderately bitter. Very good lager beer.

Very good beer 
Show. !!!!!!!!

Purchased at Bottles and Cans in Chicago, IL; enjoyed at home making dinner on a cold late April night which kinda sucks. Appearance is a moderately clear orange amber with a thin white head. Aroma of light malt, light yeast, smells rather clean. Taste is pretty good, finishes crisp, light caramel notes, moderate carbonation, nice malty quality, good lager.
355ml bottle from Waitrose. Pours gold with thin white head. Aromas of hops, citrus and caramel. Mild carbonation. Classic beer.
Pours a hazy orangish amber color. Aroma and taste are malts, some caramel, and a mildly bitter finish.

Clear dark amber body with frosty medium head, visible carbonation. Aroma has light caramel notes, woody characters, pretty clean. Taste has medium to high earthy bitterness right upfront with caramel sweetness support. Balanced towards the bitter side. After taste has long lasting bitterness. Body is full with very high carbonation.
On draught at Holsteins. Clear amber golden color. Aroma is sweet caramel malt and citrus. Taste is caramel, grapefruit, tangerine, pine, and biscuit. Refreshing balance with a good little hop bite.

Bottle. Pours deep gold with very little white head. A very aromatic beer with strong notes of hops, citrus and caramel. The body is quite fine and not overcarbonated. A long-lasting bitter finish. Nice one.

0.355L bottle. Clear amber color with nice creamy top, dissapears quickly. Fresh spring forest, and forest flowers aroma. Vegetable, lemon, earth, caramel, roasted malt feeling. Medium bitter finish. Drinkable.
Five finger head. Spicy berry aroma. Light lemon with a little metallic ring. Finished clean. A good summer beer.
On tap. Golden orange with white fluffy head. Smell is yeast sweet and hops. Sweet malt some bitter hops. Taste is medium bitter. Fizzy.
UPDATED: SEP 11, 2015 På fat @ Akkurat. Bärnstensfärgad vätska utan skumkrona. Doftar sött. Söt blommig smak.
Bottle 355 ml from Vrutak, Zagreb. Pours amber with white head. Hoppy fruit aroma. Pleasant hoppy bitterness and malty flavor. Very good considering its a lager.
UPDATED: APR 14, 2014 Botella de 35,5 cl, adquirida en La Birra. Color ambar. Sabor a malta, levadura, con regusto a caramelo. Una gran lager.

12oz bottle. Pours brown with a white head. Malt, caramel, slight bitterness. A little more interesting than your standard lagers. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Nice amber/copper color; Medium slightly creamy body; Aroma of toasted malt, floral hops, and spice; Flavor of slight roasted sweet malt, pine hops, and some caramel; Finish is slightly bitter; Nicely balanced; Solid.
Pours a translucent brown with medium white head. Aroma is some malt, wheat, vague hop.. Not much there. Taste is sweet malt, slight tang, caramel. Nice drinkable lager.

Bottle pour into a Shaker. Deep Orange/Copper color one inch white head. Not much aroma to speak of for me. Nicely balanced a touch of hops flavor. I get a little yeasty, hay flavor. Straightforward beer easy to drink probably one the best examples of a lager. Nothing too exciting though. Would pair easily with food.
Bue en bouteille de 355ml. Assez déçu par cette bière un peu trop amère à mon goût. Arômes floraux, assez sèche en bouche. Pas terrible.
bottle 35,5cl from Alko @ home. Pours clear copper with a large white head that leaves a nice lace. Fruity hops, caramel in the aroma. Fruity hops, grains, hay in the flavor.

Pours out a clear amber colored contents with a medium white frothy head that has a pretty decent retention.
The mild, sweet roasted aroma is complemented by some caramel and a slight yeasty smell.
Starts sweet and fruity, followed by some yeastiness and bready feel in the body, plus some roasted feel, finishing with a nice hoppy bitterness.

Reviewed from notes. Consumed in a pint glass, a pilsener and a nonic, nothing changed.
The appearance was a light orange/yellow colored body, one finger white head that died within ten seconds. No rings, no lacing, no carbonation rising.
The smell was overly floral with the malts coming in and out at odd times.
The taste was overly floral again, not getting into this
On the palate, it sat about a light to medium. It was mostly drinkable.
Overall, as many times as I had this and kept trying to give it a chance, I couldnt get into this. Gimme a Sam Adams over this any day!

Bottle @ Beehive, Gatwick Airport. Pours slightly more golden than your average Vienna. Plentiful carbonation. Nice scent, tropical fruit hop rising above a steady malt base. Taste is bittersweet, not very exciting but very refreshing. A good beer from a decent Stateside brewer.
bottle. deep golden with one finger head. im never going to get excited about a lager, but this is solid. quite malty and flavorful.

One of the better lagers I have had. Really malty an and bitter. Not as hoppy as I would like. Had this one at American junkie. Pours orange in Color

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Light hazy copper/orange with a large frothy good lacing off white head. Looks lively with high effervescence. Great looking beer. Citrus hoppy nose. Flavour is light/malty (grain, bread) and hoppy (citrus, herbal). Light/medium body, low sweetness, medium bitter, light acidic, soft/medium carbonation. Texture is a bit thin, but some bitterness kicks in leaving a long dry and light bitter finish.

Amber/redish with a thick offwhite head which remains throughout drinking, some lacing. Aroma of grassy hops and malt with a bit of roasted malt. Tastes malty, hoppy and bitter with a slight fruit and citrus flavour about light sweetness.
Clear golden, white foam. Aroma has some pine and malt. A balanced lager with a full body. An ok lager.
I don't usually drink lager but was pleasantly surprised by this!! Seems a bit expensive locally however.

Bottle, 355mL. Home. A clear brown amber beer with a large white thin head. Medium persistence. Floral and fruity aroma (blackcurrant). Nose is more intense than the mouth. Herbs, smoke, a bit acid. Medium bitter. Medium body and texture. Lasting bitter finish. Overall, a good floral amber lager. I first drank this beer last november during ING New Yorks marathon :)

Amber color, white head. Caramel malt nose, fruity with hints of grapefruit and peach. Hoppy taste with notes of fruits and resin, hints of berries and grass. Moderate bitterness. Medium body and carbonation. Nice!

Bottle. Smell is sweet and floral. Pours dark yellow, with a slightly off white head that fades to the edges, and lacing with a little oil in the middle. Taste is about what you should expect from a lager, but the aroma comes through with a hoppy vibe alongside it. This is a great example of a good beer.

The aroma has some hoppy notes to it, and the taste is nice and smooth, slight bitterness and a mild rush of carbonation at first sip, then it mellows out by the swallow. I get a lingering hop aftertaste, but nothing overpowering.

12 fl oz bottle poured into Pilsner glass. Appears light amber with a finger of white head. Has a nice slight hop aroma, fruity. The taste is bitter than turns into a biscuity, malt backbone. The palate is thin and it's crisp, refreshing! Definitely great for the warmer weather!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

From tap. Pours clean amber in glass. A solid finger of off-white head. Aroma is floral hops up front (nothing overpowering) and caramel at the back. Medium body and carbonation. Taste is dry, with hop bitterness (again, nothing too out there) and biscuit malts. Nice mouth feel. Sticks to the gums.
UPDATED: JAN 5, 2015 Nice amber color with medium white head. Fruity nose. Hop and fruit aroma. Sparkly. Medium body. Long bitter finish. Very nice. (Vrutak)
Good average beer that has a very appealing colour to it with a good frothy head. A good all day drinker

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2015 35 cl bottle. Pours a nice amber color, with a thick, smooth white head, slightly hazed. Nose is hoppy and malty. Aroma has a simple but effective grainy malts backbone with plenty of hops, citrus peel and hints of caramel. Taste is bitter, crisp. Texture is watery, carbonated, medium bodied. Dry bitter finish, citric. Very clean.

2015.02.23 update: had this on tap at Bubba Gump, NY. As above, a nice lager-to-vienna-to-APA crossing, clean, dry but somehow sticky, very quaffable. Soft american hops upfront.
Ótima lager, diferente do padrão do estilo bem lapada... Lúpulo lembra pinheiro pouco adocicado final seco longo bela breja pelo preço
One of the best and most full bodied lagers that you will ever have. With a hoppy aroma and a dark brown appearance, this Lager tastes more like an ale than most ales. Enjoy!
Uma cerveja Lager acima da média, com certeza. Coloração alaranjada. Gosto de cereal é predominante.
Amber golden colour. Nice white Head. malty and hoppy notes with some flower.... I like The IPA More. But a very Good one
Very bready with some dank hop flavors and a sweet pale malt body. Kind of plain, but not necessarily in a bad way.

Pint on tap. I have too many ratings to get to this famous beer just now! Its a nice copper color, clear, with almost no head and decent lacing. A nice relatively hoppy aroma for the style, different than other "viennas". Pretty well-balanced and plenty of flavor - you cant really ask for too much more out of this style of beer, its earned its awesome reviews! Get one, rook!

Bottle from Coop - Amber color, good creamy white head, beautiful lacing - Aroma is malty, caramel, flowery hops - Flavor is malty and hoppy - Light body, medium bitterness, crisp and dry, dry bitter finish - not well balanced too bitter but a better lager than Swiss
Ins Glas ergießt sich ein bernsteinfarbenes Bier mit geringer Schaumkrone. Geruch leicht röstmalzig, fruchtig herb, leicht würzig. Geschmack röstmalzig süß, leicht fruchtig bitter.
Great solid lager. Amongst the hoppier lagers this is a personal favourite.
A bottle 5,2%. Clear golden color with a tiny head. Caramel aroma. Sweet taste at first and then lightly sour.Medium body, A good beer.
Good floral aroma with an amber appearance. Tasty malt forward profile that goes with this balanced beer. Not blow your mind amazing but good session lager.

On tap at newsman Stavanger.
Small white head with nice hops aromas but disappearing quickly.
Light clear reddish amber body. Not a lot of taste but some hops and nice light bitterness which make a very pleasant balance. easy to drink a few ones in a row.

355ml brown bottle, poured into a Lager glass. Appearance is clear amber with a medium sized foamy beige head with decent retention, that when reduced left some lacing. Aroma of grapefruit, orange peels and wheat bread. Flavours of grapefruit, orange peels, wheat bread and a hint of caramel. Taste is light sweet and light-medium bitter. Palate is light-medium bodied, slightly oily texture and average carbonation. Overall a good sessionable lager, however the hops dominate the flavours, I would have liked this beer a little more malty.
Poured from the tap. Clear golden yellow with amber tinge, slightly off-white head. Bready malt aroma, very very subtle hops. Mild sweet malt and hops to taste. Light-medium body.
Keg in the Craft Bar, Lincoln. Amber with a white head. Lots of sweet pineapple flavour, and caramel too. Nice bitter finish.

On tap at Joe Canals West Deptford.
Appearance: The body has perfect clarity, showing off active carbonation bubbles in the amber body. The head is stout but dense and persistent with a light tan hue. Very nice looking beer.
Aroma: The aroma is on the light side with a mild malty sweetness with hints of bread and caramel. Theres a subtle hop aroma, slightly floral as well.
Taste: The intro is malty with a mild malt sweetness but its balanced by the mid-taste by a sort of herbal tea-like dryness. The finish continues building on the herbal qualities, fading out the malts. The finish is dry and lingers a moment with a light tea flavor. Mildly bitter and nicely balanced.
Palate: Full-bodied with a good carbonation presence, fits to style.
Overall: This is one of the top amber lagers for a reason, its no frills and balanced very nicely. Subtle hops balance the malts nicely for an approachable drink even a macro drinker could enjoy.

UPDATED: MAY 14, 2017 Pours clear orange 
Smell is weak, full malts and some hops , but not to intense . 
Taste is very full . Slightly bitter, but not too much at all . very full malty base , pretty intense in the taste, actually . Some corn . 
Very good carbonation 
If this was the standard of lager beers, id be a lagerboy ! Rated 4.1

re-rate about 4 y later. Blind tasting in black glassware , together with Dr. Beer. smell is bit sweet, fruity hops, american style hops. Full fruity, mango style. Taste is full, bitter, bit old, some cardboard, bit stale. Very mild bitterness. Faded hoparoma. Pretty american inspired. Some crisp, some biscuits. Bottle was not out of date by far, but didnt taste great nevertheless.
3.2

UPDATED: JAN 7, 2015 Pours pretty dark amber. Smell of caramel and resin. Taste of viennamalt goes through, semi hoppy with a sharp bitterness that quickly ends, a faint leathery taste comes up towards the end which is not very likable.
Poured from bottle. Smells more like a pale ale than lager. Clear amber with lacing - the way a lager should look. I taste hops, hay, barley. Dry and refreshing. Good stuff.
user_location: York, SC via NJ, South Carolina, USA

text: From Systembolaget @ home. Red-amber color, flowery citrus hoppy nose, refreshing pleasant mouth with good and long hoppy moving to bitter aftertaste.
UPDATED: JUL 4, 2014 Clear amber color, medium white head. Medium body, average carbonation. Sweet fruitiness, strong caramel aroma with nice hoppy aftertaste. Very good.

DATE TASTED: February 6, 2014... GLASSWARE: 22 oz. pilsner...OCCASION: the Olympics begin in Sochi--and I am a fool for the hype... APPEARANCE: beautiful orange-amber body; healthy and bubbly; thick, rocky white head that settles well; noticeable tracing... AROMA: fragrant malt; faint yet formidable citric elements--lemongrass, some pear--and some softer hops--understated but alluring... PALATE: medium-bodied, slightly oily--solid mouthfeel--active and bubbly ...TASTE: light malts hint at bubblegum and muffin--refreshingly light overall, with a taste that invites a six-pack without simply rinsing... OVERALL: A companion piece to Sam Adams offering, though not as bold, big or bountiful; a solid mix-pack filler, a session beer for certain, and definitely versatile enough to be a plus at parties where macros are offered mindlessly....
Copper orange colour, with a decent tan head. A lot of flavour for a "lager" , very drinkable. Would wash a burger down fantastically well. Decent off the supermarket shelf beer.

Clear orange, medium white head with some retention. Malty nose with caramel and fruit hints, hops. Flavor is fruity, malty, caramel, grassy notes, some perfumey characteristics. Hops in the finish, along with some more sweetness. Watery to medium body, oily texture, fairly smooth carbonation.

Bottle, poured into pilsner glass. Beautiful. Copper, middling white head which stays there forever, super lacy. Fruity caramel aroma. Cant decide where the fruit aromas are coming from, they seem too smooth to be citrus, but its leaning towards orange. Big, smooth hop thump on first taste, which stays just as round to the end - not sharp at all. A lot of flavour for something so easy drinking. Medium bodied. Superb.
Dark amber color. Nice white head. Taste is of hops. Bitterness. Medium body.
From draught. Clear, pale amber. Thick off-white head. Aroma of American hops, lime and pine. Similar, refreshing taste. A bit waterish mouthfeel. Medium long, balanced bitter aftertaste.

Firstly I would mention that I find Brooklyn VASTLY superior on tap than out of the bottle. Im rating the tap version here. The beer pours a beautiful, rich brown/red with a great, fluffy head. Taste is very malty but theres a lingering taste of orange and a sharpness from the hops that counters it nicely. I dont know why but I find the bottled version to have a lot less flavour and complexity.
Rich, malty American lager - thicker and fuller tasting than most lagers. Perfect beer for an autumn day 28/01/14

UPDATED: JUN 12, 2015 A respectable all-around lager, not all that sophisticated but it’s a straightforward drinkable brew. Malty aroma and lighter amber color, appetizing lacing. I think I finally really know what biscuit malt tastes like now thanks to this brew. Good flavor balanced by some bitter hops that occasionally reveal some floral notes. Savory maltiness is the highlight, coupled with a cool finish. Medium-bodied with good carbonation, but occasionally seems a bit watery. At any rate quite enjoyable, hard to find in some locales but a fine example of the style.

Perfekt lager. Älskar dessa en varm sommardag. Lagom beska och knappt någon maltighet. Knappt någon sötma.

Aroma com notas florais, cravo e folha de laranja. Aparência âmbar com belo corpo e espuma. Sabor maltado com notas florais. No paladar percebe-se um certo amargor muito bem balanceado, nada que agride o palato. No geral, uma Lager de respeito.
Okay flavor, light hops, and a bit of harshness on the palate, but an okay bite during the taste. Fresh

Aroma: light hops. Appearance: dark gold, creamy white head. Taste: light bitter, some sweetness. Palate: long bitterness, lively carbonation. Overall: OK Lager, quite on the bitter side. Bottle at Jackson&Rye, London.
East of Everything ontap (15-Jan-2015) Musk spice sweet malt aroma.Sweet biscuit malt&fruity tropical flavour. Sweet biscuit malt and light herbal flavour. Herbal floral finish and sweet malt after.

caramel, chocolate, herbs, clear, white foam, golden, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, light body, thin feel, lively,

Not usually a lager man but this is a tasty one. Has a good bit of body and a little sweetness. Great beer from a great brewery! 355ml can from Martins Offlicence

UPDATED: DEC 29, 2013 Crisp floral aroma and some sweet malt tones. This is what a lager should look like, thick creamy head and a shiny body. A little thin on the palate but overall one of the best lagers around.

UPDATED: FEB 17, 2015 This lager is absolutely gorgeous to behold with its amber shade and soapy, pure head. Its also loaded with flavor, thanks to a bold burst of crisp hops. Sweet maltiness tempered by a fresh hoppiness. You absolutely cant go wrong with this beer.

bottle after S. Boston Lager, 
 By coincidence it is the same style as my previous review, so its twice interesting to compare. Totally different brew. This more reminds kind of pale ale with more sourness in taste, but again - not in aftertaste at all. Cause thi beer on nose is unknown malty to me I presume this is Vienna malt oriented with indeed more amber ale similarities, velvety thickness, Pours amber-light orange with thick small bubbly top, light lasing, medium sustained. On nose its more deep but not complex, almost no hops to me just tones of citrus-pine but not hoppy. Flavor seems like amber ale, really - not as lager beer, no clear maltiness, fruity esters there are. Light herbal bitter in aftertaste. Palate - above average body, thick, compote texture, soft carbonation, light bitter plus minimal sweet finish, minimal dry. 
Interesting, pleasant ale like brew, amber indeed.

330 ml bottle, poured. Thanks Andre!
3A. Vienna Lager

Förvånas direkt över doften när jag vet att det är en lager. Har det där honungssöta och maltiga i doften som hos lite äldre IPA. Inte dåligt, bara förvånande. Blint hade jag troligen gissat på ale. My fav North American lager. You can pour it into a glass but I rarely do with this one. Straight out of the bottle you get the floral bouquet. Taste so crisp you can hear the crunch on your tongue. A lot of craft brewers could learn from this brew.

5/XII/13 - 355ml bottle @ home - BB: VIII/2014 (2013-1115) Thanks to Dasdan for sharing the bottle!
Clear orange beer, creamy off-white head, little stable, non adhesive. Aroma: sweet, fruity, caramel, citrus, lots of passion fruits, sweet overall impression. MF: ok carbon, medium body. Taste: bitter, pretty fruity, some caramel, bit sweet, grains. Aftertaste: nice and hoppy, some citrus, little sweet. Very nice Vienna style beer!
Gyllen brun farge med et hvitt tynt skumlag. Lukter og smaker syrlig, malt og karamell. Medium kullsyre, god og bitter ettersmak.

Pours a bit short of brilliant clarity, amber with a thin white head. Aroma is Vienna malt, faint noble hops, light toast and overall a good display of melanoidins from rich German malt. Taste is complex German melanoidins, mild but firm hop bitterness from the noble hops, toast and a moderately dry finish.

Pours light amber to orange. The head is tall, but doesnt stick around forever. Still, definitely on the beautiful side of 3/5. On the nose, there are flowers, apples, citrus, candy, berries... even a hint of green unripe mango. Very very rich bouquet, in a lager no less. Ive been smelling it for long enough now, lets give it a swirl. Up front, nice and very light roast with muted sweetness, followed by a smooth transition from orange to orange zest sprinkled with nuts before it finally leaves a long, tannic-bitter finish with warming, gentle alcohol behind. The mouthfeel is very gentle, with subtle carbonation that doesnt mask the complex play of flavors of this particularly beautiful lager. What a pleasant surprise this was.
A great session beer. Flavorful. Pairs well with any kind of bar food. Always a solid choice.
Amber brown with minimal head poured from a tap. Happy taste and a little bitter. brooklyn
11/27/2010. From bottle. Poured light amber color with a white head. A very nice lager with the extra hops. Good balance and very refreshing. Flavors of malt, hops and light fruit. Very nice.
Pleasant texture of close-to-creamy, darkish brown beer, nicely balanced between hoppy and floral notes, not too bitter, not too sweet, overall refreshing. Tried at Modern American Diner, Copenhagen.

FROM NOTES: November 22, 13.

Appearance is amber with nice white head. The head stays for a long time. Aroma is intense grassy hops and light dryness. Lively carbonation. Taste: caramel, hops, grass, sourness, light sweetness. Taste is nice and floral with a hints of caramel in the back, lasting hoppy finish to boot. Decent carbonation, nothing too overpowering. This is a solid beer, great amber color with a small head, flavorful but not so strong that it overwhelms food. This is a really good lager

355ml bottle from Tanners Wines, Shrewsbury. Had this a few times over the years and it always weighs in a nice punch against the Germans. Pleasant fruitiness with a nice hoppy character.

Deep gold pour with a rocky, white head. The aroma has very light floral notes. It has a medium body with slightly oily texture and average carbonation. The taste is mildly bitter with an easy, semi-dry finish.
En fantastisk lager med beska i min smak. Härligt guldgul med fast skum. Många smaker i en trevlig kombination. En klar favorit.

Klar ljust guld färgad med ett orange och fast skul. Doft: Blommor, malt, humle, honung, gräddkola, "lager". Smak: Samma som doft. Bra och god lager som absolut inte får serveras kall utan strax under "rumms temperatur".
Cerveja muito boa, c/ cor âmbar, aromas de malte, caramelo e algo de lúpulo. Seca, com bom amargor e corpo leve/médio.

Creme acastanhado. Bem formado. Denso. Líquido cor de mel. Bastante carbonatado. Turbidez elevada. Aroma de média para baixa intensidade. Adocicado. Um pouco cítrico. Amargor forte. Um pouco cítrica...

From tap in a bar near the brewery (brewery itself was too crowded). Amber color, some exotic fruit in the nose. mango, lychee. Some nice bitterness in the taste, fruity. Very dry, very good drinkable. Very very good for an Ale. Might be the best ale I ever had!
Impressive aroma and taste. Hops aftertaste like in best pale ales. Strong aftertaste.Probably best lager.

Standard lager pour, light, murky and a small head. citrus and elderflower aroma, very nice. Hops dominates the taste, with citrus and some malt also present. Some carbonation on the palate. A very solid lager.

Ambrée claire, effervescence moyenne tout comme son col blanc. Amertume moyenne, quelques notes de fruits, les houblons américains me séduisent de plus en plus! Et ça me change des lager européennes ou asiatiques!
Great drinkable lager, with more character than expected in this kind of beer, and smooth aftertaste.
Bottle from Brothers Beer Bistro in Ottawa. Very different that any of the traditional lagers. This one poured a light amber colour and had notes of hops and malts, but nothing sensational.
Dark golden and clear with a small, but stable head.Resiny hops and a bit citrus with some grassy notes. Medium body, distinct bitterness, a bit of malty sweetness and a bitter and hoppy finish

Fresh, sweet, hoppy lager. Good every day choice harking back to early 1900s America.

Bottle 355ml, a copper beer with good head. Nose is on exotic fruit hops. Aroma is sweet malty with exotic fruits and agrumes, resin too, body is quite good for a 5° lager, finish is nice too, lot of resin, honey, exotic fruits, bitterness and light red fruit touch.

From 12 oz can at Pork Shoppe on Belmont in Chicago...with a plate of ribs!

Pours a dark lager color; thick but quickly disappearing head. Mildly hoppy nose and initial taste....much better than your fathers lager....spices and citrus in here as well....

Yummy!

Appearance with amber color and medium foam.
Hoppy aroma: floral, citrus and caramel (malt).
Complex flavor: intense malt and hops, in which the bitterness, sweetness and spiciness are felt.
An excellent beer. form a good dispute with Samuel Adams Boston Lager.

Bottle from Tesco. Looks beautiful, would compete with any other style. Thick and golden, with a lovely sticky swirl. Aroma is equally as delightful, epic hops, melon and grapefruit. The taste does let it down, still very nice but all that is in the aroma doesnt live on in the taste. Slightly too dry, which kills the length.

Best, most complex lager available in America. The combination of hops adds up to a great floral spicy aroma, with a good lasting head and lots of pine and more flowers in the taste. Best palate I ve experienced with a lager, lasting and retaining the essence of the beer.

The type of lager that makes you think about all the times youve knocked back "lagers" and wonder why did I bother? Then you think are these truly the same beverage? Sadly the answer is yes. Brooklyn lager is a slightly amber shade with half a finger of head and a softish carbonation. The aroma clearly highlights the dry hop method, which brings malt, pine spice and faint lemon and lime notes. A perfect body for the style combines well with the dry pilsner bitterness and enjoyable floral and malt tones. Dry, Mild bitter finish.
Good lager, bomber, whole foods, light and easy to drink, light amber hue, small white head, good
On tap; Pours red amber, off-white head. Fruity, light malty aroma. Malty, sweet, a bit watery taste. Short bitter finish.
Is this the best lager in the world? I dont know but i do like it, lets be honest this is what a lager should taste like, hoppy and dry with a fruity aftertaste.
Bottle 0.355l from local Alko. BB JUN 2014. Colour is clear orange with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Some sweetness, fruits, grain and malts. Nice and fresh.

From 355 ml bottle. Pours a clear bronze with a pillowy white head and lively carbonation. Aromas of lemon, malt and pine. Flavour starts out gently before building to a firm hoppy bitterness in the mid-palate. That in turn slips away to a clean lemony finish. Not much in the way of aftertaste, maybe a little pepper. An interesting and quite lovely lager.

Clear Dark Golden/Amber pour with thin white head. Effervescent carbonation. Clean malty front, smooth mouthfeel. full body, crisp finish.

Great lager not skunky at all.

Bottle. Pours clear golden-copper with a medium head and good lacing. Aroma of caramel, malts and citrus fruits. Taste - sweet malts, bread, caramel, lemon, mild bitter finish. Light-med body, crispy, medium carbonation, easy to drink. Nice beer.
Cerveja de aroma agradável e de boa qualidade. Tem uma coloração loira avermelhada e um que de floral

Clear amber with a thin white head and some lacing. Aromas of caramel malt, bread dough, nuts and sweet citrus hops. A slight sweetness works through caramel malts, bread and nuts but a grassy hop flavour comes through at the end without any particularly strong bitter notes. The beer is well balanced though and begs you to drink in multiples. Another beer that highlights a major hole in the Australian market - lagers with flavour. I don't know why decent brewers can't do these styles which are perfect for our climate? Not hipster enough I suspect because they're not "hop monsters".

This one is very easy to drink. Also pretty refreshing I must say. I like this.
Bottle from Waitrose. Ive had this a million (possibly a few less, in reality) times, but now I need to think about it, to review it, I realise how good it actually is.

Keg at Breewdog Edinburgh. Golden amber with a good white, long-lasting head. Aromas of grass, hay, touch of apple. More on the taste, with that slight vegetal tang. Good finish, refreshingly bitter. Nice.

Bottle from watson1977...thanks Kerry! - Pours clear amber with a thin foamy white head. Nose is spicy herbal and floral hops, sugar bread, and fruity yeast. Taste is sweet and syrupy with a good deal of breadiness. Lightly toasty. Finishes with spicy herbal and floral hops. Thin and viscous with biting carbonation. Decent, but I was expecting more. This seems like a fresh bottle, but I dig Capital Amber or Great Lakes Elliot Ness more.
lys brun farve på denne. Detg lukter karamell, malt og noe blomster. Rund god karamellsmak som går over til en mer bitter ettersmak.

Draft at the Wrigleyville Rooftops. Pours a dark copper amber color with a thin white head. Aroma is malty, nutty, caramel. Medium on the palate with a stage carbonation. Flavor is sweet, malty, nutty, caramel, toast, with a sweet, nutty finish.
