Bottle. Golden-orange colour wit white head. Grassy hops and malt aroma. Grassy hops and bitter taste, with some sweetness from caramel. Light body.
0,355l bottle. Amber color. Aroma is caramel and hops. Taste is medium bitter, with caramel hops, and citrus notes. Its very good , tasty and refreshing lager.

This beer is delicious, ice-cold out of a thick glass bottle. Ive had it on draft and for some reason it never quite compares to the bottled version. I rate the bottled version highly, the draft averagely. It seems to have a more refreshing consistency out of a bottle.

Aroma: Sweet notes in the smell, honey, caramel, biscuits and citrus fruits. Oranges and mandarins.Appearance: A clear amber brew, hints of orange, an off-white head leaving some lacing.Taste: Upfront sweetness, honey cereal notes, citric tones, the bitterness is somewhat "chemical" and sharp.Palate: Medium to low carbonation, a rather simple body, a short dryness.Overall: Well, it looks and smells good, but Im not 100% into the taste and feel. Miss a solid bitterness, the sweet tones remains behind the bitterness, which actually makes me more thirsty.Note: Bottle 355 ml. Reviewed 2010-08-22.

Tasted from a bottle poured into a glass, this beer is always a favorite. A great example of how a lager can be delicious without being boring

light at first ,,then a good kick to your buzz,, caramel, roasty , grass, floral, tan foam,

A really bad beer. Had several bottles but couldnt find anything enjoyable in it all. Calling it a lager is an affront to real brewers. Looking at the list of brews they produce it would seem a case of overreach. A good brewer doesnt brew fifty or so different beers, theyll invariably end up mediocre. For those who like this beer my advice would be to try a good European lager brewed by a brewer, not a bunch of show-offs.
One of my favorite beers. Deep, rich taste. Strong, but not overwhelming. Hops are prevalent in the aroma and taste, but just the right amount, not too overbearing.

Healthy aroma of pine and citrus. Very orange and cloudy with good head. Taste of pine and sweet orange with a slightly bitter finish. Palate is medium body with good carbonation. Overall, this is a very refreshing lager, orange in both color and taste.

BOTTLE.

Ambrée, presque couleur laiton, elle dispose dun tout petit col de mousse blanche. Le nez est tout en houblons et en sucre cuits. En bouche, mince, le malt semble presque fumé, même si celui-ci est plutôt discret. Ceci dit, les houblons le sont aussi, et ce qui en résulte est plutôt aqueux. On dirait une timide pale ale américaine, mais sans la profondeur que celles-ci ont habituellement. Pas mauvaise, au contraire, mais rien ne justifie daprès moi toute la renommée quelle possède.
Bottle. Very nice amber Color with lastin off White head Nice grassy hops Aroma taste is malt with some nuts? and hops aftertaste is hoppy one of the best lagers around.

Amber with a finger white head.
Cara malts, spices and some hops in nose.
In mouth is kinda boring. Caramel, some cereal, spices and some hops in the end. Carbonation is soft and bitternes is medium.
I can not understand why everybody says thats the best lager. Here in germany I can buy 20 lagers that there are better in half price just in my town...
Bottle. Aroma has some touches of hop. Bitter taste but also some heavy touches. Ok lager but not my favorite.

This is one of the best Lagers on the market. It is consistently smooth and flavorful while packing more of a punch than most beers in this category. It is as full bodied as a beer of this style can be and it works great.
Light roasted caramel taste. Pleasant light aroma. Very minor carbonation. Overall pleasant beer. ---Rated via Beer Buddy
355ml bottle at Signalen bar. Small off-white head. Clear copper colored body. Malt base. Sweet and hoppy, rounded aroma. Hints of caramel. Well balanced, bitter finish.

From bottle- Sweet aroma that I cant deipher. Maybe toffee, maybe a caramel sweetness? It is a good aroma nonetheless. Nice amber/golden color with a half inch white head that left some lacing and residual bubbles. Taste is much the same of the aroma, sweetness up front with nice balanced bitter finish.

UPDATED: JUL 8, 2013 Pours a new penny orange with a white cumulus head that quickly dissipates. The aroma is much hoppier than many of the lagers out there. This carries forward into the taste, bitter at first that fades to a pleasant bittersweet aftertaste. Becomes floral as it warms, eventually tasting quite rosy. Great fizzy mouthfeel that will quickly foam up as you swirl it around a little. 12 oz bottle out of a tall glass. One of my favorite widely available lagers, this is a good beer to keep around.
Perfect blend on malt and hops for a lager and is one of the most refreshing lagers Ive ever had. I could easily drink a sixer of this on a night.

12oz can - pours clear deep gold with white head and spotty lacing. Nose is floral and caramel. flavor adds mild grass/resin like a dandelion. mildly bitter with a decent countering sweetness. refreshing and flavorful.

6-pack 341mL bottles from Solo. 5.2%. Clear dark brown pour with a foamy tan head, medium retention. Aroma is doughy, hints of pastry, butterscotch, and a mild citrus/fruit sweetness. Medium carbonation, crisp mouthfeel. Taste is a hint of toffee with dominant maltiness. Generously hopped for this style, and this is not unwelcome in otherwise crisp and balanced finish. The best of this style by several city blocks (not a country mile, ha!)
UPDATED: MAR 12, 2014 Good beer, enjoyable, good drinking session and a great lager. Not golden or tasteless.
Ruikt citrus en kruidig, heerlijk voor een lager. Donker geel. Smaakt bitter, die langzaam wegebt. Beetje IPA (verkeerde bier in flesje). Weinig kraag.

Bottle from mane liquor. Drunk from the stubby. Nose of citrus and biscuit malts. Subtle hoppiness is quite pleasant. Clean taste. Nice subtle citrus And biscuit malts. Clean easy drinking!!

Bottle from Mane Liquor. Sipped from the bottle. Floral and grassy hops with a bready malt backbone. Taste is smooth and balanced, floral sweetness and depth combined with a crisp malt profile. Really easy going and one of the best lagers Ive had.

Appearance: Clear amber/light copper with white head about a finger wide.
Aroma: Light breadyness, citrus, floral and slight ginger note.
Taste: Light sweetness, light/medium bitterness and a subtle saltyness.
Palate: Gentle bitterness which lingers slightly at the end after a quick finish, refreshing, medium carbonation, light body, smooth texture.
Comments: Enjoyable, far too easy to drink and refreshing on a warm day. Left a glass lace.

Serving: 12 oz. bottle from Wegmans Leesburg.  Not sure how Ive missed rating this one.  It pours a nice amber color with a lasting white head.  The nose has a mix of slight malt notes and a little floral hops.  The flavor has a solid bitterness with florals, perhaps a little pine, some toast, and a little caramel on the back end.  Overall solid and refreshing.
On tap. Light bronze colour, clear, high foam. Floral aroma. Fresh, lasting bitterness.

UPDATED: JUN 27, 2013 Just had this from a can as opposed to bottle for the first time, still tastes great.  Pours a clear orange with a small white head.  Proves you can have great tasting lager, light body, crisp taste and mellow hop finish.
UPDATED: JAN 19, 2014 Copperish brown colour with nice head. Aroma is floral and fruity sweet. Taste is caramelly sweet and bitter. Medium full. Refreshing.

UPDATED: JUL 4, 2013 Aroma sweet, bready and hoppy. A really full bodied and flavoured lager with a slightly resinous quality. Good head retention. Really good lager, the highest score (equal) I have ever given a lager.

Bottle @ eelkes. Aroma is caramel and bready malt, nice floral and fruity american hops. Mild bitterness, fruity hop notes. Nice.

355 ml. Pours amber with little head. Aromas of toasted malts and fruit. Crisp and bitter. Flavours of malt, toast, and light citrus.
UPDATED: SEP 19, 2015 Pours cloudy golden. Aroma of malt, hints of fruit. Strong carbonation. Dry aftertaste with nice amount of bitterness. A bit of a alcohol burn. Good beer for style.

UPDATED: AUG 31, 2014 Bottle into lager glass.  Golden-amber color with off-white head.  Aroma of malt sweetness, some caramel, light fruity hop and floral notes. Moderate in weight and the carbonation is a couple notches below moderate as well. Decent offering but not my favorite from Brooklyn Brewing.

White foamy full lasting head. Amber colour. Aroma is malty, fruity with peach and light floral and hoppy notes. Flavor is malty too with fruity (pear, peach) and light spicy (cloves) tones, ending in a balanced, slightly hoppy finish. Light to medium bodied.
On tap while watching some basketball at a pub.  I know this is good for the style, but I still think its only a bit above average.

Im not normally a lager fan as I prefer to get some flavour for my efforts. But this is worth mentioning in that regard. A decent flowery bitter flavour that lingers. After two pints Id be looking for something else though.
A very good lager with a very nice floral bitterness and full mouthfeel. Dark amber in color with a white head.
Golden color out of the bottle with a foamy ivory head.  Light grainy nose with some lemon notes.  Crisp cracker and toast malt flavors with some lemon peel hop tones.  Very flavorful, tasty beer.

On tap at a Brooklyn sports bar.
A very, very nice lager here.
In my opinion, this is superior to the "flagship" Yuengling Lager.
Pours copper with nice head and tastes like a lager should - malty but not too heavy. Taste of caramel and almonds (light). Nose is of resin with a  hint of citrus.Very well done here.
Tap; Nice dark amber colour for a lager with some light malt and caramel aroma. Taste is interesting and slightly roasty. Very satisfying.

Bottle from sansburys. Dark amber on the pour. Little to no head. Malty on the nose. Reminds me of paulaner octoberfest, bready and caramelly. Obviously Vienna and/or Munich used. Little bittering and hops well rounded. Decent lager for sure

Fresh from the tap at MSG. This one poured a darker orange color with an eggshell white head.  Aroma was nice citrusy hops, and light toasted notes. Pint can at MSP airport.  Golden pour and two fingers of white head.  Sticky lacing.  Nose of citrus and caramel malt, taste is the same.  Lively and smooth.  Very enjoyable.

Had this at an airport in Norway. Not much on the nose, medium head that goes away quickly. Taste. is caramel and fruits. It has the typical lager aftertaste, but this feels more complex for the style. Very nice for a session beer.

Can from State line liquors. Pours with a brownish tint and a half inch of foam. Not getting much from the nose except for a note of floral. Lots of hop flavor on the tongue with a hint of bitterness on the finish.

On tap @ Carbones.  Pours amber with a generous off-white head.  Aroma is malt and bread as expected, with some floral hops for good measure.  Taste is sweet malts and lightly toasted bread, then a noticeable amount of hops with mild bitterness, then into a more bready finish.  Very drinkable.

peach, bread and some noticeable sweetness. very flavorful and easy to drink.
golden, clear, minimal head, roasty, earthy, lightly bitter, light body, creamy, soft carbonation, bitter,
On draft at rustico Akexandria VA. Pours a clear pale amber with an off white head. Mild grassy aroma.  Mellow flavor with lots of carbonation and notes of bread dough.  Bitter finish.
Verry hoppy for a lager.  Clear amber pour.  Malty aroma.  Drinkable, but wont be listed among my favorites.
12oz bottle. Pours a hazy orange color with small fizzy white head. Aromas of light malt, caramel, and biscuit. Flavor is the same.  Biscuit malts, caramel, and slight fruity hops.

UPDATED: FEB 15, 2014 Update: it is a bit better, but not,much. Bottle. Orange hazy. Bready malts, caramel and a lot of green hoppiness on the nose. Body is lightish, crisp bitter with green hops and some caramel. Some metallic notes, dusty yeast. I wonder if this is old, I remember it  being a lot better..-- bb/h(n9)
Colore intenso ramato un po ambrato. Schiuma fine, cremosa e persistente. Caramello, dolciastra. Leggermente amara nel retrogusto. Corpo medio. Lager molto buona.
Clean, light, refreshing.  Not over flavoursome.  Light malt, light body, great amber colour.

Slight aroma of caramel.  Nice clear amber appearance.  Nice mildly -sweet caramel malt up front.  Lightly bitter, on the back end.  Refreshing bt preffer my Vienna Lagers a little sweeter and more complex.
If i had to choose one commercial lager, it would be this. Well balanced, refreshing. A safe buy, you know what you get! Great lager! Thanks, crew at Brooklyn!
Bottled ; Devon ; UK ; Hops and some malty aroma ; Dark amber color with proper head ; Medium bitter taste with malt body ; Pretty good.

Appearance:  Copper hue, nice light tan fluffy head which lasts.  Nice visible carbonation.
Aroma:  Mixture of caramel maltiness and restrained citrusy hops.
Flavour:  Biscuity malts quickly give way to a lovely resiny hop flavour.
Mouthfeel:  Snappy carbonation hits the tongue, relatively light body follows, leading to a quick, somewhat sweet and then moderately dry bitter finish.
Overall:  The way a "lager" should be.  A 6 pack of these I would be proud to bring to any party!
Bottle. Pours an amber color with a moderate white head. Nose is fairly slight and average. Tastes like a lager. Not bad for a lager, but a lager. Meh.

A bit too bitter for my taste and a long aftertaste. Good with seething salty or sweet.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

355ml bottle. Pours a clear copper amber colour, with a thin white head and aroma of fruity malt & grain. Taste is malty, with grain, earthy grass, floral fruity citrus hop & biscuit notes. Medium bodied, crisp & well balanced with a lingering dry bitter finish.  Quite drinkable lager.

Pours copper orange with a finger of foam that dwindled to a nice lacing.  Nose is aromatic with a rich malt profile.  Cracker, biscuit, carmel.  Some shy hops come up to offer a little grass and tangerine citrus.  Taste is earthy and clean.  The pale malt is nice and round and the hops lend a touch of bitterness to make it drink well.  Mouthfeel is a little flat, could have used a few more bubbles.  But it was smooth, semi dry and had a grainy and slightly bitter finish.  It wont blow your mind but you could drink a few of these.
Bottle  at olearys kista. Could have had more hop aroma.  Ok but nothing special. ....
Bottle. Golden colour with a white head. Aroma of malt, hops. Flavour is hops, some citrus.

355ml bottle shared with friends. Pours amber with a thin white head. Lovely nose of citrus, roast malt, caramel with spicy hints of chili. Tastes nice and bitter, a little sourness. Nice bit of citrus and malt. Medium and dry palate with a nice lingering bitterness. Overall, very tasty and complex for a lager.

Bottle. Pours clear amber with airy but stable off-white head. Clear aroma of hops and malt with a distinct flowery and fruity note. Fruity onset leading quickly to a bitter, hoppy flavour. Dry aftertaste. Refreshing and good.

12 ounce bottle into pint glass, best before March 2013.  Pours lightly cloudy golden orange color with a very nice 2 finger fluffy off white head with great retention, that reduces to a nice cap that lasts.  Spotty soapy lacing clings down the glass.  Aromas of caramel, apple, pear, orange zest, cracker, biscuit, floral, herbal, light pepper, and earthy hops.  Nice and pleasant aromas with good balance and decent strength.  Taste of apple, pear, orange zest, caramel, cracker, biscuit, floral, herbal, light pepper, and hop earthiness.  Light herbal bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of pear, apple, orange zest, caramel, cracker, biscuit, floral, herbal, light pepper, and earthy hops on the finish for a short bit.  Very nice balance of flavors with solid robustness; and zero cloying flavors present after the finish.  Medium carbonation and body; with a lightly creamy, smooth, and fairly crisp mouthfeel that is good.  Alcohol is very well hidden with hardly any warming noticed at all after the finish.  Overall this is a very good amber lager.  Nice fairly robust flavors with good balance; and extremely smooth to drink.  A nicely enjoyable offering.

Poured from a bottle, clear-slightly hazy amber color with a small head. For a lager, it has a decent hop/floral aroma, maybe some malty sweetness in the smell. Taste is good for a lager: crisp with a balance of hops and malts. Bitter aftertaste. Decent lager.

Drinking notes from 2-28-2010: The pour left a decent head, but quickly ended. Amber in color, had a floral aroma. Amber in color, clear. High hop taste, left over on palate. Overall a little above average lager.

Pours a clear gold-amber with a 3-fingered white head.  Smells of honey, caramel, biscuits, floral, with a hint of a sharp farmyard.  Taste is sweet - honey and biscuits, mild-moderate hops - grassy & herbal.

Clear amber orange colour; Small head and off-white foam which fades in 40 seconds. Small but sticky lacing with notable carbonation; Light and fragrant aroma of honey, light sweet malt, bread and orange, followed by nice pineapple and floral as it gets warmer; Nice, light sweet taste of malt, cream crackers, lime and grass; Light body, thin palate, hop bitterness is nice and low key, with taste profile being dominated by initial light sweetness and then a penetrating and gradual hoppiness to finish. Dry after taste, very easy to mouth.

Comments: This one is a lot more expressive and tasty than Sam Adams Boston Lager, as it leans towards premium lager a bit more. Yet it preserves all the elements typical of Vienna. Highly drinkable and enjoyable and I really like it. With this, I can kiss those shitty macro pale lagers goodbye!

Paladar: Cuerpo ligero, consistencia aceitosa, carbonización plana, acabado metálico muy ligero. 3
Sabor: inicio insípido, Final amargo moderado  de larga duración 7
Pienso que es una de las lager más interesantes que he catado hasta ahora. Su complejidad parece propia de una Stout. Definitivamente recomiendo probar esta cerveza. Sin embargo ya que ambas cuestan lo mismo, recomiendo que compren la Ale.
Overall  15
Google translate.
Appearance: cream-colored bubbly regulate head quickly disappears, leaving a foam collar attached to the vessel walls. Coppery body, huge bubble murky and slow. 4
Aroma. Gum Strong 7
Palate: Light body, oily consistency, charring flat, very light metallic finish. 3
Taste: home tasteless, moderately bitter finish long lasting seven
I think its one of the most interesting lager Ive tasted so far. Its complexity seems to own a Stout. Definitely recommend trying this beer. But since both cost the same, I recommend you buy the Ale.
Overall 15
UPDATED: FEB 14, 2013 Hopper than expected - grapefruit citrus, some lemon, beady, and great lager character. Really nice

Floral and bready aromas.  Clear gold with mostly diminishing, white head foam.  Dry, toasty, floral, and bitter.  Light bodied with average carbonation, and a very clean, balanced finish with lingering toast and floral hops.

On tap @ Brew Dog, Edinburgh.
Floral nose, fruits.
Clear blond orangeish. No head.
Normal beer, nothing exceptional.
Very nice lager, not comparable to most other industrial lagers. Reminds me of light IPAs, with bitterness and some citrus.
Im glad this is Brooklyns flagship, since its the first of theirs Ive been a fan of. Biibbly head. Light floral nose. Mild carbonation. Mellow hop flavors, pleasant florals, balanced flavors.

Pour is medium amber. Nose is immediately flowery, with some light herbal undertones, with a very light toasty malt aroma backing. Flavor is crisp, flowery hops, medium bright hoppiness, toasted an biscuit malts, Light body and refreshing. A somewhat enjoyable beer.
Good beer. Hop nose with a refreshing hop flavor and bitter finish. Over all pretty enjoyable.

My Bottom Line:
Cracking cereals with their lightly toasted angles benefit from a spicy hop tinge in this very drinkable, though unmemorable brew.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A sheet of foam covers the clear, amber-hued bronze.
-A few minerals show up here and there.
-The mouthfeel is very comfortable ; creamy and soft.
-Wooden hop bitterness balances out the finish.
-This is a very nice flagship beer to have on a portfolio.

Bottle.
Bottle. Nice floral aroma, well carbonated. Good for a standard lager. Light, refreshing, malty, but enough hops to finish crisply.

Mostly clear bubbly copper-amber with small off-white head.  Aroma malt and flowery hops.  Clean and crisp with light carbonation.  Backbone is mostly lightly sweet malt, but a big amount as well of floral hops and dry finish.  A lot of hops for the style.  Quite good though.
Una birra davvero interessante pur essendo reperibile al supermercato, di un bellambrato con schiuma poco persistente ma decisa in bocca con un luppolato molto gradevole.
Red, nice color. Fresh foam. Sweet smell. Sweet, malty taste. The beer stops a little too early. Little bitterness. Short, but beautiful. Great taste
Draught at O´Learys Landvetter Airport dec 2012. Clear amber beer with a big offwhite head. Malty aroma and flavour with floral notes. Nice one :-)

Homey dont play dat. love the new can revolution.


this shits everywhere. whatever a lager is, i like it

This was was much better the second time I tried this. The aromas were of mild hops with some grainy essence. The color was a dark golden color with a huge head. This is not a favorite style of mine because they tend to be low on excitement and flavor. This was one the best of its kind Ive had. Crisp and light palate. Hoppier version that still had remnants that were true to style. Good beer to drink with most foods.

12oz bottle, darkish yellow hue, diminishing white head, no lacing, smells a little clove like but not too much of taste, tastes a bit of banana and sour, a touch sweet, overall a good lager, dont love the brewer but maybe their inherent taste fits well with this style, serviceable in a pinch, probably a good session beer albeit at 5.2
UPDATED: MAR 12, 2013 Brooklyn beers in general dont wow me. This is a drinkable lager, amber in color with some floral notes, but I prefer other American amber lagers to this one.

Kaatuu lasiin meripihkanvärisena ja keskikokoisella valkoisella vaahdolla. Haju on ruohoinen, hieman puinen, kukkainen, voinen ja havuinen. Maku on hunajainen, havuinen, ruhoinen, puinen, hieman hiivainen, hedelmäinen (sekä tuoretta että kuivattua) ja hivenen voinen. Suutuntuma on miedohko, mutta miellyttävä. Kokonaisuutena malliesimerkki tyylissään, kevyt ja raikas kesäjuoma. Ja onhan tässä sitä jenkkihumalaakin.

Excellent beer and a good example of the style - from an American perspective. Lots of American hops

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle 0,33 L. Amber colour, medium creamy, beige head. Moderate hoppy aroma with signs of herbs, dry grass, pine, grapefruit and touch of caramel malts. Taste is a bit acidic at the first sip (havent expected that, after that aroma). Aftertaste turns into a heavy bitter. Its marked as a lager on the bottle, but it doesnt taste like lager. Its more like an IPA.
Bottle->mini Kolsch.  Light copper with frothy head, high carbonation.  Aroma: mild hops and fruit.  Taste: sweet with light bitter hoppiness descending.  One of the best of this style.

Copper gold in the glass with a pillowy white head. Lovely nose with sharp, sweet hops, toasted malt, grass and caramel. Flavour is toasted, bready malt and caramel sweetness. There?s a lovely dryness to the palette. Smooth mouthfeel and soft carbonation, quite robust in the body. Long, malty finish with another twist of toffee sweetness. Packed with flavour and character, one of the best lagers I?ve ever had.
Here is a Lager with some actual taste to it! Very good and enjoyable, has flavors of caramel and some hoppiness to it.
Easy, slides down and is more than "bearable". One of my favorite beer for a Friday after work or a warm summer night.

33 cl bottle.
Originally rated on 20090609.
Pours clear golden color with a medium head. Aroma of hops, fruits and caramel. Flavor of hay, hoppy fruits and some malts. Nice.

Bottle.  Pours a clear copper amber with a medium to large white head.  Grain and malt on the nose, a touch of sweetness and a bit of paper.  Medium bodied, crackery grain and malt.  A bit sweet, soft bitterness starts early.  Malty sweetness into the finish with a bit more bitterness following it.  Easy drinking but a touch dull for me.

Pours a Dark orangish color with a white head and some nice lacing. Fruity and sweet scent with a well balanced citrusy hop presence. Quite sweet at first, some nice caramel that gives way to a fairly assertive, but not overly strong hoppiness. Mouth feel is between thin and medium. A solid beer.

This beer should be labeled as an IPL as the hops over-power the other wise appropriate aroma and taste of a lager. Definitely not a Vienna style beer.
Once I got past the fact that this tasted and smelled like an extremely hoppy  IPA, this is a very nice beer. The color was nice coppery but had the look of a hefeweizen with yeast apparent in suspension.
Botella. Color dorado con espuma de buena formacion y carbonatacion media. Una muy buena lager con aroma y sabor lupulado, refrescante, ligera y sabrosa. muy buena
Bottle. Fresh aroma. Amber. Little carbonation with hint of honey. Watery taste, quite flat.

Bottle. Pours orange-red with average white head. Aroma is flowers, citrus, bread, grassy, caramel malt.  Taste is light sweet and and light bitter. Body is light, texture is oily,  carbonation is average. Finishes fairly dry/bitter. A rather nice lager.

What a lovely lager. Almost fruity? Delicious. I wish it wasn't so expensive so I could buy 10 of these for like a fiver instead of carling, yeah?

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Dark cloudy pour with frothy head from bottle. Wet dog smell. Fruity malty apricot and sweet taste.  Better than expected.  Like it

Bottle 0,33ltr: Clear amber coloured brew i have never rated before so long ago i drunk this one. I like pre-prohibition brews, this have a taste of some caramel and honey-like sweetness, good sweetbitter finish.
355 ml bottle. Pours clear amber with small white head. Fermented fruit smell, a bit spicy. Bitter taste, bitterer palate.
Small white head. Clear amber colour. Sweet peach aroma with hints of honey. Watery taste and an interesting bitter sour palate.

Pale golden; massively coarse bubbles in the head which is not terribly attractive.  Aroma citrus, bready yeast, maybe nutty.  Easy drinking mild flavor; bread, caramel; nice light bitterness complements.  Smooth mouthfeel, lightly sticky.  Good for the style but pretty "meh" over the spectrum of good beers.
Good for a Viennese lager. Has a nice label, which is probably my favorite part of this beer. Otherwise, the flavor is kind of flat, but its decent if you damn near freeze it.

Bottle;  Palate and appearance dont quite match the taste.  I found the taste a bit dull and bitter for my liking but still appreciated the complexity of flavors that it contains.  I must add that I did enjoy the hoppiness of this beer.

Den felande länken i amerikansk ölkultur, fram till nu då möjligtvis när en del mikrobryggerier med hög kvalitet ploppat upp lite här och där i landet. Brooklyn lager skänker på egen hand hopp till dem som får kväljningar så fort Budweiser nämns som en bra amerikans ölsort.

UPDATED: DEC 3, 2016 On tap in manhattan bar. Way better on tap than in a bottle, hop flavor and aroma comes out more. Like a cross between a pale ale and a lager, in a bottle more honey aftertaste, on tap way more hop finish. Grassy, hoppy, surprisingly good. Will order again.

(Bottle 355ml from Sainsburys) Pours bright amber colour with medium white head and body. Aroma and Taste of hops and caramel malts. Overall not bad at all, tastes more like a light ale/ipa than a lager. Better than expected.
UPDATED: NOV 22, 2012 Bottle at bar. Amber color, white head. Bitter taste with citrus, caramel,and toast. Very nice vienna.
Lovely looking beer, nice white head, deep golden colour. Fresh hot aroma. Nice bitter taste. Smooth. Very drinkable.

in bottle, with a burrito, not a great combination as the beer is very flowery in taste. Summer drink, could have max one 0.33 bottle and done. too rich in flowers. not too sure what you would eat with it - a dessert? Quite strong aftertaste. 
A bit cloudy.
Smells nice thou.
Very fresh, light, crisp, and satisfyingly dark.  Basically all that the Nordeast vienna wants to be.  Fresh aroma, albeit light.  Amazingly rich aftertaste and a warm amber color.
Pours dark amber. .. Metallic nut flavor..smooth..  Tasty... Diffrent.. Clean finish.. Would prolly do again,  way better then any other beer ive had from the brooklyn brewery

Sweet malt, bittered caramel malt. Some floral hops peek through on nose. Good looking amber with a white ring and splashy lacing. Looks like a lager that wants you to drink the shit out of it. Taste is really simple malt driven and delicious. Some hops come in to add balance quick and citrus.  Great lager.
Bottle, pour is golden, flavour is quite nice, its got a light hop flavour with a good smooth body, overall, tasty stuff
Draught. Dark brown with brown head. Aroma of aroma hopps citrus and grass. Taste hoppy and malty body.

Slight grass floral notes. Dry bitter. Fine straight brew.
33,5 cl bottle. Golden amberish color with medium white head. Nice crisp, lightly bitter and pretty low carbonation for a lager. Balanced hops and malts aromas and nice finish. Good brew.
pours light tan with two inch thick head.  crisp refreshing very easy to drink..  slightly floral with a nice hoppy finish

Pours a clear caramel color with a medium lt tan head.  Aroma has light hoppiness...earthy with dry leaves and almost a spicy/wheaty note.  Flavor has nice hoppiness for a lager...spicy/bitter atop faint toffee and earthy malts.  Mouthfeel is full and the finish is earthy/bitter and dry.

Initial hoppy flavor with some fruit and hop smell. A little cloudy with an off white head. Pretty solid lager

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Brooklyn Lager taste fantastic, rate 4 .................................................. via Beer Buddy for iPhone

A solid lager, one of the best with a decent distribution (which sadly doesnt reach KS).  A great session lager, malty and slightly thick on the palate.  A nice hoppy zip.  Tried with Nick at DMK burger in Chicago, 2012.

almost IPA instead of a lager
but the fact that almost every place in NYC has this one on draft makes me (almost) want to move to USA.
Good smell and taste. The aftertaste is left for a while. Clearly a good beer that I would buy again. The first beer I drank from Brooklyn. Are more curious about what they have for beer.
Imagine if domestic beer still tasted like this. For one, none of us would be on here rating this stuff; pretty malty, deep color, & easy finish. Def. impressed.
Draft to Unibroue tulip. Looks good for a lager; a semi-transparent copper with off-white head. Smells and tastes doughy and a little bitter. Average on the palate. A solid example of the style.
Mid gold pour with white persistent head. Fruit and strong hoppy aroma. Initial bitterness gives way to sweetness, piney/fruity mellow finish. Very nice.

Nice subtle aroma combined with a crisp fresh palate and finish with firm, flavourful character.  As much as I am striving to develope a bud for the IPAs, I think it?s time I admit I?m a lager/pilsner kind of guy.

Very good beer.
Nice, easay to drink with good amount of flavour.
slight caramel taste flows through fruity tonesand hints of citrus.caramel, citrus, earthy,
35,5cl bottle. Little hazy golden color with white head. Hoppy aroma of citrus. Nice fresh taste of hops, citrus, honey. Good lager. Summer beer.

Bottle, 355 ml. Drank a quite a few of this years ago, when this was one of the first American micros to hit shelves in Denmark. Had one yesterday and was pleasantly surprised. Clear, orangey off white head. Malty, nice fruity hoppy aroma. Smooth malt bill, toasted, with nice citrusy hops. Medium body, light bitter finish.
Stanleys Beer Fest 10/6, BOTTLE. Pour is amber with a thick white head. Aroma is grain and mald. Taste moves well from sweet to bitter.

BIg stable foamy head over slightly hazy copper body. Aroma of pine, malt, caramel and fresh bread. Taste of firm bitterness at first, and then mellowing out with some malt and bread, and a note of pine. Palate firm and hoppy bitter. Very nice. One of the better Vienna lagers Ive tasted
Interesting, good tasting high standard Lager beer. Nice mild hop taste... I like it...

Poured on-tap at the Flying Saucer in Austin:

Aroma: Clean, sweet malts, hint of hops.

Appearance: Light red/amberish color with frothy white head. Head has great staying power as it leaves thick rings of lace down the glass.

Taste: Clean, sweet grainy malts. Grassy hops in the finish.

Palate: Very crisp, refreshing. Nice and easy drinking.

Overall: This one worked perfectly as a palate cleanser in between 2 bigger brews. Very sessionable and good, clean flavors.
12 ounce bottle.  Pours a clear dark amber with a nice white head.  Aroma of malt, caramel, and hops.  Taste is caramel malt, bread, florals, citrus, and pine.  Very nice.  Wish I had more.
33cl bottle. Pours amber color with a nice white head. Very nice fuity aroma with the great hops used. Flavor is sweet, malty with some bitterness. A good beer

Love this brewery! Never had a bad bew from these guys. The flagship of this brewery is the Brooklyn Lager. Pours copper with nice head and tastes like a lager should - malty but not too heavy. Taste is cramel and almonds (light). Nose is resiny and hints of citrus. Near perfect beer.

UPDATED: FEB 13, 2016 Rerate (13.2.2016): 355 ml, bottled. Pours clear orange amber with minimal white head. Aroma: Grains, malt. Hints of fruity tones. Taste: Medium+ sweet, malty and grainy flavour. Biscuits. Tones of caramel. Dry hoppy taste. Notable bitterness. Balanced. Palate: Light-medium body, average carbonation. Simple, enjoyable. Very nice.
-----
355 ml, bottled. Pours clear orange with a decent white head. Aroma: Pleasant grainy pale malt, bread, a bit fruity and herby hops. Taste: Medium sweet, some pleasant late bitterness. Palate: Over medium body, average carbonation. Enjoyable lager. (7-4-7-4-13, 25.9.2012)

12 Oz bottle pours amber with a off-white head.  Aroma of malt, little citrus and grain. Taste is Caramel Malts and  a nice bitterness .

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Deep golden blonde, clear, with a light white head, fading. Hints of lemon, flowery and a strong malt bouquet. Light body, good malt structure with lemony hops, fresh, easy drinking. Great summer lager.

Bottle at home. 
Light amber color with head. 
Dry aroma. 
Nice crisp taste, I think there is resemblance to a ale ??




Bolton Brew Rocks !!

355ml bottle. Poured a clear, dark amber with minimal head. Aroma was good lager malt with some herbal hops. Taste is a great balance of medium malt and herbal and spicy hops. Body was reasonably thick for a lager. Overall, hops of hops for an American lager. A real treat.
Nice taste, fruity light but you can taste the alcohol. Definitly only good drinkable when its, otherwise its like all the other beers.
Bottle. Amber colour with large white head. Aroma of faint hops. Taste is a little sour citurs flavours. This is not as good as the other Vienna, Samuel Adams Boston lager.
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text: Clear amber. Medium carbonation. Fruity smell and taste. Balanced bitterness in the end. Probably one of the best lagers around!
I struggle to call this a lager, so if I had a vote on style it wouldve been low. If you ignore the fact they call this a lager what do you have? An excellent well balanced session beer

UPDATED: FEB 11, 2013 Flaske på Bacchus i Stavanger: En meget velsmakende pilsner i Wiener-stilen, mer gylden mørk farge enn vanlig pils, og god malt (litt karamell?)  og  humlebalanse med snert. Tørrhumlingen gjør sitt til at dette er et både aromatisk og velsmakende øl.  Fra fat på Sola: en  passende start på hytteturen, men 79 kr for et glass er over smertegrensen. Skal bli godt å lande til danske ølpriser.

Bottle share with JF on Southampton beer up - 09/09/12.
Clear pale golden with a frothy off-white head.
Nose is pale malt and a little grain - not much doing.
Taste as nose with a little toffee and background citrus.
Medium bodied with matching carbonation leading to a dry finish.
Ok for the style but people are making much better lagers in this day and age!
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Bottle shared with McTapps. Nose is superb with herbs and citrus. Taste not that good. For a vienna-style a but bitter finish. Definitely drinkable but nit worth superhigh points.
Bottle shared with MichaelBruch. Pale golden colour with low head combined with grassy aromas. Boring taste, nothing special. Eathy-floral notes, light bitterness.
The word lager frightens the shit out of me but this a lager you can enjoy FU Stella

Thought Id start with an easy one. Ive never been to Brooklyn but I imagine this is what it tastes like. If Brooklyn was a lager. Which its not obviously. It is full of hipsters though, or so Im led to believe having never been there. Oh, Im supposed to talk about the beer. Very nice it was. I had two.

UPDATED: NOV 11, 2012 Bardzo dobre i smaczne piwo z dzielnicy Nowego Yorku. Bursztynowy kolor, Aromat kwiatowo chmielowy. W smaku lekki karmelowy słód i aromatyczny i kwiatowy chmiel. Świetnie smakuje, a piana stoji dębem

A great lager. Brooklyn nails it again. Not as good as the Pilsner or brown, but it is right p there. Aroma and appearance are suitable. The taste is balanced extremely well. The aroma had my expectations assuming the trend of west coast citrus hops, fortunately that was not the case. A very smooth lager.
A honey gold color with a small one finger head. Not an extraordinary aroma but sensational lager from such a big brewery. The most balanced mass produced lager on the market.

After the Boston Lager this beer is probably the best known malty vienna style beer stateside. It manages to be floral amongst dominant doughy caramel aromas. Its medium amber with plenty of carbonation. The flavor packs in the grassy hops in a surprise way for a beer that one expects to be overly malty. Also very dry. Lighter and more effervescent than its NE rival.
330ml Bottle. Pours amber with a thin but strong head. Citrus and nuts, with some floral notes. Follows through with earthy coffee, nuts and caramel. A very nice lager.
Bottle at home. Clear dark copper amber, fluffy white head. Clean crisp nose, soft lager malt, soft lemony hops. Nice clean malty front, light floral bitterness. Very refreshing. Good.

Amber golden colour with a white head. Rich malt and moderate caramel nose. Also some citric notes in the aroma.Outstanding flavour. Unusual lager. Rich malt and hoppy flavour. Citric and light fruity.[On tap at Siste Reis Pub in Halden, Norway]
Pours a slightly hazy light brown colour. A fruity aroma followed by a slightly hoppy and fruity taste and a bitter finish. Overall a well rounded beer.

Bottle. A little hazy reddish copper color with a thin head. Smells like an American ale; floral hops. The taste brings it back to lager genre. Dry maltiness with a slightly fruity finish. Lively carbonation.

100 miles an hour on a train in rochester, flipping off BlacIPA doing a shot of knob creek bourbon. Its time for a beer. Dark amber. Graham crackers like wow. Dough, grass, train fume aroma. Flavor? Drinks pretty good. Well carbonated, easy drinking, didnt spill over no matter how much the train was bobbing around. Thats some ABW% for you noobs. Im done with this review.

No será la mejor lager del mundo, ni la más extrema, ni la más destacada. Pero sin duda es una lager muy bien hecha que tendría con gusto en mi nevera.

Es aromática como cabe esperar por su procedencia, huele a flores y caramelo. Tiene al beberla el contrapunto dulce y amargo, equilibrada, bien hecha. Ligera de cuerpo y refrescante.
This accurate lager was my first introduction to craft beer. The Hoppy aroma and well balanced bitterness/sweetness make it my first recommendation for any new comers to specialty beer.
Clear darker yellow with solid white foam head. Aroma is grassy, with something undefined. Taste is dry with fruit, grass flavors. Aftertaste is bit undefined, slightly bitter. (Houston 201208)

Good. The nose is full of caramel and bread malts with floral hop notes. The beer is a beautiful amber with a tight offwhite cap. Sweet with a floral bitter background. Exceptionally smooth with a lingering bitter finish.
UPDATED: OCT 17, 2012 Pint @ Start the Bus, Bristol. Amber with a long lasting blonde head. Sweet toffee malts and piny citrus hops.
33 cl bottle @ home. Pours clear amber with a decent white head that leaves a little lacing. Aroma is caramel malt, fruity and floral hops, and a little yeast. Flavour is malty with some floral hops.
Tap at Dach and Sons NW3. Full flavoured lager, bitter malt character and some hop in the finish. Very flavoursome as lagers go.
A good Lager, easy to session. Dark color appears more like an IPA, but has a light aroma and a slight honey taste before the alcohol flavor.

Aroma is inviting and delicious. Nuanced caramel-toffee malting has also bread. Hoppiness has citrus and pine and balances here well. Coppery amber, frothy blond head is medium long. In taste citrus is more on top. Nice flavor. Crisp, light. Wow, what a lager! So you can do it this way also.

330 mL bottle. Pours a medium amber with a patchy white head, decent lacing.  Aromas of caramel, orange, cinnamon and a little earthy funk.  Taste is medium sweet with a slight bitterness, fairly meaty feeling, progresses to a little sourness. A little weight on the palate with a bitter-sour finish, medium high carbonation.  A great session beer, perfect for burgers, fish and chips or other pub fare.

(Bottle). Slightly sweet malt fragrance with a fresh hop aroma and vague hints of figs and brown sugar. Malt flavor with some floral hop aromas and a bit rough and dry aftertaste. The taste is a bit short. Drinkable beer, but nothing more!
Good lager. Aroma is pretty mild but pleasant. Attractive pour. Nice bittering flavor with lager smoothness. Good potential session.

Poured a lovely, deep gold colour with a distinct spicy aroma with what seemed to me to be hints of mint and berries. Unfortunately, I thought the drink itself was far too bitter, allowing only brief moments of hoppy distinction.

Poured a cloudy/teranslucent light amber with a one-finger off white foamy head that retained and laced. Moderate carbonation. Not a lot of aroma - slight malts and some hops. Taste initally malt followed by hops tartness - good balance. Light body. Crisp, slightly bitter finish.

355 ml bottle straight from the fridge after a long hot bus journey. Poured into a 1/2 pint chalice, amber with a dense white head. Citrus and straw aroma, lovely floral hop flavour. Middling bitterness, slightly oliganeous texture, soft carbonation. Hops assert themselves again in the finish. I really like this.
Taken from old notes. I found this to be a little too sweet for a lager, imo. However, it was still decent. Has a nice, soft finish.
This was is a decent go to lager if you dont have too many options. I prefer Boston Lager, but this is definitely close. Not bad, but could definitely use a little bit more flavor.

355ml bottle. Clear copper body, small beige head. Resinous aroma, sweet floral tones, malt, citrus. Sour taste upfront that lingers into some moderate hop bitterness, biscuit, malt, lime and lemon zest.

Bottle at grease. Pours light copper with a small white head. Aroma is light but had some biscuit notes and a little barley. Taste is very flavorful for a Vienna and has some bitterness followed by a lot of grainy notes.

Beer pours into a sturdy and respectable head.   Light copper colored and easy to drink.   Not complex, but a well-balanced beer and one that you would expect to be this good that claims to be pre-prohibition.  Overall, tastes like a well made Marzen or Oktoberfest.
Bottle. Amber-red in color. Some head. Slight malt and hops but a little watery. Aroma the same.
Lots of roasted malts and citrus hops on the aroma. Mostly malt carbonation. Lots of body. Excellent beer.

Light amber looking, not really a lager in my opinion. Light tasting for a lager, light biter taste. Smooth initial taste with some bite. Goes down smooth. Like I said not to much of a bitterness to it. Not real hoppy either, not much of a head when pouring. ABV is good, right where you can hit 2 or 3 to get a buzz going and then relax with it. As it warms up though it doesnt taste as good.

amber, other than lager, looks like a pah, certainly not a vienna. bitter lot. very citrusy, lemon and orange, a lot of fishing. Beer is very important, surely cold-hop pioneer style. I drink one and then you change.

One stubby mid last year was enough to put a wide grin on my face, and leave me hankering for more. A stunning example of a beer done right, with pretensiousness cast aside. It produces a deep, orange amber and with a slick, almost oily presence as its swirled upon the glass. Fine, streaming carbonation breaks to atmosphere under the weight of a solid, rocky and messy snow-white crown. Piney, floral and zesty hops, bitter grapefruit, lime zest and under-ripe honeydew mixes with sappy honey and bold, toasted and biscuity melanoidins in the alluring aroma. Perfumy, floral and musky on first sip. Big hop presence, fresh and bright. Balancing, rich biscuity, toasted malts and honey overtones give it a firm and rounded mouthfeel. Lemon and lime zest grip the sides of the tongue with inklings of camphor and eucalypt coming in from the hops. Quite bouncy, the carbonation aiding the volatiles in the crisp, but exceedingly long hop and malt finish. Bitterness is not alarming. Everythings in harmony on this one. A delicious lager. One of my new favourite session beers!! (35,5cL, BBE 01/12, Mane Liquor, Belmont)
UPDATED: AUG 8, 2013 A very clean lager with a delightful hop aroma and taste. Nutty, slight caramel, spice.

#167
Bernsteinfarbenes Lager mit ordentlich Schaum guter Standzeit. Ein florales, süßmalziges Aroma. Im Antrunk butterweich dank wenig Kohlensäure und vollmundig. Im Geschmack wiederum malzig begleitet von fruchtigen Nuancen (Zitrone u. Apfel). Wird im Abgang angenehm herb und klingt trocken aus. Eine schöne & gelungene Überraschung und das ausgerechnet aus Amiland.
*Mein Lager hat 5,2% Alk. und wurde von BraufactuM importiert. Watch out!
	
Test vom 16.6.2011 	Noten: 12,12,12,12,12,12 - 12,00
Bella sorpresa questa bevuta, già laspetto è molto invitante, ambrato con buona schiuma persistente. Al naso deciso malto, delicato però. In bocca va giuù che è un piacere, bene, bene...
From the bottle. Very colourful for a lager (nice amberish gold) aroma is rounded for a lager too - citrusy, floral and woody. Taste is a touch woody and fruity. Very enjoyable.

See through reddish brown colour. A brief medium white head. A mild aroma typical for lager. Lots of crispy carbonation. Pretty good hops for a lager. Notes of wood and a hint of sweetness. Good for thirst.

355ml bottle.  Pours a clear amber with an off-white head.  Aromas of resinous hops, caramel, citrus, and vanilla cookies.  Light bodied, with mild flavours of pine, light grapefruit, some malt coming through, and a faint tanginess,  Citrus, and a little pomegranate in the bitter finish.  An excellent lager, and a great option for the summer if you like hops but dont want fuller bodied ales.  Thumbs up.

330ml bottle. Clear orange golden color. Good lacing. Citric hops, grainy, malty, hints of fruits in aroma. Really nice juicy bitterness. Grassy hops, somewhat dry flavor. Quite a long bitter bitter aftertaste.
Im not a big lager fan but thought Id give this one a shot. not bad. it pours like a dream with a nice thick head. taste is what youd expect.

On draft at Adams house. Adam is pretty much the man.

Brooklyn Lager appears a slightly dark brown shade. Atop the beer rests a small head that fades after a few moments, leaving no trace on the glass. Aromas are fairly weak, though I dont expect huge scents from a session lager. The taste is very refreshing and light, with a hearty malt backbone that gives the beer a pleasant, lingering aftertaste. This is a solid example of the style and a good, lighter abv beer.

0,355 l bottle.  Best before 31. Mar 2013
hay, citrus, herbs, leaves, amber, clear, frothy, white foam, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, lightly sour, medium body, sticky, average carbonation, long finish,
UPDATED: JAN 19, 2013 Amber colour with a decent head. Aroma has malt, some floral hop. A nice malty taste and a light, flowery hop finish.

Muito aromática, mesmo sendo uma lager. Coloração âmbar, presença forte de lúpulo, portanto forte amargor. Melhor lager que já bebi até o momento.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
12 oz bottle. Gold amber in color. A bit carbonated and creamy. Hoppy and a little bitter with hints of fruitiness. A well put together that you enjoy with any food or on its own.

Pours a gold amber with a white fizzy head that is quick to dissipate, but if you pour to fast it gets foamy. Smells of yeast hops and malted barley with visibly fizz in the glass. Well made lager in that it takes the elements hitting you with hops and then finishes with the light, pale malt. Yeast is prominent and makes it taste not as bland as some others, does have a creamy mouth and serious carbonation. One of the best for its style. 

As compared to say Yuengling, (which I was drinking last night) the focus is much more on the hops and yeast while the pale malt is in the background. The pale malt is much more prominent in most lagers. I thought this was almost like an IPA when i was new to different beers but now I see how it fits in to its bland genre. One of the best in a category  which doesnt have much special to offer.
Smells like caramelized malt, kind of like an average run of the mill amber lager. Pours the same. Taste has a mild dose of bitterness, some hops profile. Bottle from licbo.

Una birra ottima,apena velata e leggermente più scura di come mi aspettassi, sovrastata da buona schiuma abbastanza persistente. Laroma, acidulo ed erbaceo, viene rafforzato da identici sapori seguiti da un amaro ben calibrato le cui note hanno tipiche caratteristiche dei luppoli americani. Un rivisitazione molto yankee di un classico del vecchio continente che non lascia certo delusi.

Pours a golden copper on tap, with a thin white head and good lacing. Aroma is faintly of caramel, but mostly just corn malts and basic grains. Taste is lacking as well, kind of like a more bitter yueng ling.
Theres a honeyed caramel note on the nose whereas the palate has more hops with a lovely mild bitter, hoppy finish. Theres a great, creamy body to it as well. A wonderful lager.
Fruity and crispy lager of surprisingly high hop bitterness. Can almost feel a bit of a cider sense due to the violent fruitiness.

Smooth amber/copper pour with a frothy white head, good lacing. I'm pleasantly surprised with the aromas, quite IPA like even though BL is labelled Lager. Hops, malt, citrus, pine, citrus are all there. Wow this tastes great. Full bodied, tangy and sweet. I guess I have a certain idea of in mind but this is not it. Bags of aroma and all the flavours of a good IPA.

I would love to see Brooklyn Lager on tap all over Dublin.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Not bad to try but not worth a revisit unless there is nothing else on the list. Too weak tasting to be a great beer

Very weird beer this one. Im not a lager drinker of any kind but make myself look foolish there but saying i love Brooklyn. Its nice rich almost fruit cake like smell/aroma. Bit of a let down in color but least its not "amber gravy" 

Rich full light slightly more of a smoke to it than a normal beer of its kind. 

Very nice bottled or on tap.

Fair aroma with malty and caramel cookie notes.Clear amber with superb, abundant and lasting head.Malty taste with a hoppy finish. Very well balanced beer. Without being a grand cru, it is an accomplished lager. Would make a good every day beer.
Excelente Cerveja de malte vienna, o preço poderia ser um pouco melhor em SP, como está o preço da Samuel Adams por exemplo.

Bottle. A clear medium amber beer, with a large, frothy/fizzy, very lightly lacing, off-white head. The aroma is lightly malty (toasted bread, caramel), moderately hoppy (grapefruit, apricot). The flavor is moderately sweet, lightly to moderately acidic, lightly bitter. Medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation, long finish with moderate bitterness. Rather hoppy, it roughly tastes like something in the middle of a pure lager and an APA. Drinkable.
Boa cerveja com aroma de ervas e sabor marcante, preço acessível e qualidade excepcional, grass, earthy
This is such a great beer. Nice crisp, hoppy aroma. Head is a little lacking. Smooth refreshing taste. Finishes with a very clean, malty flavor. Love this beer.

Bitter aroma and taste but a tempting golden brown appearance and balanced mouthfeel.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

A - pours heavy and amber with a 2 finger head that lasted a while into a thickish film
S - pale and caramel malt, biscuity and hoppy nicely done
T - A malty lager with a very decent hop profile. Biscuity and even a bit of tang at the end. Refreshing and satisfying.
MF - light bodied but full for the style, carbonation was decent large bubbles that are typical for lagers
O - Better than the sum of its parts, a very good lager

Pours copper with a very thin head that leaves just a bit of lacing.  I am a fan of the aroma.  Its kind of sweet and unique unfortunately that taste doesnt really follow suit.  Its pretty well balanced - just very uninteresting to me.  A little bit of a hop kick up front and it finishes crisp and smooth.  I was slightly disappointed after seeing the great scores this beer receives.

Rating #52 for 2012

12oz bottle served cold. Aroma hoppy bitterness with some malt. Dark orange amber color 1/2 tan head with tons of tightly bubbled lacing. Taste, mild citrus slightly bitter finishes with some malt. Palate, medium carbonation very light finish.
Tap/ It smells hoppy-fruity-citrus. The taste is for a Lager very nice and intensiv hoppy-citrus. 10/10/11/9/-/10
En väldigt god amerikans lager. Frisk och fruktig och en lagom beska som faller mig i smaken. Funka alltid.

35,5 cl bottle @ home. Rated on 19.01.2011
Aroma is rather hoppy with exotic fruits and hints of grainy malt typical to lagers. Flavour is rather hoppy with exotic fruits  but behind those the grainy malt and hints of roastiness can be observer. Nice one, closer to a Premium Lager than Vienna  or maybe this is just a Premium Vienna?

UPDATED: APR 17, 2013 330ml bottle. Malty and herbal aromas. Pours bright gold, with nice white head, some lacing, persistance. Taste is malty, slighty bitter. Light body and average carbonation. Sjort light bitter finish. Good lager, but nothing remarkable.

Ottima lager di casa Brooklyn. Aspetto ambrato con schiuma poco persistente.
Gusto che definirei "lager artigianale". buona..

Backlog autumn 2011
Golden color, good foam
Light/medium body & complexity
Crisp and refreshing- wanted more

Aroma of mild caramel, nuts and sitrus. Golden colour, with a white head that nearly disappears after a little while. Very nice taste, and a long bitter aftertaste. Really good lager, that fortunatley are quite easy to find at bars around the Stavanger-area.

Bottle from Stirchley Wines & Spirits.  Pours a clear amber/brown.  No head.  Smells rich and slightly smokey with brown sugar and ginger.  Tastes more like an English ale than a lager - rich, bitter hops with a long finish.  Very well balanced with some tart citric notes, malt and grapefruit.  Mouthfeel slightly fizzy.  Good lager/bitter.

On tap at  whatever bar Im at right now in Brooklyn. Pours glassy dark amber into shaker with small off-white head and splotchy lacing. Aroma is kind of muted but mainly malty. Fresh palate with a bit of hop bitterness, a bit of spice/zest, a bit of a citrusy sweetness, and a medium to long grainy finish. Dear Brooklyn Lager, you are an ok beer in my book, love your friend hivemind I hate you dad.
Aroma is grains with mild roasted/nutty notes and a hint of hops.  The flavor is malts, a mild roasted/nutty note and a hoppy finish, but not too much so.

Widely available in the UK, brown 35.5cl bottle, this one is best before Aug 2007 and was drank on a sunny April Fools Day 2007. 

If I hadnt joined this site in August 2006, I wouldnt have touched this beer with a Barge Pole, (I had drank Bud, Olly, Blue Ribbon, Coors and few other watery products from your shores previuosly and vowed never to drink such crap again) but I am now trying American beers again, if the price isnt too high. 

Poured into my Veltins 0.2litre stemmed glass (twice), it looked a lot darker than the lagers I normally see in Europe, not the straw blonde norm at all, this looks like a real beer! Deeper tones of old gold with an off white head. 

Aroma of hops and yeasts, a lot stronger than any other lager Ive had, and Ive had more than my fair share, this is good stuff. 

Bitter and malty taste, this is very, very good stuff in deed. 

Good retension of flavours, a strong almost heavy aftertaste where the hops re-assert themselves. 

This is one of, if not the best lager I have ever had and I dont mess with those sort of quotes (see some of my other reviews). It is also the first time I have had an All-Malt Lager, so am I being unfair to European brewers? You can add German and other European Pilsners to that list, as I consider them all to be in the same basket. So well done Brooklyn and American All-malt lagers. I now have to decide if All-Malt lagers should really be compared to normal Pils and Lagers, life does get difficult doesnt it?
Malty with some balancing floral hop, a straightforward but high quality, refreshing lager.

pretty good as far as Vienna goes.
gentle floral aroma backed with a sweet malt note.
flavour is quite earthy , again with a floral note.
good balance.

Nice and clear amber colour. Light foamy head which goes away quickly. Overall taste is also quite light with a little bit of bitterness. Decent body, somewhat thin but highly carbonated. The aftertaste doesnt last very long. I find this an ok lager, will probably drink again.
Pours a dark amber color and a large white head. Aroma of floral hops backed by biscuit and caramel/toffee malts. Taste is similar with a nice bitter finish.  Body is medium.

35cl bottle shared wurh a friend.
Slight white head.  Slightly hazy blond pour.  Hoppy aftertaste.  Very nice lager.

Bottle. Clear copper with a small cream head. Nice smells of malt, apple peel, tangerine and a little coriander. In the mouth, some caramel sweetness, candied orange peel, a touch of spice, some nice breadiness. Finishes with a slight bitter tang and the flavour hangs around in the mouth quite nicely. Really nice lager, with some nice subtle flavours and balance.
Pours clear coper with a small head. Aroma American hopsa, caramel. Slightly sweet. Very nice all round. Not Bad.
One of the best beers that is relatively easy to find, with an increasing presence in chain restaurants and stores.
This beer smells fantastic, which makes me think it would be really good if they hadnt lagered it. Shouldve been an ale, but as is, its a very smooth lager. Still enjoyable

Purchased this one in Giraffe in Bury UK. Poured into a logger glass has very nice clear amber color with a thin white head. Aroma is fruty and spice. Flavor is of hops with a bitter finish. It has a carbonated slightly sticky feel acrost the palate. Overall a very nice logger that goes well with dinner or BBQ.

pour rich golden with a decent but collapsing foam, quite active carbonation. The aroma is hoppy with some malty bready notes and this one goes down easily. the flavour is subtle malt with some hop highlights..

Pours a very clear copper/gold with a nice white head that leaves light lacing.

Not a huge fan of the aroma, very malty but also slightly skunky.  Taste is a whole other story.  nice malt notes, crisp and refreshing with enough of a hop balance that adds nice floral notes and keeps it from being overly sweet.  After taste sours a little but is not terribly long lasting.  Quality beer especially as far as the style goes.
Pours an amber color with a white head. Aroma of sweet malt and citrusy hops. Taste is very similar. Medium body with a crisp finish.
In bottle ... not bad, aroma was a little hoppy. Nice body, smooth lager with hoppy notes (almost a little sweet). Good but not great

clear amber colour with lots of bubbles. very floral note, some what hoppy and one cant miss that pilsner like grassy note. somewhat bitter note. light body, quick finish but has a certain malted backbone or hoppy flavour that gives it a little weight.
On tap. Disappointing. Mild hop flavor, not much aroma, so-so taste. Decent lager but nothing special.

Amber color.  Light malts in the aroma, and dry malt in the flavor with a medium palate.  Drinkable enough that you can serve it to friends who dont like good beer, but not as flavorful as the best Vienna beers, no matter what the percentile says.
Copper clear in color with a small white head. Smell of bread and hops. Smooth tasting, crisp and clean, flavorful finish. Excellent lager.
355 ml bottle. Nice amber colour with small head. Aroma is malty. Flavour is malt, grapefruit, hops. Really drinkable.
From the bottle poured  a coppery colored brew with thin head. All hops at the nose. Tasting mainly of malt with a bit of hops sneaking around in the background. Medium body.
Bottle. Nice copper color with minimal head. Smells a bit like ice wine- grapey and perfumey and sweet. Taste follows. Not my favorite but at least it had some flavor. Sweetness fades.

355ml Bottle - Amber with a foamy head.  Pine, toffee, grapefruit and nuts in the aroma. Hoppy and nutty taste with biscuity malt, grapefruit and toffee detected. Nicely balanced and really drinkable.
Dark golden with an off white head - nice hoppy aroma with some hints of flower - malt body to support a nice hoppy flavour that lingers for some time into a nice finish - good and refreshing

Bottle to glass.  Copper color with a one finger head that laces moderately well.  Caramel corn nose.  Taste is honey, winter wheat, lightly toasted bread, and enough hops to balance it out perfectly.  A great representation of the style; full of flavor and well made.  So tasty.  The hops add a nice aromatic depth and complexity and the sweetness of the roasted malt gives it great fullness.  Moderate palate.  Very good.

Nice colour, good pour, great aroma.  It has a nice caramel taste in the mix and a good copper colour.  Goes down well especially when served ice cold.  It gets a bit harsh the closer it gets to room temperature.  Overall, a very good beer.

Draft at Momos Tennessee Street. Pours a light copper with a frothy tan head. Nose is light caramel and Munich maltiness, maybe a bit of hops on there. Sweetish entry with caramel malts and a touch pine hops in the finish. Easy drinker.

Medium amber with more of a red than orange hue and a light frothed head. Aromas of citrus/fruit/pine hops, candied caramel, and slight grain. Flavors of citrusy/pinelike hops, slight grain, and a light caramel backbone. Crisp, flavorful, slightly dry, some bitterness, good, period. Solid lager. One of my favorite "lagers."

A crisp and clear brown pour with small white head that disappears rather quickly. Aroma is fruit and malt. Solid yeast and malt taste with mild roastiness and spice. Mild finish with a little bit of bitterness. Easy drinking.

UPDATED: NOV 17, 2015 Limpido color rame con una solida schiuma bianca. Aroma dolciastro con sentori di caramello e frutta secca e luppolo a seguire. Gusto maltoso con lievi tracce fruttate e caramellate e note amare più penetranti. Finale amaro e asciutto, corpo medio e discreta morbidezza al palato. Un grande classico, ottima durante i pasti.
Very smooth, semi hoppy bitter aftertaste.  Has a slight malty aroma.  Easy to see through.  Very light beer
Pours an amber color with a large white head. Aroma is caramel malt, and citrus hops.  Taste is caramel,  licorice and pretty bitter hops.. Mouthfeel is on the lighter side.
Can from Coppers in Newcastle. A dark amber ale with a rich toffee and floral, spicy, hoppy flavour and a dry, fruity, slight woody finish.
One of the great sessionable beers.  Does a little of caramel, hops, slightly dry and sweet.  Just right if you want to have a few pints. Lovely.

Bottle. Copper brown pour with a small white head. Aroma and taste is toasted sweet malts with light floral hops. Palate is smooth and drinkable with just the right amount of carbonation. Uncomplicated but well crafted and very sessionable.

355ml bottle pours a light copper color with a small white head and little lacing.  Aroma is flowery with some light toasty cereal grains.  Taste is light malty sweetness with a pleasing sharp hop bitterness.  Light to medium body with enough carbonation to please the palate.  One of the better lagers that I have sampled and actually enjoyed.
tap at cloisters .... copper ... thin lacing ... light grassy noise ... quite fizzy ... sweet toffee ... juicy malts ... light rounded malts ... surprisngly good

Pours a nice goldfish orange. Aroma is lots of bitter hops, floral and a decent malty backbone. Smells more like a decent ipa than a lager. Taste is alright. Crisp, hoppy, floral and bread. Maybe a little citrus. Mouthfeel is a little watery. Not my type of beer but its  alright. Cant say anything bad about it. Nothing too special though.

On tap at Six Feet Under. Pours dark copper with a medium, beige head. The aroma is caramel, bananas, and light citrus hops. The flavor is sweet and malty. The palate is light to medium, malty, and smooth. Overall, this is a nice, smooth and mellow beer.
Pours orange w/ floral aroma.  Very smooth and creamy taste with hints or caramel, and just the right amount of carbonation.

Pours a nice copper-redish brown, with a nice head and good carbonation. Aroma of caramel and malt. A little hops mellow out the aroma nicely.
Velvety, delicous mouthfeel, and a nice malty flavour with hops that does not pop out, but are well balanced. Definately the best lager ive ever tasted.
From tap @ Arlanda. Copper whisky colour. Light brown head. Nutty smell, aroma of nuts and almond. Some citrus aroma also once a bit warmer. Sharp carbonation which diminishes quickly.

Poured from a can into a pint glass. Color was caramel paleish. About two fingers of head. Healthy amount of white lacing on the top. Lots of film on the sides, which I enjoy. White and wet. 

Smelled sweet caramel malts up front. Seemed to be some citrus lemon hops, but that could just be me wanting it to be. 

Tasted pretty close to the smell, maybe a more watered down version. Really liked this beer. Seemed to be more like a pale ale. Still got those lemon citrus notes.  Very smooth. 

Medium body. Creamy texture. Average-to-lively (above average) carbonation. Abrupt, but smooth finish.

Just a really good beer. And I say that surprisingly. Nothing like I thought it was going to be. Loved it.
Amber color with a lot of carbonation and a creamy head. Malty aroma and taste, with a hop tingle in the finish. Perfectly balanced, with a smooth medium body. Very drinkable.

Reddish golden amber thats fairly translucent. A decent sized foamy whire head sits atops. Some floral hops with a faint tea like aroma.  A nice malty flavor with a lot of floral hop character especially towards the finish.

For a lager, not bad at all. Light and floral. Not at all like generic European lager. Would happily drink over crappy generic lager but wouldnt pay much of a premium to do so (as Im not that into lager).
Clear blond (yellow-orange) body with a white creamy head. Floral, well balanced aroma of hops. Heavily bitter flavour: ok balanced, less appealing than the flavour though.

Bought a growler of this yesterday, and drinking it today.  A very good beer, one of the best Ive had the pleasure to drink.  Hoppy, as you would expect, yet very smooth, good drinkability!  Love this stuff!!
Taste is light hops, a bit of black pepper and malt.  Well balanced and very smooth drinking.  Nice beer.

Bottle . Pours light chestnut brown with a decent white head .Spicy citrusy aroma . Taste is a mixture of caramel sweetness amd hoppy bitterness - a sort of sweet IPA  . Medium carbonation and body  .Decent  .

Pours a deep golden, almost an orange color. The head is off white, fluffy and fairly large. 

The beer displays a nice light herbal and citrus rind aroma. The beer is very aromatic with a nice fruit forward maltiness.

The flavor of the beer is very malt forward but only lightly sweet. The herbal hop flavor is moderate to high and the beer is enjoyably bitter. Some red apple and citrus fruitiness is present throughout and the beer displays a nice light toasty maltiness.  

Really quite enjoyable.

From bottle. Dark amber with short lasting head, fades to nothing. Very pleasant aroma of caramel and toffee. Similar taste, rich caramel maltiness. Quite sweet with a slightly sticky finish. A head and a dryer finish would do this beer some favours.
Bottle 335xl @ stockholm-arlanda. Golden color with white head. Mild sweet aroma. Medium bodied, medium bitter and very light sweetness. Well balanced and very refreshing. A nice beer.

355 ml bottle. Amber body, small head. Mildly hoppy and toasty aroma. Taste is caramelly with a notable toasty bite. The generous hop use makes it different from the European Vienna lagers that Ive had.
This beer gives really good head. It tosses beautifully and swallows with elegance.

Copper pour with a 2 finger puffy head and good lacing.  Sweet Malty aroma - bready.  Caramel malts, bread, slight hoppiness to this lager.  Very drinkable.  Medium body, virtually no aftertaste.  Very easy drinking and a lager that I recommend to my macro friends who do not like the bitterness of a hoppy ale.
Una delle mie lager preferite. Floreale e amaricante con un leggero tocco di caramello e zest di agrume. Finale resistente e voluttuoso.

Hazy dark amber with a big head that reduces to a steady film, big webby lace.  The taste is All-American craft brewing.  A nice malty taste to open things up, followed by a nice floral hop that continuosly asserts itself through the finish until it is all that is left.  A solid brew.
Nice, uncomplicated lager with a rather sharp hop character. Notes of flowers and citrus coming from the hops, and a crisp malt character make it satisfactory enough for long drinking sessions.

Had on Tap, poured into pint glass

a: translucent deep amber color with decent carbonation. Foamy 1/2" head of ok retention that eventually settles into lacing

s: clean smell, malts and slight hops aromas

t: Very well balnaced between malts and hops. Hints of citrus and grass.

m&d: Medium bodied, easy to "session"
Very nice lager. It has a great Carmel taste nice malt finish. Great drinking beer, you can drink a lot of these and enjoy it!
Bottle. Nice copper-golden color with head of white foam. Mild sweet aroma. Medium bodied, medium bitter and very light sweetness. Well balanced and very refreshing. One of the best lager I had.
Bottle from Systembolaget. It poured a clear copper-golden liquid with a small dirty white head. Malty and caramely smell. Similar taste, focus on caramel malts.

Clear light amber color with a decent head. The head settles to a lace around the glass. Smells very hoppy. A spicy floral hop. Has a firm malty body. Taste very hoppy but has enough sweet malts to go around. All round a good lager.

Bottle bought @ Systembolaget. Pours dark brownish golden with a frothy off-white head that slowly dissipates while leaving some lacing on the glass. Smell is sweet with caramel, light bread, ripe peaches, wood and orange zest. Taste is malty, slightly sweet, slightly bitter and slightly metallic with dark bread, some sweet dried fruits, lemon peal, grass and wood. Mouthfeel is slightly watery and rather heavy on the carbonation. Finish is dry, slightly sour and bitter with bread and lemon peal.

poured amber from the bottle. about a 2 finger head. the smell was bready with a faint amount of citrus. the taste is very good the flavor is strong up front with some citrus and hops then ends with an almost sweet bread aftertaste.
Amber, sparkling, tall tan head. Scent of hops and smooth malt. very mild bitterness, Has a smooth feel to it, a slight grain to it, dry finish.  Very nice...an extremely well put together beer.
Copper color. Smell and taste are a good balance of hops and malts. Medium bodied, a decent beer overall.
Bottle, thanks beerandbeyond. Pours clear and golden with white head. Malt, honey-flower sweetness. Bitter - nice and unoffensive. Light body, long finish, well carbonated. Fun and balanced.

Bottle Pours an amber with a white head maybe 1/2. Tastes smells of caramel, floral, sparkling, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, medium body, sticky, average carbonation, dry bitter finish. This is one of my fav beers around always refreshing has a nice bite to it with the floral hops and sweetness from the caramel taste with nice bite dry finish. Cant beat it when it comes to a nice beer.
Blommig och söta toner av toffee samt litta citrus i doften. Smakrik med lätt brödiga toner. Harmoni. Slutsats: En mycket god lageröl.

COLOUR - Amber Gold.
HEAD - Medium white foam quickly dies down.
AROMA - Malty fruitiness.
CARBONATION - Nice medium carbonation that doesnt mask the flavour.
ATTACK - Floral maltiness.
MID TASTE - Floral maltiness.
FINISH - Malt extract and mango.
OVERALL - Very refreshing malty fruity flavour.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle at restaurant. Has a hazy amber colour with a small off-white head. Aromas of grains, sweet malt, hops, and some fruity berries. Its more surprisingly fruity in the mouth that reminds me of grapes and plums with the small touch of bitterness from grape skins. Its balanced nicely with some sweet caramel malt and spices. Light bitterness and a slick and silky mouthfeel. An outstanding vienna with a lot of taste. Drank the beer with a tasteful pizza that made the bitterness more pronounced.
Had this beer some time ago, transferring data from  database before Januar I was using to rate beer. As I drink this again I will add a complete review.

12oz bottle. Pours a lovely dark amber with a big off white head - great lacing. Im a big fan of Vienna lagers & this is a great example; plenty of rich malt in the aroma, deep caramel tones are there in abundance, zesty citrus notes in there too. Taste is incredibly refreshing, great balance between the rich malt and the floral & citrus hops. Robust mouthfeel & a satisfyingly tart finish. Excellent stuff.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
appearance is amber with a minimal white head.  nutty aroma and a bit hoppy with medium carbonation.  good beer.

12oz bottle poured into a pint glass.

Appearance is a clear reddish gold with a thick one finger head that hangs around forever. Wonderful lacing too.

Smells quite citrusy and flowery with a bit of caramel also coming through.

The flavor is a nice balance between malt and hops. A slight tartness up front along with citrus and flower flavors leading to a nice biscuit from the malt. Also some slight toffee and caramel all leading to a moderately bitter dry finish.

This is a great easy drinking beer and a nice alternative to SA Boston Lager.
One of the best bottle beers Ive tasted.  Yeasty aroma with average carbonation.  Yeasty hops flavor.  Slightly bitter finish.  Would definitely buy again.

Coloração dourada-cobre, com espuma bem consistente.
Lúpulo bem colocado, com retrogosto levemente maltado, dando a base desta lager.
Excelente! Lager de grande estilo e tradição.
Easily best lager Ive ever had. Great up front mix if bitter and roasted malt. Almost creamy in mout with lively carbonation. Awesome session beer!

Out of a bottle: has a clover honey gold color, nice two finger head with traces of lacing. Smells fresh with a touch of bread. Taste of a bit of sweet malts and a clean hoppy finish. Carbonation is quite low, yet it is fresh and clean. The presence of hops is nice and leaves a slightly dry and good after taste.

I was desperate to find a quality American Lager and this is one of the best. Nice color, full taste and aroma....nice. Just a little to hoppy in my opinion but I will definitely be buying more of this pre-prohibition American beer.

355ml at Alquitara. Orangish coloured beer with a creamy head of medium duration. Aroma is moderate malty, slihtly hoppy and sweet. Flavour is sweet at the beginning, with some honey hints and dense on palate. The final results moderate bittery with a medium duration. Texture is oily. Carbonation is low to medium. Body is medium.
The bold aroma gave way to a lightly bitter taste but a nice pleasing lager.  A nice long smooth finish was present
Tasty but to me not much like a lager I would know - has much more malt quality to it. Not that thats a bad thing all things told but its a little surprising. Decent but not particularly exciting.

Pours a deep golden with some copper coloring and a tall, big bubbled, frothy head. Aroma has a very flowery hops presence to it with some mild citrus and solid grainy presence with just a touch of toasted malt late. Flavor has a light lemon early with a pronounced flowery nectar sweetness in the middle and a light grainy touch  at the end. Body is light with a lot of sharp carbonation. Overall a pretty good brew. My only knock on it would be the flowery sweetness in the middle is just a tad bit too much for my liking but a very solid brew all in all.

Bottle. Pours a clear dark amber with a medium white head. Smells of caramel, malt and some flowery hops. Tastes a medium bitter with a medium sweet, but somehow feels like its missing something. Finishes dry bitter with a long duration. Creamy texture. Soft carbonation.

Its ok. Nothing overwhelming. Not sure if Id buy again. Or get another 6 pack. Could take it or leave it. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Mha sorprès molt gratament. Molt ben equilibrada amb notes de llúpol, mel i fruits secs en nas i en boca bona carbonatació, lleugera i fàcil de beure. Després de provar-la penso que al nostre país encara no sabem el que és una boba Lager.

Amber colour and off-white head. A very fresh and fruity aroma, some yeast as well. Very well balanced taste of sweetness and bitterness, it starts out fruity and becomes more bitter. I think that for a lager, this is an amazing beer. (Bottle)
