330 ml bottle. Pour is clear copper with active off white head. Aroma is caramel, a little bit grassy and citrus and a little hint of pine. Rich medium body. Flavor is sweet black tea, a nice soft caramel backbone. Finishes crisp with a little orange and bitter fig notes. Nice balance. All in all I like this beer a lot. Good session lager with a unique bit of flavour. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
35,5cl bottle. Nice foam, but quickly disappearing. Smooth Co2, almost less. Smell is brown sugar, caramel and malt, taste also heading with hop and smoke.

Dark straw with a white frothy head with great retention.aroma of sweet pile malt with some underlying hops. Flavour is bready toasty malt with sweetness fading into bitter balanced finish. Great lager
A nice lager that is very clean and fresh. Drinks very smooth, and there is always a ring from foam.

Bottle from Davis Beer Shoppe. Pours light copper with a huge beige head and a floral aroma. The flavor is quite hearty for a lager - caramel malt with some tasty hop bitterness. A great session beer.
From bottle.  Good hoppy aroma and taste.  No real bitterness in the taste.  Pourss hazy golden with slight white head.

Det här var för några år sedan en öl som jag faktiskt gillade och drack en del av men inte nu längre. Jag tycker att den här ölen är tråkig med en tråkig smak och dessutom blaskig. Visst det här är bara en lager och det bör man kanske ha i åtanke men det kan vara så att min besvikelse tillintetgjorde det perspektivet.

UPDATED: MAY 2, 2012 Originally had this in Brooklyn. Didnt rate this nearly high enough. Had it last night. Beautiful lager. Pours a slightly hazy sunny orange color, with nice creamy head. Lots of honey and flowers on the nose - followed by a nice hoppy bite at the end. Great lager.
Dry tasting lager, but with a sweetness to it, although it is nothing special.
Just run of the still stuff with no outstanding characteristics.  I had hopes for something more from the Brooklyn Brewery based on their other fine offerings.
Nearly taste like a brown sugared sweet potato, very slight sharpness.  Just the right amount of weight in its mouth feel
Bottle. Clear amber with a light white head. Fruit and malt aroma. Flavour is sweet, creamy malt with some bitter hops that add balance. This is a touch above most lagers and is very drinkable.
Very smooth tasting lager with a rich ale like quality, a nice surprise and a beer Id have again
Bottle @ HOme. Pours amber with a white head. Aroma of malt, sweet fruity hops, citruss. Taste is malt, oranges, melon, citrussly hops. Medium body, lively carbonation. Nice lager. 041211

355ml bottle.An unexpected deep amber colour when poured with a layer of light packed foam. Malt backbone in the nose, caramel and vanilla maybe. Almost creamy in the mouth with lots of big malty flavours. Light on the palate. My first beer from Brooklyn Brewery was a winner.

UPDATED: NOV 30, 2011 (amber lager)		
ASPETTO 			
SCHIUMA:	bianca, abbondante, fine, con media  persistenza		
COLORE:	oro carico-ambrato, limpida		
AROMA		VOTO (1-10)	
profumi fruttati, con note agrumate, quasi esotiche, qualche sentore erbaceo , su una base  maltata con un carattere tostato, caramello, biscotto, ed una leggera sensazione di alcohol			
SAPORE		VOTO (1-10)	
il fruttato quasi scompare, lasciando una leggera sensazione astringente che si mescola con sentori erbacei dati luppolo di chiara provenienza USA. Il tutto a smussare una struttura maltata dominante, con note tostate e caramellate. Finale secco con retrugosto tendenzialmente amaro			
TEXTURE		VOTO (1-10)	
corpo medio, morbida in bocca, media carbonatazione			
COMMENTO FINALE		 VOTO (1-20)	
dopo tante ales, si ritorna al mondo lager, in stile vienna, poco frequente, anche se sotto una prospettiva  totalmente differente. si ritrova una base di malto consistente che fornisce volume e morbidezza in bocca, con toni biscottati molto puliti e piacevoli; si insinua discreto ma efficace lamaro dei luppoli, con appunto laggiunta di toni erbacei non propiamente teutonici. risultato positivo ben bilanciato senza cadere in una sovre-luppolatura di cui spesso peccano gli americani. per il mio gusto personale  ringrazio la mancanza di toni troppo fruttati in bocca e avvertiti invece al naso che facevano presagire una lager molto - troppo - aromatica. una carbonatazione un pelino più consistente forse non avrebbe stonato. ottima a pasto grazie ad un bilanciamento pressochè perfetto che la rende molto versatile... e scende che è un piacere.

A deep copper color with orange highlights. Big off-white head that has some staying power and leaves a nice supply of lacing behind. Big hoppy aroma mixed with citrus and malt. Taste is malty with an ample supply of hops and citrus notes. Dry, yet sweet. Nice bitterness. Good beer.
Manchester airport. Nice amber color, lovely hoppy aroma balanced by sweet malts and caramel. Sweet malt taste with lots of hops. Very nice and well made for its style .

UPDATED: OCT 2, 2012 Light amber in colour with an orange lacy and lasting head. Pleasant Fruity aroma - peach with some sweet malt. Smooth body, nice on the tongue. Hoppy bitterness with a creamy malt centre and a watery grassy finish. Easy to drink.

Bottle from local supermarket. Clear amber in colour with a good hop aroma. Taste is dominated by the bitterness of the hops, which isnt in anyway overwhelming. This leads to a dry finish. Im not a regular lager drinker, but this gets a thumbs up from me.

Crisp, clean, bready up front.  Toasty and dry.  Touch of toffee and caramel.  Sweetness is apparent in just the right amount, but does not overtake the beer like other viennas.  Stays dry.  Just a bit of hop spice in the back and a light touch of bitterness.  Simple, but clean, crisp and tasty.  A great craft alternative to pale lagers.

On tap at McGoverns Pub in St. Paul.  It poured a dark orange color with a small white head. The aroma was notes of lemon, bread, and some grass. The taste was good, and had nice notes of grass, lemon, bready cereal, some slight sour grain, some slight caramel as well.  A very good Vienna style beer.

12 oz can.  Lightly hazed amber with sparse white foam.  Nose is toffee, mango and sweet herbs.  Crisp and bracing medium light, even a bit resiny.  Taste is tangerine peel and bitter grass finishing a bit metallic.  Surprising for a vienna.

Light amber with light tan head. Floral, malty and hopy aroma. Hopy, mid sweet taste, lightly bitter. A lot of flavor. Medium body, average carbonation. Like an IPA with no enough bitternes. But is a good one.
En botella.color dorado claro con poca retencion.aromas a malta bastante intenso para una lager.sabor maltoso con un toque floral final amargo suave.

Aroma: No discernable smell, probably due to the thick head.

Appearance: Amber body with pillowy, lasting white head. Lots of carbonation 

Taste: Fresh, grassy flavours. Surprisingly strong malt taste for a lager. 

Palate: Silky texture, almost creamy. Slightly bitter finish. 

Overall: A very tasty, drinkable lager that has some ale characteristics.
One of the better lagers that I have tried. Has a nice hoppy taste, with a nice slight bitterness, and crisp finish. A solid, refreshing brew

This is by far the best beer that is readily available at Shea Stadium (its still called Shea, not that Citi Field nonsense). You can actually taste the hops. Not the best beer ever, but oftentimes the best beer available at bars in New York.

On the side of the label it says this is a "malt liquor" which scared the hell out of me. My fears were unwarranted and I was pleasently surprised. Pours an amber orange with an off white head. Nose is of caramel and roasted corn. Rich flavor with little hops but moderately malty. After taste is thick, like melted caramel syrup. Had in bottle at AYZA Wine & Chocolate Bar, 11 West 31st Street, Manhatten, New York City.

Pours amber with low head. This vienna is hoppy with medium body. It is the lager I almost always choose if no APA or IPA is avaliable. It has a quite malty taste with hints of pine. Quite bitter ending being a lager
Off tap at the victoria birmingham. Absolutely no aroma. Dark malts for a lager and only lightly carbonated. Not bad, quite nice for the style.
Pours light amber with a light tan head. Nice hops and malts. Goes down very smooth. Very drinkable.

Poured from a bottle into a footed pilsner glass. Appearance is a hazy copper to amber color with a large, dense head of white foam. Lacing appears in rings with webs of splotchy lacing in between. Aroma is slightly bitter and sweet with a floral and lemon combination. Taste is toasty and grainy with a light hop bite toward the end. Finish is rather abrupt and dry. Of my Brooklyn Party Mixed Pack, I think this one is the stand out.
En botella.Color ambar .Aromas a caramelo,pan...Sabor dulce a malta,galleta, con poco caracter de lúpulo.Interesante
Bottle, pours amber with white head. Aroma is fruits, flowers, malts, caramel. Taste is good bitterness.

Bottle: nice dark yellow color with a white head. Aromas are sweet malty with a bit of toasty notes.  The flavor is a delight with a well balanced flavor of malt that is balanced with a perfect amount of bitterness to even it out.  This has become one of my new favorite lagers.  Great stuff!
Slightly nutty slightly fruity aroma. Hoppy bitter taste. Average lager for me.

Nice amber color with rather good head.
Has flowers and citrus, or cascade, on nose. 
Taste has also citrus, with some bready malt combining to notes of caramel and slightly piney to herbal hops. Good, crisp bitter ending.
Very good for vienna, like pale-ale with lager yeast. refreshing.

Video review at: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QDY8SYmqMDQ

Appearance: Golden/amber, 2-finger head dissipates to layering, great lacing

Smell: Little bit of citrus + astringent hop oil, raisins, new car tire rubber, toffee

Taste: Medium body, sweet malts, pumpernickel, rye, biscuit, dried apricot, nice crispness disturbed by light bitterness on finish, drinkable

Pairings: Barbecue
Bottle. Pale golden yellow with a decent white head. Fizzy with a nice hop present. Lager yeast dominates. As far as lagers go, this is a good un.

I gotta say, I am impressed, great hoppy bitterness and a sharp taste to it, well carbonated and crisp, flowery, and a clean finish.  Nice malt backbone as well, solid beer from start to finish, I highly recommend it.
Simply the best lager Ive had really surprised because a wasint so sure about buying it so happy a did this is gona be a regular for me now

Pours golden coloured from the bottle with small white head. Smell is slightly creamy malty, bit toffee. Taste is very smooth with caramel elements. Slight bitterness and gives just a little bit of a prickle in the mouth. Very drinkable.

A: The pour is a light amber color with about a finger of white head.

S: Starts off with quite a bit of toast and bread.  Just a sweet malt profile overall.  There are some floral hops and a mild grass note.  The necessary lager yeast aroma is present, as are some mild esters.

T: Things dont deviate much on the palate.  Sweet toast and bread malt flavors with a bit of a toffee note.  Minimal bitterness with floral and grassy hop flavors.  A few fruit esters give a bit of depth.

M: Light to medium in body with a medium carbonation.

O: Sort of an ubiquitous beer on the East Coast, it seems.  I found it to be pretty enjoyable.

Far more hoppy than most lagers.
Great flavour, well but not overcarbonated.
Easy to drink, with more flavour than standard lager, good beer.
Tap at stockholm. Nice lager. Beautiful appearance and aroma. Lacks palate.

Quite a good lager this one is! Very smooth and very easy on the drinkability scale; sure, you can chug it down but save that for those lessor quality macro-brews! This is a very solid brew and surely wont disappoint you in any way. Very robust and flavorful and will be a nice addition to your BBQ or fish fry! A bit more hoppy than most other amber/red lagers that I have tasted but it is surely nothing overbearing nor takes away from its good qualities!
A very session-able beer. Even flavored nice balance of floral, and citric hops. Very approachable.
12 oz bottle from variety case. I really enjoyed this, has a nice hop aroma and flavor. In my opinion this is better than the east India pale ale.
Tall boy. Aroma of slight malt.  Pours copper with tanish head. Taste is nice mix of malt and hops. Some crisp grain notes popup on palate.  Nicely structured beer.

Amber in colour with a nice frothy white head. this is my kind of lager really, has some good maly aroma and flavours, looks like an Oktoberfest/Vienna lager although the brewery describe it as a pre-prohibition style lager. I guess this means a lager that is more malt driven and flavoursome than the mega-lagers that are currently about. A more full flavoured lager, with good chewy malt flavours. A very nice beer actually, I hope we get some of their other beers in Australia soon.

Aroma has an earthy, slighty floral, citrus scent to it. Appearance is golden, amber color with a white foam head. Taste is light sweetness, with light caramel and bit of floral, definitely a flavorful lager. Palate is light body to medium, slick feel, lively carbonation and a slightly bitter finish. Overall this is one of the best everday beers in the world. Youll probably finish the glass before you finish your actual review.
Really quite enjoyable!  On draft.  Biscuit/cereal malts plus lots of floral hops.  Bit of richer caramel as well maybe.  Refreshing, flavourful, nice!

Serving glass: Poured from bottle into Pint.

Appearance: Clear, light copper with thin but sustained head. Light lacing.

Aroma: Fairly dry, with toast, caramel, cherry and floral and citrusy hops.

Taste: Nice malt backbone of toast and caramel with almost no sweetness. Hops are quite apparent and include nice floral notes from the noble hops as well as an unusual blast of citrus due to the cascade hops. Great use of dry-hopping for a typically simple lager.

Palate: Moderately high carbonation with a fairly light body. This is a very crisp, clean and dry beer; quite simply, perfect for this type of beer.

Overall: Other than a couple Pilsners out there, this is about as good as an everyday lower alcohol lager can get. This should be bigger than Sam Adams Boston Lager. But New York is always better than Boston, right? Just kidding, I am from Minnesota and really couldnt care less about the rivalry.
Not in love with this one... Almost a flowery, skunky, malt on the aroma.  Taste is just OK.

Pours an amber colour with a lightly lacing head. Beautiful aroma - a flowery hop profile somewhere between Czech saaz and classic English ale hops, and a rich biscuity malt profile reminiscent of a darker German lager. Assertively crisp and bitter, with a light noble-hop spiciness. Creamy and smooth, and eminently drinkable. The best amber lager I can remember trying.

A really surprising beer for a lager. The pour is a bright golden amber with a bubbly white head about two fingers thick. The aroma is bright and floral with pronounced graininess and sweet malts. Mostly sweet and light in the middle with a surprising hopped up finish. A good amount of sticky lacing and somewhat slick mouthfeel. Nuances of light citrus and caramel with a beautiful crisp, floral taste. Overall, a good beer for sure.

Bottle bought at Sainsburys in Pinner. An amber/golden coloured pour with a decent white head on top. Malty aroma. Tastes very malty, hoppy, fruity. Is this really a lager? Quite surprised with this one.

Sampled this puppy on my wedding day. Bottle purchased at the LCBO. Pours a dark orange/ brown, with a decent head and some minor lacing. Aroma is sweet and malty, tiny bit of hop as well. Taste is malty and sweet, some nice fruit as well. Really good stuff.
UPDATED: AUG 11, 2013 2/5 i mörkhet. Luktar maltigt, lite citrus. Söt, besk och gräsig i smaken med en besk eftersmak.

En mörk lager av wienertyp. Bra mix i doften av bröd, smörkola och c-humlens citruskaraktär. Beskare och torrare än jag mindes den (positivt) men humlen är å andra plattare, mer åt det blommiga hållet och mindre närvarande än i doften. Ändå helt okej, men inte den IPA-liknande lager som jag mindes den som (referenserna ändras väl). Men bra maltkropp och rejäl beska gör den till en lager i toppskiktet.

Comes out of the tap a beautiful clear orange amber with a thick, pale butter-tan head that leaves some substantial lacing. Aroma is strong, malty and slightly fruity. Malty flavor has firm fruity underpinning and a slight hoppy note. Firm-bodied texture is smooth, fizzy and lively. Normally I dont care much for lagers, but this is a happy exception.
This beer is really pretty decent, but still nothing much to it.  I like some more complexity.

16oz tall boy can Always the best out of a can,can you say fresh, well say it with me fresh beer in a can!!! base of a vienna style lager then dry-hopped. aromas of caramel, roasty, floral, citrus grass,  nice soft pallet & body making for a great time drink the 6pk.
Bottle: Hard to believe that this is a lager.  Why cant the macros taste this good?  Very flavorful.

Bottle from Tesco
Appearance - Amber orange, 1 finger white frothy head, hazy.
Aroma - Straw hops, floral notes, slight hint of orange
Taste - Emphasis on malt. Sweet malt, straw, caramel, slight hay with grassy/floral hops, bit of citrus. Lots of flavour for a lager.
Palate - Fresh mouthfeel, bit slick. Rapid bitter finish. 
Overall - This is a world class lager - the best lager Ive had so far.

33 cl bottle from Systembolaget. Clear amber liquid with medium white head. Aroma has notes of grain, bready malt, hay, caramel and some hops that are quite earthy and herbal. Taste is crisp and clean with medium bitterness and very light sweetness. Some citrusy hops in the flavour, otherwise quite malty. Light to medium bodied with nice carbonation. Overall, over average lager for a good price. Quite nice.
Pours a nice amber colour with a thick creamy head which leaves a nice lacing our the glass. The aroma is caramel and malt. flavour is nice light crisp and a little sweet very easy to drink.
Clear, amber honey coloured body with decent head. Soft maltiness in the taste with not a lot hops featuring, caramel notes not a lot else.
Clear dark orange color, small white head. Not a very nice smell. Very standard and actually pretty poor, expected better from this brewery.

Head is decent size medium carbonation deep gold pour aroma grain hay wheat earthyness fruit citrus flavour light resin fruit tangy bitter lemon wheat earthyness mango wheat sweetness finish smooth vienna fruity grain earthyness good session ale

Deep amber gold with a thin white head. Aromas of stemmy and lightly floral hops, caramel malts and a hint of flinty minerality. A bit of sweaty vegetal info there too. Flavour carries the hops nicely upfront, some chewy caramel/bready notes in the middle and a clean, moderately bitter finish. All in all a tasty and sessionable lager.

UPDATED: JUL 19, 2012 Bottle from Mane Liquor. Dark amber pour with a small white head. Sweet floral and citrus noes accompanied by caramel malts on the nose. Light caramel, toasted biscuit and floral hops in the taste. Fantastic lager

Pours dark amber with a large, fading  head.
Nose shows lots of sweet malt and caramel characters with some floral notes showing as well.
More rich malty notes as flavours, some soft spicy hops are also noticeable along with a little booze.
Could use more carbonation.
Bottle in Brookyln. Not too bad. A bit hoppy. But nothing too special or interesting.

Pours a dark brown amber with a large frothy tan head. Coffee and caramel malt, with some aroma of leaves.  Some floral hops and soy sauce aroma as well.  Strong malt flavor with a light hop bite at end. This is a flavorful and drinkable lager.  Very good.
Clear amber/copper with white head. Taste is hops, light bread and carmel malt. Light bodied. An okay session beer.

Finally!  Pours deep amber/copper with big off-white head.  Deep caramel malts, brown sugar, baked bread, light citrus and floral hops.  Big flavor - toasted biscuit, light caramel and sugar and a nice broad hop bitterness to balance.  Toasted malt and hop bitterness slide out to the end.  Crisp and light hop dryness, medium body.  Big, bold, rustic lager.  Tastes like fall in a bottle.  Coming from a lager culture, this cant be appreciated enough.  Near lager perfection.

355ml bottle in New York City. Pours dark golden with a medium white head. Taste and aroma are very fresh and crisp, highly floral hops, some bread, spicy. Palte is pretty smooth, a refreshing Vienna lager.
Poured a clear golden with a decent head. Nice balance of hops and malts, a little sweetness and some bitterness. Well made lager, the way an everyday beer should be.

Bottle 355ml. Very tasty, nicely hopped. Aromas of grain, nuts, and hints of caramel. Taste is sweet and bitter, with average length. Palate is oily, highly carbonated, and medium bodied. Amber, with a thin head.

UPDATED: JUL 26, 2015 Updated rating originally rated 11.07.16 @ vbf. App: Clear copper A: light caramel, floral. T/p: thin to med body finish is bitter and short. O: crisp and refreshing. Clean lager with a interesting edge glad Ive bought it again.
Bottle @ Jenny Woo, Helsinki. Originally rated on 10.10.2009. Nicely hopped and tasty for a lager

UPDATED: AUG 2, 2014 Bottle. Amber with a fading off white head. Aroma of bread crusts, earthy spices, flowers. Barely sweet taste with nice balancing bitterness thats floral and mildly spicy. Not terribly tasty but gluggable, balanced and food-friendly.

Tasted on 7/13/11 on draft at Whole Foods Lincoln Park.  Pours clear bright orange with a thin white head that recedes to thin even lace and a decent collar. The nose is malty bread with some earthy yeast, and just a hint of green hops. The flavor is lightly sweet bread malt up front with lightly earthy yeast, and more bitter hops than I expected given the nose. The body is light with average carbonation and a medium bitter hops and sweet bread finish.
Light amber color, with modest head. More sour than bitter. IMO, less flavor than Boston Lager.

Can.  Dark gold/copper color pour, good average size head and a light malt/hop aroma.  Flavor is slightly sweet artisinal wildflower honey, light malt backbone and crisp and dry on the aftertaste.  This beer is what all lagers should aspire to.

A - Bready malt with some citrus
A - Golden amber with thick white head
T - Nice light sweetness with dry, bitter finish
P - Medium body with soft carbonation
O - This is a realy good lager and definitely bere from the brewery that has wowed me
Overall a very nice beer.  Golden brown with a white head. Very smooth. Its my first time in new york, so I had to try something that a new york name on it. Very pleasant beer.

An excellent American lager in the pre-Prohibition style.  Pours a bright golden with a robust white head.  Aroma is bread dough and pale malt.  Taste is sweet pale malt with breadiness and earthiness.  Very refreshing in the old style.

12 oz bottle.  Pours clear golden with a white head.  Honey and herbal, grassy hop aromas.  Grassy hop flavor, honey, biscuit, caramel hint, orange citrus.  Pretty well made, nice flavors.  I like it.
Pours dark golden with a white head. Aroma is caramel and hops. Flavor is caramel with lots of earthy hops, and a dry lingering finish.

Bottle from my bro after returning from NYC.  Great amber appearance; tan head that lasts and leaves lacing.  Nice fruity/flowery aroma. Starts off well, nice dark malty flavour and perfect hops in the finish.  Great balance.  Overall a excellent beer, one of my favourites.

Can poured into a Brew Dog goblet.  Clear, deep caramel color with a large frothy white head.  Aroma is mainly caramel and light grassy hops.  Taste is sweet caramel, light toast, with a slightly bitter finish.  Pretty damn good lager that will likely spend plenty of time in my fridge rotation.
This poured a copper color. Aroma is caramel, toffee, and citrus. Flavor is malty with some caramel dominating. This is a nice amber lager. Not complex but a good beer nonetheless.
Fra flaske, dufter af blomster, lidt IPA, flot mørk gylden med flot Hvidt skum... Smager dejligt af blomst og IPA... Dejlig balanceret .... Lidt sød eftersmag ..., en super dejlig lager !!
Bottle. Pours clear deep golden with a medium white head. The aroma is fruity hops, caramel and flowers. The flavour is flowery and fruity hoppy with notes of citrus and caramel. Quite hoppy lager.

On-Tap in Glasgow, Scotland (Pint from a branded glass): A nutty aroma that is almost chocolate like and is backed up by a biscuit like caramel scent. The finish is a malty one.   Tanned brown to amber colour and produces a nice sized, dome shaped head that is off-white &  slightly bubbly but has good retention.   

Like the smell but caramel is a lot stronger here. There is nutty, chocolate taste to the drink which has quite a clean taste. There is hardly any bitterness in the finish.   

Medium bodied and still quite refreshing smooth & clean. The finish is light on bitter & slightly dry.   

A very nice, drinkable lager that is a welcome change from the usual pale lagers. It was different but certainly one that I enjoyed & would drink again.   

* * * This is 1 of 1001 Beers to Try Before You Die:  * * *

Appearance:clear amber, foamy off-white head.   Aroma: smells like cinnamon toast?!  Also notes of caramel, grains and a little grass.  Taste: sweet, toasty, light and malty, with notes of caramel and oak, too.   Finish: smooth, clean, crisp, and perfectly balanced.  Notes:Great lager.  Wonderful example of the style.   On tap at Birch and Barley.
Keg at The Saint. Poured an attractive golden colour with a generous head. Lots of floral hops on the nose. Not overly bitter but fairly easy drinking. A respectable hoppy US lager

Can from Appalachian Vintner. This is one of the best no-frills lagers Ive ever had and it comes in a can to boot! The pour is a bubbly dark gold with a small head. Good delicate, flowery, woody hops are the first thing noted in the aroma. Brooklyn lager remains refreshing and well balanced with a respectable hop presence in the flavor.  Yeah its a lager but its clean, tastes like barley and hops and is devoid of any off-flavors. I like.
Amber colored pour.  Slightly caramel malty flavor and very light hops make a very drinkable easy drinker.  Nothing great but not bad either.

No aroma, at least out of this tiny little ass solo cup I gotto sample this brew with. Its not a good sign when I drink some and wait for the flavor. It eventually hits, light caramel malts, sweetish. Better than the summer ale.
Amber red pour, white head with low retention.  Aroma is sweet malt, fruit and some bitter hops.  Flavor matches aroma.  Not at all bad given that they call it a lager.  (Rated 2011/04/24)

Golden, clear, sparkling body. Floral aroma with pine and citrus and some faint berries. Light to medium bitterness. Above average lager.

[superficial speed rating based on an itsy bitsy teeny weeny 2-4 cl sample @ Øl og mat festival, Oslo. Rated by tfredvik with a cold.]
Upon opening, there is a slight sewer smell.  Not the most appealing.  Taste is fairly generic, but there are some nice notes of fruit in there.

Ive had this many times, I cant believe Im just now getting around to reviewing it.

Pours a deep dark golden almost red color with a two finger fluffy white head that sticks around forever before impaling itself to the edges of my glass. Smell is very floral with a hint of citrus. Sweet malts, a little bread, a little caramel round out the nose. Taste is a little odd for a lager. Sweet up front, caramel and floral hops play off of each other nicely, then a slight mineral taste followed a dry hoppy finish. Medium carbonation, light to medium body, smooth almost creamy mouthfeel. This a great light easy drinking lager.
Bottle. Amber color, medium white head. Malty aroma with some fruit, strong hops for a lager. Taste is bitter with some fruit and a bit sour.

12oz bottle. Pours a nice clear amber with a light lacing. Smells quite fresh but very mild, light aroma of hops and malt but sweet (some caramel). Get a taste of corn syrup initially but then a balanced hoppy lager, although finish leaves an off taste on the palate. Decent for the style but just not a fan.

12oz bottle into a pils glass. Unexpectedly dark pour; sort of a light amber colour with minimal almost white head. Nutty and lemony on the nose with a slightly roasted malt note. A little sweet on the entry, but a good crisp body with a long lightly bitter finish that holds on to that lemony zest.

Colour is golden  orange more akin to a pae ale than a lager. Maly noise with notes of earthy hops. Flavour is malty and finishs dry. Leaves you wanting to take another slurp. A really good sessionable lager.

12oz bottle. Light amber appearance, hazy, minimal white head. Nice, nutty aroma. Crisp texture. Bready aroma, good aftertaste. Good aroma for a lager, but if this is a good lager, then I guess Im not really a fan of the style. (now that Im logging the rating, I guess its actually a vienna). Decent beer, but meh overall.

UPDATED: MAY 12, 2011 Decent lager but I was hoping for more. Beautiful dark gold appearance with a small head that leaves quickly. Hops balence the malt but I was expecting a bit more malt backbone to this vienna lager. Glad I tried it, probably wont buy again (and I like viennas), and rather disapointing. Brooklyn Brewery just entered our market so the beer is fresh (reasonably so) but it might be a victim of traveling halfway across the country.

bottle, amazing lovelly us hoppy aroma, amber, clear, frothy, white foam, medium body, slick feel, average carbonation, bitter, long finish, very very good beer...hoppy malty "říz" evething what a beer(lager) should have
user_location: Cambridge and Kladno(Czech Rep.), Cambridgeshire, ENGLAND

text: Clear amber pour with a good amount of carbonation and a lasting tan head.  A very hoppy lager.  Caramel toasted malt with notes of bread and honey.  Lightly sweet with a bitter hoppy finish.  Decent lager.
Bottled. Lovely dark amber beer, rich malt body, properly balanced by dry hops. Full flavour, far better than most macro lagers.

Pours dark orange with thin to no white head.  Aroma has notes of lemon, some bread, touch of grass.  Taste is simple, but has nice notes of grass, lemon, bready cereal, some slight sour grain, some slight caramel as well, finishing bitter and very carbonated.  Overall pretty good.

One of my favourite lager beers. Best on tap, but still very good on bottle. Pours a nice, fairly dark colour with a thick, rich head. Aroma rich with hops and some malt. Taste is very nice, with hops and malt giving it a pleasant earthy and bitter taste, but still balanced and with a fresh touch.

(bottle)  Pours out a lightly hazy dark amber with a thin off-white head and moderate lacing.  Aroma is lightly bready, with little kicks of spicy hops and some musty lager yeast lurking underneath.  Toasted barley and some bread dough.  Flavor is lightly sweet, with caramel, toasty malt, bread, and a lingering spicy and crisp mineral finish.  The finish is a bit off-putting.  Mouthfeel is medium with moderate carbonation.  Overall, this is a decent Vienna, but nothing all that great.
bottle; clear amber to orange with a medium white head; aroma-floral, pine, sweet; taste-mild sweetness,  very bitter, almost astringent. Surprisingly good.

Bottle picked up at Total Wine in Alexandria. Served in a Mikasa pilsner glass.

Pour yields a brew with an amber body and a pretty big off-white head that leaves behind gobs and gobs of lacing. Head goes from a few fingers to a nice, stead half-finger. The nose has some light malt and a bit of earthiness. Nothing too complex, but its done well. The taste improves upon this with a nice dry malt presence and a bit of light earthy hops. Slightly bitter in the finish. Seems to be part hops and part tannins. Body is light to medium. Good carbonation as well. Drinks really quite well. A solid brew that I thoroughly enjoyed.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 02-23-2011

Light, balanced, smooth and crisp, this truly is the quintessential anytime lager.  Aroma is very light alcohol fumes with a slight sweet malt presence and an essence of hop.  Taste is crisp malty goodness that finishes dry with the slightest hint of grassy hops.  Not a pondering bottle of complexities, making Brooklyn Lager my go to bbq/party beer.  Cheers!

You can smell the hops just as you open the bottle. The malts are present also but very subte. It looks great also, with a beautiful dark golden color. The taste is comprised of hops and malts, with a good but not too strong bitterness. Its a very good beer, very flavourfull and balanced.

0.355l bottle @ Henrik, Bergen. Pours a clear deep amber golden body with a small white head. Aroma is lager-malty, dusty hops, hints of fruits and for some bizarre reason cloudy(like in steam). Body is medium and the carbonation is medium+. Tastes much the same as it smells. Slightly boring actually but easily drinkable. Kind of organic flavored if thats a flavor? Ends with a grassy bitter finish and a slightly lasting light watery aftertaste. Nice enough within its genre.

355 ml. bottle from the supermarket. Copper(-ish) colour with a thin white head that quickly disappers. Aroma is  hops, apple and pear esters, a sort af honey-biscuit malt. Flavor is honey, pear, apples, biscuits, and a understated hop presence. Overall complexity is very subtle. A very good lager - a bit off style.
11.04.2011. 0,5l Bottle. Golden amber colour with white head. Aroma is malty with good bitterness. nice flavours and there is a good lasting bitterness at the end. Very good beer.

Golden amber in colour with a hint of copper, not your usual lager in fact a little more like an IPA , when poured a great frothy head meets the glass and looks great, best head I had today.
With floral fragrance and hint of hops and malt but not in balance, might be too malty, a citrus flavour is thrown in for good measure, labelled as the pre-prohibition beer on the bottle, this isnt what I expected, for a lager i expected to taste the almost chemical burn of the mainstream lagers, but no, slightly fruity, rich dark bitter, with the vaguest hint of coffee and chocolate in the background.

355 ml bottle from Vinmonopolet. Pours a nice caramelly amber, with a good full head. Aroma is very inviting, with a full sweetness of malt, and notes of honey, fruit, a touch of spice and a good buttery caramel. Lightly burned malty taste, with notes of caramel, some bread and a hint of fruit which gives a good balance. Burned malt gives a dry bitter finish, and a long, pleasant aftertaste.

Refrigerated bottle poured into a shaker.  Pours an amber gold (light in color for a vienna) with light off-white head.  Medium carbonation, medium lacing, and a little in the body.  Taste is slightly toasted malt with some floral hops, and a hint of grapefruit.  Didnt quite meet my expectations.

Pretty good. Pours a nice coppery-orangish color with small head, quickly dissipating. Floral aroma with a nice bite to the flavor. Sweet, malty, woody notes. Alcohol content sneaks up just a bit. Good beer for barbecues and meals.
I am not usually a fan of lagers, but if I had to pick one to drink, this would be it.

355ml. It pours a sn amber beer with steady carbonation and a nice thin lacy head. The nose is of sultanas and sweet malt. The taste is of grapes and grapefruit and there is a grapefruit pith finish. On the palate, there is a reasonable structure for lager. There is also a reasonable texture and the finish is long and bitterly refreshing. Overall, a great summer beer.

Sweet cereal grain and flowery aromas. Nice golden color-- looks very clear. Medium bodied, crisp lager. Very tasty and refreshing. Malty sweet flavors backed by flowery, fruity, hop spice. I will drink this again for sure.
UPDATED: APR 15, 2011 Nice golden color, very crisp taste on the tongue. Goes down very smooth, could drink quite a few of these.

Pours a real nice, slightly cloudy amber with a frothy white head that gives nice lacing. Aroma is floral hops and caramel malt with some fruity notes. Taste is sweet caramel malt with some fruit backed up by a nice long dry bitey bitter finish. Really enjoyable Lager.
Having visited the brewery numerous times, this classic is one of my favorites. I love its floral aroma, and particularly the balance between hops and caramel.

Pours a darker Vienna looking lager. Nose is grassy hops and caramel. Taste is really flavoursome for a lager. Fruity floral hops up front, sweet caramel hops and then a dry finish thats nicely balanced by fruit in the hops.

Bottle from Vinmonopolet (Vika), Oslo. Deep golden/amber colour, clear. Small offwhite head, settling as a robust film and a little lacing. Aroma is hoppy with caramel and some dark citrus notes, hint of cardboard. Medium/light body, average carbonation. Nice, mild malt taste, well-balanced hop bitterness, a little watery. Pleasantly mild bitter aftertaste. Good but unspectacular lager.

Pours thin with a medium Amber very un lager like colour with fluffy light head. on the nose large notes of floral and citrus delightfully enticing, much more that you would usefully expect from a lager. Tastes largely of the hops that you smells with a lovely bitter carbonated kick. The 5.2 abv balences out the malt/hop balance nicely. On the palate it is light with a large flavour profile very little of the "wet corn flake" taste you useilly find in lagers. 

Overall this beer is fantastic, I can see why this beer is their flagship brew, could drink a lot of these and still enjoy it on the 4th drink,

12 oz brown bottle. Best before Nov 2010.

It pours a golden/orange/red color with a modest white head that doesnt leave much lacing.

It has a decent aroma, it is mildly hoppy with a lot of breadiness.

It tastes pretty fresh, a nice mouthful of noble hops and bread.

It is simple but clean and effective.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 08-25-2010 00:07:00

Crystal clear amber with a small, creamy, white head that leaves clumps of lacing. The aroma is slightly toasted grains and floral, noble hops, with a touch of lemongrass. The flavor is pretty impressive; fresh grains, caramel, and a wonderful hoppy finish that blends perfectly with the malt. Just enough bitterness to fight the delicious malt. Full bodied with soft carbonation. Thought this was just another mediocre lager, boy was I wrong.

It pours an amber color with a 1 finger off white head that quickly vanishes to a cap. It has a constant amount of carb and some tiny lacing.

I get a pretty huge amount of floral notes on the aroma with some subtle carmel.

The flavor is pretty malty for a lager. I get some good sweet carmel notes and some floral and some decent spices. A pretty well balanced offering.

It finishes dry and with some lingering grassy notes. This is not your typical lager, but something better. A very drinkable session beer.
Amber, clear color, with a not fantastic off white head. Aroma has a nice hoppy floral smell. Very drinkable and good balance. Really god Lager beer.

[Keg at House of the Trembling Madness, York] Crystal clear dark gold lager with a decent bubbly head. Classic strong American lager / Vienna components with a fruity malt backdrop that mixes with the decent hit of hops. At a nudge over 5% could this one could get very dangerous after a few. Good bitter dry finish, really very drinkable indeed [26022011]
Clear amber with an off-white head. Aroma is caramel and hoppy - fruity. Flavor is medium sweet and moderate bitter. Finish is bitter. Very nice. 050305

On tap at Perro Salado - Newport, RI. Aroma is a solid, light melange of lemony hops and good toothy malt. Flavors are rich, balanced, and nothing exaggerated. Theres restraint in this beer, which I appreciate. Quaffable, yet there with something to take home. Paired well with Mexican delights of the evening, making it amenable to the situation. Thirst quenching in some elements and respectable, if slightly watered down, version of the style.

Bottle; Pour is clear amber with a modest whitish head. Grassy hops on the nose with a hint of caramel - Frankly, this brew feels more like a english pale than a vienna, for what that is worth. Also, a modest gusher upon opening as well. This brew has some nice character - slight breadiness, spiciness, and an almost nuttiness is present here, in subdued form , while the floral grassy hop presence and the lightly sweet caramel works well, overall.

Brooklyn Lager pours a nice amber color with a foamy white head.  There is a a lot of lacing as it dissipates.  The aroma is grainy and bready.  The flavor is mild, not too bitter.  It finishes crisp, but there seems to be some chalkiness in the mouthfeel.  This beer is OK.

Sampled at an ESBLS tasting.  This beer pours a light copper with a nice light tan head.  This beer offered sweet malt and some grain.  It was a bit grassy with an understated hop presence.  Very nicely done.

Pours cloudy and light amber with little foam. Aroma is very much of hoppy fresh fruits and caramel malts. Taste is an excellent blend of the hoppy, flowery bitterness and sweet caramel malts. Palate is medium and quite carbonated. Excellent.
Pours cloudy, dull gold colour. Nice white head with lacing. Great floral aroma. Slightly sweet taste, then a bright hoppy finish leaves a bitter, dry feel. Quite carbonated.

Poured from a 12 ounce bottle into a Spiegelau tulip. Best before July 2011 printed on bottle.

Appearance: Pours a hazy medium caramel color with golden-orange highlights and a 1-2 finger foamy off-white head. Nice lacing.

Smell: Pale malt and floral hops with a hint of spice. Very clean aroma.

Taste: Pale malt and sweet lager yeast up front followed by bready malts in the middle and ending with a surprising amount of bitter hops at the finish. Aftertaste is a nice mix of bitter and sweet. I dont feel that this is as well-balanced as it should be in terms of overall flavor.

Mouthfeel: Medium-bodied with a high amount of prickly carbonation.

Drinkability: Fairly high drinkability. The alcohol isnt an issue, but the unbalanced nature of the flavors keeps this from earning top marks in my opinion.

Overall: Good beer overall. This isnt something Ill actively seek out, but I wouldnt turn one down if offered to me. Its worth trying.

dark gold to light amber with thin and fine eggshell head.  Aroma is of caramel melded with slight grassy hops.  Flavor is the same, with hops coming into perhaps more prominence in the aftertaste.  Nice and balanced, but not very complex or difficult to describe.  I am not searching for unique adjectives.  Syrupy texture transforming into a moderate creamy carbonation (like the east india pale ale).

Aroma - Crisp dry style lager smell, with a bit of canned corn aroma.
Apperarance - Thick head, light color.
Palate - dry and smooth
Overall - Different from typical American Lagers, a good beer.

Slightly hazy amber brown color. Aromas of dried fruits (raisins), pumpernickel bread, and malt. Taste is malt forward, some biscuit, but a background of floral hops. Finish is firm, crisp, dry, and simple. I could easily pound a few of these. Easy drinking, yet interesting. This is very nicely done, and I enjoyed it very much.

Pours a medium golden with a thickish off-white head.  Mild aroma of beer.  Flavor is lager-ish, sorta mild, and pretty good.  Nothing offensive, but nothing really too stand-out-ish, except that its good.

Bouteille 355ml, courtoisie de SlovakSniper. De couleur ambrée-dorée et claire. Nez de houblon citrique, légèrement herbeux, floral et aux notes résineuses, légèrement malté de caramel sucré aux petites notes rôties ainsi que des notes fruitées (abricots, léger dagrumes) et de biscuits. Moyenne-mince en bouche avec un pétillement moyen et une texture très légèrement crémeuse et aux petites notes résineuses. Goût moyen-léger amer de houblon floral, légèrement citrique (pamplemousse) et aux notes résineuses (une amertume présente toute la gorgée) accompagné dun léger goût fruité (agrumes sucrées, très léger dabricots) lors de lentrée en bouche auquel se rajoute un moyen goût de biscuits et de caramel sucré, des notes de grains de malt rôti ainsi que des traces de pain puis en finale lamertume de houblon revient en avant-plan en étant légèrement asséchante et plus herbeuse. Post-goût moyen et un peu sec, moyennement amer de houblon floral, légèrement herbeux, aux notes citriques et résineuses avec des notes fruitées (zest dagrumes) et des petites traces rôties.

Amber dark orange pour from the bottle. White head that maintains a layer on the top of the brew with minimal lacing on my lager glass. Malty pretzel flowers in the aroma with a bit of lemony grassy notes. The flavor is up front with the malty butter biscuit that gets chased by the floral and citrus tones from the hops. I like the balance this beer has with the crisp dry finish. Becoming more of a lager fan with each new one I taste. This is a nicely crafted Vienna!
Bottle. Golden with a white lasting head. Fresh smells and a smooth taste with a hoppy finish. A good lager. High above the average industrials

Bottle at Den Gode Nabo, Trondheim. Pours clear golden with an one inch creamy white head.Nice hoppy aroma with a powerful malty feel to it. Taste starts very malt oriented, but with a solid hoppy background to balance it off with. Very good beer.
En riktigt bra lager, med en egen karaktär som får många andra lagers att te sig blaskiga.

UPDATED: AUG 27, 2011 (on draft at Bentlees)   A good pick as my session beer of choice at Bentlees in Mountain Lakes.  Well balanced and mild flavored, but not watery.  
Second sample from bottle (from Duane Reade) during a NYC weekend getaway.  A bit richer than I remembered and good pick for a casual session.

35,5cl bottle at Håndverkerstuene. It poured a rather dark orange colour for a lager, but the head was small and vanished quickly as lagers usually do. Aroma is mostly grassy but also notes of hops and cereal. Flavour is dry. Mostly grassy with hints of grains and corn. Short aftertaste.

Bottle 355ml @ home
Pours cloudy dark amber with a off-white head. Aroma has notes of caramel, malt and light hops.Taste is light sweet and light to medium bitter with a dry finish. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.
Bottle to pint mug.  Pours a cloudy orange / brown.  Sparse head, and medium lacing.  Good lager.

Appearance is pale brown with great clarity. Little carbonation visible. A thick 1 inch head developed with minor lacing. Head retention is good.

The aroma is of pungent American hops that are slightly toasted and nutty.

The taste is crisp and clean with a good mouthfeel. Quite carbonated in the mouth.

Initial flavors are of mild malt that give way to dominating bold hops. Bitterness is lingering and satisfying.

Excellent beer and strongly recommended.

355 mL bottle from Noble Green Wines poured into a Karmeliet glass. Dark orange lager with a well formed head.  Smells nice, pleasantly hopped.  This is pleasant, and not like the lagers Im used to in Europe.  Id be quite happy to have this again, but it might be too dry to have a few pints of.

UPDATED: OCT 11, 2013 pours amber-copper with a floral and big head. fresh bread crust, big and malty with a caramel malt edge. very fresh, floral and citrusy. average to moderate carbonation, light body. nice.

Poured from my home tap, the appearance is a deep yellow-amber color and a thick, creamy off-white head. The aroma and flavor are hop-forward, with prominent notes of grapefruit and grass, but there is also a substantial caramel malt backbone. The mouthfeel also seemed off-style, with a much more resinous texture and little of the crispness I expected (and desired) from a lager. Overall, it was different, interesting, and quite unexpected, but it was just too far from what I was looking for in a good lager.
Excellent crisp, malt and hops. Good bitterness in the finish. Pours a dark amber, not much head in from the bottle. Very pleasant and easy to drink.

Has a nice fruity aroma that reminds me of an IPA. Has a nice deep amber color with about a one finger head that laces nicely. Has a int of hops with bitter bite that fades quickly. The taste seems intimating at first but then seems to mellow. Carbonation has a nice zing to it. Not a bad beer overall that seems to have a nice balance to it. Im not sure if Id buy it again but I would refuse one if offered.
Pour is a clear golden color with a small white head. Nose is rather hoppy. Taste is not of the nose, and is rather refreshing instead of bitter.

Poured from a bottle for the umpteenth time. Transparent tan color with little head>  Smells grassy with an herbal floral resin.  Tastes of hops with malty finish. This is one of my favorite "go-to" beers where ever/when ever. Perfect example to be a flagship of Brooklyn.
12 oz. can poured into a pint.  Nice amber pour with moderate head.  Excellent flavors.  Well balanced lager.  Just hoppy enough for that great tangy flavor.  Definitely a great everyday beer.
Bottle. Orange with a moderate off white head. Aroma of sweet toasted malt and fruity floral hops. Flavor predominantly malty balanced by light bitter hops. Light bodied.

Brooklyn Lager has a medium, off-white head and a relatively clear, amber-golden appearance.  Carbonation is moderate, and a nice amount of lacing is left down the glass.  Aroma is predominately of piney hops (to me), although the bottle label talks about floral hops.  Taste is very good, with an overriding hop flavor.  Mouth-feel is light and watery, and Brooklyn Lager finishes refreshing and wet.  Overall, I found this to be an outstanding beer.

RJT

On tap at the Meddlesome Moth. 

The beer pours an orange color with a smaller white head. The aroma is a lot of biscuit malt with some floral and fruity notes. The flavor is biscuit malt, flowers, grassy hops and a little bit of fruit. The beer is very clean tasting and very easy to drink. Medium mouthfeel and medium carbonation.
Amber pour with foamy white head and lace. Aroma of light sour malt and sweet kicker. weet malt with a nice dry finish very light bitter finish. Medium bodied with silky carbonation.

Surprisingly aromatic for a vienna style lager... almost has the aroma of a pale ale with the notable dry hopped aroma... clear amber golden with a nice sustained head that leaves excellent lacing... clean flavor, a little undercarbonated, nice clean somewhat biscuity malt flavor and some flowery hoppiness along with the standard grassy hop flavors... very nice lager, easy drinking.... surprisingly good beer...

355ml bottle, 5.2% a/v

Pours a fiery light orange colour with a generous tan head. The aroma is stella,  hoppy like mad and a caramel note to back it. The taste is also great, almost a "beginners" IPA, as it has all the great floral and citrus hoppiness expected but not a hopbomb like some others. Good balance! The aftertaste is also hoppy and balanced. This is a great beer to introduce your Budweiser friends to, try and get them drinking better beer!
Pours orange-amber with a full nose of grass, dough and yeast. Full bodied palate exhibits more grass and toast. Long Finish.
Im not old enough to have experienced pre-Prohibition beers but I imagine this what it tasted like.  Very strong malty and rye flavor.  Rich, intense classic beer flavor.  A good drink.
Bottle 330 ml. Pours orangebrown colour with a small white head. Aroma of hops, toffee and some sweetness. Flavour is hops and something fruity. Great taste over all and very refreshing.

THOUGHTS: Incredible for an American made lager. Decent session beer with great balance.
TECHNICAL: Bottle. Poured a clear, light amber to copper with a large, foamy, off-white head that slowly diminished to a decent sheet and left excellent lacing. The aroma was light toasted and nutty malts and caramel; light to moderate, floral, herbal and resinous hops; and slight band-aid. The initial flavor was lightly sweet and light to moderately bitter; while the finish was sweet and lightly bitter with an average duration. There was caramel malt, toast and  floral hops. The light to medium body was a little watery and then a little dry with fizzy carbonation and a light to moderately metallic finish.

UPDATED: JAN 6, 2013 28th June 2006  Warning! Early amateur rating! Amber lagerish beer. Full bodied. Lingering bitter aftertaste - hard work. Average. 29th May 2011Clear amber beer, small off white head. Crisp palate, dry. Minerals. Creamy rich pale malt, lagerish of course! Decent mild hops,=. Dry finish with a bitterish aftertaste. Decent lager after all!

Very versatile beer.  Pours a nice amber, with a full off-white head.  Nice floral hop flavor, married with a subtle caramel body that coats the tongue.  When it comes to food, this thing is an all-star.
Orange and just a little hazy. Floral, caramel and hop aroma. Bitter and a little sweet. The name of the beer could indicate the you are getting a pale lager but this is not the case.
Bottle. Red orange pour. White head. Aroma and taste of malt, caramel, and sweet brown sugar. Very sessionable.

UPDATED: APR 26, 2013 Finally trying the original Brooklyn lager!  Damn, 200 + ratings and couldnt believe I have never rated one of the "standards" in the craft community.

This Vienna-style lager is fresh and full of nice flavors, but not a huge fan of the hop selection that comes with the Vienna.  It is good to finally rate one of the classics of the craft industry.  A great session option.
Original rating 11.6.10 - Re-rating: 4.26.13 - Finally getting back to rating one of the classics.  Still one of the best session brews of all-time!  Smooth & delicious.  Im going to have to add a few points on my initial rating of 3.4 (+ .2).

Poured up on tap at the Tampa Pourhouse with clear deep gold body and thin off white head. The aroma is fairly spicy with hops as well as some floral, thick sweet caramel and butterscotch. The taste has a chewy rich maltiness mixing with firm spicy hops, some floral hops, a mild level of caramel, some esters and a cloud of diacetyl hovering around the edges. I think the perceived butterscotch like note adds rather than takes away from the experience. Nice lager.

Intreaging brown body, good head. Yeast, wheat, maybe some cane sugar. Full, fat texture pronouncing the sweets and bitters; delicious. Great amount of flavour for the style and quite easy to drink as well. Recommended.

Bottle. Pours clear golden orange with decent white head with a nice lacing. Caramel malt aroma, a touch of toast with nice near floral grassy notes. Light medium body, a definite malt presence with a bit of caramel, nut and toast; an advanced bitterness for the style cutting through toward the sweet finish. A very worthy lager.
Bottle. Dark amber with medium off-white head. Flavour is malt, caramel, sweet, flowery and hops.

Bottle. Pours a dark, clear orange body with a medium white top. Nose is faint grassy hops with hints of toffee. Taste is pretty similar, with some sweet  floral tones reminiscent of one of my childhoods lollipops; a sort of berry-like caramel flavor...bubblegum is perhaps one way to explain it, although were not talking about your regular Hubba Bubba here. Tough one. Anyway, this is certainly not an average lager, not even in the somewhat elusive "vienna" category; feels more like an APA of some kind. Nice and drinkable, but not much else.

Bottle. Pours a golden color with a thin white cap. Lots of bubbles. Aroma is of fresh malts, some caramel and a bit of hop presence. Taste is the same. This is very well balanced. You get a nice malt flavor upfront balanced well by a hint of bitterness with perfect carbonation. Boring style, very good beer.
A good lager, strong hopflavours from the dryhoping. Its fresh, not very exciting flavourwise, but a well made beer with more taste than usually from a lager.

La robe est légèrement cuivrée.  La mousse blanche résiste pour un instant, laissant derrière elle une large dentelle.  Au nez, le malt est légèrement grillé et laisse séchapper des parfums de houblons qui se signalent par une certaine complexité : quelque chose comme des herbes avec des épices et des pointes terreuses.  Très agréable.  Le goût est fidèle aux arômes avec la présence de bonnes saveurs de grains maltés qui sont rattrapées par des saveurs de houblons et une amertume juste à point.  En bouche, le liquide est de moyenne corpulence avec une effervescence modérée et une texture douce.  La finale est à limage de nos découvertes, cest-à-dire maltée et houblonnée.  Petite présence soulignée de lalcool en arrière-goût.  En résumé, pas mauvais du tout!

The aroma is grainy, gassy.  I was caught by surprise thinking it would be a light brew.  The color is amber.  There was a 1 finger head that dissipated and covered glass in nice, froth lace.  Taste is hoppy, carmel, and slightly sweet.  low malt.  Tastes alot like a samuel adams boston lager, but much better.

Bouteille de 355 ml. Classique parmi les classiques de micro-brasserie américaine. Cette lager est tout simplement irrésistible. Garett Oliver propose ici une bière blonde dorée passablement foncée, en ouverture le houblon transperce le nez mais avec le temps le malt se fait de plus en plus sentir. En bouche lamertume est bien présente, agréable. Cest franchement équilibré, belle bière agréable. (un gros merci au Slovaque)

Bottle at Cardinal 15.9.2010.
Pours clear golden with a 3 finger thick short lived head of light brown color. Good lacing. Roasted malts, dark dried fruits, caramel, alcohol and wood in the aroma. Malty sweet with some bitterness and even a hint of acidity. 
Light body, dry, gentle carbonation.

22 ounce sample on tap at a bar in terminal 5 at JFK airport.  Aroma has some grassy hints along with some metallic hops and a light amount of pine notes.  Nicely aromatic.  Transparent copper body with a foamy, off-yellowish head and really nice lacing.  Starts with a spicy, earthy hop flavoring, before this becomes somewhat malty in the middle.  Almost a rye maltiness is present with light toastiness.  Kind of a strange malt bill.  Pretty light, and not overly chewy.  Not so much flavor on the back end of this beer.

Aroma is dough, barnyard, sweet flowers/fruits and some hops. Taste is dough, malts, some caramel malts and finishes off bitter and slightly metallic. Overall a robust, fresh, flowery yet malty lager.

Tap at the Pencil Factory in Brooklyn, NY.  Pours a dark golden orange with a big head.  Aroma of sweet toasted malt and nuts.  The taste starts off super sweet with notes of nuts and apricots roll into a slightly tinny/metallic finish.  Fairly light bodied with medium carbonation.  A nice lager, but east to get burned out on this after a few.

Light amber, frothy head.  Surprising aroma of lightly grassy hops - probably because of the balance with the malt.  Taste is slightly toasty malt and pine hops.  Finish is a great bitterness.  Its a good lager.

Bottle.  Pours clear copper with an average, frothy and fizzy cream colored head, medium retention with good lacing.  Aroma is heavy malt (bread, toasted, cookie), average hops (woody, earthy), and light esters (apple/pear).  Flavor is heavy malt (bread, toasted, cookie), average hops (woody, earthy, herbal), and light esters (dried fruit).  Light body, low warmth, medium carbonation, low creaminess, and a dry finish.

Cool, a new arrival at the LCBO (March 2007)... and an American lager. Wow ! This one is not what one would expect, from what I have just said. First thing I noticed is the hoppy smell. It is quite strong and spicy. Its colour is a clean copper-orange with a big creamy off-white head that has great retention. The carbonation is pretty active and the lacing is thick and patchy. The taste shows how strong the hop is, as this one has bite. Good spicy bitterness that stays a bit, but then goes clean all of a sudden. Very nice, and refreshing, but this one really tastes like a very good ale. So dont judge it by its title of lager.
Topped with a creamy fluffy white head. Spicy, sweet flowery bouqet. Sweet lager palate. Good beer.
Pours orange with decent head. Aroma is mild malts, hints of roasts and citrus. Flavor is slightly bitter hops and nuttiness. Soapy mouthfeel. Okay.
caramel, resin aromas. orange, hazy, frothy head. medium sweetness, medium bitterness.medium body, creamy, lively, bitter finish. overall sweet and bitter, with a med to light body.  very good beer.
Bottle. Amber with a large white head. Aroma: caramel malt, hops (cascade?) citrus, fruit. taste: caramel, citrus, some licorice. A bit thin, quite a high bitterness for the style.
Amber color with white head.   A little skunky aroma, body is medium, taste is mild but also seems a little off. Ok, but not one Id order again.
Yes the aroma has a definite pizza sauce smell!  Very fitting for a NY brew. Thankfully, it does not taste like pizza but is fruity and malty. I really enjoyed this!

Pours amber. Forms a medium, surprisingly thick head for a white, with a very high lce. Aroma is orange, cedar and pizza sauce (!), with some malt as well. Taste is a bit caramelish, sweet, mildly hoppy, and no more pizza sauce. Great!

Beer Culture: Have been listening the Brooklyn Brewery audiobook, really interesting, a must read for anyone thinking of opening a brewery or any business. After trying Brookly Lager it´s clear why they succeeded. Food Pairing: Beeg in Balsamic sauce.

Pours clear amber with a frothy head.  Aroma is fairly malty and rich with a hint of hops.  Medium body, average to lively carbonation, with a light bitter finish.  Fairly sweet.  I was really quite surprised at the quality and taste of this beer.  I ordered it on tap having known nothing about the Brooklyn Brewery, but it has quickly turned into my favorite local brewery.  Overall, this is the best Vienna I have tasted thus far.

355 ml bottle @ home. Rated @ 26.6.2009.
Pours an amber colour with a medium-sized lacy head. Rich aroma of aromatic hops, citrus and malts. The taste is medium sweet with a strong malty body. Notes of pine needles, malts and citrus. Medium bodied, lively carbonation. Tasty lager.

For the eyes: light amber looking; large, frothy, white, lasting head; cloudy body; fair lacing. For the nose: toasted malts with caramel notes; perfume hops tending to citrus; alcohol is present. For the mouth: slick body; bitter finish. For the tongue: bitterness annoys a little, but the flavor seems to get better with time. For me: a lager surprise for me... too amber; too strong; too bitter.

355ml bottle.  Pours a dark amber with a large head.  Aroma is pithy orange, slight hint of pine.  Taste is orange to start with a slighty piney, low bitter finish.  A bit watery, but overall a good beer.

Nice bready malt aroma with just hint of noble hops.  Nice white head atop amber beer.  Taste is towards sweet.  Carmel and very, very light diacetyl present.  Very light floral hop flavor.  Seems to have a little bit of a fruity character.  Enjoyable beer.

UPDATED: OCT 18, 2010 Bright amber pour. White head. Aroma is malty and fruity with caramel and pine. Taste is sweet but balanced, fruity with some roasted notes,  sirup and pine. Quite nice hoppiness for a mainstream beer. Not very complex but a solid beer, especially for a lager.
24oz on tap.  Was amber with a nice head.  Sweet malt with a clean finish. very light hint of hopps
UPDATED: JUN 7, 2015 This is a quite nice lager.  It is much hoppy and crisper than I expected. Serving: Bottle
A clear amber pour yields a spicy hop aroma of low intensity.  The medium body is floral and hoppy with a slight bitter/tartness to the short finish.  Not a bad lager I suppose.

UPDATED: OCT 29, 2011 Now on draft at Woodys in Kingston-upon-Thames, England. Good beer. Hoppy bitterness is well-balanced by malt and a touch of sweetness. Great example of the style, really good beer.

12oz bottle. Pours out a nice amber color with a light head. Tastes lightly of citrus with a nice balance of toasty malt and dry hops and a small hint of a honeyed sweetness. Medium body with a crisp finish. Overall, a really solid beer thats refreshing, easy to drink, and great for meals.
This stuff is quite good. Pours light brown with a small head, plenty of hops, malt, floral to the smell and taste. For a beer simply labeled "lager" this was incredible

12oz bottle poured into pint, nice medium amber body with an inch of light head. Citrusy semi sweet aroma. Taste is nice balance of light sweetness and citrus notes with a dry hoppiness at the back end. Finish was clean leaving moderate lacing on my glass. I have passed on the chance to try this brew before and I regret it. This is a very enjoyable session beer that would be great for watching a game or BBQing.

I dont really think Lager when I drink this beer, but is a nice (and fairly priced) session beer.  Aroma is bitter hops with hints of honey.  Appearance is a pale orange with minimal head.  Taste is bitter on the front with a honey and malt finish.  Palate is full bodied.  Nice beer.

Bottle- Clear golden color with a nice head that fades to some lacing. Light sweetness & citrus aroma. Smells inviting. Light sweetness, smooth with a good bitter finish. Fairly medium body, crisp & clean. Well balanced. Excellent lager. Good brew anytime, any place.

12 oz. bottle. Pours nice, clear honey-ish amber with visible carbonation. One-finger white head. Nose was somewhat lacking- got a brief hoppiness that disappeared quickly leaving just a little malty note. Medium body. Nice little bit of hop bitterness but sweet malts dominate through a crisp finish. Definitely a good beer if Im in the mood for it, but I just think its not really my style.

Pours a clear golden amber, with a nice white lasting head. Aroma of fruity floral hops with some malt. Taste is toasted malts with some light bitter hops. Nice medium body, crisp mouth feel, moderate carbonation. Finish is toasted sweet malts with some bitter hops, there is a lingering nutty malty ending. Overall a very good, refreshing, easy drinking and mellow lager.
Solid beer. Had been in my house over a year, felt need to try it.  Adding notes from last few months, have not been able to comment perfectly on each beer. I blame the beer.

øl og mat fest 2010- first time seeing brooklyn in oslo, so goodddddddddddddd! pours quite dark for a lager, bronzy copper with a big white head, nose is hoppy, with flower and citrus notes, some breadyness from the malt taste is similar with a good amount of body but a nice dry finish. Cant wait to start workin at the bar so I can really push brooklyn lager, it is the best american lager on the market.
Pours amber with a light head. Aroma is fruits and hops, flavor is malts and fruits with a nice amount of hops in the finish. Like a good ipa in almost every way. Nice.
Tasting - Gulf Brew 2010 - Golden with white head.  Floral, grassy notes. flavors of citrus, hay, malted barley, not overly hoppy, very decent.  A pizza beer for sure.

Excelente Pilsen. Perfeita - preciso tomar novamente. Coloração caramelo com espuma de boa formação ambar claro. Cheiro floral, lúpulo. Encorpada, suave e saborosa. Malte e lúpulo por todo o sabor. Retrogosto amargo. Lúpulo herbal no sabor. Muito boa.

Bottled. Very nice golden color with a amazing fluffy foam that stay forever!  Aroma is floral hop with some malt notes, I really love this aroma, AMAZING!!! Flavor is quite sweety with a bit of bitterness I expected more bitterness after the aroma, but is a Lager one! No complains... Some malt and bread on it. Mouth feel is a mix of malt and bread, weird but good, letting a sweetness in mouth for a medium time. I loved this beer..
Pours amber with off white head.  Aroma is caramel, grass and some citrus.  Has a touch of bitterness on the otherwise sweet finish.  Medium mouthfeel, solid lager.

12oz bottle. Pours a light amber color with a small white head. Medium lasting foam. Nice hop prescence in the nose with a good amount of malty-bread like notes. Taste is mostly sweet and malty, a bit spicey, with a nice bitter hoppy finish. Dry finish. Medium bodied with good carbonation. Overall, a very well rounded beer, refreshing too. Surely a nice surprise.
Bottle.  Pours dark golden with a medium white head.  Flavor and aroma are very fresh and crisp, highly floral hops, some doughiness, spicy.  A very tasty, refreshing lager.
Clean malt flavors of bread and toffee and nice, floral and grassy hop aromas. Starts smooth, finishes cirsp. Lovely lager that goes so well with food.

Clear, orangish/amber color with a white head that had nice retention and left some real nice lacing.  A few bubbles coming up from the bottom.  Looks pretty inviting.  Getting some floral hops at first with the smell.  A bit more than usual with a typical "lager" style beer.  Some lightly sweet smelling malts.  Not too strong though.  Caramel malt.  Bread or biscuit notes also.  The taste was of a nice light bitter touch that leaves me wanting another sip.  Somewhat sweet in the taste.  Well balanced and good.  Only slightly sour.  The mouthfeel was medium, dry, even, crisp and chewy.  I really like this beer.  I could drink this at any time during the year.  Not real heavy.  Good all around beer.  I will definitely pick this up again.
Bottle. Pours clear golden colored with a nice frothy egg white head. Aromas of herbs, hops, grass, peach and toffee. Flavors of fruit, caramel, hops and with a malty backbone. Very nice..

Poured into a pilsner glass from a can.  Pale copper pour with a big, rocky, white head.  Solid biscuit malt aroma with some light toffee sweetness, lots of pine and juniper notes add a nice hop balance.  The flavor is well hopped with lots of clean floral, minty, juniper and evergreen notes.  The hop profile is well balanced by a nice blend of biscuit of sweet toffee.  The body is light, crisp and has a nice moderate and refreshing level of carbonation.
12 oz. can poured into plastic cup at Mets game.  nice balance of hops and malt flavor.  delicious.

Bottle. Pours a nice filtered amber/orange color with a big frothy white head. Aroma is filled with caramel and a slight amount of hoppy bitterness. Not a complex aroma at all, as with most lagers. The flavor has a solid malty backbone, with alot of caramel malts. On top of that you also get a decent amount of floral hops, and a clean hop bitterness in the finish. The body is medium and slightly creamy. Overal this is a really good lager, that is very similar to the Samuel Adams Boston Lager. But i think i prefer this one.

Draught at Oliver Twist (Stochkolm).
Orange clearly color with reddish reflex. Compact and homogenous head, discreet resistance. Pleasant aroma with wood notes, banana, stum. Decidedly bitter taste but altogether balanced, pleasant and of optimal duration.

12 oz bottle. Pours clear golden-orange body and a sudsy white head. Sweet, lightly toasted biscuity malt nose and mild spicy hop notes. Flavor follows with a nice balanced malt and hop profile. Faintly buttery and lightly sweet with moderate bitterness.

33cl bottle. Poured a dark amber with mild carbonation and a thick, fluffy off-white head atop which left a scattered lacing. Plenty of juicy cascade aromas, peaach and tangerine backed by biscuit and caramel/toffee malts. Similar in taste to aroma but the hops are dryer rather than juicy with a relatively short but dry bitterness. Light to medium in body, mid carbonation with a crisp and refreshing mouthfeel.
12 ounce bottle purchased at Total Wine Pembroke Pines, FL for $1.69 Very good.

most recently, in the bottle at hat factory in RVA. nice coppery colour, highly effervescent with a big puffy head and some lacing. nice punchy hop aromas -- mostly light floral with some light evergreen and tart orange. not at all perfumey. taste is light, crisp, and clean, with a great, solid lager character with some mineral-like quality, some biscuity notes and a doughiness reminescent of some German yeast strains. lively carbonation gives it a good body while staying light and very refreshing.

Wow, what a beautiful pour. Stunning blood orange pour with copper notes and a biggg frothy white head that refuses to go away. Aroma holds beautiful notes of doughy yeast, flowery and grassy hops, and touches of caramel malt and light spiciness. Also the slightest touch of piney resin. Flavor is quite tasty; notes of German style yeast, sourdough and rye bread, and more floral hops. Palate is light and drinkable, but has a nice semi-dry finish that lasts beautifully. Really well crafted brew, and great for a summer night.
UPDATED: SEP 15, 2010 tap at the brewery. nice little lager, has a good hoppiness to it with some citrus flavours in there.

12 oz bottle from warehouse wines. pours a reddish brown with a light brown head. aroma has grapefruit, floral, and citrus with a mild hoppy aroma. taste is decent hoppy grapefruit, with a malty bready aftertaste. palate is decent. light body with little mouthfeel. Decent

Pours light amber with a tan head head that lingers a decent amount.  A nice bright, grassy aroma.  Crisp and dry flavor, some citrus character, hoppy aftertaste.  Nothing special, but drinkable and pleasant.
Provata alla spina,colore ambrato , amara ma  veramente particolare ..dopo averne provata una è scattata subito la seconda!!
Pours a very nice clear red amber in the glass. Nose is very full citrus and malts. Taste has nice malt balance, some dry hops and citrus.

Veramente buona questa lager americana! Comprata dal besagnino di via Maddalena ma già bevuta un anno fa allO Connor. Color rame, schiuma solida e persistente, con un profumo molto simile allestathè.
Leggo sulla bottiglia che è stata utilizzata la tecnica del dry hopping: in effetti il luppolo si sente tantissimo, lamaro rimane in bocca a lungo e crea un bel contrasto con il profumo dolce.

Poured from the bottle. Frothy, off-white head that had lovely lacing. Clear medium amber colour and a fabulously flowery aroma with a bit of hops thrown in. Medium body with a slightly creamy mouthfeel. Active carbonation all the way to the slightly bitter finish. I didnt taste much malt at all...more hops/grass throughout. VERY quaffable...very light yet with a good bit of personality. HIghly recommended.
On draft. Orange pour with white head. Hoppy scent and taste. Nice with hot wings.
Bottled. A clear amber beer with white head. Aroma is malty and grassy. Taste is malty and fruity. Quite bitter with a nice hops flavor. Dry finish. Very good lager
Bottle. Malty body, flowery hop. Thick frothy white head, golden-amber colour. Medium bitterness. Light to medium bodied, lively carbonation, dry finish.

Nice drinkable lager. Light Amber color, clear,  Med high carbonation, bitter finish and bubbly.  Nice nose of grassy/floral hops, carmels, bit of nuts.  Cross between a Sam Adams Lager and a Morlein OTR ale.  Well done.
A copper color with medium body and a hint of malt sweetness. Clean and crisp.

Draught.  Pours an effervescent golden brown with a creamy off-white foamy head.  Light malty aroma.  Packs a decent flavor with dry malty presence and a slightly bitter grassy finish.  Medium bodied.

Nice deep amber pour with a thin off-white head. Mild floral hop aroma with some bread or yeast smells. Slightly hoppy with some notes of caramel malts. Pretty tasty overall and Id drink it again, but I wouldnt go out of my way to get it. Nothing special.
Copper color with a thick offwhite head.  Grain and caramel malt aroma.  Great caramel malt character with floral hops.
This is a very drinkable and good tasting beer.  I had this on tap at a local restaurant.  It had a touch of caramel and bread taste.  IT was suttle and good.

Had a bottle on the train ride home from city today.  Ive had lots of times and know it pours a nice amber color.  Its malty with some caramel notes and made the train ride filled with drunken yankee fans somewhat bearable.

Maybe one of the best amber lagers ever. deep amber color with a  light head and the just right sized head. The aroma was caramel malt and a sweetness and slight fruitiness like pineapple. The taste was a light bitter and balanced sweetness. Nothing wrong can be found with this beer.

An enjoyable sessional amber lager.  Nice malt character with a touch of caramel sweetness, and just enough bright hop flavor and aroma to keep it balanced and alive. There is a note of wet stone minerality, which does not detract, but should be considered for pairings.

Poured a light amber color with a thin lasting head. Pleasant hoppy nose with some malty sweetness. Malty start with a creamy, mildly carbonated palate trailed by a lightly hopped finished. Very well-balanced.

On tap @ White Horse. A refresher from a long journey. Thanks Martin. The colour is very good Czech pilsner style. Lots of golden glow. The head is minimal and nothing special. I get a massive caramel body and light fruits in a descent but not substantially hoppy beer. Yeast strain is good but not up there with Orval and Westy. I know this is well made and consistent. I had to have it on tap from a long hard slog. Cheers Martin for quenching my first. This SHOULD be a global success and a mega seller but some reason isnt there yet.

UPDATED: JUL 22, 2013 average offwhite frothy head. good lacing. mostly diminishing. translucent thick dark  reddish-yellow body. aroma: heavy hoppy, grass, earth, nutmeg. if and ff: light sweet moderate bitter; long duration. Palate: light medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation, metallic finish. aroma traz hortelã, condimentado, delicioso amargor lupulado (saboroso sem ser agressivo, lembra o de uma IPA, mas bem mais fraco) permeado por um inédito dulçor herbal, que também lembra hortelã, mas com leves toques de mel. excelente cerveja, uma das melhores representantes do estilo que já degustei, boa drinkability, 120 s


5/1/2010:average frothy offwhite head. good lacing. mostly lasting. sparkling thin dark yellow body. aroma:heavy hops, flowers, peach. if: light sweet moderate bitter. ff: light sweet heavy bitter. long duration. palate: light medium body, watery texture, medium carbonation and metallic finish. magnífico amargor de lúpulo semelhante ao de uma IPA, imensamente mais saborosa que a média comercial brasileira, leve dulçor de mel no paladar, lembrando bohemian pilsener

Nota: 130 skol

Pours a fairly dark amber colour with a small tan head. The aroma is of caramel malts and hops but is slightly fruity as well. The taste is malty and a little sweet then becomes nice and bitter, almost dry. The finish is long and the beer has a nice medium body to it. Overall quite good and fairly unique.
On tap in a pint glass.  Not bad for a lager.  A decent amount of hops which wasnt expected for the style. Light golden color, light body.  Most interesting beer I saw at the bar, so a good choice.

12oz bottle, best by Sept 2010.  Pours amber with a two finger off-white head that is quite pillowy and rocky.  Leaves some nice rings of lacing.  Aroma is floral hops, some fruit, biscuit, toast, light caramel malt, an attention-getting aroma for a lager, and the flavor follows suit.
