Nicely hopped overall, very floral, some citrus with good bitterness that is balanced very well against some sweet caramel malt and bread.  Nice, enjoyable finish, very tasty and refreshing.  Medium body, slick, good carbonation.  Fantastic lager.
Clear golden with excellent head. Metallic hop aroma. Light body, medium carbonation. Sweet and tangy start with a good bitter finish. Very nice.
Nice smooth lager. Pours a medium yellow with a white head. Taste is smooth and delicious. I have a bit of hops on the tongue and maybe some hay. Nose is hoppy.

Its hard to find a truly good lager. And by "lager" I mean a more traditional American-style lager rather than the many niche European (-style) bock and pilsner varieties. American lagers are unfortunately associated with "The Big Three," which isnt fair to GOOD examples of the style like Brooklyn Lager. This beer has everything the typical American beer drinker wants in their beer: good flavor that anyone can enjoy, combined with easy drinkability and a body that isnt too heavy.APPEARANCE AND AROMAI poured a 12oz bottle into a tumbler. Brooklyn Lager makes its distinction known right off the bat as the beer pours to a pretty shade of clear, dark amber/copper. Its not overly-bubbly like so many cheap adjunct lagers tend to be. It has an off-white, frothy head that lasts throughout the life of the drink and leaves noticeable lacing on the glass.The aroma is also a lot different than you might associate with an American lager. Its quite strong with floral hops and a touch of sweetness. While mild overall its still inviting by virtue of the fact it doesnt have that typical "beer smell" to it.TASTEWhatever flavors youre used to tasting in a "Big Three" lager you wont find them here. In fact, Brooklyn Lager has a lot of tastes that caught even me off guard. First of all, the head imparts a rich creamy texture followed by a slight caramel sweetness and the beer finishes with a gentle hop bite. Its unusual for lagers to have such hop distinction to their palates but Brooklyns hops are difficult to ignore.The beer does have a slightly dry, bitter aftertaste as these hops seem to linger for a few seconds but quickly dissipate. Some brews like this tend to dry out the mouth, but this one does not. DRINKABILITYIt should also be noted that this beer is only medium-bodied, but drinks like something much lighter. The palate is actually quite mild and the mouthfeel is thin, and it finishes with the smoothness of a velvety stout. If you drank Brooklyn Lager blind you might mistake it for a high-end "lite" beer. At only 5.2% ABV this is a beer well worth investing in a 12-pack for parties, BBQs, sessioning situations or just as a regular in your fridge. The satisfying taste and high drinkability would make it an ideal beer to pair with dinner.FINAL THOUGHTSBrooklyn  Lager is a perfect gateway beer for Joe and Jane Six Pack as well as yuppies, frat boys and party girls looking for something more satisfying than the usual "Big Three" without the intensity of a more high-end craft beer. Beer geeks will also appreciate and enjoy its craftsmanship and find it truly satisfying.NOTE: WATCH THE VIDEO VERSION OF THIS REVIEW AT:http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kTP_7ofH-PY
UPDATED: DEC 11, 2014 Not a fan at all of this one. Its not really my favorite style of beer though.
Excellent lager, one of my favorites of the style and goes so well with NY pizza.  I dont care to give a description...

A- Amber body pours with a thick foamy white head. Head quickly fades to a nice collar. Some lacing is left behind in the glass.

S- Nice balanced smell. Big caramel malt and floral refreshing hops.

T- Little caramel malt and some hops up front. Balanced finish between refreshing hops and caramel malt. Aggressive bitter hops linger long after everything else is gone.

P- High assulting carbonation with thin body. Somewhat watery at first.

O- The high carbonation, thin body, and aggressive aftertaste dont do much for me. The refreshing hops and caramel malt leave a lot of promise though. Not bad overall.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 06-29-2007 03:46:22

Poured a nice amber color.  Not much head.  Nice mixture of malt and hops.
Wish I had more than one to drink.  Excellent lager.
Pours amber with a small head.  Nice caramel and malt sweetness, smooth, biscuit, toast, some floral hops.  Good sessioner.

Pours a nice amber with a frothy head that  is lacey...the aroma of malt,citrus,  with a faint nuance of  bitter coffee/mocha in the finish with a medium sweetness, medium bitterness and lightly sour, average but proper bubbles on this one  with medium body  .
Overall a GREAT LAGER ..its Brooklyn
cheers!

(12 ounce bottle - pint glass)  Pours a amber color with a large frothy head.  Has a thick lace too.  Aroma consists of caramel malt balanced with a floral hop quality.  Tastes of light to medium bitterness and light sweetness.  Medium to full body, oily texture, light carbonation and great finish.
Tap on brewery. Amber body, white head. Aroma of butterscotch, citrus, toast, cookies. Palate is balanced, mayde slightly thin. Flavour has nuts, cookies and citrus hops. Great lager!

[Tap] Pours a light amber color with a good sized white head. Initial aroma of sweet malts and light citrus hopping. Taste is a bit more complex. Biscuit, toffee, caramel and pinecone in the flavor. Dry, grassy and surprisingly bitter finish. I really thought this was a well put together beer.

Generally disappointing beer. Small, under-carbonated head with a mild but unexceptional nose. Flavor is fairly weak and extremely skunky- it tastes like drinking the sweat off the fur of a wet dog- with virtually no appeal whatsoever. Both hops and malt were sub-par. One of the worst beers Ive ever tried.
Amber color with a nice hoppy aroma.  Nice malt flavor surrounded by bitterness.  I didnt expect this kind of flavor from a "lager" but I am pleasantly surprised.

Tasty!  Im not a huge lager fan but this is tasty.  Not much of a nose, but light and slightly sweet and a nice clean finish.  Good change of pace for someone who usually drinks IPAs and Imperial Stouts.  This is basically a light clean malt flavor, no discernible hops.

Pours a clear, light copper color with a solid off-white head which leaves great lacing. Aromas of bread, light caramel malt, and subtle pine and grassy hops. The palate is medium in carbonation, light in body with a lasting finish. The flavors is malty upfront and ends with a pine-tree bitterness. Overall, the beer is refreshing and drinkable. Theres a good balance between the sweetness of the malt and the bitterness on the back end, and its a pleasing beer to look at. I wish the aroma was stronger and included more, and the pine-like profile of the hops is a bit cloying.

UPDATED: APR 21, 2010 Poured from bottle. Phenomenal nose of toast, light citrus, vanilla, and spice. Pours a rich red-gold with a tall, creamy head that leaves lace and has a long life. The flavor is rich and complex; grassy, toasty, and nutty with a long, clean hops bite at the end. Palate is a little thin. One of the best lagers Ive ever had.

A solid American lager; pours light amber with a rocky, frothy white head.  Aroma of piney hops and sweet malt; flavors are well-balanced between light and carmel malts.  Straightforward and well-crafted, nothing fancy but pleasant.

Had the draught version at a bar in NYC. Disappointing--insufficient carbonation, with a weak taste that grows slightly stronger only as it becomes drier at the finish. Tastes, in essence, like a watered-down Pale Ale.

One of those old classics before I was familiar with the term "craft beer." Dark copper pour with standard white head. Aroma of sweet caramel malt and a touch of cherry. Its a smooth, pleasant nose. The flavor is similar, but some bitter hoppiness pokes out its head at the end. Quickly fading finish. A good, solid brew.
Bottle, pours a dark copper with a light head. Aroma of yeast and dough. Flavour is a good balance of malts and hops, with yeast and dough. One of the best lagers Ive had.
Perfectly balanced lager.  Malts come in first with a medium bodied flavor and then the hops kick in at the end for a light finish.
UPDATED: APR 3, 2010 Really enjoy this lager.  Everything a lager should be.  Fresh and crisp with a flowery and flavorful finish.

UPDATED: MAR 22, 2010 A dark brew bought at my local grocer. I did not enjoy this beer, the aroma was pleasant though, it was a coffee scent. The taste is mildly fruity, skunky, and too bitter in my opinion. Better with food.

12oz bottle from Gabriels.  Pours a deep copper body with a fluffy head that leaves some nice lacing (for a lager?).  Aroma is floral hops and a bit of malty sweetness.  Flavor is lightly hoppy up front and then some caramel sweetness.  Light, clean finish thats very easy to knock back.  Better than expected.

Received a single 12-oz bottle from new member Brooha. Pours a clear golden amber colored brew with a thick and creamy off-white head that has some nice lacing and head retention. Aroma of citrus and floral hops, caramel and golden grain malt, some light toffee and a hint of iced tea. Taste is medium bodied, semi-dry caramel malt, citrus and floral hops and some toasted bread dough. Finish is semi-dry with a citrus and light iced tea aftertaste. A touch away from the maltiness than the Vienna beers Ive tried but still a good sessional beer.

Bottle. Best by 4/10. Amber/copper, clear, white head. All malt- cookie, toffee, sweet caramel, toast. Just a touch of earthy bitterness on the clean finish. Light/medium body, balanced, easy. Decent session brew.

Pours light amber with a very thin head and some lacing.  Aroma is Initially sweetly floral and opens up to some yeastyness.  Fairly dry with a round, vibrant mouthfeel.  Taste is tart fruits with some herbs and winter vegetables and a bit of yeast.  Finish is less impressive but is dry and hoppy.  A nice beer!
Pours light amber with an off white head.  Aroma is a blend of caramel malts and citrusy hops.  Flavor is caramel, with a nice citrusy and earthy hop presence.

Che buona questa birra! davvero non mi aspettavo di trovarla così piacevolmente facile da bere. Dal colore ambrato ha una schiuma sfuggente, ma è negli aromi che più mi colpisce per il suo stile, agrumi e luppolo su tutti. al palato è dapprima dolce, di frutta, poi più amara. un buon corpo. per i miei standard è più che promossa.

This weas a mainstay for me when I used to travel to Penn. and NY. Glad to find it at Gils Market in Cooper Township, MI. Medium amber pour from a 12 oz bottle. Pleasant aroma dominated by hops. Flavor is light on the malt with modest hoppiness in the finish. Very quaffable, very tasty, great stuff.

dark amber color with some malt aroma.  mouthfeel is quite thin, but makes up for it in the taste.  good amount of aroma hops with only a hint of bittering.  certainly an excellent easy-drinking beer that provides some depth of taste.  reminded me of a Samuel Adams Boston Lager, but would have to compare side-by-side to truly make a comparison

12 oz. bottle pours a dirty peach with off white head. Initially, the aroma of hops pushes out of the pour, followed by a gentle wafting of caramel. Medium bodied with solid but not overwhelming carbonation. Flavors of crisp leafy florals in the front palate, warming to a citrus malt in the middle with a finish of earthy woods and hops. Slight citrus aftertaste. Enjoyable and versatile, this might become one of my go-to session beers as its a little lighter for me than SNPA.

12 oz. bottle from Publix.  Pours a light yellowish amber.  Grassy fairly hoppy nose for a lager with a decent light amber malt background.  Bitter upfront with a slightly sweet finish.  All of it mild but refreshing and drinkable all the same.  Good for a session.

Sampled on tap at the brewery. Pours light brown/dark orange in color with a thin white head. Smells of hops, citrus, various light malts. Taste is pretty much the same, quite nice on tap but not too memorable.

Amber color with small white head; hoppy aroma of pine and grapefruit; medium bodied, crisp mouthfeel with moderate carbonation; nicely hopped and fruity flavor with toasted and bready maltiness in the background; moderate bitterness in the finish.

Pours a clear copper body, with a fair amount of carbonation and a nice frothy off-white head. Pretty good head retention.

Smells of citrus-like hops, some grain and light hints of fruit (apple, cherry, plum).

 Its got a nice hop bite up front, followed by some malty, slightly sout graininess, with a hint of fruit. Not much in the way of sweetness. The finish is moderately bitter and bready, with a bit of lingering hoppiness.

Light-to-medium bodied. Crisply carbonated and a bit acidic.

This is a sessionable beer, especially for hop-heads, or those who are beginning to get into hops. Id prefer this over pale lagers any time!
buonissima vienna con i classici sapori di crammello ma contrastato da una buona dose di luppolo.
Not a big lager fan, but this one is not too bad. Has a nice dark golden color when poured into a glass, with a soft white foam head. The aroma has hops and barley hints.

( 12oz bottle) pours clear deep amber with nice oily bubbled head with great lacing. Nose of caramel, floral hops, and grass. Taste is crisp citrus hops, citrus oils, mild earth character, and toasted grain. Finish is oily, creamy and the body is just right.

One of the best American made lager from a bottle. A orangy/bronze color. Nice hoppy aroma. Pours to a nice head. The head slowly fades during the course of drinking, but never completely leaves. Has a bit of a sweet floral throughout. Nice aftertaste. It is the first beer I have had in a long time that I tried to get the last of the foamy head out of the bottom of the empty glass, it was that tasty. I highly recommend this beer. I plan on buying more asap.

12oz bottle from thecarster1 poured into a pint glass.

Pours a deep golden amber with a steady stream of bubbles from the bottom feeding a very thick white head that stays on as a cap for the duration.

The aroma is subtle light biscuity malts, some toasted grains and a bit of grassy hops.  The hops are also right up front in the taste with a floral grassy taste up.  The backbone is decidedly sweet with lightly toasted caramel malts before a crisp, barely-bitter finish.

The mouthfeel is extremely smooth and very clean and crisp with a strong carbonation that all pulls together to make an excellent lager.  Its smooth, fairly sweet and has none of the skunky characters you sometimes get in a run-of-the-mill lager.  Enjoyed this one thoroughly.

[bottle]
Nice US hops aroma: pine is stronger than grapefruit, then some caramel. Clear bronze with a clingy, lacy white top. Nice hoppy caramel flavour that is slightly lemony and with some faint peanuts. Also bitter grapefruit. Crisp finish, medium carbonation.

Courtesy of a trade with joe McPhee this poured a cear amber with and off-white head and very distinct lacing.  Nose of sweet malt with a  touch of breadyness  Medium mouthfeel. The flavor is sweet with light caramel malts balanced with light floral hops,  The finish is long and bitter.  A very well crafted beer.
Brown amber color with a decent tan head. Malty aroma with caramel sweetness and some citrus. Flavor is sweet toasted malt with butterscotch mellowness and a nice wellblancad hoppy citrus touch.

2008-04-12, bottle, Göteborg
AP: Golden coloured bodu, high white head
AR: hops and fruits 
F: hops and fruits, well balanced and brewed.

pours amber golden-brown with a fluffy off-white head. nose of bread, floral hops, caramel, toast. flavor is bready, toasty, and a little bitter. floral. malty and well-balanced. finish is a little dry, nutty flavor comes through.
Quite good lager. Fruity and flowery European-lager-tasting hops added to a full bodied American lager. It tasted familiar but much hoppier. It worked and is very refreshing.
Pours orange. Nose is sweet malts, spicy hops and yeast. Flavor is full of sweet malts, bitter hops, bubblegum and toasty grains.

Bottled. Wow. Its Christmas and I bought this for my Uncle who is more of a Lager style beer drinker. Was not expecting this much. Amber in color with small but lasting head. Aroma is bready and sweet caramel (overall  some sweet malt feel) balanced excellently by floral hops and earthier tones. Flavor is earthy hops, and dry-hopped floral, balanced back by sweeter caramel but remains dry throughout. Big bite for lager at end. A Christmas miracle. ALSO my 420th rating....I cant believe the video they played after I saved it!
Bottle. Pours amber brown with thick rocky head and lots of lacing. Tastes sweet with some toasty and floral notes. Great session beer.

In NY from a bottle.  Nice frothy top with dark golden and copper color.  A bit of citrus, toast and hey.   Bubbles seem more refined and creamier than most lager.  Well balanced finished which longer than expected finished with nice bitterness, malt and hey.  One of better lager around.

12 oz bottle. Pours clear amber with a small head that is short lived. Nose is quite malty and citrusy. Some piny hops and some grain. Malts are sweet and chewy.Some caramel and a bit spicy. Taste is nicely fruity and malty. Some sweetness but not too much. Finish is neither dry nor sweet. Small hints of citrusy hops all along. Finish is a tiny bit hoppy and very fruity. Highly drinkable, tasty and refreshing. A bit more hops would be great but perhaps it once had more (I doubt this is a fresh bottle).

Pours clear amber with lively carbonation in the body, and an ample one finger white head with tight bubbles that leaves a moderate lacing. Head retention is quite good. At first, the aroma meets with a light grass note and sweet caramel malt with hints of graininess. A very light hop character presents in the form of citrus and evergreen. The flavor provides a nice balance of caramel sweetness, mild toast, and a light but distinct resinous hop bitterness. A slight grainy astringency peeks in near the end, but intermingles with the hop profile so doesnt act to detract too much. Palate is light bodied and nicely effervescent with a crisp clean finish.

Pours out a nice dark hold with a fluffy tan head.  Light toasty aroma complemented nicely by the floral, grassy and slightly citrus-like hop character.  Body is light with a nice lasting slightly bitter finish.  Slight toasty flavors with notes of earthy hay.  Finishes out well.  Light and enjoyable.
Gold colour with a good head, smells like lager but has a nice citrus and hop taste, very nice.

Enjoyed from a 12oz bottle in a pub glass.  The beer pours a deep amber color, with a small but resilient white head.  Aromas of Munich malt come through in the nose, as does some earthy/spicey noble hop character.  The palate is initially malty before transitioning to an assertive bitterness, and a surprising amount of hop flavor.  Overall, a nice interpretation of an often poorly brewed style.

On tap at some dive in NYC. Pours a crystal clear, golden-copper colored body with a finger-width, off-white head that dissipates slowly and leaves a very nice creamy lacing. Aroma is really pleasant for a lager. Floral fruits and grassy hops with a light malty sweetness. Flavor is impressive as well.  A good amount of flowery citrus and a moderate grassy bitterness accompanies a really nice malt profile. Lightly sweet and crisp with a dry, moderately bitter finish with a nice lingering aftertaste after a light to medium, smooth body. Overall, a great lager. Very pleasant bitterness, fruits, and malt backing. This is what I look for in a lager.
Aroma of floral spruce. It poured a filtered light brown color with beautiful lacing. I tasted flowery hops with a caramel finish. Overall this is the best premium lager Ive ever had.

Totes itself as the "Pre prohibition style beer," and I can imagine that description to be quite accurate. 
Nice, deep gold, lightly copper color with a fluffy, creamy, tan head. Excellent hop aroma, grassy with a slight citrusy nod. The malt is there as well in the form of a raisin-like, bready aroma.
Nice body, not too thin, not too heavy. Wonderful hop flavor comes first, then the sweetness of the malt blends in. This beer is somewhere in between a Sam Adams Boston Lager, and an Anchor Steam beer - having the best characteristics of both!

This may well be the richest lager Ive ever had...far from a delicate balance of some golden lagers, this beer is full of flavor, and is definitely differs from its delicate cousins.  It pours amber, and is nicely balanced, with a ton of toffee and butter noticed, balanced nicely with some hop bitterness.  Aroma was pretty mild, but more malty than hoppy, with the sweetness of the toffee notes and the buttery diacetyl cutting through.  Mouthfeel was nice and clean.  A nice beer.

I had two of these alongside an enormous sandwich at the Stage Deli in New York.

Bright copper coloured beer with small but tight and creamy head that leaves a lot of lace. The aroma is dominated by a rich, piney hops, with some butter, malts and alcohol. The taste is crisp, lemony hops, little hops and nuts.
Had in a bottle at a bar.  Light amber color.  Hoppy with a great malt flavor.  Excellent taste left on the palate.

Bottle: Pours a nice orange amber color with a nice white head. The nose is fragrant with some nice juicy hops, the light maltiness lets the hops come out, even as light as they are, they taste very fresh and citrusy. The flavor has a great balance of body; bready biscuity malts and a floral cascade note in the tail. Very nice body but not heavy, amazing drinkability and quaffability. This is a damn good beer all-around!

Clear light copper, foamy head that hangs around for a while, nice lacing.  Aroma of resiny, piney hops.  Very crisp to begin, prickly carbonation and bitterness on the front of the tongue, very lively. A bit malty with a hint of caramel and bread  Finishes with just the right bitterness, and a citrus hop bite.  Flowery, resiny hops in the aftertaste.  This beer gave me a while new faith in lagers after I had written them of forever.
Bottle. Wo! quite a nose here, strong piney hops (hints of celery here) quite intriguing. Taste is hoppy, pine pretty heavy for a lager.
Brilliant amber color with a light tan head. Big fruity apricot/peach aromas with grainy pale malts. Rich, frothy mouthfeel. Refreshing flavors of grainy malt grist with lightly sweet honey.
user_location: Same Trailer, Different Park, Louisiana, USA

text: A decent, light and lively lager.  Floral aromas with a hint of caramel.  Finely balanced.  Much more malt on the palate -- cereal grain, wheat, slightly toasted.  Dry hop finish.
Sampled in Boston. A pretty well made lager, fresh with mild hopping and malts. Drinks smooth. Has a hint of herbs that are nice and crisp. Very nice brew.

UPDATED: JUN 25, 2010 Splendido colore ambra dorato con una schiuma molto spessa e durevole,aroma fruttato,maltato e aromatico.In bocca è piacevolmente fruttata,maltata.Più ne bevo più ne berrei! Una piacevole sorpresa!
Bottled 355ml. -Pale amber coloured, small to medium off-white head, slight malty nose. Moderate sweet malty and herbal hoppy with fruity notes. Bitter hoppy finish. Just average.

Bottle. Think it is an affordable and quite tasty lager, pleasant fragrance of fruit caramel and a bit of citrus. The flavor offers tropical fruit, caramel and a bit floral. Nice! Pleasant bitterness.

Bottle courtesy of and shared with ogivlado (thanks!) Amber/orange body, medium sized thick white head that went away slowly. Lemony aroma hop, notes of pine, quite nice. Some maltiness in there too. Piney hoppy taste, trace sweetish malt, Ends kinda salty. Couldnt shake the impression that this wouldve been far from spectacular had it not been for the very nice hopiness.
(bottle from j12601). Clear amber color. Medium off white head. Light grain aroma and flavor. Avg duration. Slightly dry finish. Thin texture. Soft carbonation. Fair lacing.
33cl bottle, Alko. Copper color, flowery aroma, fruity, hoppy flavour. Refreshing, good brew.
A golden brown beer with a small head. Aroma is malty, & the taste is malty with a slight spicy hop taste.

bottle 35cl from kihoskh
clear orange small white head
nice mild flowery aroma, malty notes, old hops, aroma almost like a barley wine.
flavor is bitter, slightly sour / flowery, malty, old hops.

UPDATED: JUL 8, 2010 Bottle. 12 oz. Pours orange haze with a thick, creamy, outrageously lacy off-white head. Aroma of sweet malt, caramel, roast, slight smokiness, citrus, and light hop. Medium, rounded bodied with a clean, smooth, refreshingly juicy mouthfeel. Excellent Vienna lager.
0.330ml bottle. Nice copper brown color. Light head. Taste has lots of malts, some citrus and nice bitter aftertaste. My kind of beer at the moment.
12 oz. Bottle. Pours a nice copper brown color. LIght to medium head. Smelled of malt. Also tasted of malt. Also some hints of citrus. Recommended.
Six pack from the Majestic on Eastchase.  Really dry and really smooth?  A little floral , but good.

On tap in Brooklyn. Reddish-brown pour; medium body. Aroma was very hoppy. Flavor was initially very bitter with some malt; later transitioned into a distinct citrus finish. It was all right, but seemed heavy on the hops for a Vienna lager -- a little too much to be considered clean and crisp. Citrus fruit finish was unexpected.

UPDATED: OCT 19, 2012 From a 12 oz bottle, poured into a lager glass. Orange, amber in color, not a lot of head. Medium body, lightly malted and hopped. A fairly typical lager.
Update Oct 19 2012: It seems my tastes have evolved over time. This is a stellar lager, with a very clean and refreshing character!

Ive had Brooklyn Lager a couple times. I always come away with the same impression.

I could go into a extended review of the beer. Brooklyn makes quality beers, but to sum it up quickly...

The beer is out of balance. The Hop flavor overpowers the beer start to finish.

Hops quickly over power the malt flavor I am looking for in a medium lager, and interferes with the crispness of the finish.

Draft at Pinhook. Cloudy yellow to orange hue with a thin layer of white head. Nose is malt with a touch of sweetness and perhaps diacetyl. Flavor is light malts and grains, pretty standard lager. Light-medium body with a clean texture that is almost too thick for the style. I dont think this was the freshest specimen, but still quite drinkable and refreshing, east coast all the way!

UPDATED: AUG 22, 2010 Had  a very nice amber colour but not much head. Hoppy flavor that went down very well. Had it some time ago and cant remember the finer details of this beer. I do remember that it tasted good though.
amber pour with a minimal head.  Floral hop aroma with some nice toasted malt character.  Clean, crisp flavor with nice toasted malt flavor and slightly bitter hopping.  nice

hazy copper pour, minimal head. Aroma of citrus hops, lots of orange peel, a little bit of both sweetness and floral notes as well. Flavor is pretty grainy, and taste of sulfur, not really what i expected. Very dry bitter hops. Little metallic flavor to me. Not undrinkable but not a favorite of mine.

nice and hoppy with a mild malty biscuit sweetness in the middle. Really crisp and clean flavor. Smell is hoppy but also a little like melon candy - overall though, not fruity. Very straightforward, very good. Better than all other low alcohol hoppy beers Ive had, and way way better than all low alcohol lagers Got this because it was a lager in a can, and I had heard that Brooklyn made good beer - but I thought that it would still suck - cuz damn, its a lager in a can. But it is good. I could drink many of these.
Quite an enjoyable beer a nice smooth malty sweetness with a tingling of hops on the palate, a very drinkable beer.

UPDATED: MAR 1, 2010 Having Brooklyn really tured me into a big fan of the vienna lager style..toasted malts, grains, caramel with floral hops come through, a great tasting lager thats very drinkable and not overdone..could use a touch more toast and hops but otherwise very nice....

bottle poured an amber color with a thin white head. aroma has light hops, mild malt, a bit of sweetness, and a bit of grass. thin mouth feel with medium high carbonation. flavor has sweet malt, bitterness, caramel, and flowers.

Bottle from longshot - thanks Mark!.  Crystal clear amber with a large puffy taupe topper that leaves craters o lace along the glass.  Aroma of toasted malt, mild citrus, cereal grains and floral hops.  Taste of floral hops, mild sweet malt, herbal hops light honey and a hint of sulfur.  Minor bitterness on the finish.  Doesnt remind me of the other viennas Ive had.
a well rounded lager. not something i could drink all the time, but a unique flavor.

Has a golden color.  Aroma is of malts and citrusy hops.  I can pick up some type of lemon and yeast in the undertones.  Taste is of hops and malts with some spices.  Has a little bit of a bite.  A good session beer.

man I love good beer from a can, and this is a damn good one! I found that i kept smelling this over and over, it really just grabbed my attention. It has a great blend of malts and hops. Well rounded brew and I suggest getting the canned version if possible.
Really good beer. Im never disappointed. Got some good hops going on, overall this is one of my favorite lagers

clear gold, fluffy white head, good lace.  nice balance of sweet malts, and mild hoppiness in the nose (my notes say good smell!).  flavor follows the nose with a sweet malt start, followed by a hoppy bitterness.  light body, nice bitter finish.  i didnt expect to enjoy this one much, but i was reallty surprised.  a good sessionable beer (i had more than one).  i had several bottles of this at the bar in the newark airport rennaisance hotel.
Little detectable aroma aside from some faint yeast. Clear golden with a thin head. Crisp and pleasantly bitter.

Bottle pour...lager glass. This beer is good. Aroma was full, nice, almost sweet, but roasted malt goodness to it. The pour was smooth, nice, with a darker tinged head that laced to the side of the glass as I finished it. Crisp, full body and flavor, with some hops bitterness that seems just right for this beer. Overall, a very good brew. I think I will have a glass Sunday night with our spicy, Greek marinated, bbqd chicken.

Draft.  Pours clear amber with a frothy off-white head that hangs around for the ride.  Malt, grain, hops, and citrus in the aroma.  More flavor than youll get from just about anything else with "Lager" on the label, with some enjoyably mild bitterness to the hops.  More body than expected, too, and nice smoothness.  Just a very good lager that beats the hell out of most of its peers.

heavier body than a lager may generally represent, good full palate, and fluffy mouthfeel.  mild flavor but good.  I grabbed to have for my fishing trip, wanted a good lager out of the can and it fit the bill rather well.  But the best beer (to digress) to have on a boat in the middle of a lake in the middle of nowhere canada, is a bells two hearted, bottle.  Damn perfect time to have that beer.

Bottle: pint glass: From Brooklyn, drinking a Brooklyn, in Brooklyn....nice.  Pours a dark amber, light brown, clear.  Pour creates nice bubbles leaving a full finger off-white head.  The nose is of raosted malts, very nice and medium.  The taste is full doy, yet thin enough to drink quickly.  Again the roasted malts come through, with an even blend of hops.  Very well balanced, very drinkable.  Great brew.

Brought 6 pack back from NYC. Amber color with nice white head.  Head stays all the way down with good lacing. Nice sweet malt aroma with floral hops.  Very nice balanced taste between malt and hops. Crisp, a little dry and fruity. Fuller bodied than most lagers. Extremely drinkable. Great beer.
Pretty excellent, all around. Well-balanced as one could ask for, with just the right hop profile and level of maltiness. The nose and appearance are just about perfect.
12oz bottle into a phone.  Obvious fruity and floral hops accent the malt well.  Not bad!

Bottle. Clear orangey-brown looking beer. Head does not last long. Faint hop aroma. Malt is nice, a little sweet and a little toasty. Nice medium hop bitterness. Very easy to drink. A lager that I like more than most ales!

A color of clear and light orange. Really excellent color for a lager. Head goes away almost immediately, but leaves some nice icy lace. Its how lagers should always look! The aroma gives a nice grassy hop over some decent pale-ish barley. Aromas are mild but refreshing. A spring-y aroma. The taste gives more grassy hop flavor, which is such a welcome element. There is mild chlorine from the grassy hop but its not intrusive or unpleasant. The feel is a fizzy, bubbly mouthfeel. Lager-dry, but good. This is one terrific, hoppy lager with good body and lots of character. Grassy and malty both.
Bottle from Utobeer, 29th July 09. Amber with an off-white head. Good malty aroma and taste. Fullish palate and great body, this is very drinkable.

So I finally tried Brooklyn Brewerys flagship beer, the lager. But I did it in style: on tap, in Williamsburg at the Brooklyn Bowl. This was a great beer. Rich amber pour, considerable pure white head. Scents of malts and citrus. Regarding the taste, I actually got notes of mango. I dont know. The beer had just enough complexity to keep me interested. The flavor was crisp and firm and overall the experience was stellar.

This is the only Brooklyn beer ive seen in my neck of the woods. And this is also the best lager I think ive tried.  Beautiful amber colour, nice big head. Very malty nose, fresh sharp hops, citrus.  Went down very easily, balanced quite well.  Sharp and bright. Please send more of your beers to London!
Sampled at the 8th Annual Music City Brewers Festival.  Clear orange, whitish head.  Aroma is sweet malt, grassy hops.  Taste is toasty, grassy, sweet malt.

Are those Cluster Hops?  Ive long wanted to brew a pre-prohibition lager.  When I saw this was a commercial example, and only $5.99 for a sixer at King Richards in Michigan City, I got it.  Actually sort of tastes like Sam Adams Boston Lager, with a different hop profile.  So, I guess Sam Adams is a Pre-Prohibition lager, too.  Vienna lager?  Eh, maybe.
I had no idea pre-porhibition beer tasted like this.  Poured light amber with a cotton-like yellowish head. It tasted much more like an IPA than a lager.
Pours a nice clear amber. A touch of malt. Medium carbonation. Refreshing taste. Not earth shattering but a refreshing good beer.
On tap at Nashvilles Music City Brew Festival.  This stuff was tastey and much better than I was expecting.  A great dark amberish lager with some nice hops in there to boot.

Sampled at MCBF. Pours amber with nice retentive off white head. Fruity nose. Light bodied but not watery. This is nicely balanced- hops, malt, sweetness all meld into a refreshing lager with a citrusy nuance. This is what macro loyalists SHOULD be drinking.
Now this is what a real lager should look and taste like.  Pours an orange color with an off-white head that sticks around.  Perfect malt/hop balance that has a clean semi-dry finish.

Bottle. Amber to slightly darker. A thick dense off-white head with an almost greenish tinge. A massive whack of citrus-y hop aroma. Some malt up front with a hoppy, very bitter finish which almost tastes a little burnt. A good beer but perhaps not one I could have too many of in a session.
Hoppy nice aroma with a hint of orange. It also has a nice hoppy flavor. Quite dry with a medium bitterness.
tap.  pours amber with a small head.  pleasantly surprised by this one.  nice crisp floral hops against a pleasant caramel, toffee, malts.  very crisp and refreshing.  well balanced.  nice beer.

Bottle, I cant believe I havent rated this yet!  A gem of a beer, this simple lager pours amber-brown with a medium sized head.  The palate is exceptionally crisp, fairly light, with a semi-short finish.  Aroma is delicately floral, earthy, and with some caramel and toffee notes.  Flavor has a nice earthy quality, with substantial floral and herbal hop varieties.  It levels on a really pleasant bitter-sweet note, full of just the right amount of flavor, before settling into a soft finish.  Excellent.
As far as lagers go, this one is absolutely the best Ive had.  Just a clean, crisp beverage; you cant really go wrong with one.  Trust me, pick up a 6er or head down to the brewery on Friday night.
Bottle: clean sweetish malt upfront and then comes good dose of hoppy bitterness, maramalade like, a lager with clear ale qualities. very flavourfull, refreshing, i really enjoyed this one.

Sample at July 17, 2009 Beer Club meeting. An amber-colored lager with a lovely head.  Malty aroma with hints of hay, no doubt dry-hopping.  A floral, fresh hop flavor.  Damn good for a lager.  Probably the best lager Ive had in a while.

Scoperta nel 2008 a NYC.anche se la lager la immagino di un colore  molto piu chiaro, questa birra mi ha veramente stupito.
birra dal colore leggermente ramato,e dalla schiuma compatta.al palato lascia quel giusto amarognolo che non guasta.
è una lager che consiglio vivamente a tutti!!!!
Dai ce ne fossero di lager così, anche se il dry hopping che dona la particolarità è forse anche troppo per lo stile e crea una sorta di "ibrido" che però slurp
Overall a nice drinking beer, nice understated flavor that doesnt get boring after a few. a very well made lager.

Best before April 2007.  This poured a frothy white head of one finger, gradually diminishing to nothing.  The body was scarcely like a lager, rather more like a pale ale and so was a most pleasant surprise.  THe colour was a clear orangey amber, with a very nice aroma of hops and malt in what seemed like a 60/40 ratio.  The taste echoed the aroma, maybe being oven hoppier than that.  Mouthfeel was smooth and the finish was more sweet than bitter.  I indeed liked this beer!

Pours a dark amber color with a small, off white head that settles quickly to a thin film. The aroma shows toasted bread and grains, earthy hops, and a caramel malt base. The flavor follows suit with the toasted grains and floral hops coming through with just a touch of sweetness from the caramel malt. Medium bodied with ample carbonation leads to a slightly bitter finish. This is a well made lager and nice version of the style.

12 oz bottle. Pours a deep golden with a small white head that lingers. Aroma is crisp and malty, very refreshing and sweet. The caramel notes dominate over a nice subtle floral hopiness. Flavor starts crisp and clean. Nice sweetness but it never really subsides and continues to dominate over the slight hop bitterness in the finish. Hops are again very floral. Definitely a decent easy drinking beer, just not greatly balanced.

My first Vienna style. Its an attractive beer, pouring orange-amber with a medium-sized lasting creamy head and moderate carbonation.  A malty aroma leads into a flavour dominated by sweet toffee malts with (unfortunately) some metals creeping in at the edges.  Theres a little bitterness in the finish, along with floral and botannical hints that made me think of the smell of flowerbeds after a heavy summer storm.  However, the sweet malt is the main thing here.  If this is a typical example of the style, Id be happy to try some more Viennas - this runs rings around most other lagers!  Ooh, Ive just noticed my rating was the 1,000th rating for this beer - now I feel special!

bottled.
Aroma: light malt aroma and mainly citrus blossom and mango-like hops.
Appearance: medium amber with a good, thick off-white head that lasts.
Flavor: Starts bready , continues with strong bitterness and hop flavor and ends with malty sweetness. clean lager character.
Palate: medium-low. goes well with general appearance and flavor.
Overall: a great lager! probably the best lager Ive had. sets a great example to what a lager can be.
Better than I remember! Nice aroma, nice dry hops. Nice and well balanced.

0.355L bottle, lightish copper colour, small stable bubbly head, hoppy citrus aroma, flavours of hoppy citrus some white fruit and some caramel, light body and light short aftertaste. very dissapointing, much too hoppy and one dimensional for a viena.
Bottle from The Cave. Amber colour, off-white head. Nose has fruits and citrus, with caramel malts. Flavour is caramel malty, hoppy and floral. Very drinkable.

Big thanks to Joe McPhee. Pours a clear amber with an abundant tan head and glass-coating lace.  Aroma of floral and citrus hops well balanced by caramel malt smells. Truly well-integrated aroma. Flavor is citric, tending towards grapefruit bitterness, on top of of firm, worty malt backbone. Tasty, but falls short of the awesome aroma, sometimes off in a slightly metallic way. Medium bodied, juicy mouthfeel.

Pours a nice copper color with a thin white head.  The smell is very hoppy with a decent caramelly malt background.  Other notes of ginger, spruce and cough drop are also noticeable.  This beer tastes of sweet caramel and bitter hops, but also of some flowers and a delicate touch of earth.  Finish is lightly bitter.

Bottle. Pours lightly hazy, bright copper with a thick off-white head that leaves concentric circles of lace. Fruit and citrus nose, with just a touch of caramel. Sweet citrus and flowers taste, with a bit of toffee. Lingering earthy bitter finish. Tasty, but Its pretty hoppy for a malt-forward style and seems a lot more like an ESB than a Marzen.

ambrato scarico buona schiuma piuttosto grossolana buona persitenza il naso è prima maltato leggero caramello poi luppoli erbaceei con un tocco citrico in bocca malto discretamente intenso poi luppolo non molto amara buona persitenza dry hoping invita di nuovo a bere

Pours amber with a white foamy head, longlasting.  Taste is malty with notes of caramel and bread.  Flavor approaches an American pale ale more than a traditional lager.  Try this with pizza rather than standard lagers and the flavors will compliment one another.  Has a similar feel to Sam Adams Boston Lager, though I would rate this slightly higher.  Great stuff, drinkable, sessionable.
12 oz bottle... never was a fan of this one but it is definitely drinkable just not something i would turn to, i had any other choice from the brooklyn guys
Great session lager. Excellent balance, good hop flavors, very ale-like. Not surprising any more, but still a well made beer.

Bottled. Clear coppery beer. Quite small but creamy head and nice lace. The aroma is very clean, hoppyish and dryish malty. Lemon, some grape fruit and slightly caramelly maltiness. The flavor is dryish and only slightly caramelly. Crips and clean bitterness in the finish. Medium bodied and refreshingly carbonated palete. Simple but great.

UPDATED: MAR 14, 2010 Location: Updating this rating with a 12 oz bottle, 3/14/10 


Aroma: Caramel malts, fruit, bread, floral and grassy hops

Appearance: Clearish copper-amber color with a lacy white head

Flavor: Clean malty flavor, light hop presence as well, balanced

Palate: Smooth and clean, drinkable beer, light-medium body, quite sessionable

Overall Impression: 
A flavorful and highly sessionable lager, a good example of the style.  I dont have a ton to add to the old rating, other then what is written above, my opinion hasnt changed too much on this brew.  Ill up the appearance from a 2 to a 3 and leave the rest alone.

Overall Impression: 
Definitely a solid example of the Lager style.  A nice amount of floral hops give this one some taste and distinction, a pretty nice beer.  7,2,7,3,13

From bottle at Norma Jean, Deep golden color white nice white head, aroma of citrus and grapefruits quite winey, flavor is winey with some malt and herbs, finish is winey with low bitterness, body is medium. OK

Bottle. Pours deep amber with fluffy off-white head, quickly dissipates leaving some lacing. Aroma is heavenly, lightly herbal, spices,with a wholesome breadiness in the background. Flavor is mild caramel, bitter, floral and loads of hop resin lingering long into the finish. Beautiful.
not your average lager. smell of hops and taste of hops is significantly more anounced in this lager.  one of my favorite lagers.

Copper colored beer with think foamy head that dissipates quickly after a few sips. Rich floral hoppy aromas dominate with some straw undertones. Flavor starts with apricot and biscuit, then burnt carmel in the mid-palate with a crisp, bitter finish. Overall an excellent beer..... for a lager.

I shared a 12 oz bottle of this MereLikesBeer. It pours a dark honey amber with tan head. The aroma is hoppier than I expected, but with a nice sweet malty background. I was very pleasantly surprised with the flavor and the aroma, which was both plenty hoppy and malty, with some nice caramel notes. Very tasty brew! Cheers!

Well, this is my first "technical" rating for a lager..dont think I am in love with the style, however this beer does the style justice.  I tasted it with BeerBaron617, my beer buddy...  Its got a nice pour - a dark honey amber color with a nice off white head.  It has lots of bubblys in it, which I like :)  It smelled really nice, malty and a bit hoppy too.  Not what I expected out of a lager.  Taste was pretty decent.  Defiantly tasted the sweetness of the malt and maybe a bit of honey and caramel.  I got a big taste of the hops...its just really not what I expected out of a lager.  Cheers to Brooklyn for doing a pretty decent job.

***review from Aug 5, 2007***
Just noticed that the best before date is March 07....I cant imagine how great this beer must be when fresh. On the previous bottle I had, the pour was incredible and I was giving it a 10 but I was suspicious cause the glass was producing a cloud of endless fine bubbs that gave the brew an inch thick creamy cap the entire way so I decided to get another bottle into a different glass. This time the pour was equally good producing a large, thick off-white cap but this time the effervecance was almost nonexistant and the cap did not last. Left some sticky messy lacing and retains a ring. The beer is a medium amber colour and slightly hazy. The aroma is excellent and comes across quite refreshing - thick English style malts, good level of sweetness which is all blended perfectly with the soft floral hops. WOW. So chuggable! Well blended combination of caramel and biscuit malts, obvious spice and bold hops (apricotish) - more hops than I expected for the style, but a hell of alot less than the overhopped West coast stuff. Mouthfeel is ok and the carbonation is average. Medium bodied. The malts put a thin coating on the stiff hops that glue to your mouth. Great beer although Id question it belonging in the standard lager category. Nice looking label! Another high quality offering from Brooklyn. Drink up.

I cannot believe I have never rated this!  Nice dark yellow, good sized white head.  Nice hoppy aroma.  Taste is excellent - well hopped over a light but malty base.  Floral.  A session go to beer when I find it on the LCBO shelves.
Bottle.  Smell is malt and hops.  more malts though.  Not a huge fan of this, but its pretty good.  Very good cold.  Very malty taste as well.

Amber pour with an off-white head. Malty aroma with some hoppiness coming out in the aroma. Flavor has some sweetness to it, nice malt . Crisp tasting, sweet aftertaste. It is what lager should be- Tasty!. Good at 45 -50 degrees. Crisy sweet malt aftertaste- a great flagship beer. Nice lacing.

Dam just noticed this brew expired a four months ago hope it still be good to drink. Body appears to be brown combined with burnt orange, a quarter inch cap was produced with excellent retention for a lager, very nice looking brew. Aroma is good but for a lager its not exactly fitting the profile but yummy smelling none the less. Lots of milder floral hops, tons of malt, and the typical grainy qualities found in lagers can be found in the delouses aroma. Very nice flavor the malts have a much darker taste and this a touch more bitter then what I was expecting, the hops are very noticeable and come across very flowery. The more I drink the more I can taste the malts and they seem to have a lemony taste in them. For a lager this dam good maybe a touch to much hops for the style but it works, the only real complaint I have about this brew is it is slightly watery but I shall let that slide because this is dam good.

This one caught me by surprise.  At a local bar I ordered it b/c I was in the mood for a lager and I had never had this one before.  Expecting something light with mild flavoring this was more like a Sierra Neveda Beer beer than a light lager, and I say that as a compliment.  It is definitely dry-hopped with an aroma you smell way before your nose gets to the glass.  For a lager it has a medium body and a clean crisp finish more like a pale ale.  Definitely a beer I will be drinking again.

Pours a lacing off-white head with and almost amber body.  Smells of citrus and spice hops along with some malt.  Flavor is a bit caramelized malt and some citrus hops.  Finish has a nice bitterness to it.
Amber pour, big head and lace. Bold and hoppy for a lager, with good carb and a sweetness pervading. Fair.
Bottle at Two Boots in Grand Central Station. The aroma is dry hops. The flavor is slightly bitter. The body was medium with a think texture and lively carbonation. The finish is mildly bitter.
12 oz bottle thanks to Dmac. Thanks Dave! Pours a bubbly frothy head. Aroma of sweetness and hops. Flavors are almost sour. Very nice.
Great looking amber color with a thick foam tan head. Floral aroma with sweet barley. Taste is apple, malt, and hop spice. Rich texture that is very balanced. Good lace, Good texture, Great beer.

(12oz. bottle)  Pours a golden body with a small off-white head.  Aroma of orange pulp, toasted grain, dustiness, and some florals.  Flavor of hops (grass, floral, earth) and toasted malt with a moderately bitter finish.
pours a clear amber with a thick off white head. Aroma of floral hops. Floral hops in the taste, a bit like apples in the middle with the hop bitter finish. Kind of dry on the palate. Not bad.
16oz can. An OK lager but nothing special. Being from Boston I actually prefer me a Sam Adams Boston Lager.
malty sweet smell, smells like an oil painting? its red with a medium head, taste is bready and nutty, and a little sour. decent palate.

Bottle, Rehills, Newcastle. Good hoppy nose, could detect grass and aniseed, with some creaminess. I also thought there was some pepperiness in there, which I tend to associate with Czech pilseners. Hint of caramel towards the end, and a touch smoky.

On tap at P.J. Clarkes.  Very difficult to differentiate from Sam Adams.  Pours amber in color with a frothy tan head that leaves plenty of lacing.  Smells and tastes mildly of hops, caramel, and faitn red apples.  Fair.

UPDATED: APR 28, 2009 Finally able to taste this beer!! I tried both their Brown and Black before thanks to a friend of mine but I can now try this one at home.I used the Brooklyn Pokal that I had. Beautiful amber color with a rich creamy head. The nose is all flowery hops. Very inviting. The palate reveals some hop flavors and some fruits - a bit of citrus - and finishes with a touch of spice. Well-rounded, you can taste the use of the malts to balance it all. Finishes on a little dry note. I do not remember when drinking a lager was such an enjoyable experience!!

355 mL bottle. Pours a beautiful copper gold with a creamy white head that sticks around, nice. Biting flowery hop nose, with a dry malt hint, nice. Flavourful malt with a meaty floral hop, with dashes of spice and fruit. Nice bitter finish. Like the first time I had a Creemore, this is a pleasant reminder that lagers can be a beautiful thing.

A nice tasting brew on draft at top hat bar pours a copper brownish color with off white head had a nice hoppy aroma floral and a simple flavor of fruits.  It had a slight bitterness and a little watery.  A good brew for 5.2% Id do this one again

UPDATED: APR 21, 2009 bottle: Reminds me a lot of JR Brickman Amber. It has that sharp almost apple taste.  Feels more like an IPA it is so bitter.  I wish this had more malts or sweetness to round out the finish.  Give me a Headstrong any day. However, this is a beer you can really settle into with some spicy food.  It will stand up against some serious flavour.

aroma of floral, clean hops with light cereal background. appearance is vibrant rust. flavor is of flowery hops, just bitter enough to dance on the tongue and end clean and dry, and quite quickly. a clean, refreshing beer that does more then the bare minimum that so many others are happy with, this is hopped as well as a pale ale, a bit of a departure for this style. yet, as crisp as it is, a slightly sticky note comes to light at the very end and the malt shines through.  what balance!

Talk about backlog. No rating even for the lager. This is one that got me started. I feel it has changed and for the worse. Used to have a nice creamy mouthfeel and nice caramel malts with a hop essence to balance it out. Used to be great.

Oh squiggly line, in my eye fluid. 
I see you there, lurking on the periphery of my vision.
But when I try to look at you, you scurry away.
Are you shy, squiggly line?
Why only when I ignore you, do you return to the centre of my eye?
Oh squiggly line, its alright, you are forgiven.
Bottle. Copper pour with a small off white head. Hoppy nose with elements of dirt, butter, and citrus. The flavor is hops up front and "goldfish" malts. Fizzy and watery.

12 oz. Pours translucent gold, small white head with pretty good lacing. Really nice aroma (slightly spicy, with lighter fruits (mostly apple) mixed in. Taste is dominated by an apple/pear juice kinda mixture- alcoholic apple juice? HELL YES. A good amount of complexity with this beer- and some hops at the end too. For 5.2%, this could be a session beer to reckon with!

Can.  Pours a slightly cloudy brownish amber with a two finger dense head and aromas that are an interesting mix of spices (coriander and pepper), apple juice, grass and pine needles.  Flavor is a decent mix of dusty grains, spices and apples.  This is pretty good for a lager in a can.
user_location: The Wet Side of a Dry Town, Pennsylvania, USA

text: Bottle. Pours translucent bubbly copper with a thin white head that quickly dissipates. Aroma is leafy english hops, apple and pear esters, honey-biscuit malt. Flavor is honey, pear, apple cider, biscuit, subtle maple wood and raisin character, undertones of caramel and chocolate, and a soft hop presence. Overall complexity is very subtle. Im tempted to say its like a pear cider with a bready aftertaste. Palate is light being a lager, there is a somewhat carbonated bite but overall very smooth. A very good lager.

Pours a golden amber with a creamy white head. Aroma is heavy hops, not what I was expecting from a Vienna. Flavor is akin to an IPA and certainly not what I wanted in a Vienna lager. Complex malt character is kind of ruined by the hop flavor. Incredible head retention and lacing! Some of the best Ive ever seen.
Bottle. Light amber with some red in it. Clear with a small head. Aroma; Lots of fruits with a small bitter ending.

UPDATED: APR 17, 2010 Appealing amber body color with small head. Roasted caramel malt with bitter herbal pine hops. Strong fruity aroma. Biscuit & wood notes. Medium-high carbonated. Bitter-herbal aftertaste. Very enjoyable refreshing beer.

Pours amber with a huge, foamy cream head.  Mild caramel and straw aromas but the piney hop bouquet really shines through here.  Nothing forward flavor-wise, even a bit weak. Just some hops and toast in the finish.  Could use some more body.  Very drinkable but nothing special.

Bottle. Deep amber with foamy white head that is long-lasting. Aroma is sweet malt, wholemeal biscuit, and very floral hops. The body is firm and has good quaffability too with a long-lasting flavor profile and lots of biscuity malt, yet is refreshing too. Remains mostly floral and reminiscent of Fuggles in its hop character. Balanced. A nice beer but tastes best when chilled.
If you have to drink a lager, drink this. It has the presence and malty complexity of an American Pale Ale and the hoppy bitterness too. Crisp, clean- great to chug but better to savor.

Bottle.  Pours clear red with a decent head.  The smell is faint, a little spicy and malty.  Tastes grassy, surprisingly because i didnt smell it at first.  Nice grain malt flavor.  Slight bitterness.  Very smooth.  Im defanatly going after seconds.

Draft at PC Pub  Pours a nice amber with a white head.  Has a good apperence.  Aroma is yeast and hops.  Taste is lightly hoppy and crisp.  Has a good moutjfeel and a decent finish.  A very refreshing beer.  I like this one very much, well done Brooklyn.

The beer is amber in color with nice foamy head.  Aroma is of bread with a touch of hops.  Hops hit you right away (almost IPA like) and linger for a while.  Sweet malt is muted compared to hops. Too hoppy for Vienna but great lager nevertheless.
I really enjoyed this.  Fresh hop nose on a golden brown colour.  Taste is long with hop and spice.  Fantastic beer, very happy that I bought a 6 pack instead of a single.

One of beers of choice when I lived in Manhattan. Never made it to the brewery though. Red body with exploding head. Slightly hoppy nose. Lots of hops in the taste. Spicy. Smooth, and a great session beer.

Glass of the month at Winking Lizard.  Clear red in color with a huge white head.  Not much going on in the nose; lager yeast and a bit of hop.  Flavor is outstanding for the style.  A nice hop and malt balance that is way more pronounced than most lagers.  Reminds me of a really well made ESB.  Was not at all excited to see that this was the glass of the month, but it far exceeded my expectations.  Kudos to Mr. Oliver and the Brooklyn folks for taking a humdrum style and turning into something interesting.
Light orange lager. Light aroma with hops. Dry over the palate but does not offend with the aftertaste. Interestingly smooth.
Not what I expected for a Vienna. Hops dominated the malt way too much for me to consider this a good Vienna.

When Im in NYC this is my go-to beer when selection is limited.  Amber in color, its more like a pale ale than a lager really, with a great floral hoppy aroma and flavor that you dont usually see in this style.  Smooth and crisp like a lager, however, with a sweet malty backbone.  Hell of a session beer.

Appears quite dark for a lager with a good sized and active head of a reasonably creamy foam.
Creamy hop aromas, mildly fruity and sweet.  Sweet in the mouth with some citrus fruits and honeyed malt then a lightly bittered finish. Very drinkable. A little bit fizzy for me but still excellent.
Very drinkable, which is aided by its very reasonable price. Interesting enough but not too much to think about when having a bit of a session.

Brooklyn lager is clear, deep gold in color and has a quickly dissipating head. Upon popping the cap, the smell of fresh hops rises up pleasantly. In the flavor department we have a floral character with hints of apples, grapes, and sweet malts. The hops and sweetness actually hit you simultaneously, but the hops take the high road over the roof and sides of your mouth while the sweet flavors go underneath. The final act leaves you with some lingering sweetness coupled with dry bitterness. A very well balanced lager - one of the best Ive had.

Bottled.  Poured lighter amber with a short off-white head that stood up nicely.  The aroma picked up sweet caramel and lighter fruity notes with pineapple and honey accents.. decent.  The flavor had caramel and honey sweetness surrounded by spicy and citrus bitterness.. tacky and muddled on the finish.  This really dried out toward the back of the palate, leaving a grainy impression.. didnt flow well.

On tap at Novare Res in Portland.
In a word, yum.  This is a crisp, cool lager thats got a handsome hop profile and a creamy smooth palate.  Very nice beer!

A   good  session lager.Still brewed to the pre-Prohibition recipe, thats cool to know. If you get a FRESH bottle, this has some of an ale like vibe. Caramel malt,floral ,resiny hops .So eazy to sink.!
pretty hoppy for a lager.....dry, flowery with a faint malty aftertaste. A very solid lager.

Nice amber color with light medium head.

aroma was slightly of citrus?

Good flavor/palate with a med/slight dry hop finish.

Solid beer
This is one of my favorite beers on tap. Golden color with a nice head. Aroma is hoppy with light citrus undertones. This is a very crisp beer with a good balance. I can drink this all night.
A bit darker than I expected. Amber in color.  Clean hoppy aroma.  Foamy off white head with a piney bitter aftertaste.  Overall, a nice effort.  Im glad I finally can get this in TX.

UPDATED: JUL 31, 2009 355 ml bottle. Finland.
Clear amber colour with small off-white head. Floral and fruity hoppy aroma. Right amount of hoppiness, no overdose. Same goes with the flavour. Refreshing hoppiness. This is absolutely one of my favourites. Excellent. Could drink this everyday.
Look is a golden yellow color with an average white head.  Smell is malts, flowers, nice hop character for a lager type beer.  Clear and crisp finish.  Refreshing and plesant for the style.

(Draught at Akkurat, Stockholm, 2 Jan 2009) Copper colour with frothy, white head. Malty, fruity nose with notes of citrus, grapefruit, caramel, toasty grain and fresh and floral hop aromas. Malty, fruity taste with citrus, grapefruit, apricots, dry grainy malt, slightly toasted. Fresh, floral hops in the finish. Really good balance in this excellent lager. On the thin side though, finish could be a bit longer. Still very nice beer.

330 mL. Pours a light amber with a terrific beige head that sticks around completely leaving awesome lacing. Aroma of floral hops, lemon zest, and pale malt. Taste is bubbly with pale malt and floral hops. This is more like a pale ale than lager. Excellent! One of the best lagers I have ever tried.
Bottle/draft.  Good broadly availiable lager in NYC area.  Pours amber with a little head.  Has a nice hop flavor.  Good bar beer and very drinkable.
12 oz bottle.  Decent for a lager.  Not too much corn flavor.  Citrusy lemon on the aromas and flavors.  Crisp and refreshing.  Not to shabby

bottle.  a really nice lager from Brooklyn Brewery... one of the best lagers I have had to date.  pours a deep golden with a bit of white head.  nice flowery hop aroma.  very lively on the tip and top of the tongue with carbonation, hops and some malt.  a very nice mix of hops and malts.  medium body which finishes with a good bitter crispness.

Gout de carton, tres seche. Manque de houblon.

Cardboard taste, very dry, lack of hops...

Draft at Hungry Brain in Chicago. I just thought this could be good, but all I could smell were cheetos and all I could taste was sour cream and onion Ruffles. Not good. It looks okay, though, pouring a nice gold color with almost no head. But I just couldnt get past the cheese. Bad.

330ml bottle from the LCBO
The aroma is malty and sweet 
Pours a nice orangy cooper with a big white long lasting head and lots of lacing
The taste is more like an IPA than a lager very clean crisp and refreshing
One of the best lagers I have had will be getting more

Bottle from The Ducie, Manchester.  Reddish-brown in colour with slightly off-white head.  Citrus hop aroma with biscuit malts.  Very floral taste with spicy characteristics and a bitter finish.  Perhaps a bit too lively carbonation.  In looks and character this is a close cousin to a flavoursome English bitter.  Reading other reviews it would seem this is a different colour the world over.  Odd, eh?
Draft in Florida. Toasted lemon-honey malts. yum. Touch watery but with good weight. Very tasty but not very large or unusual.

Clear medium yellow body that is slightly fizzy. Light, pleasurable taste with a slight hop finish. Very drinkable, but not very intense. This is a great drinking beer, but has very little to offer in terms of breadth of palate or intensity of flavor.
a well rounded lager. not something i could drink all the time, but a unique flavor.

Reviewed 11/30/2008 (Tap @ Flying Saurcer, Houston, TX): Pours an amber brownish body with a small creamy white head. Has a sweet aroma, fruit.  Some hops in the nose. Grapefruity taste, sweet strawberry aftertaste. Malty.  Watery palate. Has a soft mouthfeel. Hoppy taste.  But too malty for my taste.

Sampled at Big Pour Mesa, AZ.  14 karat color with a touch of orange at its core.  Very tiny eggshell head that left minimal lacing.  Fairly sweet aroma although there is definitely a hop presence...can smell freshly cut fairways.  Flavor is also hop forward for the style.  Refreshing and enjoyable.

On tap at Big Pour Mesa.  Pours a light amber with a small beige head.  Nose is grassy hops and malt.  Taste is sweet malts mainly with some decent hops in the finish.  Lighter mouth feel.  Decent  hoppy for a lager.

UPDATED: DEC 6, 2008 Bottle from Systembolaget
Amber and slightly hazy leaves some lacing.

A anekdot from last week when I had it in a night club:
My colleagues comments were that the beer that I´d orderd smelled, and tasted like perfume, my explenation that it is american citrusy hopps was´nt bought...

However, this is a good beer that leaves a veile even when served in the bottle.
Pours a dark gold/light brown colour. Malty and hoppy flavour aroma with hints of some caramel and nuts. Medium almost full-bodied beer. Excellent

Wonderful light brown color. Aroma is of smoked malt and German hops. Light mouth-feel with some of the light graininess that youd expect from a Vienna lager.  Finish is crisp but mellow. Excellent. One of my favorite versions of this style. Once again impressed by Brooklyn.

Tasting at Brewtopia.  I will say that for a Lager style beer this is pretty decent.  Amber pour.  Whitish head.  Aroma is malty and hoppy both.  I get some sweet floral hops, some caramel and toffee malt.  Flavor lends itself to a good balance between hops and malt without having that normal nasty lager flavor that so many beer get stuck with.  Pretty refreshing and tasty.

Mild sweet aroma.  Clear medium yellow body that is slightly fizzy.  Light, pleasurable taste with a slight hop finish.  Very drinkable, but not very intense.  This is a great drinking beer, but has very little to offer in terms of breadth of palate or intensity of flavor.

Dark amber beer with an off white head. Sweet caramel, floral 
aroma. Good hop flavour, nicely bitter with a light syrupy sweetness to 
balance it out. Quite full bodied for a lager, but good nonetheless. Great beer, much 
better than expected

(12 oz bottle consumed Nov. 5, 2008- served in shaker) Poured transparent dark amber, low carbonation, half finger white head that tried to lace.  Aroma of vinyl, hard water, and old wheat- YUMMY!  Hits the mouth with a medium body, malt feel is ok, nice feel in the middle, hops on the backend and finish.  Refreshing- the prototypical microbrew- which in this case is a good thing!
deep golden couler with a good white head. Clean and crisp but also flavorful. good malt-hop balance. Its good to see a well made vienna.
Cloudy amber with a small off-white head. Malty and hoppy notes. Caramel, malt and bitterness. Mefium body with a bitter aftertaste.
Very nice blend of malt and hops. Not too sweet, bland or overcarbonated like alot of lagers. I can drink this often. Excellent lager.

Tap at Draught HousePours a weak, uninspired amber with a leafy strawberry mixed in water odor.  Flavor is autumn leaf and malty sweet nut.  Average mouthfeel.  More like a Bronx Cheer than a Brooklyn beer.
user_location: Ugly, Hot, and Humid Spring, Texas, USA

text: Bottle @ Michelle and Rob’s wedding:  This beer pours a golden amber color with a nice head.  The aroma was a little maltier and hoppier than most lagers.  The flavor was smooth and well balanced.  Hints of hops, caramel malts, and not very complex.  An excellent beer, one I may have thought otherwise before trying.

Pours a dark golden amber and looks like a bock. Excellent carbonation. Pours with a lot of head but wettles down to 1/4 inch in a short while. Aroma is malty, pure and clean. Clavor is malty with a littlw spice, some mild sweetness and a good hop presence. This beer is damn good for a lager. The finish is full. Body is medium. Light lacing. Notes of clean crystal malt and slight bitterness on the finish.

Bottle. Pours a clear orange golden color with a medium frothy white head that diminishes quickly. The aroma is wheat, caramel and bread. Good sticky lacing on the glass. The taste is first a light hop with a crisp malt finish.  A great session beer, glad it finally made it down to texas.

Pours a medium amber with a small, short-lasting head that dissipates to a nice lacing.  Aroma is balanced between yeast, malts and hops, but is very mild overall.  Taste is fairly hoppy for the style with some hints of the malt character behind it.  Mouthfeel is still on the watery side, but it doesn’t detract from the overall experience.  Another excellent, drinkable offering from the Brooklyn Brewery.

UPDATED: APR 14, 2012 Very light aroma with hops and malt. The taste is OK with a touch of caramel and some strange metallic extraneous flavour. 120414: Re-rated from draft. Very pleasant. Hoppy, thirstquenching lager,

Pours a clearish golden amber color with a short lived whitish head.  Smell is fruity, mildly hoppy and some subtle yeast.  Taste is crisp and lightly hoppy up front with some yeasty flavor and malt behind that.  Some light lingering hop fruitiness and bitterness making it very crisp and drinkable.  More like a pale ale than the lagers I’m used to drinking and this was surprisingly good.  Nice session beer with flavor.

Pours a completely transparent amber brown, beautiful carbonation, and a thick frothy head. Very yeasty aroma, maybe some toasted wheat, chestnuts, and caramel. Full body and well balanced flavor. Starts with a nice malty-ness, follows is some caramel, a tiny bit of hops and a crisp clean finish. This beer has great body, great flavor (though not very complex), great balance, and I enjoy it very much. Fantastic.
Pours deep amber into a shaker.  Bright white micro head with excellent retention leaves spot lacing as it slowly recedes. Fruity orange aromas. Soft with upfront caramel and a lasting citrus finish.
UPDATED: AUG 5, 2010 En hooters nyc Bien mericida despues de casi 10 horas de estar viajando. Hoppy con sabor bien
bottle, dark garnet amber, light 1/2 " head, nose is very fruity and hop, flavor is malt cookie and bitter, different lager

Fluffy to rocky, largish off-white head. Light, clear maple colored body. Decent retention, Good lacing. Aroma of floral hops like a light pale ale, light caramel and bread. Taste is a bit of cardboard, light hops, and a bit watery. Lightly fizzy

Pours a orange golden color with a medium sized puffy off white head. Nose is caramel, sweat, and toast. Taste is crisp and refreshing with notes of citrus and summer fruit. Some corn on the back end. Not bad, highly quaffable.

UPDATED: SEP 28, 2008 This lager pours a very nice deep golden color with a nice head. Nice mellow nose of bread and just a hint of hops. Taste is light crisp easy drinking with a slight fruity taste. Not a bad lager, and will definitely hip other folks to it!
bottle thanks to dyetube.  deep amber pour with a thin cream head.  rich malt scent with some slight hops in the background.  rich malts with a slight caramel finish, not too shabby of a brew.
Pours light amber with dense white head.  Caramel aroma with slight floral hop aroma.  Hops right up front, dry with slight malt finish.  A bit thin on the tongue.

Bottle from Kegs & Barrels in McKinney, TX. Pours a very nice looking clear amber with thick off-white head. Has a nice malty floral aroma. Flavor is malty, hop flavor, with nice hop bitter. Mouthfeel is light-medium body, high carbonation. Over all, pretty good beer.
This had a very hoppy scent especially for a lager. It was probably the hoppiest lager that I have had. Very different which is what I liked about it.
Aroma is hoppy and floral.  Color is a nice copper.  Flavor follows up on the hop aroma and is balanced by a maltiness.  A fine lager except I’m not sure what category this belongs in.

Had this in ’06 on tap in times square for the first time and loved it. Trying in now two and a half years later from a bottle and it’s mediocre. It’s amazing what time spent in the upper eschelon of craft beer can do to your old ’favorites’.  In this beer’s defence, I think it was a great ’gateway beer’ to explore what else is out there. If you’re just getting into ’craft’ and don’t have a taste for much yet, this is the beer for you. I thought it was wonderfully hopped for a lager, and I credit this beer with opening my tastes to the IPA style (which is now my preference). Give it a try and see where you go.

From bottle.  Part of Dayton Beer Tasting July Event.  Paired with Garlic Shrimp Skewers.  Poured clear golden with a small off-white head.  Floral and light yeasty notes on the nose  Easy drinking with just a slight hint of sweetness.

Creamy non persistent head with a wonderful polished teak colour.  A subtle yet persistent toasted chestnut flavour.  I am astounded at how good this is.  You see,living proof lager doesn’t have to taste like a urine sample, now does it guys!

pours a big off white creamy head amber colour, looks very appetizing. Aroma is very floral and fruity with notes of malt and hops. It has a medium body with distinct biterness and a quality that i can’t clearly describe, but I love it! mouthfeel is rather sparkly, but it goes together perfectly with the flavour. If I had to choose a beer to drink for the rest of my life this would be it!

12 oz bottle.  Pours clear deep amber/gold with a small off white head.  Nose of floral hops, malts and perhaps a hint of wheat.  Taste of malts with some nice hoppiness coming on towards the somewhat bitter finish.  Medium body.  Overall pretty impressive.

This one had the predominantly malty biscuit aroma of a Vienna, and a slightly off-white head.  The liquid pours with the dark copper color. The taste was extra sweet even for a Vienna, and was balanced nicely though with floral hops.  A good session brew.
user_location: Lake in the Hills, Illinois, USA

text: UPDATED: SEP 7, 2008 i had this beer while visiting a friend in north jersey while i was already drunk.  the palate was skunky, the flavor eeehhh, the appearance good, the aroma eeeh, and thats it...

12 oz. bottle.  Pours a copper/amber color with a light white head.  Floral aroma and hints of citrus and caramel.  Surprisingly more hoppy than I expected but nicely balanced b/w the malts and hops.  Light bodied.  Finishes bitter.  Pretty good.
Bottled to pilsner glass - red color, citrus & malt aroma with malt.  Starts off slow, but has a good bitterness in end.

Can courtesy of SantaTy5592

Pours a golden color with a little haziness in it and a giant foamy off white head. Aroma is citrus, bread, hops, caramel. This brew is light, hoppy, citrusy, malt, bitter yet easy drinking. Much better than expected.

12 oz bottle poured into a lager glass.  Poured a clear gold with a huge sparse white head.  Aroma was piney hops and some malt.  Flavor is hoppy with a good malt balance.  Medium bodied with average carbonation.
Pour was golden with a white head.  Citrus aroma and flavor.  Some carbonation came through, I was not impressed by this at all.  Found the beer to be little better than most macro brews.

Bottle from Vintage Cellar. Medium dark amber color with a large frothy beige head. Aromas of malt and lightly spicey hop. Near medium body with near creamy carbonation. Flavor is light caramel, and a touch of citrus sour - which might be the hop. It doesn’t finish all that bitter, but it is well balanced. It’s a very tasty drink.

Pours light copper with frothy, here and then gone, just off white head.  Smells like whole grains in the husk and taste very much like milled grains with a sugary tinge, reminds me of horse feed .  Very raw flavors give way to a pleasing and full mouthfeel for the style.  Lingering foul, stale aftertaste takes this rating down a bit.  Pretty good though.
On tap.  Pours a brown/orange, small head.  Lots of piney hops, sweet malt.  This is a very smooth drinking beer and one of the best lighter lagers that I’ve had.

Pours a clear burnt orange, with a rocky tan head.  Aroma smells stronger of hops than most lagers, and the flavor matches it.  This beer has much more going for it than I thought.  The crisp malt on the back end of this is about all I can pick out that I would qualify as a lager.  The flavor is rich and hoppy.  The presence of the hops almost push this into more of a pale ale flavor profile.

Bottled import. Pours red-amber with a big but short-lived head. The nose is malt with hints of fruit candy; then as it loses its chill, a floral scent emerges. Full bodied for a lager, with a very nice balance of malt and bitter, and a crisp aromatic and bitter aftertaste.

12oz.  Wow, what a surprise!  Pours amber red with a white head that disappears pretty quickly.  Nose is sweet malt, red hots (cinnamon candy), and a bit of fig.  Body is much more straight forward with some significant body for a lager... mostly bread-like yeasts, I have to say I am not a huge fan of the finish.  A bit thin up front, but overall I am very impressed.
Wow, this really smells quite nice. A little fruity, hoppy. This is pretty tasty.Much hoppier than most lagers.  A good crisp bite.
Bottle, supermarket.  Enjoyable crisp lager.  Good thirst finisher.  A good goldy colour.  Nice.

This is a lager?  Tastes more like an ale, but that’s what I love about it.  The lager yeast come through in the finish, nice clean and crisp, while the upfront taste bursts with flavor.  Malt dominates here but that’s not to say hops aren’t present, they are definitetly there but I feel the malts need to be stronger for the finish to be balanced.  A very quaffable beer! Garret Oliver knows his way around a beer and a complimentary dish, and with this is beer, he did very well.  At least for my palate.

UPDATED: AUG 3, 2008 Having gotten home from working both my jobs today, I decided what better way to relax then through quaffing my Brooklyn Lager. I also rather enjoy a crisp lager with my sushi if I cant have sake.

Poured a clean golden yellow from 12 oz bottle into my lager glass, leaving a good layer of foam on the top which still lingers, though clinging more to the sides of the glass. As I go to enjoy this liquid bliss, lemon and hop bitterness wafts through my nose. I dont feel much of a malt presence, though the hops are crisp yet mild enough to be smooth, not front and center like with an IPA. I taste a wee bit of malt, but overall lemon zest and hop crispness and spice play across my tongue. theres a hint of something else...maybe cinnamon apples...maybe from the malt... the overall profile for this very drinkable lager though is one of lemony zest and crisp hop flavor that tingles across the top of your tongue as it heads to the back of your throat.
