Overall, a very satisfying lager. Id have no problem reaching for a glass of Brooklyn Lager in a bar somewhere.

(Bottle).  Very interesting lager.  Aroma is clean orange peel.  Beautiful dark copper color.  Respectable off white head.  Flavor is crisp, relatively mild, with bitterness in the finish.  Easy to drink, easy to like.
Dark copper colour with a medium lasting white head. Lots of hops in the nose. The flavour is hops with notes of grapefruit and malt. Long bitter aftertaste. Medium carbonation. Quite good.

Deep copper color......very fluffy head.  Fragrant hop aroma.  Malt sweetness up front, extremely well balanced by a noticeable hop flavor......slightly crisp mouthfeel.  Taste of hops continues in the back, with a long, slightly bitter finish.  Probably the best lager I have ever tasted.

Bottle BB 7/08 into tulip. Wow!! Best lager Ive ever tasted - hands down. Had just about written off lagers personally, but finally getting around to trying this jewel has my faith restored.  Ive been saved! NO typical lager nastiness. Handsome, deep, clear amber pour, with accompanying white foam. Some light lacing on the glass. Couldnt really detect any particular aroma, rather I experienced a bright, fresh, clean aura, for which I reward it points. The flavor is delectable, with a clean, crisp malt character that lingers ever so pleasantly on the tongue. The delicate, floral hops just radiate and meld beautifiully with the malt to create a sublimely integrated balance. The malt and the hops are equally apparent, assertive, distinct, and enjoyable. Stunning and gripping dry finish, not unlike a good Cabernet. And all this from a bottle that is supposedly past its prime. And Im impressed!  Im waxing. I salute your flagship, Mr. Oliver!

Bottle. Not the standard Pilsener style lager. Pours with a darker color than expected, essentially amber. Very malty and not so much spicy hops in there, in style indeed closer to an amber ale than anything else. Nonetheless it is a well balanced beer with a fairly robust body.

Bottle drink by Sept 08. Clear copper/amber, white head. Very flavorful lager, but like most Vienna lagers. Sweet malts are overwhelmed by hops. Floral and aromatic, but ultimately, citrusy and bitter. Cascade are used and come through (this isn’t too far off from an APA or Amber ale). Lots of bite and some pilsner-like scratchiness going down.

...this beer is really trying to be something its not...an amber ale.  While pre-prohibition lagers were typically more malty and bit more hopped, they  werent supplemented with crystal (or any other type of caramel) malt, as this beer is.  Pre-prohibition lagers were made with what was available at the time, which were, more often than not, things like 6-Row Pale malt, wheat, corn, etc. ... not english or german style malted grains...those came later.  The ingredients in this brew smack of American amber ale...(sans the lager yeast)...not any style of lager.  While this brew is certainly better than a Sam Adams lager offering, its really no better than any good homebrew... and it isnt a pre-prohibition lager.
better than sam adams, but not by much. still a middling just ok lager. defintiely more complex than sam adams, but thats not really saying much. eh, a middle of the road lager.
This is what a lager should taste like. Take note big guys. Lots of flavor and no corn.

Had in SoHo, on draft.   Very similair to Sam’s boston lager imo.  But all together a bit bolder..  heavy hop and spice presence, medium bodied.  Looked great being poured.  Overall, above expectations.

UPDATED: JUL 18, 2008 From... a can!  Nice new way to enjoy this beer.  Had this many times before but finally ranking after an afternoon on the lake and these suckers straight from the can.  Medium dark amber pour with off-white head.  Much more malt and flowery hops than expected from a beer labeled a lager.  I always taste celery seeds when I drink this beer, which is a bit odd, I suppose.  Heavier on the palate than a lager as well.  Great session beer.  Feels a little sticky sometimes.  Really enjoyed this beer ever since having multiple pints at the Fat Black Pussy Cat many years ago in Greenwich Village...
From bottle... poured dark orange. Aroma was citrusy, but also slightly nutty. Packed with flavor -- bright and hoppy. Slightly dry finish. I loved this one, and I’ll definitely get it again.

12oz bottle.  Pours deep amber, thick light tan head.  Aroma is rich and full of malted barley and sweet floral hops.  One of the best smelling beers from the east coast I’ve opened in a good while...    Flavor is very light.  Hints of toasted malts,  honey, cardboard, and some leather and hay.  Earthy finish.  Medium bodied.
Bottle:  Nice light brown color with a semi off white head.  Large scents of hops.  Very surprising on the first taste.  Very smooth and not bitter.
bottle. pours clear copper with creamy white head. aroma is doughy, sweet bread. flavor is sweet bread slightly toasted, above average amounts of floral hop notes. nice example of a vienna.
Good solid lager. Could drink quite  a few of these. Lots of flavor. Would like to try on draught sometime.

Had this during Armin Van Buuren’s set in McCarren park. Amber pour, not much head. Hoppy aroma, hoppy taste, smooth, a bit toasty. Lots of hops, they work well with the beer. Strong malt also. Quality brew, it will surprise you.

bottle at home from Alko
Color:pale amber nice head
Scent:strong hops
Taste:nice piney hops and sweet maltiness almost like IPA.
Bottled.  Clear amber color with a nice white head.  Clean dry taste.  Very good

Bottle purchased at Sams Wine and Spirits, in Chicago. Pours a clear, pale copper with a dense, creamy, off-white head that leaves behind sticky lace. The nose is of muted toasted malt and a nice compliment of floral hops. Light-bodied without feeling thin, the mouthfeel is soft and clean with a subtle hop bitterness at the finish. The flavor follows the nose: sweet, toasted caramel malt up front backed by an excellent balance of floral hops. This is an exceptionally quaffable and flavor brew. I could easily run through a sixer of this watching a ballgame. Unfortunately, I cant get it here in KC.

BOTMC Selection: Poured from the bottle into a double-walled pint glass.  Pour produced a golden amber body with a pale yellow head of foam which mostly diminished with moderate lacing.  Aroma is well-balanced, with a fair amount of hops, providing a floral scent.  Dry, bitter taste,with some malting, and a clean bitter aftertaste.  Not overly complex, though full-flavored.

Bottle. 12 fl. oz. Clear amber color with fine, white head and nice lacing.  Blended aroma of sweet malt and citrus.  Thin body with a dry finish. Flavor mirrors the aroma but with a healthy amount of bitterness going down.  Clean, crisp, highly drinkable.

Bottle from Whole Foods in Charlottesville. Brown pour with a medium head. Decent retention, moderate lacing. A much hoppier aroma than expected for a lager. Some sweet notes in the aroma also. Hops are large in the taste also, along with a vegetal, metallic and slightly salty unpleasant flavor. Interesting stuff.

12oz bottle (variety pack) from Bayville Package Store, Fenwick Island, DE...pours amber in color, frothy white head (cold pint glass right out of the freezer)...mild but sweet malty aroma with a hint of citrus...mildly bitter flavor, some hops, malt...decent lacing...little bit of a thin mouthfeel, went down fast...easy drinking good tasting lager.

Bottle:  Poured deep copper to amber in color.  the nose showed off citrus, caramel and had a nice spiciness.  The palate was sweet (caramel) but also had a balancing bitterness with some noticable citrus.  Soft, plush and medium-bodied.

Sparkling amber, small fizzy head. Herbal and biscuit malty nose. Flavor is slightly buttery caramel malts, herbal hops. A bit watery but smooth palate. Nicely hopped, crisp lager, not that far from a (really) poor IPA even.

UPDATED: JUN 27, 2008 Appearance: Dark amber, almost no head.
Aroma: Quite malty, can smell the hops. Sweet.
Taste: A bit boring. Malty aftertaste.
Info: 355ml bottle, 13/8-2005, 1/300
bottle in a variety pack.  more hops than Im used to for an ale. hazy color with small head. pretty decent

UPDATED: JUN 25, 2008 Copper murk with tan/white head. Nice malty taste. A good blend of sour and bitter. Nice hops bite in the finish. Full flavored yet very drinkable. Tastes a bit like southern iced tea.

33 cl bottle, Mulmur, ON. Slightly hazy golden/light amber. Pronounced hop aroma, nice sharp hop bite. Lighter body than hoped for, brief bitter finish. Drinkable and balanced but Id go with a Three Floyds variety over this.

Bottle from a Brooklyn mix pack. Pours a nice amber, pretty solid white head. Aroma is great: toffee, caramel, with hints of bitter hops. Taste is dry with bits of caramel, toffee and a bitter hop finish. This is better than Great Lakes Eliot Ness.

Bottle; poured a n orange-amber with a medium white head; somewhat creamy.  Aroma was great for the style, dominated by flowers and oranges; earthy.  Found it to be pretty carbonated.  Dry and bitter for the style finish.  Toffee and caramel makeup the initial thrust of the beer, then some sweetness and it finishes with grassy and flowery hops.  Definitely above average for the style.  Surprised it took me so long to try this.
Ill be damned.  A non-skunked lager.  I didnt know it was possible.  Better than Sam Adams Bahston Lagah.  Delicious brew.  Im diggin it.

Pours nice copper color, with small beige head. Aroma is malty. Flavor has nice balance of the malts and a very nice dry bitter finish of grass and floral hops. Palate is somewhat sticky and leaves a nice lacing behind.
Pours brown with a thin head. Aroma is very malty. Flavor is malty, with some sweetness in the end. Not too heavy, not too watery, one of the better lagers out there.

33 cl bottle - amber colored beer with a small head. Fruity aroma combined with hints of malt. Flavor not as impressing though, bitterness seems kind of, well wrongly placed. Dont really agree to the choice of hops for the beers flavor here. An interesting beer though.

A blast of herbal / menthol hops greets my nose as I pop the tab on this can.  The pour from the can produces a one-finger thick, lightish tan colored head.  The beer sits in my large Tripel Karmeliet tulip with a murky amber appearance, that takes on an orangish hue when held up to the light but remains deeply hazy.  I shouldnt have poured the entire contents of the can as the initial portions of the pour were quite clear.  The aroma is quite hoppy; it definitely has an herbal hop focus, but there is just a hint of citrus zest here as well.  Grassy grain notes become noticeable as do notes of crushed malt and soda crackers.  The herbal hop component is a mix of light menthol, clean hemp oil and a fresh cut herbal note.

This has a solid bitterness to it that only becomes more biting through the finish of each sip.  Grassy grain and herbal, almost grassy hop notes intertwine.  A touch of malt sweetness comes through in the middle and finish, but doesnt really intrude on the hop focus of this beer.  Herbal hop notes that are a mix of notes, none of which stand out nearly as much as the overall herbal presence; touches of rosemary, menthol, green hay, wild flowers and a finish of grapefruit zest.  Easily quaffable, but not watery; this has a certain presence / heft from the malt, but is still quite drinkable.

This has a huge hop profile for a traditional Vienna (which of course this is not trying to be), and it is quite a nice addition, the fact that this is dry hopped comes through quite nicely with the vibrancy of the herbal / spicy hop character.  This is a really nice beer, a perfect accompaniment to the 106°F / 41°C heat we have here today.

Beautiful orange beer with quite large beige head. Very fresh and pleasant aroma: fruits and light flowerness. Flavour is first fresh and fruitfull and it changes bitter and slightly dusty later but it does not bother to enjoy this beer. Quite light to drink with medium carbonation. American hops fits greatly also in to lager. There should be much more lagers like this in the market.
Solid malt taste, good aftertaste with some caramel. Good solid feel to the this one. Liked it would buy again
user_location: The World of Beer, Texas, USA

text:
Date: 06/08/2008
Mode: Bottle
Source: Trade

Appearance: clear amber, fine beige head, scattered lace, 
Aroma: sweet malt aroma with touch of breadyness made sweet by light caramel and balanced with light floral hops, 
Flavor: dry malt flavor, caramel malt is kept dry by floral and earthy hops, building bitterness, long biter finish, 

Aroma: 5/10; Appearance: 6/10; Flavor: 5/10; Palate: 6/10; Overall: 10/20
Rating: 2.6/5.0Drinkability: 6/10
Score: *4

12oz bottle served in a lager glass. Pours copper with a one finger off-white head. Smells of caramel, biscuit, and grassy hops. Taste is caramel and dough. Finishes clean, lightly bitter, with some metallic element. It left some pretty incredible lace all the way down the sides of the glass, nice enough to rival some of the best Belgians. Pretty good session lager for the warmer months.

pours brilliant copper color with medium white head.  aroma is overwhelmingly hoppy, especially for style.  very nice floral hop flavor with a farily complex malt backbone.  drinks almost more like a light ipa than a lager....really yummy beer.
12oz bottle.  gold color with a small white head.  light hops floral whiskey aroma.  hop taste with hints of malt and caramel.  K-6.5

UPDATED: AUG 26, 2009 Bottle.  Pours a amber gold body with a thin top.  Aroma is pale malt, subtle fruits, and a moderate hop bittering aspect.  Drinks pretty easy, with a strong hop kick to finish this one.

Bottle.  Pours an amber color with thin head.  Aroma is not very strong, but is pleasant with slight citrus aroma.  Equally malty and hoppy and easy to drink with a slight toastiness.  Very good beer and something that I could drink everyday.

Tap at Rustico.  Clear, dull orange; thin rimmed white foam.  Sweet, herbal aroma; floral honey, grass and leaves, orange, cinnamon; even keeled malt and hop presence, refreshing and sweet.  Fairly basic crisp malt flavor; light iced tea, biscuit, cinnamon, honey; crisp cereals and earthy noble earthiness.  Bitterness is citrusy; malt bill full and rich.  Medium palate; moderately carbonated, fresh and forward.  Satiating and charming, warm, refreshing example; spot on.

Draft @ Rustico.  Pours a clear, deep golden-amber color; very light tan head with good retention and fine-bubbled lacing, coating the glass; a gorgeous pour.  Solid amounts of tea, toasted malts, and earthiness / red fruits in the aroma; crisp, toasty, tasty nose.  Medium mouthfeel: toasty malts, red fruits, and some soft brown sugar upfront; solid levels of carbonation; chewy, toasted malts and crackers and earthy hop bitterness; very drinkable.  Medium finish: bread, earthy bitterness, and crisp crackers; some slight fruit.
I am so glad that Brooklyn Lager is available again here in the Chicago Area.  A great lager.  If you have not checked it out, check it out now.

12 oz. New penny-colored and clear with a large lasting meringue of head. Earthy spiced caramel, crisp apple, slight molasses, grain, and a squeeze of lemon in the aroma. Flavors are the same and damn good; tastes more like a good ESB than a lager. Light-medium body is mostly smooth and dry on the finish.

Wow.  Every so often the brewers self description is surprisingly off. This is a lager, true, but its amber color and malty character distinguish it as a Vienna and an excellent example at that!
Very tasty beer.
nice fresh dark beer flavours of fruit and citrus. very nice bitterness and hop flavour

Bottle BB feb 09. Big carbonation, almost gushing, Fresh citrus reminding of egg whites, sugar and lemon.. Pineapple, vanilla, apricots, papaya, mango and spicy hops. Medium body, grapy but soft. Clean and creamy. Some roasted malts. Dissapointingly short aftertaste.
A nice clear amber color with a sweet aroma of fruit and hops. A nice, clean drink with nothing too crazy on the palate. Very refreshing.
Bottle, from Whole Foods, Greenville, SC.   Really nice looking beer.  Amber color, nice nose of spices and hops.  Nice floral hops and a peppery finish.  Highly drinkable and very enjoyable.
Quite interesting lager. Floral and citrus notes in both flavor and aroma. Berries and slightly spices also. Lots of common with same brewerys EIPA in hop sector.

Its gonna be a photo finish, folks, as there are just days till we fly right past the "BEST BEFORE" date of June 08 notched onto the front label.

Appearance: Pours a clear, amber body supporting a hefty crest of whiteish foam.

Smell: Delicate toasty maltiness with a pleasant spicy, floral hop scent.

Taste: Crisp, toasty malt flavor with a restrained sweetness thats quickly scrubbed away by a spicy, floral hoppiness and medium bitterness. Finishes with a lingering spiciness and some sweetish grain hints.

Mouthfeel: Medium-bodied. Soft, medium level of carbonation.

Drinkability: A fine, tasty lager from Brooklyn. If only every trip to Lagertown could be as satisfying.

Awesome brew, Had this at a beer tasting and really enjoyed it. Pours a deep but clear amber colour- fairly large head. Well balanced, nice touch of citrus fruit as well as hint of caramel. creamy texture with a long smooth hop finish.

Bottle poured a clear amber with a lingering ring of ivory foam. Aromas of carmel and citrus. Palate was light to medium bodied and smooth. Flavors of carmel and light citrus with a smooth moderatly bitter finish.

Bottle sample at a beer festival in kibbutz Maabarot, May 08. Deep golden with a small white head.  Aroma of slightly floral hops. Flavor starts sweetish with some malt, caramel and bready notes, and and finishes bitter and hoppy, a bit sharp. Medium-bodied. Rather nice.
Beer poured a golden amber with thick white head. Aromas of hops, flowers. Tastes like caramel malt and hops. Touch of bread dough. Best lager beer I have ever had.

On tap at the Field House in Phila. Dark but clear mahogany color with firm head, nice looking beer. Mild malty aroma, a hint of hops. The flavor was doughy and caramel malts without being too sweet. The malts were well balanced with earthy and bitter hops, but not overpowering. Medium body, well balanced flavors, and a dry finish made this a very drinkable and enjoyable quaff. I hope it is as good from the bottle as I plan on buying a case. Well done lager.
UPDATED: JUN 14, 2008 Bottle. Aroma is a bit bitter with some fruity notes. Pretty dark amber color. Taste is fruity with a bitter finish,cheap and good lager. Very drinkable.

Guy at Jaspers in Nashua recommended this as complementary to Sam Adams Lager. Doesnt quite measure. A little hoppier than I like, and seemed fizzy to me. I am not a Vienna aficionado, so take with grain of salt. But in my humble opinion, its a rare case of the mainstream Sam actually being better than the micro.
UPDATED: MAY 8, 2008 12 fl oz. hoppy with hints of caramel. pours a clear amber with a white frothy head. pale larger. i think i detected hints of chocolate

A dark amber colored lager with large bubbles and a medium beige frothy head.  Great nose! Bready, some caramel malt, and hoppy aroma.  O... its a vienna that makes more sense =p.  Toasty, slightly burned, caramel malt flavor with a modest hop bit.  Very sweet and bitter.  Doesnt come close to Eliot Ness in terms of character or balance.  The malt is almost syrupy.  Tastes like an English lager more than a Vienna.

Amber pour with nice off white head, slight lacing. Bready nose with some floral/herbal/grassy hop shining through. Flavor is big on the noble hops, mild citrus, bread crust on the finish. Smooth medium body. Very drinkable and much better than their ales.

On tap at Laguardia International terminal before going to Paris with Rebecca. Brooklyn Lager is a very nice amber color with a light-orange head.  The aroma is full of hops with a nicely tinted caramel background. The flavor is very well balanced with hops and  sweet malt. This is a very nice beer.
One of the best lagers on the market. Good malty taste. Not too smooth but not too bitter. Better on tap, but still very good in bottle.

Bottle. Pours amber with a fluffy and long lasting off white head. Aroma is sweet malt, almost caramel, and some light floral hops. Medium body. Flavor is sweet malt, caramel, a light note of wood, and floral hops in the finish. Pretty nice.

Off-white head is medium and bit heterogenous, leaves small lacing. Color is faintly hazy, yellowish copper. Aroma is very nicely bloomy hoppy, toffy and a bit berried. A bit berried flavor is sweety malty and very much flowery hoppy for a lager. Nicely bitter. Quite light-bodied and tingly carbonated palate.

12 oz. bottle on 4/23/2008. Very attractive tawny amber body with a firm, well developed off white head that leaves behind some thick bands of lace. Maltiness in the aroma comes through as dark toffee and caramel, complemented by a distinctly floral hop aroma. Medium body with an effervescence to match, and a round, smooth mouthfeel. Fairly assertive bitterness for the style, but the malt base provides sufficient balance. Finishes nicely dry and fairly clean. Certainly one of the better Viennas, at the hoppy end of the scale for the style.
draft at the metro. nice mix of malt and hops.  Good crisp lager, but nothing special.
Bottle. A crisp, copper-colored beer. The taste is malty, with a generous dose of spiky hop flavor.

UPDATED: JUN 16, 2008 Bottle. Pours amber, clear, with a two fingered off white head int a Sam Adams lager glass. Aroma is a bit of sweet malt mixed in with a nice hoppy floral aroma, though understated. Flavor is nice and basic: very drinkable balance of malt, caramel up front fading into a nice dry, hoppy bite at the end. Versatile, drinkable beer.

From Løvbjerg, Aarhus
Bottled
Beautiful orange-copper colour with distnct white head. The malt suits the hopping well

Bottle, Carringtons, Didsbury, Manchester.  Pours a copper colour with an off white head. Sweetish aroma with elements of malt, hops and caramel. Malty taste, decent body. Slightly bitter, hoppy finish. Very drinkable.

UPDATED: MAY 8, 2008 pours almost a coppery  colour with white head.  goes down nice.  a solid hoppiness  Has a  nice (albeit short)finish which makes it very drinkable.  Good flavour.  not overly bitter and not too sweet.  a solid brew
341mL bottle from the LCBO.  Pours dark gold, with a large off-white head.  Soft malty aroma.  Flavour of dryish malt with nicely assertive hops (with just a touch of citrus in the opening).

Draught at the Magician, New York City. This was served too cold, of course, but its still a classic beer: full-flavoured with a nice sweet malty base and a long, dry finish. I had this several times on my recent visit to New York and it made me wish (and I know that this is sacrilege for a Camra member) that there were decent keg beers widely available in the Britain so I wouldnt have to drink John Smiths or Guinness when I go to bars with no cask beers.

Pours a clear reddish amber with a thick creamy white head. Aroma is honey with a bit of hops. The flavor is malty with a nice little hop kick to it. Somewhat grassy on the finish. Pretty decent lager.
Not usually a big fan of lagers, but the extra hops in here really make it pretty good. Grassy and slightly sweet with a toffee malt flavor.
Fairly nutty with a nice malt base that was fairly sweet but not overly so. A good amount of hops as well. Very solid business.

12oz bottle: Poured a golden honey color with a suitable white top.  The aroma is a delicate balance of honey and caramel malt and grassy and piney hops.  Soft and inviting.  Drinks easy with a subtle dose of sweet malts and rindy hops.  Finishes slightly bitter and leaves me wanting more.  Good.

Clear amber body with an appealing, frothy off-white head. The aroma is more hoppy (flowers, mostly, but also notes of orange peel and grapefruit) than malty (caramel, baked cookie), but presents both. The flavor is lightly sweet and lightly to moderately bitter. Moderate acidity. Finishes with a slight sourness in addition to a mild bitterness. Dry. The medium body has lively carbonation and a watery texture. Reminds me a bit of Sam Adams Boston Lager, but more flavorful and a richer body. Nice lager.

bottle.  average off-white fizzy head (dissapated quickly and fully) into cloudy amber body.  good lacing present.  aromas of caramel and light hops.  flavors are lightly sweet and lightly bitter throughout.  dry texture.  average carbonation.  duration of finish was short.  easy drinking good stuff.
On tap. Pours copper with a frothy, foamy head.  Aroma of sweet malts and hops.  Taste of citrus and hops.  Smooth finish.  Very nice beer.
A very flavorful lager, clear gold color, dry aftertaste.  What a good lager could and should be.

12 ounce bottle. Copper in color, white foamy head. Grapefruity and hoppy. It nice. I think I would like it more when it gets warmer out. Nice carbonation...just right. Lots of great flavor. Nice beer.

UPDATED: MAY 2, 2009 Bottle. Light amber color w/ a white head. Nice hoppy aroma: citrus and a bit flowery. Refreshing, well-balanced flowery hop flavour: citrus and grapefruit. Nice bitterness. A filling and very drinkable lager beer from Brooklyn. One of my favourite lagers.

Copper with beige head.  Hop and caramel cookie aroma/.  Complex caramel malt, nicely toasted, and hop flavor character.  Nice bitter finish.  Medium light body and medium carbo.  Very nice and complex enough not to be boring.  Satisfying.

LCBO about $2 per bottle. Hoppy aroma.
Copper with a foamy white head that sticks around and coats the glass. Creamy, hoppy dry, clean taste. Easy drinking, all "lagers" should taste this could. Dry bitter after-taste.

35,5cl bottle @ home. Copper! very dark for a lager - we shall continue... but found not much, except malt and a very bitter hoppy finish, but hey, the last time i looked it said lager on the bottle. Where did the 3.43 average come from?

On tap. Pours a med-dark amber, small head. This is a full bodied solid lager. Nice fruity nose with a strong malt finish. A great session beer, and very drinkable. I could be wrong, but I am under the impression that the tap beer is brewed in brooklyn, and the bottle version is brewed in upstate New York. This is an old standby particularly when I am in places lacking micros and good imports, and I am never disappointed.
UPDATED: OCT 18, 2008 Amber with a fine head. Spicy and flawery aroma with notes of citrus. The flavours are grape and iron on a malty background.
Something I drink quite a bit, a nice initial pour with a good orangish color.  Strong aroma with a consistent taste throughout while drinking.
i think this is a must try lager it was very crisp with a woody, aroma and a brown, appearance and held a rocky head,

UPDATED: MAR 22, 2016 On tap in namesake @ the Bier Markt: Amber-orange with medium head and healthy lacing...good looks.  Aromas are strong with sweet malt, fruit and floral hops.    Tastes hoppy with undertones of citrus and butterscotch.  Bitter finish.  Very impressive.

355ml bottle 
5.0% ABV 
I tried this beer on February 26, 2008 at "Smokeless Joes" in Toronto, Ontario.  The beer poured a dark translucent amber colour with a white head which disappates to permanent lacing.  The aroma was slightly malty, but had an unmistakable floral hoppiness that was a prelude of good things to come. The mouthfeel was medium bodied with medium carbonation.  The flavour  had some hints of malt, but was very hoppy, with some grapefruit like bitterness in the finish.  A very good beer.
Strong aroma and flavor.  Hopsy taste and just enough kick at the end.  A good looking and tasty brew.
Very crisp with a  tiny bit more hops on the tongue then most logers, the smell reminds me of a Sam Adams Boston lager, but agin with just a bit more hops.

341ml Bottle: Pours a deep peachy brown, cloudy, and with a decent white head.  Aroma of cinnamon rolls, rock candy, floral hops, caramel malts, and yeast.  The flavour is spicy and hoppy, nice and bitter, with a very nice caramel sweet malt to balance.  Grassy, earthy tones in the aftertaste.  Very nice!
strong stale yeast and tin can aroma. Tastes of plug hops and tin can. Exuberant head. Liquid yeast infection.
This is a very solid beer - nice robust flavor, with an excellent taste of hops.  The clear, amber color is impressive, with a nice head.  Reminds me of a mix between a lager and an IPA.

Bottled. Clear pale amber with a thick white head. Flowers and oranges in the aroma with buttery undertones. malty flavour of bread and fudge with subtle aromatic hop notes of flowers. Mild spicy and grassy finish with floral undertones, hints of white bread and toffee.
Bottle. Hazy amber colour with medium creamy off-white mostly lasting head. Hoppy aroma with notes of caramel. Sweet bitter flavor. Bitter finish.

Clear dark amber.White head.Sweet caramel  aroma with grassy floral notes.A nice balance of sweet and bitter, with the hops bitterness more pronounced in the finish.Soft texture,smooth.Very nice.Ill be having another.

Poured from bottle to a lager glass a nice amber color - a nice dark amber for a American lager. Pours carbonated and with a  decent head.  You can smell the hops right after the pour, very hoppy. A little bitter on the palate but the taste is very consistent and smooth. Certainly at the top of my Lager list and probably my favorite Brooklyn.
Bottle. Pours a copper colour with a light head. Hops, orange and some malty caramel on the nose. The taste has some sweet caramel notes and some nice hops. Good QPR on this lager!
The carbonation was lively on the pour. Amber gold color with a sweet smell of flowers.    A very tasty lager!

Tasted 09 Feb 2008.  Clear orangish amber color with a carmel, malty aroma.  The malt flavor has a "biscuity" sweet flavor ending with a earthy, peppery, bitter hop character.  Has the bitterness at the end expected in lagers.  Oily texture whole way through the tasting.
this beer is a clear amber color and has no head. A very crisp malt aroma with light sweetness. The flavor is very heavy with malt and quite a bit of hoppiness on the back end.
Poured a honey color with a medium head that did not fade quickly.  Aromas of sweet malts and floral hops.  Taste was very sweet with a hint of caramel and wheat.  Overall a great lager.

aroma is full, with sweet malts mixing with floral hops.  pours a dark amber with a big head that stays present throughout the duration of the drink.  flavor is a great balance of malt and hops, featuring plenty of citrus flavor and a hint of caramel.  medium bodied.  A very nice session beer.
Pours a nice clear copper with small white head that faded quickly.  Aroma is piney hops.  Taste is a good balance between malt and the slightly hoppy finish.  Nice beer I would buy again.

I really enjoyed this vienna style beer. The aroma was malty and sweet but the taste was of high hops and bitterness. The cold aging of the beer rounded out the bitterness giving it a good hoppy finish. All of the Brooklyn beers have been tasty so far, i look forward to exploring more of their flavors.

UPDATED: NOV 21, 2008 12 ounce bottle.  Nice, citrusy hop aroma - tangy and fresh.  A light, yeasty lager - nutty and dry.  Some citrus flavor, a little tart and hoppy, not much malt presence.   Unusually dry and sour for a lager - an interesting brew.  The flavor seems to have changed over the years.

Bottle. Aroma of light fruitiness and wheat cracker. Flavor much the same. Hops always hovering. A really nice beer to chill with, not sure what else to say, but probably the most enjoyable light lager Ive had to date.
Slighty dry finish to this, great brew though. Easily a session beer. Great taste of hops and malt mixed together nicely. Off to get more!

Bottle, from a bodega blocks from the brewery (the Bklyn one, where this is NOT made). A clear orange-amber beer with a modest white head that leaves lacing. Aroma is caramel malt, with some flowery hops notes. The taste is surprisingly hoppy for a lager, atop a solid malt backbone. Finish is crisp dry hop bitterness. I could drink this all night, in fact I just might.
Pours darkish golden with a decent sized head. Aroma of caramel with some fruitiness. Nice palate, finishes a bit dry.

Honestly, I had been avoiding this beer for a little while. Usually the flagship beers for any individual brewery seem dull and boring. I really expected a lot less from this. Fist I was highly impressed with the head formation and glass lacing. It has head similar to some Belgians I have had. The taste was heavy on the amber malts and caramel with a bit of bitterness to balance out, even if was a bit over bitter for the style. The only thing that really spoiled it for me was the aroma.

I had never tried this, and was pretty happy to see the six pack cans.  Medium towards light amber, very nice head.  Aroma very citrusy with some malt in the back.  Nice malt flavor, sort of has that "built up" malt flavor you find in some Czech lagers that supposedly comes from the decoction mashing.  No clue if they do decoction mashing for this or not, but who cares, they got a nice flavor!  The finish is citric hops, out front and bitter.  Very pleasant, much more ale-like in some ways than I expected.  Good stuff.
Rich amber color, decent head.  Beautiful boquet of several fruits and flowers. Generous amount of hops nad malt for a lager.  Complex and balanced.
The best part of this beer was the billowing head. Very pronounced maltiness and more hop bitterness than was expecting. There were some butterscotch flavors that I didnt like.

nice fresh bottle for the first time, after only having had stale bottles a couple of times years ago. smells like a cask bitter - sulfur and flowers with crystal malt. pleasant biscuitty malt, quite long on palate, with salty, substantial flowery bitterness. some fruitiness in aftertaste. tastes much more like an ale than a lager, but a good ale. quality session beer. i could drink a lot of this stuff.
Dark amber with tiny head. Aroma is light malty with fruity notes. Flavor has fruit and caramel notes with a mild hoppy end.
Pours darkish golden with a decent sized head. Aroma of caramel with some fruitiness. Nice palate, finishes a bit dry.

Pours amber with tight, white, lasting head. Caramal malt and floral aroma maybe honey too. Pleasant on the palate with the full malt, brown sugar flavour and enough bitterness to carry it. Simple but not too simple. Its hard to find good american beer in shops in the UK and in the abscence of good APAs, this lager can work as a less hoppy alternative.

12 oz.bottle.  Pours Amber with moderate off white head with good lacing.  Nice lager malt nose, a touch of caramel and some slight earthen hops.  Good malt character, caramel with some fruity esters.  Clean, crisp hop finish with little to no after.  A well done lager.  Tasty and highly drinkable.

Slight sweet malted nose.  Amber yellow in color with a decent white head.  Dies quickly.  Crisp and frothy on the tongue.  Long dry ending hangs around a while.  Brooklyn seems to specialize on this.

Clear amber color with a medium white head.  Aroma is very sweet and bready with some honey, grain, caramel, and subtle hop aroma.  Flavor has a very sweet/grainy mix thing going on with some light summer fruit and honey.  Hop flavor is mild with a lighter mouthfeel that is pleasant, if boring.  Decent for what it is, but this one has never really done it for me.
sm ell and taste are both mix of  mild malt and hops.  mouthfeel is smooth. appearance as poured is light amber with thin head. Pretty good overall, but ive had better lagers.

bottle - Pours clear light amber with a thin, white head that sticks around and laces well.  Theres a sweet malt aroma with a hint of fruit esters.  The taste has a good hops balance to go with the pale malt.  Theres a refreshingly bitter finish.  Brooklyn Lager is a very solid session brew.

Poured a nice copper color. Modest off-white head that dissipated completely. Decent lacing. Aroma is a nice, modestly hopped caramel malt. Refreshing. Flavor is malty, nicely balanced between sweet and bitter. A slight hint of butter and a slightly astringent aftertaste. This lingering astringency which is so often present in Ambers and Brown ales is why I dont enjoy these beers more.
Bottle poured into shaker.  Dark amber colour with a medium white head.  Aroma had a nice hint of hop.  Flavour starts with more hop but finishes well balanced with malt.  Nice lager.
amber head, citrus, caramel, malts and detect hoppy bitterness.  Ok - wouldnt get again

UPDATED: DEC 16, 2007 Pours dark amber color with thick white head and lots of lacing. Nice citrus aroma with sweet malt in the background. Taste is clean with a nice citrus hop bite at the start, a well-balanced malt backbone, and then lingering hop bitterness. A very well done beer thats easy to drink, very refreshing. A lager with a bit of an APA personality.
Had it on tap last. Im only 24 years old so im still very much so learning but i know that i really liked this beer. i thought it had great flavor to it
Great lager can drink a lot of this, with full of aroma and flavor, most importantly its all well balanced,I wish they had it in 40"s like mickeys do.

UPDATED: APR 6, 2008 Bottle. Dark golden/amber color with a white head. The aroma is hoppy and floral with notes of citrus and caramel. The taste is also hoppy and has a good bitterness. Notes of citrus, sourness and some sweet malt. Very hoppy for a lager beer.
dark amber pour, little-to-no head. very nice strong aroma, mostly hops. nice smooth flavor, strong malt and hop balance with a nice mix of bitter hops and hints of fruit flavor.

This beer pours a clear dark amber color with no head but does have some spotted laceing. The aroma is very floral and you get some hints of malt and hops. It has a nice initial bitterness which fades rather quickly. There is also some nice hints of fruit which you dont notice untill about 3 or 4 sips. The palate is very smooth and warming, it has lots of hops and some mild hints of toffee which coat your mouth. The duration is very long and lasts for a while.

The first sip was a surprise and then realized there is a hint of fruit.  This is a very good lager similar to Sam Adams.
The flavor is excellent.  Buy more than a six pack of this one. 

Found in
Laurel, MD
Strong hop presence in the nose, grains. Beautiful deep copper color with an ivory head. Bitter hop taste with decent malt backbone. finishes the same. Very interesting take on the style.

UPDATED: NOV 20, 2007 The flagship beer of the Brooklyn Brewery, a concern which has reestablished beer brewing in the County of Kings, New York. This is a fine smooth heavy lager, flavorful with hints of sharpness. The color in the glass is burnished gold, with a small-to-medium cream-colored head. Best served very cold. A good beer to drink with lighter meats such as fowl or pork, it can be enjoyed just by itself.
UPDATED: AUG 28, 2009 This is American, but rather delicious. Quite exquisite: perfumed, fruity, sweet, bitter. One of my favourite beers, but seems to have disappeared from here. Wretched shame.

This is what I expect from a lager.  Nice golden color, thick white head.  Floral, hoppy aroma.  Medium toasty, hoppy, malty flavor - really nicely balanced.  Dry, bitter finish that just makes me want to take another sip.  I could drink this beer all day long.

bottle: pours an amber hue with a small white head that disapates fast.
aroma is a wonderful nmaltiness with floral touches and some caramel, and grainy. flavour starts a tad bitter and then slides into some toasty malt and caramel malt, some slight fruity floaralness and some earthy hop bitterness is in the finish. very good beer and a style i am really starting to love.
This was a very good beer and I believe my very first Vienna.  I definitely would like to try others now.

12 oz. bottle my mother-in-law brought back from NY - Pours a slightly hazy amber color with a 3/4 finger thick off white head.  Light lacing.  Aroma is light grain and very light herbal hops.  Flavor is toasted grain with a nice bit of hop bitterness.  Medium body.  A smooth, easy drinking Vienna.  A nice beer.

amber pour with an off white head...nice malt and floral hop aroma... fresh tasting with a great malt and hop balance...great beer...I dont fell like Im having a lager ...this is a beer thats readily available and I dont know why, but I dont take advantage of it

$8.69 for a six pack at Winn Dixie.   Its out of character for me to be buying six packs of a lager, but this and the brown ale were the first Brooklyn brews I have seen in North Florida.  This is not your typical swill lager.  Very hoppy, with a round, smooth malt base that holds everything together.   Dry and nicely bitter on the finish.   No faults, and excellent.  One of the few lagers I actually enjoyed drinking.  Amazing to find it at Winn Dixie.
Bottle.  Some floral hop aroma and lightly smoked malt.  The flavor is similar and decent for the style.  Dry-finish with some lingering hops.

Pours a clear, ruby brown with a sandalwood head.  The aroma is dominated by the flowery, piney hops.  The flavor is dominated by the same notes, but the beer is crisp and refreshing.  The malts do tend to fall by the wayside in this beer, but for the style, this is a fantastic representation.
A lager with a nice malty and hoppy aroma. The flavour is crisp and cleand like a lager should be, with a sound amount of hops. The is is quite dry and bitter with a nice malt flavour. A fine beer!

This is a very nice beer.  It pours a copper color, with a moderate white head.  It has a very pleasant, citrusy hop aroma.   I really like the flavor--it is well-balanced between the malt and the hops, with just a tiny bit of hops bitterness as it goes down.  One of the other posters said it best:  it tastes like a pale ale turned into a lager.

Had on tap at the London Bridge in Jax.
Poured a nice copper-orange color displaying a durable, rocky 12" white head. Some spotty lacing as glass drained. Aromas were admirably balanced between the surprisingly upfront hops notes and the caramel malts. Plenty of citrus and floral hop aromas combined with toffee, biscuit and caramel. Mouthfeel was moderately full, fluffy and very smooth with a refreshing amount of carbonation. Taste profile was quite APA like with plenty of citrusy/floral/spicy hops coming to the forefront, but it still maintained the clean delicateness of a lager. Finish brings in the malty, caramel candy, toffee sweetness. Easy drinking and would be a superb everyday lager to enjoy regularly.
12 oz bottle. Clear copper with an off-white head. Good grassy hoppy aroma. Nice caramel malt flavor with a strong bitter finish. Very good, easy drinking lager.
UPDATED: AUG 10, 2009 12oz BB Jan 08 - Copper orange liquid, dry tea nose, dark tan head, hoppy bitterness, no real body.  Eeh

Aroma/Malty-light,
Appearance Head/Initial - size/large, Head/Color-white, 
Body/Hue-clear,
Initial Flavor-bitter/light,
Finish/Flavor- bitter/light
Palate/Body-medium
good beer
Smells strongly of pleasant citrus hops. Pours a clear copper color with a small white head. Taste is refreshingly citrusy with a nice light feel to it. Tastes like a lagered pale ale. Fantastic.
Bottle. Large, lasting head with excellent lacing. Flowery hop aroma. Smooth & light on the palate. Crisp, mild hop bite with a hint of malt on the backend. A very good session beer!
Moderate hoppy aroma. Clear light amber color with a medium whiteish head. Mellow malty start finishing with a slight hoppy bite.
35,5 cl bottle. Amber color, small white head. Caramell, sweet malt, honey, fruity/floral, ok bitterness.
i was pleasently surprised when I tasted this beer.  hoppy aroma, hoppy flavor clean crisp finish.!

Smells a great mix of fresh cascade (?) hops, bittering hops and caramel malt.  An amber, almost orange brew with a very small head.  Nicely sweet, well balanced, slightly creamy with a great fresh hop flavor.  Finishes slightly bitter.  Could drink these all day - i really like this beer.

This is a very good Vienna. Aroma was caramel with some hops in there as well. Pour was a nice dark gold with a one finger off white head. Taste was classic Vienna. Caramel and malt mostly and the hops round out the beer in the end. Sticky and wet mouth feel. Nice.
user_location: Moon Twp, suburb of Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, USA

text: this beer has some qulaity to it and is widely availible.  ive had it bottled on two sides of the atlantic.  ill go for it over large producers.  nothing special.

Crystal clear medium amber body with lively carbonation.  Large, spongy, off-white head that settles to a 1mm blanket of foam.  Nice thick ribbons of lacing circle the glass.  The aroma is subtle but well constructed.  Toasty bread notes and surprisingly lively herbal hops play well over a caramel malt base.  Floral scents make their way into the mix, adding subtle complexity.  The flavor is very similar, with toasty grains, caramel malts, floral and herbal hops blending well in a very fresh tasting, refreshing rendition of the style.  Theres a bit of cream mixed in as well, adding smoothness.  Medium bodied, with a lively mouthfeel.  The finish is mildly spicy.  Not a knock your socks off style, but this is well crafted.
12 oz bottle Total Wine and More in Cherry Hill NJ- Pours a mid Amber coloring, decent hops for a lager based beer, flowery tastes and smells.
Amber color. Nice whitish head.  Grainy base and a low hop aroma and flavor.  bitterness is evident but not strong.
Beautiful amber pour.  Pretty hoppy for a lager.  Good beer to check out if your in the New York area.  Obviously much better on tap than in the bottle.
This is part of a beer club. Had only one bottle but was decent for the price. Poured great and had a nice finish. Would do again.

I enjoyed this on draft in Manhattan, and was really pleasantly surprised.  The aroma was not too exciting, mostly grainy/earthy hops with a touch of caramel malt.  A good appearance, a very dark rust color with a creamy, tan head.  The flavor was quite good, hoppy and mostly bitter, but had some sweet aspects as well.  I was very impressed with this type of palate from a lager.  It was quite creamy and smooth, but still had ample carbonation, very well done.  Overall, it exceeded my expectations and I would like to have it again.
Amber colour with large white head.Aroma is really malty and bitter with taste of hops and pepper,really tasty and fresh beer better then many others Lagers.

35.5 cL bottle. Pours deep orange, clear, with a slight off-white head. Fruity hops aroma, slight caramel malt. Malty flavour, slight roasted with a minor bread like note. Fruity and bitter hops join in a bit later, given a rather dry flavour into the finish with a minor refreshing fruity note. Slight soapy mouthfeel/flavour.
Light amber color.  Smell of malt, hops, flowers and some pepper.  Taste of hops, pepper, citrus, flowers and malt.  Refreshing and not that bad.
Very nice.  Floral hops and malty aroma.  I swear I can smell some orange notes.  Medium mouth with a nice bitter finish.

I love this beer! Im partial to Lagers and Pils yet I do enjoy the extra character a pale ale has....this beer is the perfect beer for me!

Full flavour, beautiful head for a lager that melts away into a nice cover that laces the glass all the way down....nice caramel color. Taste is full, feel is nice and it leaves a sparkle on your tongue.

This along with Christoffel Blond are my 2 favorites amongst the beers I can get in my region.

This is a nice step above Sams and IMO much better than Urquell or Czechvar.

Highly recommend!

UPDATED: SEP 30, 2007 On tap at Beerbistro. I dont really like lagers, but maybe Ive just drank the wrong kind. Nice hoppy aroma, and a taste of hops, fresh fruit and malt. Very pleasant. Ive since bought a couple of bottles at the LCBO and it worked well paired with a thai red curry.
In glass on tap. Excellent lager. This has some character to it with a rich golden hue and pleasant hop aroma. A touch more thickness than many lagers with a good balance. Recommended.
Finally some charcter in a lager.  Nice head that stays with the brew.  Goldish color and clear.  Nice hop smell, crisp and fresh at the back of the mouth.

12 oz can. Another of my "I havent rated this yet???" beers. Golden brown with a huge off white head that disintegrates rockily. Rather hoppy nose - citrus and grass, sweet malt. Light to medium bodied, the sweet maltiness comes through in the flavor, well balanced by floral and grass flavors. Some dry bread notes. Very flavorful, damn pleasant.

355mL bottle:  Clear amber body with one finger tan head and that distinctive cask-conditionned effervescence.  Aroma of sweet roasted malts and floral hops.  Flavor is rich, robust with peppery notes, resembling ale more than lager.  Well rounded, bitter dry finish.   Whomever enacted the prohibition obviously never had a Brooklyn Lager!

Had this on tap. Pours a medium brown without much of a head. The aromas are hoppy, with a bit of malt. Taste is pretty hoppy and bitter, but with a pretty light and watery body. A pretty basic beer, but better than most other basic beers. Has average or slightly below average qualities in every area. Drinkable and consistent, but Ill only get it if the only other things available are other crappy american lagers.

12 ounce bottle from my SS summer 07
Crystal clear copper with a lasting off white head.
An overwhelming perfumey hop aroma with a scant amout of malt.
The hop flavor in the beer is just not really what I was looking for.  I wish it was a bit closer to neutral.  Again, it comes off as perfume for flower petals, with toasted malt in the trail position.  Strong bitter finish.
Medium body with active carbonation. and a dry finish.
Cartainly a better option than a lot of beers, but not something I really like to have again.
bottle. no hops in the aroma but very light malt. more malt in the taste and a litle something else but not much on hops. nice easy drinking

Bottle. What the aromas in this beer lack in complexity it makes up for in balance. Malts have a moderate roasted smell, hops smell of pine and herbs, and a light earth smell for the yeast, with brown sugar and a very light note of apple. Head is creamy/fizzy white with no lacing and is mostly diminishing. Color is a clear amber/tan. Flavor starts moderately acidic and finishes moderately acidic and bitter. Palate is light to medium, dry/watery with a lively carbonation. Nothing fancy, just a good drinking beer.

Pours an decent amber with slight foamy head.  Nose of dry hops, some malt backbone.  Palate mostly the same, finishes clean but a little more solid on the malt profile than most lagers. Nothing amazing, but good enough.
12oz can. Pours hazy golden amber color with full foamy off white head. Aroma sweet malt and floarl hops. Taste nutty malt and hops with lite bitter after taste.
Certainly has its own flavor and hoppiness. Acceptable, but leaves me wanting something. I couldnt see this as my regular beer.

Rated while drinking: Pours a dull golden-orange color with a majestic off-white head. Big head. Smells of fruity hops and almost something spicy; maybe pepper. Great balance of malts and hops in the flavor, backed up by more hops near the swallow. Tasty! Smooth and crisp on the palate; makes you want more. Solid flagship beer for Brooklyn. Could drink this everyday with every meal.

12 oz. bottle. One of my favorites becuase of its exceptional balance. Aroamas of sweet citrus and sandalwood and yeast. Russetted orange color. Minimal, retreating head. This is  deliciously hoppy for an American lager: flavors of grapefruit, resin, and malt tinges. The dryness of the flavor profile doesnt compromise its robustness. Cheers!

Slight hazy honey-gold amber hue, with a small beige head, floral hop and toasted malt nose, with a citrus fruity note,with some toffeeish and biscuity accents, with a hint of bready dough in the aroma follows through on a medium-bodied palate with a toasty and biscuity malt character,with a nice flowery hop citrusy note hint of toffee too, leading towards a hop bitterness finish.

Bottle. Crystal clear amber color with a decent white head and nice lacing. Excellent aroma of hops with sweet malt. Good toasted malt flavor underneath the considerable hop presence. After tasting this at the Emerald Coast Beerfest I had to bring some home. Very good.

I had this one on draft at the Emerald Coast Brew Fest in Pensacola, FL.  Nice hop aroma and attractive amber color.  The taste was very hoppy and really appealed to me.  The drinkability was very high.  I would recommend and will definitely have again, and Im not a huge fan of lagers. Mouthfeel is a bit thin. Good beer.

eh, it was an ok beer. had it on a full stomach, the head didnt last long.  ididnt wow me at first, but when i got halfway through it i started to appreciate it more. it was better then most lagers ive had.

UPDATED: JUN 5, 2008 Bottle. Golden amber color, with two fingers of fluffy, white head. Already I can sense that this beer is no ordinary run-of-the-mill lager. The aroma is pretty consistant with that of a pale or amber ale. Very hoppy. Grapefruit, other citrus. Some malts as well, although nothing stands out overall there. The flavor also seems less like a lager and more like an ale. Light hoppiness, which means the standard array of citrus notes and some malts, too. Watery body, very refreshing with a pleasing aftertaste. A very drinkable beer.
Clear amber with a good sized head. Medium body. Very clean flavour, sweet with caramel/toasted malt, well balanced with a good hit of hop bitterness.  Straight-forward and refreshing.
Amber color. Great long lasting head. Very hoppy for a lager. I am not sure I have tasted a better lager.

Draft, copper color with a medium lasting head, very good hoppy flavor for a lager, wasnt expecting it to have such a nice bite to it, nice bitter finish, overall it was a decent beer, nothing too great though.

12oz bottle. Honey orange colored body with a two finger, sudsy, pillowy off white head. Spotty lacing. Hop aromas pour into the room upon the inital opening of this beer. Also we have some malt notes, honey, biscuit dough and grapefruit, but mostly floral hops. Hops, citrus, dough and sweet honey come through as the beer is consumed. Mouthfeel is heavily astringent, light to medium bodied, somewhat sticky and oily on the palate. FInish is short in length, a bit bitter but overall pretty bland and finishes a bit watery at the very end. Was hoping for more.

UPDATED: OCT 29, 2007 Draft. Golden color with nice maltly toffee aroma. Very drinkable brew that reminds me of a cross between Sam Adams and Yuengling.

A great brew that I will surely have more of. One of my favorites.

12 oz. bottle, best before May 08. Golden amber colour with a mostly lasting rich creamy and frothy beige head. Bready, toffee, orange, and grapefruit aroma. Bready and lightly sweet malts, a touch of toffee flavour, then a juicy grapefruit and orange peel bitter finish. Light to medium bodied and combines the crispness of a lager with the juiciness of an IPA. Good stuff - I want more.

pint - Aroma is mild malts with a touch of hops.  Pours transparent gold with a small bubbly head and great lacing.  Flavor is strong with sweet malts and the hops are more pronounced.  Clean palate.  Drinkable on a hot day and really not a bad brew.
12 oz bottle. gold, cloudly with cabonation. smooth easy drinking. very pronounced hop taste with bitterness in the finish. nice everyday beer

July 2005 - This beer pours with a nice foamy head and a nice clear brown lager color. But lets get down to it. Its hoppy. The hopheads will like it because of this. I think its kind of lacking other than having more hops than a normal lager. The taste is a little on the thin side and frankly I find the hoppy taste out of place in a lager like this.

Pours a clear light copper with a small but lasting head and minimal lace. Very nice aroma, malty and crispy. Taste is perfectly balanced - sweet without that sickly honey flavour, perfectly set against crisp floral/citrus hops ending in a dry finish. Creamy body with perfect carbonation. This is an excellent lager, both drinkable and appreciable.

UPDATED: NOV 19, 2007 Re-rate. Bottle. Sweet hop nose with grassy malts. Deep clear gold slow but active carbonation drifting towards a big frothy head. Wonderful smooth palate. Full bodied but not heavy. Flavor is dry bitter citrus peel. Such a nice beer for all occasions. Upped flavor and overall score after a few bottles of this reminded me that it is possibly the perfect session beer for me.

The most impressive, widely available beer regularly served in the tri-state regions pubs and bars. Pours a clear amber-brown with a solid off-white head that fades to a consistent cap. Great lacing. The aroma is fresh and floral with fruit undertones of banana and sweet, bready  malts. The flavour is deliciously floral, citrusy and bitter, with a biting hoppy aftertaste that lingers for a while on the back of your tongue. Caramelized fruits are also evident in the aftertaste. The nice dry finish dries the sides of the mouth. The body is medium with a suitable, tingly carbonation.

UPDATED: SEP 16, 2008 excellent beer. I had it out of a bottle in Florida and was impressed by how well it poured and its overall light brown appearance. The flavor is strong yet smooth and has a great aftertaste. I would reccomend in a bar setting, especially during the evening.

One of my favorites. This is for me was the epihany of lagers.  I remember when I was 19 first tasting this and saying, "wow!"  Really enjoyable, truly a everyday beer - great with many foods....simply put -> buy a case and never be disappointed.

12 oz. bottle: Pours an amber gold wtih a thin off white head that quickly diminishes. Fruity aroma has hints of floral and a mild hop character. Malty flavor has hints of citrus, dry fruits with a touch of caramel. Finishes well with no lingering aftertaste like other lagers. A good everyday beer to keep in the fridge.
Bottle. Golden amber with white head. Ahh, Fruity and very hoppy aroma. Dry and medium body. Good lager. Short aftertaste
UPDATED: SEP 19, 2007 On tap... golden brown with a off white head. Fruity and distinct aroma. Love the hoppiness in this beer. Nice fruity flavors. Subtle touch.

Pours a honey to amber colur with a large white frothy white head. Aroma is HOPPY, citrus hops, floral hops with an outline bread and caramel malts. Initial taste is bready malts with an outpowering bitter citrus hops. Bitter hops linger on the palate with a mix of spices and other dark fruits. Good lacing of the glass with a decent head retention. Active carbonation that was perfectly matched.
Pours a ruby color, with a mild malty aroma. With a hint of hops and soap smell. Above average overall, not a big lager fan, one of the better lagers Ive had though. Worth a try.
Pours light tan, with a moderate head. Aroma is mildly fruity, rather hoppy. Tingly mouth feel, moderate fullness. Flavor is lightly fruity, flowery, and solid. Bitter hop aftertaste.

12oz bottle. Pours a nice orange amber with ample, frothy off-white head. sweet caramel malt aroma with some floral hops. Biscuity malt and caramel flavors are nicely complimented by floral hops mild citrus. Long, mellow hop finished. Well crafted and very enjoyable.

Aroma is a spicy, flowery scent at first, a bready malt characteristic , and a smokey roasted nut note on top of it all.  Appearance is a semi-translucent reddish/amber color with a medium sized tan head that diminishes into a soapy tan film.  Taste is nice malt overtones, with a bit of really bready overtone,  a nice medium to robust lager that is really exciting my taste buds.  Palate is lightly bitter with a lingering bitterness that fades over time.  Overall,  A darn good lager in my opinion.  Cheers!!
Good lager, cloudy coppy colored, which I thought was interesting.  Good lager, but Yueng is still king in my book.  Bluengalingalang, thats what I say.
Bottle. Nice head with good duration. Color is golden. Aroma is malt and a good amount of hops. Taste is not so strong though. Good bitter finish.

Pours a clear amber with a tiny white head and not much lacing.  The scent was a good balance of hops, malt, floral notes and citrus.  A little thin on palate, but not a bad beer for a bbq.  A good enough session brew.
UPDATED: JAN 26, 2008 Bottle - Porterouse- very enjoyable- amber orange with a small head, caramel aroma with an equally caramel flavour, nice hoppy tang too with a small hint of marajuana, enjoyable

Bright, clear amber appearance with a large off white head and good lacing.  Spicy hop aroma mingles with some toasted malts.  Slightly sweet malt taste; hops project more of a floral flavor; bitterness lingers in the aftertaste.  Medium bodied, well carbonated mouthfeel.  Nicely put together and will go well with most pub grub.  Sampled from a can with no metallic off-notes.

12 oz. bottle.  Pours a clear light amber color with a medium sized beige head.  The aroma is sweet malt with the slightest hoppiness.  The flavor is somewhat muted.  Light sweet malts and light hops combine to a forgettable finish.  This was an average American lager.
I am not a typical lager person, but this was a good smoothe beer that went down nice a quick.  This is definately your typical American Swill Lager.  Good beer plain and simple
Crisp and refreshing, this is a good everyday beer.  Not the most spectacular looking in the glass, but it has a nice taste of the hops without being real bitter and dry.
Fresh aroma of hops and malts. Flavour is mostly hop yet not bitter at that. Clean and refreshing but not a lot beyond that, really.

Pours a light copper color, with a medium, well-retained light tan head.  Pretty big malt character, with a good amount of spice in there too.  Mild hops are also present.  The taste is mild as well, a little bit grainy, some malt and hop presence but neither is overly up front.  Just a slight little bitterness in the finish.  The aftertaste has a small tidbit of spice left on the palate.  Decent I guess.
On the whole, a drinkable beer. Little bitter (hoppish) for a lager. Has more malt taste than normal lager also. Decent beer, nothing great. I agree that it is a good session beer."
As far as lagers go, its not a bad beer. But the plain taste of the lager makes me feel like this is a "go to" beer when you are in a NY hotel and its the only thing on tap.
Sampled at LCBO Summerhill Beer Festival, Toronto ON. A bit dark for a lager, and a bit too strong/bitter too. The blonde that poured it was sure excited about it though.
UPDATED: JUL 31, 2007 Fad. Mget lækker lager. God balance imellem umlen og malten. Samtidig utrolig smagfuld i forhold til procenterne. Alt i alt meget anbefalelsesværdig.

Draft pint, Russels, Bloomsburg PA.  Pours a clear dark amber body with an off-white head that left some light lacing.  Malty aroma with some light caramel and toasted notes.  A hint of butterscotch and some light floral hops.  The flavor is pretty clean, with biscuity and toasted malt, a hint of sweetness up front, lightly bitter on the finish.  Mouthfeel is medium bodied with moderate soft carbonation.  A little sticky sweetness and a hint of graininess on the finish.  Overall, a pretty decent beer, a nice compliment to the medium rare burger I was having.

Bottle with expiration date of Oct. 07.  Pours a rich copper color but almost no head.  Smell a hint of malts and a little fruity.  Fresh and mild, not overpowering.  Tastes a bit hoppy.  An above average brew.

UPDATED: JUL 26, 2007 surprisingly red/brown.  guess i was expecting a pale lager.  smell is surprisingly malty considering that, but mostly subdued.  flavor is similar, but pretty balanced and drinkable.  i like it.

Tap.  Pours a deep orange with a small, slightly off-white head.  Aroma is largely floral hops with a slight malt characteristic.  Flavor is malt up front with an excellent floral hop aftertaste.  It is crisp and refreshing, just like a vienna lager should be.  Great beer.

I live in Texas so I was very happy to find this beer when I went to Chicago for the weekend.  Pours a deep copper into the glass with a small off white head.  The aroma is nice and floral.  This beer is loaded with malty flavor with some nice crisp hops.  A very smooth brew and one that I wish I could enjoy more!
Amber color wihte head.  It has a great citrus hoppy taste to it. You can also smell the hops. It has some bitterness to it but not overpowering. Looking foward to tasting more from Brooklyn.

Draught --- poured a medium tangerine color, much like slightly tarnished brass.  Great head that stuck all the way down the glass as I drank it.  Thick.  Great mouth feel with lots of presence.  Refreshing and clean.  Not much lingering taste here.  Flavors of grapefruit, lemon peel, and citrus.  Some mild bitterness and only the faintest hints of malt.  A good beer that you could keep drinking all night.  Not overly fantastic, but if its on tap its worth getting.

clean, crisp, absolutely full bodied, hopped to hell lager without having even a remote taste of lager yeast or any of that other botton fermentation nonsense that takes over the flavor profile of almost every other lager out there.  Its freaking beautiful to have a full bodied lager that doesnt taste like a lager but doesnt make you as full feeling as drinking an ale...superb!
This was a pleasent surprise Darker than I expexted, and more full bodied, as well. Nice toasty, spicy aroma, and a dry, toasty flavor. Perhaps a touch of nuttiness, too. Tasty.
Very ale like - a a good ale at that.  Hoppy, dark, citrus touch and a really good bitter finish.  Glad that this is available here in Toronto - its a really good lager (or ale).

How this qualifies as a lager I dont know.  Looks more like an amber, hoppier than some IPAs and more bitter than your average ale.   Still a nice beer with good overall balance and a nice finish, just dont call it a lager.

Dark ruby red body with large two finger head that dont last long.
Aroma is of flolary hops, i thought the aroma were little weak.
The flavor is mostly of flolary hops to, som maltiness are noticeble.
The palate thin with fizzy carbonation.
This beer is wery hoppy and not very balanced betveen malt and hops, but it has a nice flavor still. Dont drink it if you dont like very hoppy beer.s

Definitely malty, but I think what goes awry here is that the hops destroy a lot of the qualities one might look for in a vienna.  Im not too familiar with the style.  I have had the Eliott Ness and it isnt this.  Otherwise the appearance and the aroma are excellent.  The taste is overhopped for a lager -- uh -- a vienna.

UPDATED: AUG 19, 2007 Pours an amber-orange colour with a lot of thick, rich head, that lasts and leaves some major lacing on the glass. Aroma is of hops, thats pretty much it. Taste is immediately hops, at first I was wondering if Id been tricked into drinking an IPA or APA or a bitter, but then the malts eventually kick in during the finish and after taste to add some balace. Enjoyable, but I wish the malts werent so subdued by the hops.

Floral hops and breadlike maltiness dominate the aroma.   Appearance is an appealing reddiish brown.  Flavor has some sweetness, and a little more hoppiness than I expected.  The finish tends to klinger, with some bittering hoppiness.  Light to medium mouthfeel.  Good beer overall.

UPDATED: SEP 6, 2010 Rated 2007-07-03 - Pours light amber with a fully receding off white head. Aroma of sweet malt, caramel, and earthy hops. Taste is lightly sweet, doughy, with nice hoppiness. Mouthfeel is medium to full bodied with moderate carbonation. Enjoyable.
Ar 6 Ap 4 Ta 7 Pa 3 Ov 13

Rated 2010-09-06 - Pours amber with a mostly receding wispy off-white head. Notes of sweet toffee, floral, earthy resinous hops. Medium bodied, lightly resinous with lively carbonation. 
Ar 6 Ap 4 Ta 6 Mf 3 Ov 13

Orange-amber in colour, long lasting off-white coloured head, great lacing.  The aroma is hoppy upfront - some citrus, more floral - some bready malts and caramel sweetness.  The flavour is very fresh and hoppy, very floral, lots of citrus bite, caramel malts, moderately bitter.  Chewy mouthfeel, medium body, medium/high carbonation.  Finishes long, some hop, medium bitterness, dry.  This is a hoppy Vienna, I quite like it.
355ml bottle from the LCBO in Peterborough, Ontario for $12.40 a 6-pack.
Opened on March 1, 2007 
Best before December 2007.
Tasty. Pours amber with small white head, strong enticing aromas of malt and fruit. Tangy, malty and fresh tasting, good mouthfeel, hops in finish. Excellent lager!

Draught at Københavnske Øldage. Clear, golden, well-carbonated beer with a lovely, creamy off-white head. Fruity nose, lightly hoppy, and balanced. Nice, fruity, balanced flavor where some piny notes also find theire way. Creamy and silky mouthfeel. Sweet, fruity and nicely hopped finish. A lovely lager. Wish more brewers could follow this example. (070512)

UPDATED: MAY 23, 2008 this is a truly awesome vienna. it pours a lovely light brown with nice white head. the aromas are a perfect preview for the taste. firm throughout with a balanced slightly bitter finish. hoppy and drinkable. this is my go to summer brew that is availible at my local LCBO.
One good lookin beer.  Rich, but not too heavy for summer drinking.  Little bit of caramel and lots of hops for a vienna.
Arrrghhh! hoppy, heavy and more bitter than your mother in law. Call me uncultured, but i didnt like this beer at all.

Bottle. Pours a clear copper with a large off-white head that lasts leaving great lacing. Aroma of sweet malt, light caramel, and floral hops. Taste is the same as aroma with a well balanced bitterness. Medium thin mouthfeel that finishes crisp and dry. A very flavorfull and refreshing Vienna Lager.

Bottle. Dark amber appearance is remarkably dark for a lager. Generous floral/hop aroma with a gooey drop of golden syrup. Good hop bitterness clings throughout the flavour cycle, generating excellent length. Rich palate. Further sips reveal wood and floral characteristics. A full-flavoured lager that deserves the pedestal it sits on.

UPDATED: OCT 16, 2014 Ive had a love hate realationship with Brooklyn lager. At first I really disliked this beer, too heavy and always just sits in my stomach.  Now Ive arrived at a detente, its ok, will drink if necessary.
Draft...amber in color, strong hop taste, white head, this is one of Brooklyns best in my opinion. And a lager, no less.

[Sampled in 2005.]

Maybe not the best from Brooklyn, but I could give it another chance. Boring and unbalanced. Watery!

12 oz bottle. Poured a clear orangey/copper with a small white frothy head and some nice visible carbonation. Aroma was malt dominant and slightly sweet with some earth notes of grass and dirt. Flavor was refreshing and smooth with some floral hops notes, a little sweetness and a malty aftertaste that lingered nicely. As far as lagers go this is one pretty darn good beer.

Bottle at Dæmningen. Clear dark amber - white head. Aroma: Citrus hoppy, light grape, light malty. Taste: Citrus hoppy, light grape, citrus zest, light malty, caramel, sweetness, resin. Bitter finish !!

The aroma is actually hopped, thank you Brooklyn. Its also got some biscuit/bread like yeast and malt. The appearance is amber/gold with a medium head and nice lace. The flavor is like the aroma with an assertive, bitter (tinny and grassy) taste to go along with the bread malts and a slight bit of paper. The palate is as smooth as any I have had from a lager. The finish is somewhat dry and buttery. As lagers go this one is pretty darn good.

Bottle from Tesco 14-06-07. Great perky hoppy nose to this, I wouldnt know how it looked because rather shockinlgy I was that thirsty I decided to just drink this from the bottle (shame on me) It tasted  very good though and despite the hoppy nose, this wasnt as hoppy or as bitter as I anticipated in fact I felt that it had rather a nice layer of honeylike sweetness to temper the bitterness and there was plenty of flavours going on in there but my gulping greedyness probably didnt do it quite the justice it deserved still it was very nice.

The aroma is hops and a light pine and slight citrus smell. The head is creamy, off white with excellent lacing. The body is a slight cloudy and golden in color. The initial flavor is mild bitter with a nice bitter finish. The body is light to medium, the texture kinda creamy and the carbonation soft.

Bottle, Tesco. Ive walked past this dozens of times, thinking it was going to be just another of the boring American lagers that seem to be the main representatives of the US beer scene in England. So finally when this went on sale I thought Id give it a shot, and wow--this is great stuff! Copper pour, nice layer of snowy white. Heavy herbal perfume, pollen, fading roses; the charming smell of classy old ladies. Full herbal hop bitterness. Shockingly hoppy actually--the hoppiest thing Ive had in at least a month. (Part of the sensation is probably that Im not used to this sort of hop flavors being used prominently.) Carmelly sweetness very tied in with the particular quality of the hop flavor. Chewy hop finish. A really pleasant surprise. Joins SNPA in my own little pantheon of respectable, full-flavored American brews available across the pond. And now, Im off to clean my local Tescos out while its still on sale...
stong cedar wood smell. very robust flavor. nutty, crisp very smooth with little after taste. bitter sweet. Excellent beer
Grassy and hoppy aroma. Clear copper color with a thick frothy head. Hoppy and simple with a copper finish. I knew right off it was no ordinary lager even without looking.
very hoppy and flowery flavours and aromas.  nice large head.  on tap and served in proper glassware.  enjoyable.

Rated 5/27/07:  Top shelf here, I was expecting yellow, crisp, and average but this is not your typical lager. Light amber pour that sparkles in the glass, tall lasting head, and remarkable lacing. Malty aroma, a little sweet with some caramel and biscuits. Good floral hop scent as well. Heavy body for the style, nice filling brew. Real bitter that bites you at the end. Surprisingly complex taste, malts o plenty produces a nice bready, toasted, and nutty flavor. High hop bitterness flowery and rightly done. A touch of sour apples and caramel as well. Great find, really hits the spot.

bottled from tesco.
dark amber colour, aot darker than standard european lagers. 
very well hopped, alot of malt flavours come through. really drinkable.

UPDATED: MAR 19, 2008 330 mL bottle.  Amber, with white/beige head that recedes to a film.  Laces okay, though.  Aroma of hops (cascade?) and brown sugar.  Taste doesnt quite live up to the aroma, but thats a big challenge.  But it is nicely bitter, with enough malt character to make it interesting.  And the hops are almost perfect.  Well carbonated.  Taste is full enough to make you forget this is a lager.  Outstanding.

Pours a nice copper colour with a slightly yellowish head that stays, but also has some flavour. A really nice, slightly fruity, hoppy smell. The taste is really juicey with some nice malt flavours and a real belt of hops. Great hoppy aftertaste and a really nice balance between bitter and sweet flavours. One of the best largers Ive ever tasted!

UPDATED: SEP 28, 2007 The aroma is dominated by the hop. Its the same with the flavor - its first malty, but very fast the taste of hop takes over. Its a bit similar to their east india pale ale. The head is a bit better and more creamy than the most lagers (this was from a bottle).

All in all a great lager with taste! (To quote a fellow rateberian). I still wish they wouldnt filter their beer, but I guess thats because they try to be a bit mainstream.

12oz. Bottle
$7.19 6-Pack
Sams Downers Grove

Best before 7/07

Brooklyn Lager poured a crystal clearhoney golden with handfuls of big carbonation bubbles rising to the head. A 2+ finger fluffy meringue like white head formed on the pour as it slowly receded it left sticky patch lacing down the pilsner glass. This is a really good looking beer.

Aromas of toasted malt greet the nose up front. Along with a nice even dose of grassy hops and a tea leaf like quality. Clean fresh smells.

Flavor is much the same as the aroma. Lightly toasted grains lead the way and are quickly followed by a nice balance of grassy herbal hops. The tea leaf character is in the flavor as well but more subdued. 

Medium bodied but crisp and smooth. Good carbonation keeps this beer moving through the palate.

Very easy drinker. Could see myself polishing off a few bottles of this today.

High quality sessionable beer from Brooklyn. Brooklyn just recently came to Illinois and Im looking forward to trying all of them I can get my hands on.

4/22/07
330 Bottle - Lots of malt, strong sweet hops and tar like treacle. Tastes like an ale. Heavy-ish body. Good, strong flavour, full body, nice beer.

UPDATED: MAY 27, 2007 nice amber color, big full beige head. very very nice hop aroma, nice and floral. There is a great malt backbone, really comes through. Outstanding lager, easily one of my favorites! imagine that a lager with flavour!!!
Bottle from Total wine in Huntersville NC.  This pours a nice copper with virtually no head.  Taste is a bit weird and seems much stronger than 5% alcohol.  Meh, I didnt like this at all.

A nice surprise actually. It is definitely better than any other style of lager that I have had. The color is a bit darker, which is nice. The malty taste is very noticeable. It hits you mainly in the aftertaste. The beer goes down smooth, not too thin for a lager actually. I think that this beer, if not eaten with anything, can leave a weird after aftertaste in your mouth. The taste is solid and very nice, but not too complex. This beer is mediocre.
bottled. Wow, nice surprise. Excellent malt and hop bitterness, incredibly balanced for a straight forward beer like this. Refreshing with a very hoppy finish. Excellent session

Bottle - 341ml. Pours a light amber body with average carbonation and a decent off-white foamy head. Lovely malty/hoppy aroma that carries oaky, piny, flowery and fruity (mainly grapefruit) notes. Taste is sharp and well balanced. It is dominated by hoppyness and ends with a dry bitter finish. Very enjoyable!

UPDATED: AUG 20, 2009 Bottled 355ml. Pours a light orange amber beer. Nice unexpected color. Wonderful crystal malt aromas, reminds me somewhat of Samuel adams boston lager. Some eucalyptus? Sweet malt, excellent. Flowery, some caramel. Dominated by the hops. Good hoppy taste that can t quite match the aromas. Apricot, peach flavors. Dry finish. An excellent lager! Rerate: Definetely a very good beer. Staying with the initial rating of 3.6.

12oz brown bottle. Orange gold colour with a full fluffy head, leaves some sticky lacing. Slight floral hops scent with background malt.
