Flavour has a lot of malt, citrus/apricot/fruit notes, finishes with some grassy and floral hops. A dryier finish, medium body with light carbonation. Good drinkability, great hot weather beer.
Bottle.33cl. Pours dark, hazy orange with off-white head. Flowery hoppy lager aroma. Grassy and piney hop aroma. Medium body, bready malt notes

Bottle. Bronze coloured with a decent off-white head that left some lacing. Aroma of floral hops with a touch of sweetness. Flavours of grassy hops with some summer fruit. Finish was nice and dry. Enjoyable.
Clear bright bronze, yellowish rocky head with decent retention. Soft toffee and faintly floral aromas. Same flavours roll into the palate with a dry finish. Delicious!
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: Very good lager. Poured a surprisingly amber hue, with decent head. Nose is very floral, with some hops, malty balance. Taste reflects the smell, again much more floral and spring-time-ish than I expected. Very good session beer; highly recommended.

6 pack bottles.  Surprised how amber it was- thought it would be more a yellow shade.  A small head remains for a long while, good lacing too.  Starts sweet, ends with a lingering bitterness.  More body / complexity than I was expecting- I enjoyed this beer.

Ok brooklyn. Brooklyn lager was one that got me into the finer side of beer. Fruity and toasty with hints of nuts but overall a simple thin taste that gets to you after cases and cases. Certainly not one of my first choices but when options run out, i rush to the lager.
Bottled. A bit on the red side. Minor white head. The aroma is malty and hoppy. The flavour is distinct with a hoppyness. There is a sweet aftertaste as well.

Out of a keg. out of my growler. out of my pint glass. out of my bladder. ok, ok, I didnt really try it out of my bladder. But this beer was so suprisingly exceptionaly good that I gave it serious consideration.
Bottle sampled. Pours amber/golden with a small white head. Aroma of floral hops, fruit, and sweet malts. The flavor is sweet, floral, toasted malts, and a mild bitter finish.

Pours golden with a touch of red.  Has a small, quickly dimmenishing head.  Aroma is malt, slightly sweet, and grassy.  Flavor is grass, malt, nd ratehr hoppy.  Finishes bitter and sorta dry.  Its a good brew, maybe a little too much of the grass hops but nothing to fret over.  I make sure to drink it when I visit Brooklyn.
On tap @ Common Grounds NYC. Great lager, hop presnce, balanced well with the malts. Ill drink this any day over any of the macros. A nice alternative

355 mL bottle. Pours a clear amber with a moderate head.  Aroma is of sweet malt with a bit of grassy hops.  Taste is moderately bitter, with a bit of an apricot sweetness.  Bitterness makes for a clean finish with little aftertaste.  Overall, described as a lager, but sure is tastier than any of the macros.

On tap, in a bottle, I think Ive even had it in a can.  It looks beautiful, a clear amber with minimal head.  You can smell the hops very strongly.  Speaking of hops, its a bit too hoppy for a lager.

A beefy, hoppy lager.  If youre going for lager, this one is it.  More body, more aroma, and more hops than what you would expect.  This one makes for a great barbecue or shrimp boil if you are into that sort of thing.
Better than an average beer, but thin and a little watery, hoppy for the lager style of beer. Not a bad beer, but not great.
Better than most standard lagers. Typical malty flavor, but very hoppy for a lager. A bit on the thin and watery side. A boring beer, but easily drinkable.

aaahhhh the beer of my homeland! tucked away in the craziness of my beloved nyc -the center of the earth- is one of the best lagers in the world. taste of beer, hops, a layered effect of flowery sweet clean and genuine flavors. not too sweet!  a touch of bitter just to open up your imagination. "yeah cousins" you are back in new york now! genuine body because thats how its brewed.

On tap at Mile Square in Hoboken.  Im not much of a lager guy to begin with, so i suppose i already came into this expecting not to like it that much.  However, the taste is there.  Not too much else to say about it.

355ml bottle. Pours a light copper colour with a small off white head that deminishes quickly. Sweet aroma with notes of malt, hops and caramel. Taste is slightly less sweet than the aroma with a nice bitter finish. very smooth with good carbonation. a top notch lager.
On tap at the brewery.  Golden color, small white head.  Very nice for a lager.  Hoppy flavor, slightly malty, very drinkable.  Another good Brooklyn effort.

WOW!
This is one nice "lager"---it tastes more like a pale ale to me.  
Very nice to drink on a hot day.  Thank you NEW YORK!!!
Poured a light copper color with thick white head. Sweet smell. Taste was just slightly sweet malts, caramel, and a tad of bitter hops on the finish. Clean and refreshing. A great solid summer brew.
Clear orange gold with an off white head. Nice american hops in the nose. Easy metal & thin body. Slight malty & bitter hops The hops shines through and is very nice. OK

UPDATED: APR 18, 2007 12 oz. bottle, best before 7/07. Time to start auditioning summer beers, I think, and Brooklyns just showing up at Sams Wines. Brassy color under a think eggshell head, very clear, light bubbles. Hoppy notes in the headspace come out when opened; in the glass it mingles with light but firm Vienna malts. Taste continues those Vienna malts with a matching hop profile, a little mellower than the usual Saaz. More spicy than flowery, but "flowery" is a difficult hop characteristic to preserve in a bottle. A fine American lager indeed.

UPDATED: JUN 9, 2008 You know, Ive never really been much of a lager guy. But if I was, this would be my lager of choice. Pours a nice light amber colour, with a thin creamy head. A lingering aroma of malts, and whiskey, with strong notes of hops. A very tasty treat, lots of dry hop flavour, with lighter notes of malts and caramel. Nice bitter dry finish which lasts until the next sip.The only thing that stops this beer from being amazing is the watery mouthfeel.  Still a Top Notch beer.Will buy again and would certainly reccomend to lager lovers.
Sudsy white head, a lot of caramel in the flavour.  Pretty sweet, but it settled in and by the end of the glass was alright.  Faint yeast breadinesss.

Aroma: Thick floral citrus character. Piney resinous strawlike malt character
Appearance: Light tan head with thick tight head. Copper gold
Flavour: Intense rich bitterness balanced with a full crystal malt flavour. Clean, no esters or diacetyl charater.
Mouthfeel: Medium full bodied sparkling with a lingering stickiness left on the lips.
Overall: Complex and well balanced. Rich and assertive resinous bitterness contrasted with a full, rich, sweet but not cloying malt character.

wow. this was made more impressive from the lacluster brooklyn brews wed had before this. lots of flavor here, malty and hoppy but pretty darn good for a vienna style lager. would definitely buy again.

355 ml bottle (5,2% abv). Small but dense off-white head over a bright, pale amber body.  Nice hoppy nose along with dry malts and dry fruits. A little malty sweetness and a fair amount of bitter hops in the flavors.  Not so mouthfilling as expected, a bit watery palate, but still an enjoyable and well-made lager.

Clear golden-orange body and a sudsy white head.  Sweet, lightly toasted biscuity malt nose and mild spicy hop notes.  Flavor follows with a nice balanced malt and hop profile.  Faintly buttery and lightly sweet with moderate bitterness.  A fair session amber lager.

This is the few good lagers i have drink in my life, The scent first hits u, Spicy well bit kind of clove. Must be good with a cuban cigar. Also thanks to Teoman Hünal for exporting this beer from all away from USA
Green.  Smelled green, tasted green.  Too dry for my tastes.  Date on the bottles is 340 6.
My first Vienna lager compliments for Piscator.  Fantatstic tasting draker lager.  Well carbonated.  Cant wait to get some more.
Bottle - surprisingly good, considering the style.  Amber to orange body with an off-white head.  Sweet malty aroma and a touch of spice hops.  The flavor matches.  Very nice!

Light orange in colour with average carbonation. Well balanced aromatics with lots of grassy and slightly citrusy hops mixing with a bit of both sweet and dry buscuity malts. Hops forward in the mouth with a nice grassy, spicy, and floral flavors... good firm bitterness too. The malt elements re-appear on the back end with a bit of light toast. Refreshing, but still has loads of character. One could win over a patio full of macro lager drinkers with this beer. Big thanks to pootzboy for the bottles.

Bottle.

So its nice that the LCBO is carrying this as a regular item. Ive had it a number of times since its release about 3-4 months ago. Pours a shimmering clear copper body with a large foamy white head slowly receding. Pleasing aroma consisting of mild grain sweetness and fruity, kind-of leafy hops. Solid body structure with bready type flavours up front and then leading into twangy hops. The finish is again a bit astringent and bready. 
A nice well-crafted brew to keep around.

can from Greens in ATL.  Honey aroma, with some citrus notes.  Dark gold/orange color with a thin but steadt white head.  Malty but still has a good hop presence, especially for a lager.  At first I thought it was going to be so malty that it feels heavy?  But then there is a sharp crisp flavor, either from the lager or the hops or both.  Complex but still greatly refreshing, easy to drink in the Florida heat, if only we could get it down here!

Dark, hazy golden-orange color.  Thick, foamy, sticky off-white head.  Sweet citrusy, grapefruit, caramel aroma.  Flavors were nicely balanced between sweet malts, citrusy/grapefruity hops, caramel, and brown sugar.  Soft, sticky mouthfeel that finishes very dry.  Really good, well balanced, complex and interesting stuff.

Quite simply one of the most pleasurable beers to drink.  Probably the hoppiest lager Ive had in a while.  I drink this all the time.  One of the few beers that can mix great taste with a "i could drink 8 of these" drinkability
I had this on tap and I have a funny feeling it was either a bad keg or dirty lines as it had an odd odor and a very bizarre taste.  I will have to try again!
Golden color with foamy light-tan head.  Has sweet (like honey) and hoppy aroma.  Nicely balanced and finishes with a lingering bitterness.  By far the hoppiest and most flavorful lager Ive had.

Pours a light amber color with one finger head. Not much aroma here, a little malt and a little floral. Taste is spicy hops with some lemon. Finish is dry and bitter. Biterness does not make me want to take another sip. Not my idea of a sessionable beer. I would pick it over the macros but probably will not seek this one out again.

[218-20060303] 355mL. Sweet citrus hops and lightly earthy aroma with hints of apple and lychee. Clear, light amber orange body with a small off-white head. Very grassy hops flavour with a bitter aftertaste, subtle apple lychee fruit. Medium body, fairly smooth. Nice hops, great blending.
A bit shy aroma.  Great balance between hops and caramel in flavor.  Smooth and tasy.  Yummy.  But is a Vienna?
Sweet fruity aroma.  Good mouthfeel.  Very bitter taste.  Lingering taste.  Very smooth going down, enjoyable.  Mildly acrid aftertaste.

Tap, at LGAs NYSB.  Pour is golden, though a deep golden.  Aroma is citrus and a bit of hop.  Taste is a fairly normal lager taste, nothing too special - though a bit more fruit - citrus than expected.  Refreshing.

out of a can!  Huge off-white head and a clear copper body.  Pretty big saaz hop in the nose and flavor.  noticeably malty,  more than a pilsner but not as rich and sweet as the only other vienna i can think of, GL eliot ness.  A really good beer and cheap too. good sessioning.  you cant beat a craft beer in a can, but i think i might like Pikeland pils a little more than this.

My team lost by 33 pts ... ouch.  Ah, well at least theres still beer in the fridge.  This poured with a deeper color than Id expected (because I didnt read the label), pretty much an amber-golden beer.  The whipped-up head sticks to the top of your lip on the first swallow.  Wow, theres a lot of apple in this one, tart light caramel, too.  Pretty rich, yet disarmingly drinkable.  Well done.  (#2750, 3/15/2007)

UPDATED: MAR 23, 2009 Softly sweet, your nose will be begging for more. Unfortunately, once you let it onto your tongue your mouth will be begging for more too! Very american, with a spicy sweet fruitiness. A pure clean taste - you know its good for you!

Amber in color, with a nice citrusy and slight sweet honey taste. The afertaste is slightly bitter, just right. The head was white and short lasting. Very little lacing. I enjoyed this beer a lot. Cant wait to taste their other brews.

Bottle. Pours a clear bubbly amber-orange with an average size lasting white head -- now thats a good looking Lager. Nice aroma of fresh floral hops along with some grain and caramel malt -- very nice! Flavour has a nice balance of floral hops and caramel malt along with some fruit and grain and a light bitter finish. Its hoppier then your average Lager and thats a good thing. Medium bodied. Wow, this is a fantastic Lager, Im shocked how much I like it!
Amber with a white short lasting head. Fresh flowery hobby aroma, sweet malty medium body with a descrete hobby bitterness in the flavor. Very good for a lager!
An above average lager. Nice copper brown, firm white head. Flavourful, with mild fruity undertones, satisfying hop presence.

UPDATED: MAR 17, 2007 March 3, 2007. Bottle. Dark amber brown with a smallish white head. Lightly hoppy, very light grainy citrus notes in the aroma. Pleasant bitterness, light toasty malt flavours. Average palate. Am pleasantly surprised by how much I liked this. 7/3/7/3/14+ Courtesy of Tuqueboy.

Tasted Blind, March 2007. Volo IPA Challenge Mystery Beer Bottle. Bright orange copper body, small creamy off-white head (3+). Perfumey floral hops in aroma with a bit of alcohol presence as it warms. Pleasant bitterness, same floral from the aroma with light citrus. Creamy but light palate. Flavour is a touch airy or washed out depending on your generosity. 6-7/3+/6-7/3+/14

355 mL bottle from LCBO.  Served cold in a tulip glass.  MR 01/07
App.:  Clear, medium-dark amber, tight, foamy tan head.
 
Aroma:  HOPS (citrus, floral and green-resinous), some sweet malts in background.  

Palate:  Medium-light body and fairly full carbonation.  

Flav.:  Plenty of green, resinous hops that becomes grapefruity, a bit of roasted malt behind that (caramel and toffee).  A decent bitter finish.

Overall a touch unbalanced towards hops, but still plenty nice.  Im happy that the LCBO is bringing in some decent American beer.

Nice light amber.  Bright white, extremely fine head stays throughout.

Beautiful bready malt nose, with a touch of treacle.  Medium in the mouth, with less malt sweetness than the nose leads one to expect.  Good spine of bitterness balances the malt richness.  Long finish.  Just beautiful with food.  Solid beer.  I like this a lot.

Bottle- Pours deep amber/auburn, with anm average beige frothy head. The aromas are super fresh spicy hops, floral, perfume, and some slight caramel, butterscotch. Pretty spicy and hoppy flavour profile, cirtus, thrills gum, some bready/doughy malts, cookie. Probably an americanized version of the style, which suits me fine. Spritzy, hoppy finish. Nice.

I had this on tap at Newark Airport and thought the barman made an error and brought me a pale ale. However, this bottle from the LCBO confirms that it was a lager. A nice copper amber ale with a thick lacing off white head. Surprising nice floral hops in aroma with light biscuitty malt. In mouth, this is a fresh hoppy pils, with dry crisp malt, floral hops, medium bodied. You can taste the hops upon burping. This was a great acquisition by the LCBO.
Bouteille de 355 ml. Ambrée légère, petit collet qui dure. Arome dhoublon parfumé de caramel doux et de petit fruits. Goût dhoublon fruité un peu sucré, arrière goût peu amère.

Bottle.  The second Viennese lager I have really enjoyed (the other being Schells Firebrick).  Amber color with medium head.  Decent balance between malt/caramel/sweet and the typical lager hoppy bitterness...  However, I think that its a little too hoppy for the style (or my tastes).

Other ratings seem to be dead-on for this one...tastes more like an American Pale Ale than a Vienna Lager...hops are right up front, subdued in the back of the palate by malts...tastes  extremely well-made, and as such, everything is well-balanced. Huge head poured, with a beautiful copper in the glass. Smooth carbonation. I dont have a lot of experience with American beers, and even less with American cottage/craft brewers, but this one must be among the tops. Glad the LCBO started carrying this one!
Strange, no head whatsoever.  Orange and amber in colour.  Sweet caramel and chewy, hoppy in scent.  Slightly toasty and caramel with a hint of sweet malts.  Very nice.  One of the better lagers.

Bottle, pours a dark gold amber, lots of sweet malt and some bread fragrances, 
whiffs of caramel and some hops in the nose, nice malt taste with a hop bite,
dry finish on the tongue, good mouth feel.

Bottle: Poured a deep orangey color lager with a nice medium foamy head with average retention. Aroma is hoppier then expected with some light caramel malt. Taste is more bitter and hoppy then I would have expected but still retain some of the light caramel malt that I love in Vienna. While this beer is interesting and refreshing, it resembles more of a hoppy ale ten a Vienna.
great lager!!!!!!! one of my definate fav lagers ever ahh hell it is my fav lager. amazing hop character, great flowery nose, good malt backbone, great beer. got at the lcbo
Didnt do much for me. Very hoppy and unappealing in a bland way...Id rather a sam adams for a widely available US beer

Was I happy to see this in the store today! WOW. poured an orange amber with orangy head. In the nose I got a hop floral aroma right away. Is this an IPA? Or a Lager? Sweet tart malts with plenty of hop bitter that lingers on the back and sides of my tounge. This is a great beer.

This beer is readily avaiblable in the UK.
This is one of the best, crisp, good aroma, and you can drink this as a session beer. Very good.

UPDATED: MAR 1, 2007 You know, this really does taste rather pre-Prohibitionary. Beautiful reddish-gold and a short fizzy head that leaves the glass lacier than my aunties panties. Crisp, very hoppy and tart aroma right off the bat, a complex bitterness that runs the gamut from flowery to grapefruit-like. A solid malt (butterscotch, toast) presence -- maybe a bit of corn syrup mid-sip, but it dissipates into a satisfyingly bitter finish. A bit minerally as well. Tastes much more like an APA than any lager Ive had, but still has that German lager bite to it. Slightly slick and sticky. Impressive and quite well-crafted.

Bottle: Poured a brilliant orange-amber lager in the flute with a decent 3 finger sticky off-white cap which lasts and laces well.

Aromas are of sweet toasty malts and floral Pacific hops...delicious!

Medium body silky mouth feel malty-floral pale ale -like character.

Up front a chew on big toasty malts then almost instantly this is balanced off with a rush of bittering hops which take over the balance mid palate...side tones of apricots...finish is bitter-sweet as the malts give up and let the hopping go metallic.

Interesting twist on a lager...certainly not a Vienna or a German style at all..uniquely an American hybrid style...this beer is hop-forward and bright, sharp and ale-like..floral, spicey-bitter ...even has an apricot bouquet pale ale nose to it...very much like a cross beween pale ale and a sturdy steam beer...Malty, sharp and hoppy very refreshing but I like my lagers more malt pronounced and complex.

If you like spicey-floral pale ales mated to sturdy steam beer you will like this lager.

I tasted this lager with a few pre-conceived perceptions that proved to be incorrect.  It came in a rubbish bottle, which is always off-putting, though one does say never judge a journal by its cover!  It is also touted as New Yorkshires number one beer - everyone knows New Yoykers are stupid, small-minded people with no taste, so this did not bode well!  I am quite happy to hold my hand up and say "look here Flashy, your pre-conceived perceptions of this lager let you down."  It has a dark amber colour, bitter sweet hoppy taste, which stays on the palate.  Absolutely bally tastey!  This beer gives lager a good name and tastes more like an American pale ale in the mould of a Sierra Nevada - it certainly does not taste anything like the mass-produced lagers served in the UK.  If youre in New Yoyk, any time soon try one of these boys out, or dont if you dont want to "its up to you"!

Fresh sixer from LCBO. Wow, a quality micro that even your Macro-drinking friends will not blink at - and I mean that in the best possible way!!! Nicely bitter hop profile that puts flavor shape ahead of harshness or shortness... and plenty of citrus and fruity dazzle on the nose. With enough refined malt sweetness to keep things from getting thin, this is a true class act & a major accomplishment for a broad-market accessible Lager.

Bottle from the LCBO. Beautiful deep orange-amber colour with a soft white head, and a fresh aroma of bready malt and mildly citric and floral hops, like orange and lemon blossoms. The flavour has some slightly fruity sweetness off the top, before the tasty hops kick in towards the finish. I know it may not be all that for you Americans who have been drinking it forever, but for us Ontarians, having this world-class lager finally available in our province is cause for celebration.

Bottle. Im glad this is going to be a regular beer from the lcbo. This is one of the best lager ive tried. Pours amber with a big white head. I  like the strong presence of hops (especially for a lager) which leave a nice bitter after taste.

355 ml bottle - pours clear amber with a big white head that leaves excellent lace.  Super surprising aroma of fresh floral and citrus hops, alongside a malt sweetness.  Flavour maltier than aroma, though the hops are still dominant, and lend a mildly bitter finish to the brew.  Delicate carbonation.  This is remarkable for a lager - more reminiscent of some good ales - the whole package reminds me especially of the Anchor Liberty Ale.  Great stuff, and adding this as a permanent listing is one of the rare positive moves made by the LCBO.

12oz. bottle - pours orangey golden amber with a big, foamy white head. Leaves excellent lacing down the glass. Aroma is shocking for a lager, especially in this bland Ontario market - its fresh and floral hops all the way, with a nice bready malt character in the background. The flavour has a much bigger malt profile than the aroma, with that same breadiness and some sticky sweetness coming forward before a pleasing bitter/dry finish. Smooth drinking all the way through. Nice hop-forward aftertaste as well. A fine example of what a lager can be - they dont have to be fizzy, piss-yellow and boring.

UPDATED: JAN 1, 2008 Many thanks to 3 Sons and dogs in Wexford tonight for providing the 2 and 3 oz free samples of Brooklyns various beers.  Im not sure if 3 ounces of beer is really enough to provide a rating, I like to chug 12 oz bottles. Anyway, here it goes. This Brooklyn lagers pour is orangey yellow with a whitish head. Its bottle has an attractive label. Oddly, the beer  smells like a pale ale or IPA, you know, the aroma of fruity hops astern.  Has that typical pale-like medium hoppy asperity.  The finish is mild to medium coup de main and it lasts for a few moments. This certainly is not your typical lager. If it didnt have a style listed, I would say it is more like ale, possibly even american pale ale. Gone, in a moment! On par wit elliot ness and penn pilsner but not as good as point classic or dos equis xx amber.
user_location: Beaver Valley, Beaver County, Pennsylvania, USA

text: UPDATED: MAR 20, 2013 Draft at Jerrys. Copper with good, foamy white head / Sweet, floral nose of pine, clover honey / Light body, somewhat watery, with otherwise good balance and very dry, bitter finish / Lean flavors of honey, straw, and biscuit / Fair, with really no "Vienna" character.  Much more of a pilsener.
35.5cl bottle from Tesco. Amber colour with a rapidly disappearing white head; strong hoppy aroma; a full mouthfeel with lots of dry hoppy bitterness; and a citrus sharp aftertaste. Excellent.
Overall I felt this was a somewhat bland beer. No reaction to this whatsoever and very unremarkable.
Dark colour. Bitter and flowery, quite full taste! Dont quite know what to make of this, is it sweet or is it dry? But its good, thats for sure.

Bottle. Pors golden amber with medium white head. Bready malt character with a little butterscotch. Still very dry with herbal hop aroma with a touch of apricot. Smooth with a fine bitterness in the finish. A very good lager.

Dark amber to copper color. Slowly diminishing taupe colored head. Decent lace. Lightly toasted malt with a mild fruit and herb hops component. Weak start with a gradual increase in malt flavor, with bread and light caramel tastes. malt is then reduced as the hops kick in and continue to add bitterness to the finish. Herbal and mild woodiness in the linger. A full lager, a touch too much in the pure bitterness, a start of the weekend, or just finished the lawn type brew.

Bottled.  Clearamber, small head, Distinct crystal malt aroma with some canteloupe-like hops. Fairly sweet with the expectedly clean, hard mouthfeel goes well with the flowery aromtic hops. Light-medium bodied, medium bitternes. Enjoyable

12oz. Bottle:  Aroma is malty but also smells of floral hops.  Poured orange/amber in color with a  medium-sized, off-white head that lasted throughout.  Clear.  Sparkling.  Flavor is moderately sweet and lightly bitter.  Starts out doughy and malty and then finishes grassy, yeasty, and a little bitter.  Medium body.  Sticky texture. Average carbonation.  Bitter, slightly dry, finish.  Overall, a well crafted but rather average Lager.  A little too malty in the middle.

From a 12 oz. bottle with an unnotched freshness date along the right side of label.

Poured a clear reddish amber golden with a foamy white head, small amount of laced sticking.

Aromas of light bready malts, lemon fruitiness and floral.

Good carbonation and a crisp, dryish, smooth light-medium bodied mouthfeel.

Tastes of grainy, soft bready malts, a sour lemon in the middle, a spicy hop bite at the end, and a dry grainy, bready finish.

Very nice, quite quaffable lager, would go great with a sports on TV Sunday.

What a nice surprise! This is a pale lager disguised as an ale - and very well so. Nice head and a rather dark golden color and the aroma has notes of fruit/aroma hops. The flavour has floral and fruity notes with notes of caramel and a nice hoppy bitterness in the long finish. A very nice lager indeed.

This lager pours a clear amber with a dense white head that mostly dissapates.  It has a firm aroma of citrusy hops.  The mouthfeel is light with almost no carbonation.  It has a simple crisp hop flavor from start to finish.  Its almost like a lager version of a special bitter.  Very simple and refreshing.

Clear copper, with a loose, billowy off-white head that laces well.  A very fruity, spicy hop aroma that definitely hint at a ale. Medium body and a good hop bite that pushes this lager above the competition.
user_location: Peoples Republic of Athens, Ohio, USA

text: Pours a coppered amber with a nice beige solid head with decent staying power and nice lacing.  The nose is delicate and floral.  Creamy rich malt underneath.  Really nice creamy full rich mouthfeel.  Perhaps a bit much for a lager, but very nice in my opinion.  Big rich malt, a big sweet, but not overpowering, toasted with good balance also coming from floral hops.  Its nice to see a lager with some real flavors to it.  Very floral.  The finish is floral, but the aftertaste comes back to the sweet and slightly fruity malts.  A bit of alcohol for the ABV being so low.  Id buy this in a heartbeat for a party in place of Sam Adams or SNPA... this stuff is tastier yet not too big for the palates of most.

Nice, malty lager. Great refreshing drink, a little overcarbonated. Lots of mellow floral flavor - some nice hop essence, bittered really well. Would make a nice summer drink - overall a little bland but enjoyable.
Bottle. Clear amber colour with a fluffy white head. Aroma is mostly fruity with some bready malts. Nice full flavour, dry fruits, honey and citrus. Decent bitterness, long finish.

A very complex beer.  The first thing one notices is the flowery aroma of the hops.  It is followed by a good balance of roasted malts (bread like flavor) and citrus notes.  Although the beer is dry hopped it does not overpower the flavor.  A very good beer to drink.

from notes taken during last 6 weeks
orange glooming amber color
head lets a nice withe slowly dissapearing layer,slightly offwithe
the smell remembers me a bit "gewürztraminer"(sort of grapes),malty smell too,fruity with caramel
tasts like grapes pears some hops,some swweetish-sourness
aftertaste peaches,grapes,malt,,a bit of bitterness
rather nice beer!!

UPDATED: MAR 15, 2007 Tasted again 15/03/2007.  330ml bottle shared with 4 others at Island Bay. Great drop - nice balance of sweet juicy toasted malt and spicy hops. Dry hopping gives a slight chemical note to nose and astringency t palate. Too hoppy for a Vienna but fantastic as a complex good drinking beer.  Quite well travelled but Id love to try it fresher.  Upped from 3.1 to 3.5.  Tasted 12/01/2006. 120z bottle from Rumbles, Wellington.
Rich gold colour, bright, with a fluffy white head. Rich malt aroma, very continental, which reminds me of Sam Adams - those east coasters must love their Munich and Vienna malts. Woody hop spice: nutmeg, cinnamon. Dry in the mouth: sappy, toffee, toasty, slightly astringent, malt character, with more spice in the hop flavour. Medium bitterness. Medium-light weight and just a little overcarbonated.  Crisp and snappy. Very good but it falls well short of blowing me away.

Amber color with head that laces throughout. Aroma is rich and flowery with a sweet hint (honey?). Flavor is fresh hops  and somewhat smokey, slightly caramel-sweet malt.  Finish is bitter and very well balanced, medium bodied. Excellent.

Bottle.  Sweet malty aroma with a little bready yeast.  Clear golden pour veers toward amber and has a creamy beige head.  Taste is sweet and malty, some caramel and very light toast.  Light body is actually kind of watery, nice squinch of bitterness at the back of the tongue, where light hops, herbiness, and a touch of spice converge.  Clean and pure but not very exciting.

12oz bottle, Pours your basic amber color no real distinction here, My first Vienna so I didnt know what to expect, Pleasantly surprised too Flavor was balanced and easy to drink. another great beer to sit down and drink anytime.
Bottle. Pours a medium amber with a small off-white head. Aroma is roasted malts and sharp hops. Flavor is well balanced, with a medium body. quaffable for a lager.
Bottle.  Light copper colour. Hoppy and malty aroma. Nice fruity flavour with a good flowery touch and bitter finish. Great Vienna!

Bottle. Creamy off-white good mostly lasting head. Amber colour. Powerfull great cascade hoppy aroma with loads of flowers. Alas not spo great taste. Heavy bitter flavor, with no balance at all.  Watery palate and lively carbonated.

Translucent amber body with around a half an inch of off-white head.  Smells hoppy and roasty malty.  Tastes hoppy and roasty, kind of citrusy sweet notes in the flavor too.  Full-flavored and medium bodied.  Not quite as crisp or clean as one might expect a lager to be, but a pretty tasty beer.

Bottle. Dark amber colour, large off-white head, bubbly. Dusty hoppiness, slightly fizzy smelling nose, slightly sweet malt. Very clean taste, bitter and slightly lively slightly fruity taste. Slightly floral and bitter finish, very clean, very easy drinking. Quite ok.

UPDATED: JUL 22, 2007 Draught Dark amber pour with decent head and nice lacing. Nice hop and malt aroma and flavor. Very smooth, clean finish, well balanced. Good session brew. Will defiantly drink again.

UPDATED: AUG 15, 2007 Little one finger head appears on top of a light copper body. Floral tones highlighted by notes of toffee, mild hops and malts, spices are evident too. Very refreshing taste yields to more aggressive spiciness and grassy hops. Finish is very clean. Very well done and quaffable Vienna.

It starts with an amber pour, and a good head that slowly diminishes.  The aroma is a thin one, just a hint of bitterness and astringincy.  Has a citrus, slightly bitter taste, with a thin palate.  This is a beer that exceeded my expectations, and has the hints of a great session ale.

UPDATED: JAN 17, 2007 (Bottel) pours clear amber. Citrus aroma with malty tones of caramel and toffee. Light undertones of flowers and small spicy notes. Maybe some fruityness. Crispy mouthfeel with a medium bitter, grapefruity ending. Nice malty backbone. Slightly peppery palate. Medium body.

A dark, amber coloured beer with a thick white head. A soapy hop aroma, citrusy with a malty undertone. A dry, hoppy taste, floral, slightly grassy and citrusy. There is a malty flavour in the background. The finish is dry. (Bottle - purchased from Tesco, Fakenham, Norfolk, at a reduced price of 95p. a bottle).

UPDATED: JUL 28, 2007 Re-rate. Pours golden/copper with a frothy light tan head. Lightly sweet malty aroma, with a good hop profile. Nice hop bitterness and spice throughout, with big balancing semi sweet malt background. Palate is medium, bitter, a little oily, with nice hop spice through the finish.
Very sweet, malty, round taste. This beer was a happy surprise; I really enjoyed it. Good with pizza.
This has caught me by surprise, a nut brown lager with a lingering hoppy taste characteristic of an English ale.

Ive got to say, this is a tastey beer.  Seeing it anywhere and everywhere I went in NYC I was half expecting it to be weak and watered down ... what a plesent suprise!
Had a nice lagar-esque flavor but with both malts and hops.  Which is wierd becaus eI often think of lager as beeing rather tasteless.  Hops are what make this beer good.
This one takes a little getting used to.  Nice fizzy head and some decent hoppiness.  Solid 3.

Bottle. Clear yellow colour and a sparkling look. Initial appearance of head was medium. Aroma was hop flowery and spicy, yeast as the predominant notes. Favour was light bitter and dry. Light bodied with a light bitter hoppy finish.
Had this on tap and poured to a golden colr with a thin white head.Had hints of lemon and malt and most definetly hops.Not too bad though.

Bottle best before Feb 07. Poured an amber color with a frothy off-white head that left lacing rings. The aroma was floral, citrus, and a hint of vegetables. The flavor was a nice mix of hops, caramel and floral. Medium body and bitter throughout. Very nice!

Pours a honey golden colour with a thin lace of head. Sharp, almost lemony hop aroma on the nose. More lemon hop flavors in the taste with a lingering sweetness that fades into sharp and pleasant hops. The tip of my tongue is tingling! Certainly a favorite for the style.
Brewed close in proximity to me, also a damn good beer. Prominent hops taste.

Can.  Never truly tasted this from the can outside of the ballpark.  Poured an amber color with a frothy mostly lasting off-white head.  Dark bread/grainy malt and grassy hop aroma.  Flavor of grainy cereal malts with a fair amount of hops in the back. A trace of soapiness noticeable.  Light to medium bodied, slightly fizzy palate.  Nothing exceptional considering whats available on the market, but pretty good for a macro-craft beer in a can.  I figure this is what good German-American immigrant lagers should have tasted like in bygone years.

Hmmm. Didn;t enjoy this one as much as some of the other raters. Seemed pretty middle-of-the-road unremarkable to me. Amber in colr with a small whitish head. Definite bit of floral hops in the nose, along with a dose of malt. Flavor was largely toasted malt with a fairly well-balanced hop presence, but a grainy quality that I wasnt crazy about. Not a bad beer, mind you, but unexceptional. A decent offering.

Slightly hazy orange, with a medium, white head. This tastes a lot like Sam Adams Boston Lager to me, but hoppier. Im kind of curious how its classified as a Vienna in the ratebeers database. Especially when you consider how hop-forward this beer is. Very nicely blended hops and malts in the taste. An enjoyable brew.

pours clear amber with a fluffy off white head that lasts forever and leaves great lacing. visible carbonation. aroma balanced light toasted malt and hops. flavor sweet toasted malt with a bitter hoppy backbone. finish bitter hoppy and dry. light and slightly floral.  light bodied crisp. nice balanced surprisingly hoppy lager.

bottle-thanks to vyvvy for the sample.  pours medium orange with a small soapy white head.  somewhat oxidized nose but just faint.  mostly caramel malts, toasted with some sweetness from faiding hops?  could be somewhat of an old bottle, but definately not past prime.  flavors are lightly sweet, caramel, light cardboard, toasted grains-true to the style.  really comes across pretty boring.  maybe i need a fresh bottle.  carbonation is ample and a little too much.
Bottle and draft. A nice crisp aroma and good appearance with a good foamy head and active appearance. Good flavor and well balanced. Very smooth.

Poured out a bit lighter amber, almost medium, aroma of hop flowers, spice.    Taste of smooth hops, malts and alspice.  Nice easy flavor.  Not to bold, but not exactly   boring.  Pretty good lager, not like the mega brewer types.
user_location: The Crystal Coast, North Carolina, USA

text: Got this beer because I had nothing better to do. Definately not an ordinary lager. Darker than a pale lager and much, much hoppier. Ultimately, it is a nice and hoppy beer, but of the three beers that I had at the time, this six pack was finished last. A good beer, but I would rather drink something else.

Bottle: Pours a clear amber with a large foamy off white head that lasts for a bit and laces very well.
Aroma is floral hop and a hint of honey backed up by a biscuit and caramel maltiness.
Flavour has an assertive hop presence  blending into a medium malty body and finishing with a nice lingering bitterness.
Very tasty.

Bright amber-orange coloru.  Slightly chewy, caramelly aroma.  Full body.  Lightly toasty, hints of caramel.  Clean.  Fairly flavourful brew.  Nothing terribly special in terms of either flavour or aroma but quite well executed and with enough body and nuance in its caramel/toast notes to keep things flowing.  Nicely done.

UPDATED: MAR 11, 2007 (Bottle BB 07/07; ABV 5.2%) Fruity (citrus), hoppy (flowery) and malty aroma. Amber colour, clear and small, white, very slightly lasting head with good lacing. Toffee malty, citrus fruity and moderately bitter flavour. Medium-bodied and softly carbonated  palate. Good brew, which does not taste lager! 10/03/07 (original rating was 7/3/7/3/14)

Amber body wih some lasting off white head.  Aroma is floral and hoppy with slight caramel malts.  Nice bitterness at the front with a slight citrus and herb flavour before ending bitter and dry.  Nice mouthfeel, full and fresh.  A basic but well built beer.
Bottle. Dark red body with anice off white head. Malty and hoppy aroma as well as flavour with a bitter finish.
Bottle. Dark golden colour with an off-white head. Aroma is sweet, malt, hop. Flavour is sweet, hop, fruit ,  malt. Light bitter finish.
Bottle 355 ml. Dark red body with a thick white/reddish head. Attractive floral and fruity aroma. Flavor is sweet malty, rather fruity and hoppy. This is one of the best lagers I ever tasted so far.
A bit smoky aroma with peppery maltyness. Light red colour, thick head. Foamy palate. Wonderful long finish with flowery hops. Tastes extremely German.

UPDATED: OCT 11, 2006 Lots of flowery hops and honey in the nose. Chewy amber body with a lasting blanket of suds. Caramel malt with a big spicy grapefruit hop finish. A wicked kick of rounded, lingering bitterness. Not dissimilar to Samuel Adams Boston Lager, and far too rich and tangy to be classified as a lager.
UPDATED: OCT 31, 2006 A hell of a laaagggaaa.  Not many better than this one.  Deliiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiish.

UPDATED: MAR 9, 2017 Golden color. Thick, frothy head lasts a long time. Aroma of fresh hops and malty.  Smoth caramel flavor with a pleasant roasted wheat nose.  Extremely full bodied and complex. Very nice lager.

From bottle. Great aroma of hops and honey, sweet but very distinct. Clear in appearance. Orange, yellow in colour with a thin head. I must say the taste gives an impression of quality to this beer. Tangy orange and malty. Another U.S beer ive tried recently and I am impressed. I would have this again.

Pours clear copper with a good sized light tan head.  Aroma has caramel malt with some butterscotch - rich, sweet and smooth.  Medium body with some sharp carbonation.  Taste has the caramel / butterscotch from the aroma along with some light spice - very smooth.  The finish has some sharp spicy and woody hops - fairly crisp.  I think this may have been a bit old with the malt taste, but it was still enjoyable.
Poured copper, nice head - true lager - rich, full flavored, a bit flowery, as usual one of the best from the bottle
Nice strong lager with a finish that hangs around with for a good finish.  A lager not for the light beer drinker.
Semi-dark lager with aroma of grapefruit and grain. Taste is grapefruit (probably from cascade hops) and bread spices. Quite lot of acidity wich make your taste buds go yay!

Just bought a book by the founder of the Brooklyn brewery, thought Id try some of his stuff.  This reminds me of Sam Adams Boston Lager- similar copper-roasted color, bright hoppiness, floral character and decidedly American taste.  Enjoyed each sip.  Nice one.

UPDATED: OCT 13, 2006 Bottle from Tescos, Dingwall. Lovely copper colour - looks extremely appetising.  Malty and flavoursome. Nice long lasting hoppy bitterness to finish. This reminds me a lot of Budvar and i probably marginally prefer it to this. Great saazy finish but less smooth and slightly more astringent than the Budvar. This definitely make sme want to taste more of their beers!

12-oz. Thanks, AbusedGoat! Pours ruddy amber with a big moussy platinum blonde head that settles to lace and rocks after one sip. Spicy saaz aromas; I poured this a little warmer than cellar cool and it was not quite a room-filler but definitely an area filler, and its showing a very pleasant nose for a lager. Nice earthy, spicy hops on the finish as well as the nose--more complexity on the finish, which lingers with a bit of the bitter. This is really nice, refreshing stuff. Its only 64F here today, but thats warmish for Seattle, and this is a solid Indian Summer session beer.
Clear dark amber body with a creamy tan head. Sweet caramel aroma with some dark malt. Sweet malty flavor.

Bottled. Amber color with small head. Citrusy, sweetish, caramelly, raisiny and vinous aroma. Rich taste with citrusy and herbal hops, firm bitterness, dry hop flavor, salty minerals and light caramel. Citrusy dry hop finish. Balanced and satisfying beer.

A Mes rate: 
Malty nose. Decent golden amber looks. More malt in the flavour with a dry hoppy finish. *yawns*

UPDATED: JUN 22, 2015 Dark golden / light copper colour and ok head. Nice fruity aroma with a lot of aroma hops, similar to an english inspired IPA. The taste is a little dissapointing, though, however some caramel and citric / flowery hops are present. The aftertaste is fruity and has a quite long nice bitter finish. Quite thick and creamy for a lager. Nice.

Bottle.  Deep orange color with a rich foamy head.  Nose of fruit and resin.  Kind of hoppy for a lager, but not so much that it fatigues the mouth.  Nice caramel roasted malt flavor with a hoppy finish.  Quite tasty!

On Tap. Deep Amber, moderate head and good condition. Initial flowery hop aromas followed by a malty toast and bread note. Pine resin, hops and citrus notes in the mouth with some caramel malt and a long hoppy finish that dries toward the end. I added a slice of lemon.

UPDATED: JUL 27, 2008 Sampled from bottle at Rivers Bend on 9/1/2006 - Thanks Matt!  I really enjoy all of Brooklyns brews which is why they are one of my favorites.  Their brews are always aromatic, tasty, and true to the style.  I feel that they are above average and worth trying at least once.  For me, Brooklyn beer is what I usually go after when I need a good, somewhat unique, and relatively affordable 6-pack.  Other than that, I will have to add more specific comments once I have a chance to really taste this beer again...  Rating:  7  3  8  3  15 = 3.6
______________________________

7/27/2008:  Brooklyn Lager pours a nice golden amber colir with a ample carbonation and a foamy, lasting ivory-colored head.  The aroma is malty and characterized by a floral aroma with some citrus to it as well.  The flavor is very much the same with a lightly caramel maltiness balanced with a fresh, flowery and lightly citrusy hoppiness.  In addition to the hop flavor there is also a good level of bitterness that helps create a delicately dry finish.  This beer has a medium to medium-full body that is really smooth.  Brooklyn Lager is very flavorful, crisp, refreshing, and extremely satisfying.  I am always impressed by this and the other Brooklyn brews everytime is sit down with one to enjoy.
12 fluid ounce bottle (5.2% Alc. by Vol. / Best Before SEP 2008 1159) from tish.  Thanks Tish!  Rating:  7  4  8  4  16 = 3.9

Bottle. Pours clear, oraney amber with a big creamy head of warm, orangey white colour. Great hoppy nose promising citrus and apples, but also bread. Flavours are bitter with citrus and apple hoppiness in the lead, giving way to balancing bread flavours towards the finish. Dont let the Lager in the name fool you- this is a wonderful American amber ale.
Amber with white head. Has more malt, hops and color than your average lager. Maybe this is how lager is meant to taste!?
Amber - Gold appearance - Strong Carmel and Hop blend.  Slight bitterness makes it a little more complex than the avg lager.    hint of fruit -- very refreshing.

UPDATED: AUG 30, 2009 First rating鶣 ml bottle from Swedish Systembolaget) Color is hazy amber, head is white to tan. Aroma is of clear almost heavy hoppy character, also Wiener or Münchener malty smell. Taste is heavy hops, medium high bitterness. Also mixed is the malty taste, its Wiener of Münchener, I cant decide. Mouth feel is medium, rather high CO2 level. After taste is of the specific malt used. A really nice beer!7/3/7/3/14=3.4Rerate(On a restaurant outside of Stockholm)On August 25, 2008Clear copper color, white head. Hoppy and malty scent. Also sweet malty and bitter hoppy taste. Medium mouthfeel, medium bitterness. I can drink this one a lot, taste nice!7/3/7/3/14=3.4Rerate(Bottle from Systembolaget)On September 27, 2008Blind tastingSlight shady apel copper color, off-white head. Fruity, hoppy scent. A bit buttery and grainy, fruity hoppy taste. Medium mouthfeel, low bitterness.7/4/7/3/13=3.4RerateBottle at a blind tastingOn August 30, 2009Clear copper color, off-whitehead. Fresh, citrus, grape, sweet scent. Hoppy, sweet, sugary, fresh taste. Medium mothfeel, medium low bitterness.8/4/7/3/15=3-7
Pours a honey amber colour with a thin head. Mild caramel aroma. Light caramel malt  with a medium bitter finish. An average beer.

Pours a darkish golden with a bubbly wite head. Floral and slightly grassy hops on the nose, with some light malt toastyness and a little corn. The body is a little thin, with some corn and some sweetness from the crystal malt. the finish is very dry and crisp. Its really isnt too different, but as far as your average lager goes its about as good as it gets.

The truth is I am really not a personal fan of this type of lager. That said, this is much better than almost any other American Malt Lagers that Ive had. 

Appearance: This beer pours a coppery light brown, decent white head.

Smell: Raw barley was the overwhelming aroma. There was also malts, and a bit of green (hops) in the nose.

Taste: I found the taste to be a bit watery, with lots of empty space. Light malts up front with a quite hoppy aftertaste. Above average compared to American Macros but certainly not a very interesting beer in comparison to other craft beers or American All-Malt Lagers. Aproachable.

Mouthfeel: A bit thin and watery; typical of an American lager but certainly nothing special in the mouthfeel (just okay).

Drinkability: There is nothing very interesting about this beer but it is cool clear and refreshing, like water. It is definitely a significantly sessionable beer, with low ABV and no extreme flavors you could drink it all night; and still walk home (w/o stumbling).


Hope this is helpful.
Cheers!

Coppery colored, lively carbonation. Medium sized yellow head. Sweet, caramelly, nutty, hopped, floral and even some bready tones in fine and complex aroma. Medium bodied. Flavor has caramel with fruits, aftertaste has citrus, bitter hops and lasting dryness with some floral tones.
Mild hop malt aroma with a hazy golden appearance with a minimal cream head.  Taste is well balanced with hops and malt and has a slightly bubbly finish.
Bottle, Sweet fruity smell, Golden, Powerfull bitterness and a hint of citrus, A little too fizzy taste on the tounge
Hoppy and floral. Not skunky. Goes down well. Slightly heavy on the carbonation.

UPDATED: MAY 10, 2009 Bouteille. Couleur dorée-claire dominée par un moyen collet blanc. Arôme de malt et de houblon floral. Goût bien maltée avec une présence houblonnée florale et une certaine amertume. Corps moyen.

Big on the malt (as advertised) which had me pleased, it was also nice to see the respectable hop profile presented here. Strong floral hops help balance a semi-sweet, doughy malty flavor. This beer will not blow your mind, but it is a highly enjoyable lager, and reasonably priced and widely available to boot.
Dark enough to pass for a pale ale.  Tastes almost like a PA as well.  Delicate malty flavor with a nice helping of hops.  Great lager.
great lager.. complex enough to enjoy with every sip, but not too complicated to be done after one.. crisp tasty refreshing and simple

A very nice lager coming from N.y. This beer makes me think of fond memories of me wanting to run nude beond the fall air of the woods where I can swim for hours in the creeks and springs. Damn thats a nice lager.

Bottle: Hazy, amber coloured, thin, quite stable foamy head;sweet-malt in the nose with a tinge of liquorice and a quite strong hoppy aroma; moderate to strong bitter flavour, medium bodied: moderate malty and long aromatic bitter finish. Very pleasant and spicy....!

(bottle, 1 month past the BB-date) Hazy amber coloured effervescent hue with a short, slightly off-white foamy head. Slightly dusty and sweet buttery, resiny Bohemian-like malty aroma with herbal and slightly floral hops. Aromatic bitter hoppy flavour, crispy mouthfeel, well-bodied and balanced malty base with a slightly fruity and floral hoppy taste; quite dry and spicy bitter finish with an aromatic hoppiness. Rather inexperienced with American beers I find it very quaffable.
Bottle. Golden colour with a nice moslty lasting white head. Heavy hoppy aroma and taste. Very powerful bitter finish.

Draught at the sunset grill 7/30/06. Pours a dark copper/brown color with a small fizzy head. Head receedes to nothing. Nose is grainy and malty with some nice earthy notes. Palate is full and grainy with some tingly bubbles. Flavors are grainy and corny with some earthy light hop notes and a sticky finish.

Pours a clear copper with a frothy ivory head. Light lacing. Smells of grassy malt and light citrusy hops.

Grassy malt and bitter hops. Light fruitiness from the malt. Persistent low level herbal hops. Lightly sticky mouth and long longering bitterness. Pretty good stuff.

(Bottle from Julios Liquors) Pours a deep amber with about 2 of biscuit head that drops to about 1/4". Good-looking beer. Aroma is quite hoppy - flowery and fruity. Mouthfeel quite smooth and full. Decent lacing. Initially has quite a more flowery and less fruity hop taste, very much like an IPA. Remains quite hoppy and bitter but some caramel begins to emerge. Bitter finish. Gosh this seems like an IPA, curious to know why they made it so hoppy. A good beer nonetheless.

Had it on tap, in bottles and at the Brewery.  When it first hits your mouth, you think it could be beer. Then the overwhelming flavor of rubbing alchohol hits. I am amazed I can still see. I will never understand how such an otherwise decent brewery can produce such an offensive lager.

Bottle 0,33l. Starting beer in a tiny beer samling session together with Rune at Järnvägshotellet in Kiruna, Sweden. Clear golden brown. A pretty lasting tanned head. Hoppy aroma. Fruity flavour. Ending in a pleasant bitter lasting aftertaste. A bit unbalanced but a very good lager.

UPDATED: JUL 17, 2006 355ml bottle (Alc. 5.3%) sampled with Finn at Järnvägshotellet In Kiruna (13.07.2006). Nice appearance with a lasting white foam over an amber coloured content. Hoppy aroma. Flavour of sweet malt, fruit and hops. Sharp bitter finish. Lively carbonated. Medium bodied. Very much like a pale ale, so this is my best lager so far.

UPDATED: FEB 9, 2011 355ml bottle. Pours amber. minimal, off-white head. Malt aroma, hoppy taste. Similar to an IPA.

Re-rate. Tap - Jan 2010. Crisp, fresh and more complex than your average lager. Excellent. Will come back to this review...
pours golden, light orange, aroma is flowery hops, biscuit, malts,  Taste is smooth with a light malt presence and a dry, crisp hoppy finish.

bottle, almost no head to this, malty aroma,  nice and fresh flavour, hoppy which was good and a dose  of bitterness at the end. have to search out some more brooklyn beers, havent seen many here in the uk

UPDATED: NOV 24, 2006 Aroma: fruity, lovely hops, full-bodied malt, vaguely musty.

Appearance: almost clear amber, some whiute, yellowtinged head that quickly lowers.

Flavor: bitter, full-bodied thanks to some swetness, hoppy afterbitterness.
Palate: just right carbonation, rich, refreshing, a little slimy.
Bottle. Really aromatic, fruity hoppiness in the aroma. Good bite, hop dominated taste. Nice, prefers this to a lot of other beers.
Pours amber in color, has nice hoppy smell to it. Very nice hoppy bite in taste and goes down smooth. Overall good for its style.
Clear yellowish color, with a white head.  Creamy, sweet aroma.  Clean taste, and easy to drink.  Nice hops.

Clear, amber appearance, under a slim, but sturdy speckled white head.

Creamy, malty nose, quite attractive...soft and flowery, pleasant esters from yeast (?)... I like it. 

Taste: smooth, clean, crisp, malty. Light bodied, but nicely textured, good grit, tight balance, tidy hops meet copious malt. A streamlined beauty, full of flavor. Blend of fruit associations chimes in, some apple, melon, grape, mixed with grain. 

Quite a classy lager, this one, damned good. Almost ale-like in its display of flavors. Just goes to show what happens when a lager is done well!

Can be drunk without disappointment, and no end in sight for the taste. Very, very nice!

This is a decent beer, but not worth the price I paid.  It has a light amber color, sweet aroma, and a light crisp taste.  It has a sweet taste on the front of the tongue, a clean bite in the finish, and no aftertaste to speak of.  Its a decent beer, but nothing to write home about.
On tap, this is an all around good and easy to drink beer. Well balanced with a decent amount of hops, has a slight honey taste. Pretty good lager from a great brewery

Bottle (from Tesco, BB Oct 06). Copper coloured. Slightly floral hops against firm maltiness with a slight toasted grain feel. The graininess wouldnt work well in some beers but is well integrated here. Dry and quaffable with refreshing hop finish.

This is a lager, but reminds me more of an ale or even a mild IPA. Pours to a golden copper color, with thin, diminishing cream-colored head, and okay lacing. Aroma is citrus fruit,  and floral hoppiness. Taste follows along the citurs fruit, predominantly grapefruit, and some floral, rose petal. Finish is somewhat dry, slightly bitter, but long lasting. Im impressed with this beer.

Pours a goldish-amber color with a medium off-white head.  Aroma is of floral hops, toasted and sweet malts, and caramel.  Flavor is very much the same with a sweet malt and caramel finish that lingers.  The flavor of the floral hops and the malts blend together very nicely.  Not my style of beer but I do enjoy this brew.

12 oz bottle.  Deep golden/amber beer with a creamy off-white head.  Aroma is very toasty and sweet.  Fresh malt with a lovely floral hop aroma.  Slightly perfumey.  Some sweet caramel.  Very fresh and toasty malts.  Floral hops with a soft but insistent bitterness.  Im surprised I havent had this before, but Im more surprised by how good it is.
Amber coloured. Sparkling white diminishing head. Aroma is citric and hoppy. Fruity, hoppy and quite bitter flavour. Medium bodied. Some sweetnes and acidity in finish.

Bottle, 355ml. A copper-coloured pour with a small lasting head. Strong aromas of hops and citrus. Tastes very alcoholic, with hops, citrus and caramel. A nice hoppy, bitter, somewhat fruity finish with some acidity. Average carbonation. Pretty good.

tap.  outside of madison square garden where the Celtics put a whooping on the highest paid, and worst team in the NBA.  This beer represents the people of New York.  I say it represents them well.  It is revolting in just about every way.  Ill take a coors please.  Do you guys remember when the Sox came back from 3 down?
Light amber. Great grassy fresh hoppy aroma -- from the dry hopping I suppose. Not much besides the hops though.

I had this one at Shea Stadium, in a plastic cup. It had a big white head over a dark gold brew. The head up and left sip lines on the plastic cup. Well balanced hops and malt, neither too strong but had a full-bodied effect. A pleasant beer. It went down easy.
Pours dark amber with little head. Aroma is very hoppy, though yet it has a spicy quality to it. This expands to the taste, where spices and a flowery feeling add to the hoppy bitterness...
A nice clean light brown beer.  A rich full bitter flavor.  Very flowery aroma and a little bit of that passed on to the taste.
UPDATED: JUN 21, 2006 Very nice lager, sweet maltiness, smooth dryness the whole way through. Long after-taste. Definitly hints of caramel.
A very nicely balanced beer. Some flowery hops with a nice tasting malt. Doesnt do anything fantastically well and too expensive for what it is though.

Draft version. Pours a clear amber color with a rather thick white head. Great lacing. Interesting sweet malty aroma hints at pre-spice applesauce and  and fresh baguettes. Flavor is dominated by an appley malt presence with just a faint hing of bittering hops at the finish to hold everything down. This is the kind of lager that a lager hater could enjoy.
Pours a nice amber color.  Nice sweet malt nose with a hint of hops. Taste is caramel, with mild hops and a touch of fruit.

Tested 29/1-06. Bottle: Light brown clear, Aroma of hops and malt sweetnes. Lots of bitter/aromatic hops, long nice bitternes in the finish. I will say this is a lager who tasted like an Ale. Werry good indeed!

Found this in Kyoto. Pours deep orage gold with a big white head, disipating quickly but decent lacing. Nose of grassy hops and a sweet herb/mint and flowers. Somewhat soapy flavour, good balance of hops and earth and tangerine malts. Tart and some cream. Sort of Odd. Bottle is only a month old but may have not travelled well. Sitting under those bright lights might have added some stale bread flavours.

Minimal aroma but great refreshing taste.  The hops burst forth in your mouth, and give you that natural "bite" flavor which is appropriate for this style of beer.  I wish this beer was more true to the pre-prohibition style and have some maize in it.

Tall, creamy, off-white head rests on a clear caramel to amber hued beer.  Rich bready, malty notes are immediately apparent alongside crisp floral hop aromas.  Elements of cookies, dates, toffee, and pecans all come into play.  Flavor is moderately sweet, lightly bitter.  The finish is lightly sweet and moderately bitter.  Very clean with a nice drying floral hop finish.  Medium body, watery texture, average carbonation.  Crisp and clean.  Its nice to have such a pleasant Vienna readily available and makes a creat conversion beer as well.
UPDATED: JUN 21, 2006 brown, hazy, frothy, medium bitterness, medium body, thick feel, average carbonation, bitter, very dark.  Not a bad beer.  Good in small doses.

Clearish honey color.  Smells like crisp apples.  Fruity undertones.  Good foamy head.  Nothing special really, but good to drink if you dont want to think about the beer you are drinking.  It had an apple Jolly Rancher taste with no apple flavor if that makes any kind of sense at all.

12 ounce bottle and poured into a pint glass.  It is a light brown colored beer and very clear with lots of bubbles, very inviting.  It formed a small head when poured into the glass that becomes a constant layer of foam.  Spotted lacing is left on the glass.  The aroma is a light molasses.  The taste is the same on the front end, but it finishes with a nice hop bite.  The is a very refreshing brew and I could sit around and drink a bunch of them.
UPDATED: MAY 15, 2006 This beer is truly one of the things I miss most about New York City!  I always look forward to going there to have one.
Nice and drinkable.  Would have been better, but just a bit too much on the floral taste to suit me.
bottle.  golden brown with white head.  Im normally not a big fan of lagers but this one wasnt bad.  some hops, a bit of malt, some bitterness

UPDATED: JUL 15, 2008 Re-rate based on can sent by Ty5592. Hazy coppery body, thick, puffy off-white head. Toasty nose with sharp herbal hops. Bitter, bready body, with sharp herbal, spicy hops complementing toasty, sweet malts. Long, bitter, somewhat metallic finish. Certainly much better this time around than my first sample on tap. On tap at Logans Alley, Grand Rapids.  Blonde-golden body, thin off-white head.  The aroma and body were biscuity, toasty, and cerealy, with abundant buttered breads (diacetyl notes) and an earthy hops finish.  This was relatively fresh beer but seemed rather stale and bland.  Im not impressed. 5-3-5-2-9 (2.4).

this is a pretty good brew.  Id expect nothing less from Brooklyn.  Real nice appearance and aroma.  malty and slightly bitter with a dry finish.  Got it in a variety pack - cant wait for the next bottle
best mainstream lager. period.  its rated a 4 cuz i rated it against other lagers not toehr beers. dry hoppy sexy deep
first i hate lagers and really dont mess with them, yet on tap this is prolly one of the only full tasting beer without that american pee watery bad lager taste. looks good

UPDATED: OCT 29, 2009 1. On Tap at the Sports Bar, John F Kennedy Airport 28/09/2005
Amber coloured with hoppy and floral aromas. Crisp on the palate with a malt finish.
2. 355ml Bottle at the Bear & Billet, Chester 05/04/2008
Some carbonation. Very fruity grapefruit and pine aromas. Amber golden coloured crisp extremely hoppy and fruity with a slightly bitter lasting malt finish.
3. From the Bottle at the Fly In The Loaf, Liverpool 20/02/2009
Some carbonation. Golden amber coloured and very hoppy with a hint of caramel in a crisp and slightly dry malt finish.

Clear copper brew. Frothy head that lingers. Nose is mostly green hops and lots of em. Unmistakably dryhopped. Very chunky bitterness in the nose. Malt are absent. Carbonation is very apparent. Flavors are interesting for a vienna. Not hardly any malt sweetness mostly hoppy green goodness.As the beer warms more sweetness shines through. Very honey-ish with a bitter hop edge. As per style...I dont know. As per beer....pretty decent
Bottle  Floral (from hop), malty nose; A bit thin but very fine bitter body; Quite bitter finish with a little hop to it. Ordinary, but pleasant beer.
What a great lager. Well malted with a wonderful hoppy snap. A nice, long slightly sweet finish.

Pours a translucent amber with an average light tan fluffy head.  Aroma was a nice floral and citrus hop with a caramel malt balance.  Flavor was malty with a light hop mix. Flavor was solid but a step down from the aroma. A very solid lager though.
Bottle, from sampler pack. Very good lager. Nice and hoppy & malty at the same time. Very well balanced.
Pours a clear amber color with a white head.  Aroma is a bit malty with some fruit.  Taste is smooth, a bit hoppy and dry on the finish.  A very solid lager.

Bottle. Pours a golden amber color and very clean and clear. Nice creamy white head that dissipated slowly. Ring, with wonderful lace that left the surface covered in a thin layer of foam the whole way down to the bottom. Clean bitter hop taste to start, fading into sweet fruity flavors - such as peach - then finishing with roasted malt flavors. Dry, clean finish. Nice medium body. Balanced. Pleasant carbonation that makes it refreshing. A very solid lager. Definitely not the best lager around, but my favorite so far - taking into consideration value and quality.

Poured from the botte at The Railway in Putney (London), golden amber with a large rocky head. quite a bit of carbonation. A fruity aroma of apples and peaches. Fruit again in the flavour - definitely peaches. The carbonations works well, a dryish aftertaste. I dont typically favour a lager, but this must be one of the best, I see why it is so highly rated.
One of my favourite lagers around at the moment. crisp taste with lots of hops and malt.
Aromatic and bitter, tempting color, and a deep lingering flavor with lots of hops and malt. A really good lager.
Amber with a white head. Taste is clean and crisp with a decent hop bite. . Nice dry finish as well. Very nice, flavorful lager that I would definitely get again.

The aroma is a pleasent combination of fruit and malt undertones.  It is a rich amber color with a frothy beige head.  The head is fully lasting and the lacing is considerable.  Initially there is a burst of hop flavor with a caramel malt taste coming through.  The finish is dry a bitter.

i cant believe i havent rated this and i picked this up in okinawa of all places / its a decent brew; i like it / maple brown body, slightly hazy, tiny beads of bubbles stream upward, soft light tan head, little to no lacing; smooth, slightly prickly; slight pine and floral notes, toastiness, lime tartness with a slightly sweet and juicy aftertaste; not bad, not bad...

Small white coarse-laced head shrinks to a thin white ring. Hazy light brown body. Sweet, fruity, caramelly aroma with strong citrus hop profile. Malty, bitter taste, somewhat watery. Bitterness with fruity notes lingers. A very good, and quite untypical, dark lager.

Brooklyn Lager pours to a beautiful deep golden color with a thick white head, and a good bit of carbonation. The nose on this is very nice with a good balance of grassy and citric hop aromas and crisp and biscuit like malt aroma. Brooklyn Lager is hopped with both Hallertau and Cascade hop varieties. The palate is firm with some good pale malt flavor, a touch of malt sweetness, and a clean and smooth body. Three malts go into this beer including 2 row pale, caramel, and carapils. Brooklyn Lager finishes with more crisp and biscuity malt flavor up front, then ends with a grassy, citric bitter hop bite, that balances this beer out very nicely. 

This is a well done lager that is brewed from a pre-Prohibition lager recipe. Its not my favorite craft golden lager on the market, but this beer, like all Brooklyn products is rock solid.

Pours copper with a thin creamy white head.  Aromas of of honey, toffee, yogurt and some delicate hoppy notes.  Taste is hoppy with some nice bitter citrus and tarte malt characteristics.  Finish is lemony and slightly tarte.

This beer pours a sweet reddish amber color, and leaves a thin white head that disappates quickly. The smell is very malty with caramel aspects that give hints of honey and lemon. The taste of this lager is crisp and refreshing the sticky sweet malt weighs on your palate in a good way and there is a lemon wheat flavor on the palate that makes this a balanced refreshing brew to drink all day def session quality.
Bottle.  Sweet corn and peach aroma.  Orange amber with moderate head.  Slight sweet peach and malt flavor.   A bit on the sweet side but overall okay.

Bottle.  Bought by accident, surprisingly pleasant.  hoppy citrust aroma, hoppy flavor.  very interesting for a lager.  Then again its not your usual cheap lager w/ adjuncts.  good for it.  there is stll some unpleasant bottom fermenting "tin" flavor to it, but good for something billed as lager... its even coppery with a nice head and some lacing

UPDATED: FEB 10, 2006 Bottle.  Pours golden with a thick off-white head that lingers awhile.  A nice hoppy floral/citrus scent.  Similar flavor, with more hops than most lagers, hints of yeast and maybe a very vague maltiness, and a dry, rather bitter finish of grapefruit hops.  Medium to light body, but slightly too carbonated.  Overall not a bad lager.

I wasnt real enamored with this selection; however, lagers are probably my least favorite style, so that may be why.  A clear golden pour with an off-white head.  A hint of a floral in the nose and some wood on the palate.  Also a dry character and a hair too much carbonation.  It may be a better selection for the summer.

Bottle. Pours dark, hazy orange with off-white head. Flowery hoppy lager aroma. Flavors are mostly flowery/grass/straw, with malts sort of taking a backseat. Hints of yeast and hops. Satisfying lager, but too low on the malts.
bottle.  Poured a light amber with a medium head.  Hoppy aroma with citrus and pine notes.  Flavor was a bit of caramel and hops.. Medium mouthfeel with good carbonation.

12 oz. bottle.  Pours a rich amber, which is darker than most lagers, with a decent white head. Light fruity nose. Nice strong hop presence in the taste, which was surprising for a lager. Very enjoyable and easy to drink!

Poured a light amber with a decent white head that dissipated quickly.  Ive liked Brooklyn beers so was excited to try this one.  Some malt in the nose, but I sense more hops than anything else.  Not bad, but unexpected.  Nothing about the flavor stands out, basically a middle-ish malt-hop flavor with some extra bitterness in the dry end.  Not bad, but this is my least favorite Brooklyn beer.

Bottle-Pours a nice amber/orange color with moderate head. Hoppier than I expected for a lager, guess thats the "Pre-Prohibition" recipe. I didnt really taste any malt flavor to balance it out, just a long hoppy, dry, metalic  aftertaste. Dont understand all the buzz about this beer, just seems average to me. Didnt find it very refreshing.

Aroma is full for a lager, closer to some brown ales Ive had. Kinda nutty, malty. The taste is where you can tell its a lager. Malty, slightly dry, but not corny like cheaper lagers, surprising dry hop bitterness at the end. Overall very pleasant. Goes well with pizza, too.
12z bottle.  Clear, sharp and a nice golden glowing hue.  Sweet, apply, fruity, citrus hop nose.  Sweet smooth and a great hop bitterness.  Classic!  Honey!  Ambrosia!

355 ml bottle. Light amber. Nice head that stays. Characterful hoppy aroma. Hefty amounts of piney and floral hops. Lively carbonation gives the beer a bubbly apperance in the mouth. I like the aroma a lot better than the flavour. Flavourful, but perhaps a tad monotonus. The malts are subdued and do not balance the hops. Dry aftertaste. These pre-Prohibition beers are so much better than our modern lagers. I’ve tried the New York Lager from Nørrebro Bryghus and I still prefer theirs to this one.
for a "lager: this bad boy is pretty hoppy.  A slightly floral aroma.  When was brooklyn the brewing capital of the east coast?  I need to check that one out.

On tap at Brooklyn Brewery, Williamsburg, Brooklyn, NY.  Clear amber beer having small white diminishing head and spare lacing. Average carbonation. Fresh hoppy aroma. Light-to-medium bodied that starts with light sweet malt and tongue lashing hoppiness.  Finishes dry with long lasting hop bitterness. This beer is more of an IPA than Brooklyns IPA!  This is a good drinkable hoppy beer. Hopheads take note.

UPDATED: SEP 9, 2006 This beer is good, but what the heck is pre-prohibition about it?  Pre-prohibition lagers are made from 6-row and corn, which this has neither.  And they didnt use cascade hops, which dominate this beer.  Good, but a big fat lie.

Grapfruity, piney aroma is nice, with a clear orange pour and some sort of head. Flavor is pretty much nowhere though, with no finish and only moderate flavor up front. What is there is a touch malty with decent american hops flavor.

Everything about this beer was a pleasant surprise, from its mid amber colour and sweet malt aroma to its intense bitter finish. Interesting and refreshing. I wonder if Asda, where I bought this bottle, could be persuaded to ship other Brooklyn products to the UK.

Just when I thought I was over lager altogether ...  This is a damn fine example of the style.  The best looking lager Ive seen, with a rich amber inner fire and a creamy head.  A good hop/malt balance adds to the character on drinking, and it finishes strongly with a pleasingly dry fruitiness about it.  Why cant we get lagers like this on tap in the UK instead of the succession of Carlings, Carlsbergs and Stellas that dominate?
Very nice color and lingering head. Aroma is nice with maltiness. Taste is very good but with some coppery metallic aftertaste on the back of the tongue. Very nice hoppy finish.

Bottle (12oz).  Poured slightly hazy amber-gold, not much head.  Pleasant amount of hops, fair amount of mildly oaky sweet light roast malt.  Taste is more hoppy than malty, where the aroma was on the sweet side, the flavour is more bitter.  Decent linger, average body for the type, almost astringent mouthfeel, gets a little "dishwatery" by the end of the bottle.  Definitely not a pale lager, this is the bitterest "Vienna" Ive had - and very good at that, although the finish doesnt hold up too well.
Bottle.Amber. Quickly dying head. Strong taste of hops and smell of flowers. Long aftertaste.
UPDATED: FEB 8, 2006 IT was another Lager in the festival, but it was not discusting as most macro lagers, I liked it so far, but it was mor elike a light Pilsener. Like El Salvadors.

This is one of my favorite lagers I have ever had.  It has a nice color with a decent head.  The aroma has a lot of hops.  The flavor is strong and lasting into the very nice bitter aftertaste.  This is a great beer to go all night with.  And it goes very well with my favorite scotch, THE GLENLIVETT.
Bottled. Amber colour with a decent sized white head. Floral hop aroma. Nice malty taste with some hops and caramel. Long bitter finish. Nice fullish mouthfeel. Enjoyable.

Jax Beer and Wine, Atlanta, Ga - 12 oz bottle. Pours a light amber color with a slight off-white head. Aroma has a perfumey, sweet essence to it with some floral accents to it and a citrusy back end. Flavor has some sweet caramel notes, hints of ripening vegetables, and a hint of mosquito repellant. Mouthfeel is decently thick for a lager and it finishes strong.  Surprised and impressed.

Amber in colour with a nice big white head. Disappears quickly though. Has a little fruity and hoppy aroma. Malty and a little sweet taste with the bitter hops coming in the end leaving a nice mouthfeel.

Bottled, pasteurised, Wetherspoons World of Beer Promo. Deep amber colour, white head, not over carbonated. Surprisingly decent beer, heady fragrant hops with a good chunky dry malt body. Long finishing late hops, a very enjoyable beer.
This was a good solid lager. It was pretty hoppy and sweet and had a good smooth taste. Was hoping for a little thicker taste though.

Amber pour with frothy, solid head.  Aroma of flowery hops, crisp lager taste but with a strong floral character which definitely dominates any malt presence.  Exceptionally clean, no discordant notes or bad aftertaste.  Pretty good stuff.
One of the best lager beers I have experienced--tastes more like an ale with a stronger hoppy taste. Dark red in color with a small amount of head.
355 ml bottle, bought in Denmark. Amber colour, large foamy head. Very nice flowery and fruity sweet aroma. Flavour is somewhat less interesting, some toffee, nuts and dusty hops. Bitter finish.

UPDATED: FEB 3, 2006 Unexpected. Aroma is sudden and unexpected as soon as i open the bottle, floural hops and grapefruit. Taste is similar with enough malt to balance it out nicely making this a very drinkable and enjoyable, what i would call pale ale rather than lager. Wetherspoons now sell it so winner all round.

I bought this beer on the recommendation of my liquor store owner, and have regretted the decision ever since.  Unbalanced hops, an unenjoyable bitterness, and a watery palate combine to render this beer virtually undrinkable.
[bottle from peckhams] Pours dark brown with a moderate head. Aroma is sweet fruitymalts with some breadish notes. body is light and it has a little bitterness in the finish.

UPDATED: JUN 17, 2007 re-rate - malty but very hoppy aroma.  amber colored with a large off-white head.  flavor is awesome with lots of bready malt and tons of hops.  perfect balance.  very nice beer....... 

9/8/05.  malt aroma.  amber color.  fresh hops with a  good malt balance.  this is an excellent beer and a favorite from this company.
Nice carmel color and a sweet white head fill the eyes while the powerful dry hopped aroma fills your nose with joy.

Deep rich color for being a lager.  Rocky offwhite head.  Hoppy aroma springs out of the glass.  Drinks more like an ale than a lager.  Smooth maltiness with a goodly amount of hops.  One of the better lagers Ive sampled.

This bottled brew poured a medium sized head of light brown colored foamy fine to medium sized mostly lasting bubbles that left behind a transparent softly carbonated caramel brown colored body and a very good lacing.  The aroma was mildly malty and the mouth feel was mild with a tingly smooth start.  The flavor was mild and slightly off with sweet malty notes.
