Bottle. Poured a small sized off-white head that was creamy and smooth, small, medium and large sized bubbles, sparse lacing, transparent, carbonated, and a copper hue. Malty, caramel, hoppy, and sweet nose. Flavor was malt, caramel and hops. Smooth palate. Light-medium body.

Bottle. Pours golden amber, a little darker than expected for the style. Fresh hops and sweet malt on the nose. Medium-light body, flavors of citrusy hops and buiscuity malt; dry, crisp finish. Doesnt have the smooth texture of some lagers, and I dont know if Id identify it blindly as a lager. Drinks more like a light American pale or amber. Im consistently pleased with Brooklyn, and this is a tasty take on the style.

Draught. Light amber color with thin head. Not much nose, but got a whiff of hop spruce and malt. Fairly hoppy flavor with some caramel undertones. First fe sips were good, but the flavors wane quickly. Moderate carbonation. Overall, not much character and a bit pedestrian. Put in perspective, though, its a much better lager than the macros.

Pours a med amber with a frothy white head. Aroma is of munich cookiness and floral hops. The flavor is very hop accented with some earthiness and a nice caramel bicuitiness. Med. bodied. The bitterness is med but higher than any other lager I have had. This is well balanced and an interesting American lager, so much better than Samuel Adams, I have to cringe every time I hear that they are the #1 craft brewer in the country.

UPDATED: DEC 14, 2006  Bottle.  Dark amber, malty burnt caramel aroma, some hop aroma, very carbonated in mouth with toffee flavours, some hop toffee finish.  Not too sweet thankfully 3.3/5

Re-rate. I love the hops on this now. Just wonderful. I dont get the toffee  so much nor was it over carbonated. I must like it as I bought two bottles in quick succession from Tesco.
starts out Ok, with floral aroma and reasonable appearance with head. First sips fine, but tires quickly. Not so drinkable. Some bitterness and balance. Malts and Ok aftertaste but just damn boring
Very excellent lager from someone who typically doesnt enjoy vienna/pilsener/most lagers in general :)  Excellent malts tasting of caramel, burnt sugar, and candy with a nice hop accent.
12 oz bottle-pours a deep off white creamy head that stays around, then laces nicely while drinking.  Color is amber.  Taste is creamy, with the hops coming through.

12oz bottle - Pours amber with a fair offwhite head.   Aroma is floral but you can certainly tell that there is some malt behind those hops.  Flavor starts out bitter and almost sour.  Lemon and grapefruit soon give way to the sweet caramel malts that dominate the flavor of this.  On the palate this is medium bodied and a very nice vienna.  I liked this one.
Clear orange golden color, short head. Nice aroma of hops, quite floral and flowery. Taste is bitter, dry, caramel malt. I like these kinds of beers.
Floral aroma. Very nice. Amber/gold appearance. Got a bitter taste, malty. Nice palate.

Pretty decent floral hoppy aroma. Very strong and penetrating. Clear, amber-gold coloured with a thin, white head. Taste is bitter and sweet. Floral hops in it. Clean palate. Thanks to Noize for the import.
Not a bad beer. I tried several of this breweries beers all were pretty good but nothing stood out.

on tap at Calcada in Newark, "summer suds" event.  brownish golden color, mostly clear.  light tan foamy/thick head.  aroma is citrusy, fresh lime.  flavor is lime peel, dry hops.  high carbonation. tangy dry finish.  a little malt sweetness.

Draft at new watering hole called Homestead. Dark amber color with medium head that diminshed quickly. Medium malty and floral aroma. Medium body. Good full flavor with smooth dry finish. Above average lager.

UPDATED: JUL 11, 2005 fabulous beer!
i want to drink this at a hot summer midnight!
this beer has peculiar smell.
somebody might be poor at this smell.
in this case, try cooled one.
12oz Can: Easy drinking, tasty and well balanced; mild flowery and grassy hopping; session summer beer extraordinaire

Pours an amber body with minimal head. Aroma is flowery and malty. For a lager the aroma is AMAZING. There was actual complexity. Flavor is malty and bitter with a dry finish, enjoyable but nothing to write home about. For a lager this was exceptional.
A very mild an pleasant beer. The best thing about it is actually the aroma which is very malty and yet fresh. Excellent color as well.

Pours clear amber, almost an iced-tea orange with a thin white head.  Floral hoppy aroma.  Sweet blend of light tart bitterness with full malty hops.  Full body with slight creamy mouthfeel and a hoppy finish that left me craving more.  Overall a pleasant surprise and a good drinking beer.

Pours deep golden with an off-white head. Aroma is sourish and hoppy. Flavour is sweetish with a rich hoppy bitterness, which lingers for a good time; not really wellbalanced, but rather provocative. I like that - go get em tiger!!! Still quite drinkable, though, and by far the best lager Ive had.

Bottle
Golden amber, lacing tanned head. Fat grassy and piney hop aroma.
Medium body, bready malt notes, the hops from before - feels a bit light on the tip of the tongue.

Poured a clear brassy color with a moderate, sudsy cap of foam. The nose was of toasted caramel and floral hops with a small snap of citrus notes as well. The taste stated malty and clean with a hearty dose of toasted caramel and spicey, floral hop accents. The end brought a tea like hop character evening things. The feel was medium to light. A touch of copper sealing a well integrated mix of dry caramel and German hops in the finsh. A well made all purpose lager.

UPDATED: AUG 29, 2008 Rerate:Big floral and citrus hop bouquet with nice round underlying toasty, biscuity malt profile.  Clear deep golden-copper body is topped by a generous and constantly replenishing white head that laces well.  Bready malts are apparent without overpowering sweetness.  Bitterness is pronounced yet balanced and floral and citrus notes linger.  Dry medium body with lightly prickly and very refreshing effervescence that lasts throughout.  Really a good solid American lager.  It has notes of a vienna but a pedigree all its own.  Lager glass.  Just above fridge temperature.  Bottle (Toby’s, Aug-08).Original Rating (7-4-6-3-14=3.4): Bready, biscuity malts are apparent in the nose with some herbal hop notes.  Clear copper-amber with a thin, white head that recedes to ring.  Moderately bitter with light herbal, minty hop flavour and some grainy malts.  Bready/biscuity sensation in the nose is much less apparent in the fairly sweet, though dry flavour.  Medium light body is somewhat watery though carbonation is decent.  Sampled at Mondial de la Bière 2005.

Couleur ambrée dapparence claire, faible mousse blanche ne couvrant pas tout le dessus du verre.  Une touche de grain est présente, surtout diacetyl en aromes, beurre et butterscotch semblent masquer la présence des autres éléments.  Grain frais et herbes en bouche, le beurre est toujours présent.  Texture allant vers laqueuse, corps mince, carbonatation offrant un bon support et semblant approprié au style.  Échantillon, mondial de la bière, Juin 2005.

Clear light amber body, gentle off-white head. Very toasty caravienna reminiscent malt. Minty fresh cereals, cane sugar and vegetal undertones contribute to add some depth to the mostly sweet aromas. A slight buttery aspect matches the light woody dryness well to my taste and somehow, vienna malt seems to pair with butterscotch pretty well to develop a grainy dryness that strikes more as fresh cereals, nutty and bready than anything else. Very lagery body, slightly watery yet with an oily aspect and pleasant low carbonation.
I had this draft in New York.  Surprisingly enjoyable with a simple cheese burger.  Enough malt, full hoppy bitterness, and a great creamy mouthfeel.  Surprisingly enjoyable for a lager.

Poured darker gold, with a lasting white head. Aroma is quite hoppy and floral, with some decent biscuity malt to back it up. Very refreshing hoppy flavour, and not all that thin in body either. Nice session lager.
UPDATED: AUG 19, 2009 A great beer, great hoppy aroma with a balanced malt taste, very enjoyable.  POurs nice a dark, full of life and ready for action. One of the best lagers out there.

Aroma:caramel and ggood hops flavor....
Appearance:orange,ligh head...
Flavor:malt caramel good bitterness..

A fine beer and one that I think is underrated here, as are most clean, well made lagers. No this is not a double IPA or a monster Imperial Stout, but a well made, hoppy, crisp lager. It pours amber with a fluffy head that lasts and lasts leaving ribbons of lace. This sample was a bit old and so the hoppy aroma has faded a bit, but it is still there in the aroma and flavor- herbal and blending nicely with the maltiness that is the foundation of this style. Well done, and like Sam Adams, this one is better fresh, like most average alcohol beers.

Clean style with more character than one typically associates with the style. Shows good hop and malt balance with no portion drowning out the other. Hints of chocolate late in the palate speak more of an English ale style. Consumed on tap at the Blind Tiger in NY.

Bottle. Lovely acidic, hoppy aroma, a little perfumy. Bright copper colour, unstable white head. Flavour starts off quite bitter, turning flowery and acidic and finishing with a nice bitterness. This beer is very nicely hopped on all levels.
Golden amber colour with a fine off-white head. Lovely fruity and flowery aroma. Flavour is quite hoppy on top of a solid malty base.

Bottle, at home.
Golden amber with white head, almost lasting. Good lacings. Aroma light of hops (flowery) and malt. Flavor light sweet, then heavy bitter. Light body, watery, lively carbonated.
one of the better lagers but i suppose that isnt saying a whole lot in my book.  more character than most lagers.  eh.

Bottle. Nut much of an aroma and average appearance. Great flavor, however! Nice and malty with a touch of hops. Smooth mouthfeel as well.
Definitely one of the better lagers Ive tasted.
Bright orange in colour with big creamy head. Big hoppy flavour, is more of an english bitter. Is an interesting interpretation of and English beer and has done a bad job.
Very full and frothy.  very hoppy too.  very dark, would like to try a fresher bottle
Golden with an average white head.  Aroma is filled with flowery, citrusy hops, with a bit of cookie sweetness.  Flavor is piney and a bit malty, and the finish is dry and a bit astringent.
UPDATED: JUL 2, 2007 Citrussy and hoppy, this is a very refreshing and pleasant beer. Pours a dark amber with small head. Sweet aroma, fresh flavour and good mouthfeel. The first vienna Ive liked :)
Bottled. Golden colour, huge white head. Fruity and hoppy aroma. Smooth palate and flavour of berries and fruit. ot much aftertaste. Good balance.

Bottled
Golden color, small but steady white head. Flowery, fruity nose. Extremely well-balanced malt and hop character. Feels more like pils than lager (what this Vienna means here?).  Flowery, hoppy, world class brew.

UPDATED: OCT 10, 2006 (Bottled, 5.2% ABV) Deep golden-copper color with a medium, firm and lacy head. Toffeeish, nutty-hoppy aroma with some floweriness, berries and butter. Quite strongly bitter, slightly roasted-malty and woody-nutty-hoppy flavor with a salty and mildly acidic finish. Sticky, bitter-woody aftertaste. Medium-bodied, slightly harshly bitter, mildly acidic palate with a bit fizzy carbonation. A slightly harsh and watery, but overall quite balanced and tasty brew with nicely aromatic hopping. Certainly one of the best Viennas out there.

Bottle. Amber with white head dragging Belgian lace at is collapses. Aroma is citrussy, which is repeated on the palate complemented by some light spiciness. Finishes with some bitterness. Thin mouth ffel with lively carbonation. An OK beer, but too dominated by the hops.
This is Brooklyns flagship beer. Its a golden copper that offers a sweet caramel aroma. It manages a nice malty taste. The aroma for this is much more appealing that the actual taste.
a great beer from brooklyn this lager goes down smooth and has a very nice color to it is a great beer to go with a meal or if you just want to have one while you are out

Is this a lager?
Im impressed! This is by far the best lager Ive ever tasted. Its full of flavour, aroma and fruity like a good ale.

(Bottle 35,5 cl) Quite dark - and very pretty - amber colour, limited head. The top quality aroma hops are revealed already in the nose and certainly when the first drops hit the tastebuds. Nice bitternes, but first and foremost aroma, with a fine malty body. A fine example of an excellent microbrewed American Lager.
Descent beer.  I like the maltiness in Viennas.  This had a maltiness similar to the Sam Adams.  It is a worthwhile session beer but not one I would have again.
comes in a six pack that my gf bought me as a present.  this is one of the less impressive ones, but still good.
I really enjoyed this beer.  Has a great smelling aroma.  A real hoppy fruitful flavor that I really enjoyed.  I would definitely get it again.
Brownish color with a head that was gone pretty quickly and was virtually nonexistant.  Malty aroma with a bite of a hoppy in the flavor and the aftertaste.  Pretty good, but not amazing.
Dark color with off white head. Aroma of honey and hops. This was quite possible the best lager I have had, and i am not a huge fan of the style, try this one.

Slightly hazy, deep gold in colour with a fine tight white head, that lasts. A big nose of malt initially, but a fantastic fruitiness from the hops comes creeping in.Quite a complex flavour with malt well balanced by a delicious citrus note from the hops. Have liked this for years, unfortunately not always available around here. A fine brew that has not diminished in character over the years, a treat!!!

UPDATED: MAY 17, 2007 Fridge Temp. Aroma is toasted malt with coffee overtones. Creamy head diminishes. Amber in color. Cloyingly sweet to the point of unappetizing. Has a strong honeysuckle flavor dominating, reminds me of Bit OHoney candy bar. Mouthfeel is light, watery with soft carbonation. Finishes as if you licked a spoon of honey.

Bottle at On the Rocks.  Nice yeasty aroma with a fine amber pour that was suprising for a lager.  The taste was also impressive with hints of honey, oats, and hay.  Nice smooth mouthfeel and medium body.  Needs a slight addition of malts but overall this was a great choice for the price.
An easy drinking lager from a great brewery. Nice light brown color with a lasting head. This would be a great beer for a summertime cookout.
Strong Cascade aroma/flavor similar to Sierra Nevada Pale Ale which I do not care for. Other than that it wasnt bad.

poured amber with decent thicknexss of white head.  very smooth, with good taste.  hint of spice and citrus mixed with yeast and wheat.  medium body and feel.  Very SLIGHT alcohol burn.  finshed strong and stayed around.

Bottle pours a fiery orange, translucent, small fizzly white head, soft carbonation, with fairly attractive carbonation. &nbsp Minor oat/barley like aroma, with hints of wheat bread. &nbsp Semi-sweet on the tongue, malty, slightly bready, and a bit oily. &nbsp Medium body and mouthfeel. &nbsp Finishes with a bit more of a soft hop background. &nbsp Not bad, but wishing it was a bit maltier. &nbsp Thanks goes out to radiomgb for the trade!

Had on tap at Park Slope indie-rock venue, later found six-pack in local supermarket. Being from Brooklyn I felt I had to try this beer, and I wasnt dissapointed. 
Tap has slightly better aroma than bottled, both had a translucent amber appearance, and a better flavor than I expected though again tap wins over bottled. Finish was ok, may have lasted a little longer than desired but overall this is a good choice.

Golden yellow colored, with active carbonation and a medium foamy head, this was a classic looking lager when poured into a Pilsner glass from the signature minimalist Brooklyn styled brown bottle.  The aroma indicated presence of sweet honey and caramel malt and noble grassy hops in this beer, and after the first sip I could tell that it did not lie.  Medium bodied, bready, sticky, creamy, and slightly salty, this is a moderately flavored, crowd pleasing lager with enough character, and hoppy bite, so that it would not disappoint even the seasoned beer connoisseur (among whose ranks I would not place myself, I might add).  Worth seeking out if in the mood for some simpler pleasures.

UPDATED: DEC 27, 2004 (12 oz bottle, obtained in trade with shadey, thanks Shane!) Not just your generic lager, this one has a lot of flavor.  A toasty, malty, somewhat sweet flavor is nicely balanced by a mildly bitter hops, which prevents the palate from getting too sweet and tiring.  But as the beer finishes, it takes on more characteristic flavors of a lager.  It starts off nicely, but doesnt finish as well.  Malty, lightly sweet nose smells a bit like an Oktoberfest.  The color is light amber and slightly cloudy.  Smallish off-white head fades to a rim after a bit, and theres only a few specs and dots of lace on the glass.  So dont let the label fool you, this is much better than a generic lager.  That fact may account for what I think are inflated ratings.  In the end, its still a pretty average microbrew with some "lagerish" tendancies in the finish.

Almost clear amber color with thin white head. Aroma of toffee, like an English ale. Decent body with moderate carbonation. Flavor of caramel, malt and hops with a somewhat harsh bitter finish. My bottle is a bit oxidized but then Im a good distance from Brooklyn. This beer is particularly good when fresh.

12 oz bottle from Premier Gourment, consumed in a hotel room in Fredonia, NY.  Deep gold with reddish ruddy hints, fluffy lasting head...biscuity malt and light herbs in the nose...fresh grassy character in the body, some  orangy sweetness, biting dry late hoppiness, very full.
Amber-brown with a tan head. Sweet smelling, hoppy, citrusy. Taste is slighgtly malty, with some hop character as well... in fact, lotsa citrusy hop character towards the finish. Nice.
Aroma of hops and some malt, dark amber, small custard head. Malt flavour with some hops afterward. Medium bodied, bitter aftertaste, seems like a Pale Ale? A nice beerm doesnt fit the style.

clear golden orange, off white head.  citrusy hop aroma with some freah bready malt and pine.  juicy malt flavour support big orangy, tangy hop flavours.  bitter floral hop finish.  was excellent with a good burger.  very nice.

Looks, smells, and tastes like a lager should.   Amber color with a light white head, the nose is malty, with a bit of yeast.  Body is solid, with malt flavor giving way to a crisp, slighly bitter finish.  I had this right after a bottle of Victory Lager, and this easily crushed Victorys offering.

Clear, pale amber-brown body with a good head. Theres a slight tingle in the nose. The flavor has a slightly bready malt. This is extremely drinkable and actually not a bad beer by any stretch. I actually preferred this over the disapointing Pilsner.
One of the best lagers Ive tryed. Has a real good malt, something like cornflakes is in the aroma and flavor. Nice large white head.

Bottle - thanks to slob.  Wow, this is a lager?  Pours nice amber with a small white head that diminishes mostly and leaves some lacing. Aroma is more pale ale-ish, sweet maltiness and plentiful hops.  Flavor is rich and full, lots of toasty, slightly fruity malts and bouquet of tart, citrus and herby hops.  Light to medium body and gentle, creamy carbonation.  Very nice beer!

Golden colour with a little white head.
Fine aroma of malt, hops and aromahops. Good malty taste with lots of hops.
A very good lager.

On Tummits tap At Summitts Wayside Taven during the Brooklyn Brewing Tasting...Nice full body for a Lager...Plenty of caramel malts to this one...Lcking a bit in some hop characters but maybe not for the style...Definite session brew

Pours a beautiful sparkling amber with a small, but lasting head. Nice malty floral aroma. Taste has notes of caramel, toasty malts, toffee, floral hops and some citrus qualities. Has the perfect amount of sweetness with a lightly bitter aftertaste. Great malty body - full and creamy on the palate with lively carbonation. Great lingering sweetness. Good head retention. Im impressed.

From Eyedrinkale. Thanks. Fantastic hoppy lager with muted malt notes. Very quenching and light without being watery. Really beefed up version of a lager, but still has the "light" elements of palate and body.

Good stuff.

UPDATED: MAR 24, 2008 Bottle 355ml (6 pack)
Appearance:   Amber (with slight haze ?), on top impressive solid creamy head . Nose :Refreshing , sweet caramel blended with good dose of wet leaf hops , bitter fruity ending.7+ Flavor/Palate : Medium full bodied. Plenty of bread rye like malt , traditional , fulfilling. Hops show up just I time but they play more subtle note than aromas. Despite softening effect of juicy malt hops managed to make fairly crisp, semi dry brew. Versatile lager that id great for every occasion. (f-8)

I had just read an interview with Garrett Oliver, and I just thad to try this brew. Frankly it devilvered all expectation. I was a bit doubtful at first because of a bad previous experience with a (Maroccan) Vienna, but this was definitly different: Low off-white long-lasting head, gold brown colour, and a hint of honey in the very filling taste. A bit of fruit, too, making the whole experience thoroughly enjoyable.
This was a really good lager.  Had a copper color to it with a slight white head.  Had a very nice flavor and is one that i will drink again

UPDATED: AUG 22, 2006 2004 draught at the Burren.  Awesome color, copper brown, with some light golds, slight hint of haziness and a small off-white head.  Smells crisp, a mix of lager yeast, light toffee and plenty of fresh hops.  Flavor is very full and hoppy, with warm hints of caramel, maybe even slight chocolate and some honey and almonds all wrapped up in to a drinkable, medium bodied lager with no thinning.  I love the hops, they are perfectly balanced, always present but never dominant or astringent.
This is a decent lager, nothing special.  I was expecting a little better.  Relatively smooth with some overtones of malt and tangy flavors.  It will do.

Very very interesting lager.  Light copper color with good amount of head.  Aroma is a mixture of flowers and caramels.  Flavor is sweet and malty but with a good amount of hoppy finish, without being overly hoppy.  Very balanced and intricate.  Overall, well worth your money.

Somewhat cloudy orange/gold with a nice, frothy white head and visible streamers of carbonation.  Very... fresh aroma mostly hops, cascade I think.  Some malt in the taste, but more hops than anything else. When sufficiently warmed, more of the malt comes out, but they still play second fiddle. Slightly floral, somewhat piney.  The head lasted through the whole pint and the finish was crisp.   Weird for a supposed lager, but whatever, this stuff is pretty good!

Light amber colour. Off white lasting head. Good carbonation. Malty sweet aroma. Sherry? Malty flavour, sweet. More sherry. Well balanced by a flowery hoppy finish. A touch of underlying sourness? Perfumy notes too? Overall rahter hoppy for a lager, but good though.

UPDATED: NOV 14, 2004 Bottle.  Clear golden brown color.  Light but flavorful body - no way I would call it "thin". To my untutored taste, a Pilsner-like hoppiness.   A pleasantly bitter, lingering aftertaste.  BUY AGAIN?: Definitely
Dark golden color, light sweet malty aroma and taste, medium body, light bitter dry finish.

Light copper in color with a creamy off white head that laces well and lasts long. 

Its suprisingly hoppy with a well pronounced herbal, fresh and flowery aroma. 

The hoppiness is present in the aroma and very pleasant. Is this dry hopped? Very grainy flavor with toffee and caramel notes.

This is an all-malt lager which is great. Anyone trying to get into craft brewed beer would like this. 

Good solid bland lager.

A lighter amber color gives the idea that something isnt going to be the same with this beer in the realm of lagers.  Tasting it reinforces that thought.  The flavor is lighter and more flowery than most lagers.   I must say an interesting beer none the least.
Amber color with a medium thick head. Malty nose...a little hoppyness.  Nice sweet, malt taste...goes down real easy and the malt sticks with you. Props to Sancho for sending me this gem.

I found this beer to have an excellent flavor.  Very malty and sweet, with a very slight hoppy finish, but not a lot.  The malt really carries this beer.  I am a big fan of sweet malt beers, I ilke to call this a dessert beer.  Id definitely drink it again.
Amber color with decent sized head when poured into a pint glass. Aroma of malt, hops and citrus. The taste is flat with a thin body & mouthfeel. Bland and malty. Tastes of caramel.

UPDATED: OCT 27, 2006 This was my first staple beer.  Great stuff.  I will have to try it again before I go singing its praises, but I remember a great lager to be enjoyed anytime. 

RERATE: Amber color with a white film for a head. Nice doughy aroma that is very attractive.  Nice flavor and body.  A very pleasent all around session.
Draught.  Amber colored, clear, with white head.  Aroma is malty and hoppy.  Flavor is quite good.  I like the haoppiness at the end, and there is a decent malt balance.

A very good lager that I enjoyed in the best bar in the world (brickskellar Washington DC).  I had heard many good things about this brewry so I had to check this lager out. It has very good flavor in the malt.  A nice bit of hoppiness and it drank very smooth

Unless its from Germany I usually steer clear of that four letter word.....LAGER. This was honestly the first Vienna Ive had.  Poured out a golden color with a big white head. Had a typical lager aroma with some notes of sweet malts like carmel.  Right off the bat I was impressed by this lager. It had a nice taste with more complexity than expected with some notes of carmel and a slightly bitter finish. Not a bad brew at all
Deep golden color with a white head. The taste is a full malty pattern with a balanced slight dry bitterness on the palate.
This must be over-rated or maybe this was better in years past.  I was impressed by its color, its flavor was good but not exceptional, not worthy of being in the 70th percentile.

UPDATED: JUL 29, 2007 One of my all-time faves!  Pours mahogany with a tall, foamy head.  The aroma, which normally diminishes once the tastebuds have hit the brew, stays around for the session.  The roasted malt blends with the adequately crisp finish quite well, all the while dipping in caramel overtones.  The finish/aftereffects/effervescence hangs around (in a good way), inviting another pull.  Nice integration.
Golden-amber with ok head. Hoppy-citrus aroma. Caramel-nutty and bitter flavour. Nice palate.

08.25.04  12oz bottle.  Reddish amber pour with fine head.  Some flowery aromas are surprising along with a more comfortable biscuity and lemongrass nose.  Flavors are subdued, flitting atop a slightly sweet cardboardy front and a floral perfume that lingers in the throat and nose.  Not at all what I expected, not totally swell.  Better choice at this particualr bar than duds like Stella, Newcastle, Smithwicks, etc.
Pours amber in color, has nice hoppy smell to it.  Very nice hoppy bite in taste and goes down smooth.  Overall good for its style.

I sampled one bottle that I received in a trade with j_b for a IPA that I despised.  There was some head that disapated quickly.  The hops was most noticeable right off, but thabkfully not in the clean aftertaste.  Ill prefer Yuengling to this product.
Enjoyed this in a 20 oz "Brewtus" at the local Applebees after discovering they had it on tap.  I really enjoyed this, tasty and easy to drink.

Somewhat reminicent of a Sam Adams Boston Lager. Nice reddish-amber color and great hop/malt balance. The caramel maltiness is balanced out nicely by the citric/fruity hoppiness. Dangerously easy to drink. A well made "pre-prohibition" lager.

Thanks to the chick for bringing this back from NY for me.....very thoughtful.  Golden-amber in color.  Fresh bready malt aroma with some hops.  Flavor was very crisp, fresh, hoppy and cull....nice subtle yeastiness throughout.  A very good session beer.

Draught at Dojo, New York.A clear dark orange beer with almost no head. Full and sweet malty aroma with toffee tones. Very flavorfull for a lager. Malty and hoppy with notes of Brooklyn yeast and flowers. Nutty finish. A beer I could drink all night long....!

UPDATED: DEC 28, 2004 Tastes homemade to me - definitely made with the traditional 4 ingredients.  Nice amber color, started a little foamy but settled, with good proper residual head.  Excellent aroma, hops and flowers, nice sweet malt taste with perfect hops balance, no aftertaste (clean finish).  Loved it!  (ps this doesnt taste like a Vienna, more of a pale ale)

This lager has a cloudy golden to amber appearance with mild floral aroma, small white head, moderate hops are present with a strong grapefruit flavor in the taste. Smooth going down with a carbonation bite at the end. Nice Lager, I enjoyed it better than the pilsner.

(on bottle) I think it´s the best vienna I´ve had so far, the again; Negra Modelo is a vienna. This has all the stuff for a good thirstkiller. Both the sweetness of the malts and the freshness of the hops to the nose. A sweet/sour mouth, a tad too foamy. And a round, bitter finish. I´ts on my list in the bar, but not my favorite style.
On tap. Golden in color with a nice head. Nice floral hoppy aroma. Nice and clean tasting. Smooth. Decent beer.
Bottle. Golden in colour, floral hoppy aroma. Slight hoppy bitterness. Dry, flowery finish. Decent beer.

Fine stuff indeed.  This marzen-like brew is amber in color and malty in the nose and on the palate.  On the balance it is 75% malt/25% hops, just to keep it lively and enhance the aroma.  Taste is of honey and oranges.  Finish is clean.  This is the rare lager to sip rather than pound after mowing the lawn.

UPDATED: JUN 14, 2007 This is a damn fine beer. I wish I could get it at the local supermarket. If I could then this would be my number one beer in the fridge. Pours with a golden copper color and a tan puffy head. Head dissipates quickly but leaves a drop of lace behind. Aroma is sweet and malty with some hops on the back end. Flavor is slightly fruity for a lager, very malty and filling. Overall, everybody I know who has tried this beer has enjoyed it. It is smooth, satisfying, and delicious. If I knew this beer was so good when I lived in Brooklyn I might have never left. 

Tried this again recently; this time on draft. I noticed that the draft version has a distinct malty, scotch character to it. The more I explore this beer the more I find to like about it.

Note: June 14 2007, Guess what? Lucky me, this beer is now available locally. As promised its on the top shelf of my fridge in its new permanent spot.

UPDATED: FEB 25, 2006 ReRate -- Winter 2006 -- well maybe I was just hankering for a bit of hops in London, but this out of the bottle had a bit more to it.  Reminded me a bit of a sam adams in its nice deepness and "american-ness."  Hoppy lagers arent bad.

Ehh... smell reminded me of a macro.  Nothing here at all to make me want more.  Very bland lager. (3/3/5/3/8)

Good stuff!  I have to say a surprisingly great Vienna from Brooklyn.  Nice and smooth, red orange copper hues, serious satisfying malty taste for the style and just a hint of hoppiness to go with it.

Light brown/amber with a medium sized off white head. Aroma of hops and malt.
Malty flavor that has a nice balance of hops.
Bottled: OK but a little thin. Mild hops with a faint malt follow. Ill have to try it again - maybe I got a bad one.

Basically I found this one to be citrussy hops on bland malt. Clear orange with a white lasting head. Hoppy aroma and flavor, and what seams to be Cascades???. It is smooth and clean, but not really my thing.
user_location: Good Beer Bar Deprived, New Jersey, USA

text: This is a fantastic beer. Brooklyns best, and thats saying something. Quite possibly the best lager brewed in the United States
35.5 cl bottle. Served in DBF 2004 sample glass. Dark gold. OK head. Fresh, hoppy aroma. The taste is dry and hoppy with a slight fruitiness. Easy to drink.

You know what,  For a lager, this is a pretty decent beer.  I had this after waiting over 20 minutes at a local pub to get the barmaids attention. Though nothing would be worth that wait, it was a pleasant surprise.  Great way to spend the last day of summer classes. No sleep til....BROOKLYN.

This one was excellent!  Pours dark straw with a medium, creamy, off-white head.  Aroma of malt, corn flakes, hops, and slight fruit and honey.  The tastes hits the papillae with layers of malt, fruit, honey, and a slightly dry, earthy finish.  This is a rock solid lager.  If Bluebeard had this stuff at sea, he might not have killed so many hookers.
Amber colored with little head and a hoppy aroma. Not a bad flavor for a lager, the hops are there, as well. A decent beer for the style.

UPDATED: NOV 19, 2008 Third attempt at rating. First one I was out to lunch. Second improved after a pint at the map room. Read "Beer School" and had to re-visit. Lasting fair head with a bit of lacing. Dark amber. Don’t get a lot of aroma but this is a nice aggressive hopped beer. Tasty dark caramel malt with a peppery finish and after taste.
Amber coloured. Rather hoppy aroma. Hoppy flavour. Dry finish. Fruity and flowery notes.

Lighter amber color, white head. Nice hop prescence, a little bit of bread. Flavor is a little malty, followed by a decent amount of hops. While nice, the hops left an odd astringent taste on my tongue. Medium bodied. Overall a nice beer to be given the dubious task of carrying the lager title for the brewery.

One of my all-time favorite beers.  Just this right rush of spice on the tips of the surface, jumping up at your tounge.  Good brown-gold color.  What else to say but I love it, and that flavor is unforgettable as you go through a night of well-wearing drinking at the bar after a long (insert:  week, day, hour).

I hadnt had one of these in a while and was really pleasantly suprised at how great it was. Really full flavored, nice body. A little sweet and flowery nose with some malt. Just enough hops to keep it smooth and not too thick. Ill be drinking this more often.
user_location: New York, east village, New York, USA

text: Awesome beer. Nice small slightly dark head and a dark amber color. Good strong flowery aroma, sorta malty. Caramel.  Flavor is a little strong but good. Little alcohol taste. Perfect lager.

I love the Brooklyn Brewery. Since I am a big lager fan, this is the stuff I drink normally (also because I am also from Brooklyn). Caramel colored with a bit of lacing on top. Nice refreshing smooth taste and uplifting aroma. Rich taste that you cant go wrong with.

Little short lasting head.  Amber brown color.  Caramel malt with earthy flowery hop aroma.  Light body.  Light bitterness accents slight malt taste.  Very little aftertaste, it finishes real quickly, almost as if it evaporates off of your tongue.

Had this brew on tap at some point in time during my stay in the big apple, but I cant remember when and where.  The notes are on one of my ATM reciepts for May 30th so that might have been the day.  Wonderful nose of citrus and ginger.  The brew is clear copper amber.  The white frothy head is mostly diminishing.  The neutral flavor has a moderate citrus acidity with a decent finish.  The light to medium body is soft and dry.
UPDATED: NOV 21, 2004 A fantastic lager. Darker and with more flavor than your average lager. Medium hops and very sweet. I was impressed.
Aroma is malt and sweetness.  Flavor is slight malt forward with a malty finish.  Nice light everyday beer.
Kind off dark. This is a very pleasant lager. Quite malty and sweet but with a nice balanced bitternes in the aftertaste. Great.
Dark golden, nice head. Aroma is metallic and also brings vanilla. Flavor is metallic too, a little bready and with some licorice. Peppery finish, a really good lager.

Bottled. DBF 2004. 
Amber colour. Flowery aroma with notes of caramel. Richly malty. A little too carbonated in my opinion. Also a bit harsh hoppiness. Bitter finish.

Bottled.
Amber. Some toffee and hop in the aroma.
Rather lively at first with a fine bitterness.
Bottled @ DBF2004: Golden coloured with an medium off white head. Fruity and light hoppy aroma. Some malts and caramel notes in the flavour. Ends in a light bitterness with some apple notes.
Amber color, nice white/brown/yellow, head. Aroma is metallic and floral. Flavor is metallic and a little spicy. Floral touches and also some vanilla. A very rich and nice tasting lager.
Amber colour with nice big head. Near perfect blend of hops and caramel malts. A nice example of this style of beer.

Bottle, just at expiration.  Pours clear amber with big head, stays around a while as rocky fluff.  Light floral aroma.  Body is there on tasting, pretty generous actually.  Tastes of caramel malt, honey, hops.  Sweet toffee aftertaste with hoppy slight metallic.  Quite different from their Pilsner, darker, sweeter, more body, hops are better here.  Decent lager but Im not heading out to buy more tomorrow.

Medium sized offwhite head, excellent retention and some splotchy lacing. Lightly hazy orange color. Fruity nose. Medium body. fruity, soapy flavors, hops and a hint of malt. The soapy flavor dominates. Finish is dry. Blaaah.
I really liked this beer - a lot more taste than whats going around in New York and definitely one of my favorites that can be easily found in this city.

Beautiful amber color. Very nice hoppy aroma, fruity, caramel. Reasonable body structure, featuring a quite strong caramel character supported by a strong (and quite aromatic) bitterness, and some fruitness (apricots).
Light brownish head,  to a red/brown body.  The appearance makes me wanna drink this beer! The taste is quite sweet and with a little flowery touch.

Orange/yellow gold coloring.  Minimal head.  Aroma is sweet floral.  Medium hops on the tongue to start.  Then smooth and some burn at the end. Body is mild, with some hops at the beginning and end and some minor sweetness in the aftertaste.  It starts strong and then weakens a bit and the nose seems more complex than the taste.
Also on draft at Silk City.  Good looking pour ( i poured it myself), but really a drikable and forgettable pint.  BTDT.

UPDATED: OCT 2, 2004 Bottled from bodega on 157th-dark Amber color  smooth not what i expected from A lager which is i guess why it's under Vienna. smooth drinking good. And it's my "hometown beer" malty too
A very good lager, with almost a pale ale quality to it.  Nice hop nose, with a good solid malt taste, this is how every lager should turn out.
Cascade nose, medium amber body, small white head. Cascades in a lager? That's different. This doesn't really work for me.

UPDATED: APR 21, 2004 Bottled sometime in 8-03(best before 2-04)As far as lagers go this is pretty intense.Aroma of so so juicy cascades(dark peachy aroma when warm_ and some grainy malts(In typical NY brew fasion).Almost amber/gold,OK head/good lace.For being 6 months+ old the hops really held well(is this pasturized?)More like an amber ale/APA than a lager.Hops and grain on the palate(thank God for hops).These are going for .69$.Decent.Eczematic's rating kinda nailed it though(commercial desciption dead on).
This shit kicks ass!!! I really love the look of the bottle, great design. It's smooth, crisp, clean and one of my favorites to pick up when i visit home (next to Yuengling of course).
Foamy white head tops a copper body.  Nose is hoppy, fruity, citrus.  Medium body.  Clean, crisp taste.  Thought it was a very good lager.

UPDATED: APR 8, 2004 Bottle.  Pours amber/brow.   Small head.  Smelled hoppy with a touch of caramel a little like SNPA.  The taste is great and gets even better when it warms.  Good hop to malt balance in the finish.  Excellent

UPDATED: MAR 11, 2014 This beer tastes a lot  like Samuel Adams Boston Lager to me. But, to me that is not a bad thing.+++ Sampled from a 12 oz brown bottle this beer pours a beautiful red-brown color with a small foamy tan head. There aroma was sweet, malty, with a definite presence of herbal hops. Strong hoppy flavor with some malt and sweetness. Medium length finish. Medium body. Ok.

I drinkit all the time and never review it. So why not today? I picked up a six pack at Wegmans.
This is a great lager. Not like what the macro breweries have done to the name. It has a really nice foral scent with a nice smooth malty and hoppy taste. Brooklyn has made one of the best lagers outside of Germany.

Copper and amber body with a thin, white head.  Crisp hop aroma with nice malt undertones of caramel and freshly baked bread.  The light to moderate body is refreshing an finishes cleanly.  A nice interplay in the mouth of hefty malt and piney hops.  Another well-crafted lager from the East Coast.

Blimey, a bit dark for a lager was my first thought until I came to enter the rate and discovered it is classed as a Vienna (my only previous Vienna being the "Mongolian Baadog). Any way, an intriguing ginger/gold colour, with a reddish tints. The aroma has dry bready malt with something a little sharp in the background. Much the same in the mouth, with orangey nuances. Sweet and sour finish. Not bad. Certainly better than your average lager. 355ml bottle from beersofeurope.co.uk
pours out redish in color, fruity tasting aroma.  thin non existant head, a little too sweet for my liking- but a good beer in general.

Bottle from Safeway, Shirley, West Midlands. Smells like an Amber Ale - bright malt and sweet orange chocolate. Orange colour, with an attractive white, fudge head, which leaves rugged lacing. Fresh and fruity to start off with, malty on the finish with plenty of oily orange throughout. Smooth, refreshing and with some tingle - superb.
This is a decent American Pre-Pro. Crisp and refreshing with more body and flavor than any current U.S. Marcos, and many imports as well. Refreshingly bitter.
Nice floral bouquet pretty golden appearance and fluffy head.   Good taste but a bitter finish.  Looked prettier than it tasted but overall a good showing.

UPDATED: DEC 28, 2012 Bottled.  Brown coloured lager with a berry fruit aroma.  Very full, malty flavour but the aftertaste is a bit too sweet for my liking.  Not particularly refreshing but drinkable none the less  Score 2.9Subsequent ratings scored 3.4, 2.8, 3.2, 3.5, 3.3 and 3.2. Average becomes 3.2

on tap:  this was is the brooklyn brewerys flagship beer, and was the most readily available for a while. now there are several others all over. i kinda got hooked on this when visiting nyc for lack of better beers to drink in a local bar. nice and hoppy like a pacific northwest pale ale, not as much flowery nose as you would think, more grassy. i always look for this one and you should too.
pretty odd stuff. some lemon zest in the aroma. tasted of anzac biscuit dough with a slow bitter finish

Pours chestnut brown with some reddened hues to it. Tall puffy tan head. Aroma is seemingly malt with a floral hop tinge to it. The taste seems more dominated by the hops and a splash of citrus comes along with it. Lighter malt tones throughout. Also, maybe some nuttiness as well. Finishes with a little bitterness and some more flowery aftertastes. Decent beer.

I was totally expecting this to be Saranac Lager since I saw "Brewed and Bottled in Uttica, NY". All I thought was Matt!!! I was wrong. Thank god. Well, this beer poured a deep amber, with a thick off-white head. The nose was sweet and citrusy. Orange peel, lemon zest, hops, and flowers. It has a slight creamy mouthfeel and a mildly dry finish. This was a very enjoyable brew.

The main thing that struck me about this one was the dark coloring - very dark for a lager of any kind.  Had a hop presence that is rare of a Vienna, and it made this one quite good.  Way better than the Brooklyn Ale.

I was at a loft party in, oddly enough, Brooklyn when I was told I had to sample some of this local lager. It wasn't half-bad. It wasn't the watered down piss I was expecting. It had a nice malty finish with a little hint of hops. Next time I'm in New York, I'll definitely have another bottle.

Just a wonderful, quietly delicious lager. Nothing about it begs for attention. It's just a smooth, crisp lager perfect for a hot Summer day. I bought a 6 pack of this stuff once a week one Summer when I was in college. Broke as I was, it had to be Brooklyn Lager and it was worth paying $7 a six pack for such an elemental pleasure. I have never tired of it and I can't recommend it enough.

A very good lager. Deep amber pour with a nice lacing head around the glass. Aroma had hops which I thought was quite pleasant! Somewhat 
bitter with the taste, smooth, and a kick of hops which I enjoyed. Another good brew I've had from Brooklyn! Had this in the US Airways Terminal at Laguardia Airport (LGA).

UPDATED: DEC 12, 2008 [draft at The Distillery - Rochester, NY] Very light aroma, nice deep amber color with nice lacing, small tan head. Wonderful flavor of fruit mixed with hops. Medium body with a slightly bitter twang to it. The finish is smooth with very little aftertaste. I did not know what to expect from it but I was surprised and pleased.

I cracked this open expecting your standard piss-gold lager, and was treated to a fine amber bodied brew with a small tan head.  Aroma is malty and sweet.  Flavor is very nice, a touch of hops with a creamy malt backbone, which fades into a subtle and dry finish.  A great surprise.

bright amber colour, moderate head, well-hopped, beautiful flowery and light buttery aroma, medium-bodied, slightly oily with a medium bitterness, the finish is dry with a flowery hoppiness - a very pleasant beer which I could imagine drinking on a regular basis (btw, this is a very free interpretation of a vienna imho)
Deep gold color. Fluffy white head. Citrusy hoppy nose with biscuity malt overtones. Assertive hop flavors are well balanced by the strong malts. Clean finish.
Small amount of citrus taste and a good thick head. Nice body for a lager. I really enjoyed this with some NY pizza.

UPDATED: NOV 11, 2003 On a warm Saturday afternoon in May, took one of those bikerides that took me a lot further than I probably should have went.  During a much needed pit-stop, I enjoyed two excellently poured pints of this Lager accompanied by a heaping order of pommes frites with curry mayonaise.  This is a filling and smooth, albeit pretty typical lager.  Hints of toasted nuts and citrus.  Hopsy, but not overboard.  A little bite never hurt anyone.  Good head and sweet aroma.  Too bad the frites gave me indigestion on that long ride home!  I've never been let down by a Brooklyn beer!

UPDATED: NOV 13, 2003 Pours a medium orangish brown fluffy head that sticks around. Mild aroma of soft floral hops and dough. Flavor is of soft floral hops and a nice doughy malt profile. Near room tempature a slight caramel malt flavor comes in. The hops and malt are very well balanced. The palate is very creamy especially if you get some of the head in your sip. Medium-full bodied for a lighter lager.

The term "Lager" is such a generic term to use on a label as I have seen it used for a range of styles, vienna to helles.  It can be deceptive.  Well this is a vienna, deep gold in color with a creamy substantial head.  Floral hop aroma with some orange and pine.  A sweet malt taste with a dry slightly bitter end.  A nice taste but seems to lack body for this style.

Dark amber colour with a VERY dense off-white head. Nice powerful hoppy aroma. Great balance in the aroma with malt as well. Some alcohol in the scent. Medium to Light-Bodied; Slighly acidic taste with subtle malt and noticeable hops. Aftertaste bittered from the hops and left flavourful. Overall, a very good beer-better than I had expected and definately reccomended! I bought this twelve ounce bottle at Beers of the World and sampled it on 16-October-2003.
Although I prefer Ales to Lagers, this lager makes up for the lack in hops with its fruity yeast.  Definitely a good lager from a quality brewer.
Nice dark lager.  It pours very smoothly with perfect carbonation.  The taste is very balanced and smooth.  This is a well crafted beer.
Dark lager with a hopped aroma, and bitter flavour with a pilsner like finish.  A good quality lager.
Prettty good.  Well-balanced, not to light, great hop flavour but not too bitter.  Smooth and clean.

Head is initially average sized, frothy, off-white, mostly diminishing. Body is clear medium amber. Aroma is moderately hoppy (flowers, grapefruit), moderately malty (caramel, cookie), with a note of apricot. Flavor is moderately sweet, moderately acidic, lightly bitter. Finish is lightly sweet, moderately acidic, moderately bitter. Medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation. A bit sour for my liking, but decent.

UPDATED: OCT 1, 2003 Pours clear copper, smallish white head that sticks around quite well, and leaves good lacing.  Body has a lot of tiny bubbles meandering about.  Aroma is mainly caramel and some other malt sweetness, some hops playing around in the back to balance it out nicely.  Flavor starts with some caramel, middle is clean with a slight fruitiness, ends with a good chewy and tasty hoppiness.  Body is medium, medium carbonation level, easy drinking and smooth.

Light malt and a little floral aroma.  Color is a "clear amber" if there is such a thing.  Nice hoppy initial flavor although it somewhat hides the malt.  Doesn't have the caramel backbone I've come to expect from Vienna's, definitely the most hoppy version that I have tasted.  A bit more malty as the beer warms.  Probably not a true Vienna.

Fairly dark for a lager. The color is amber and it has a thin, lasting white head. Strong aroma of hops with some maltiness in the background. It has a medium body with medium carbonation and a smooth, creamy mouthfeel. The flavor is malty up front with lots of hops that come through. The finish is long and lingering with a nice hop bitterness and some malty sweetness in the very end. A great lager, one of the better ones I have had.

UPDATED: MAR 16, 2007 re-rate!!! 3/14/07.  Poured a nice golden honey like hue with a thick white head which seemed to have nice lacing.  Aroma was rich with caramel malts as well as some yeasty notes.  A smooth crisp flavor that  plays off its sweet aroma with a nice smooth finish.  good beer.
UPDATED: AUG 25, 2003 This is a light amber lager with a very flowery aroma and flavor. The malt is totally hidden behind the hoppy flowers. Too bad.
(bottle) Deeper gold than mega-macro lagers. Floral aroma. Slighlty sweet malt up front with a surprising amount of hops (for a lager) in the finish. One of my favorite lagers.
Definently one of the better lagers out there.  Nice aroma.  Not as lagery as one might expect.  Well worth a try.

Bottled. Beautiful amber colour, with a medium fluffy, rich white head that persisted throughout. Malty dry aroma, slightly sweet. Totally scrumptious malty, bread-like aroma. Smooth body and palate. Very complete.

Excellent color, very smooth, vaguely hoppy but not excessively bitter. Refreshing but not too light, with plenty of body and a sweet finish. Consistency varies widely, though, from batch to batch. I have had some outstanding cases and others have been almost mediocre.
This is a very smooth easy drinking perfect to start a night of drinking with...Wonderful citrus aroma with lots of hops exploding from the bottle....very smooth and refreshing
Big head, copper body.  Hoppy, floral and citrusy nose.  Very hoppy, good malts.  Is this really a vienna?  Doesn't taste a thing like Dos Equis.

This was the most abundant beer from Brooklyn that I found on tap in NYC.  A decent body reminds me that all lagers are not terrible--there is a grassy, sortof tart, acidic profile to this beer as well.  I enjoyed this beer with some spicy Chinese fusion cuisine.

UPDATED: APR 18, 2005 A really good lager, somewhat in the mold of Samuel Adams Boston Lager, but much better. Sweetish malts give way too a nicely hoppy spicy, dry-ish finish, lots of flavour, yet mildly refreshing, really nice quaffer.
i was hoping not to be disappointed with this beer but I was.  Very nice color but that is as far as it goes.  Very light bodied, no aroma, no head and a bad aftertaste.
user_location: HdG (past: NYC, KS, Rain City), Maryland, USA

text: Yeh this was quite nice, a bit pricey here - but i probably would try again.

This is a pretty tasty vienna lager - light copper - small head but good lacing - aroma is sweet and slightly flowery - pretty heavy and malty for a lager - with a decent amount of hopping as well, rounding out this unusually creamy vienna - slightly buttery as well - one of my new favorite lagers.

Clear amber brew with a small, creamy white head. Good lacework.
The aroma is floral and malty with a hint of cocoa.
This lager tastes hearty, malty and well-hopped. Acetic, not bitter, hops seem to have been used. Excellent balance.
Light-bodied with a creamy mouthfeel and fairly lively carbonation. Short, crisp finish. Like all other viennas that I've tasted, this beer would probably go very well with a meal.
First tried on tap at a social function. Nice beer. It has a thick, rich flavor. Substantial is a good word. A great everyday drinker.

Flavours run deep and are complex.Nice appearance but I couldn't get away from a slightly 'tinny' feel and an aftertaste that whilst not unpleasant certainly wasn't the most friendly I have come across, Having read reviews raving about this one I have got to say that I feel a bit dissapointed.Its all a matter of taste butI cant help feel that this is an overrated beer-boring and old fashioned label as well.

A great Vienna - not quite as crisp as Elliot Ness or, especially, Riverwest Stein, but completely traditional and lovely - all butter and caramel here, but crisp nonetheless, only a tad flowery, tight hallertau ending. Yum.
user_location: Łódż, Warsaw, Poland; Michigan, Ohio, USA

text: THIS was actually my farewell beer as my I bought at departure at airport. Liked it better in a large glass than the sips from friends plastic cup at brewery (not fair asssessment). Much better than I had thought, though not particularly special. Round mouth feel and good balance for what is essentially an easy drinker. An all night session perhaps, though I would perhaps head for "higher ground" by personal choice.

Hoppy, definitely; somewhat fruity (grapefruit comes mostly to mind, but it is mild).  An interesting variation on the style, and a welcome relief, even if I'm not ultimately a fan.  (on tap, Brooklyn Brewery)

Medium golden peach color with substantial white head. Mild aroma of floral hops and some malt. Well balanced 
crisp flavor with a medium body. Flavor has mild malt beginning leading to a clean hop middle. Finish is 
simlarly balanced, slightly hoppy, full, and somewhat dry. Lingering pleasant aftertaste.
a decent lager, though not the best of the brooklyns.  found the hops to be a bit too pungent, but at least they're high quality hops.
Amber color and lasting head.  This lager was refreshing and easy to drink.  Very floral aroma and taste.  A great beer.

I initially tried this because Kung Pao likes to drink it.  I just don't know what they see in it.  It also features the distinct, awful aftertaste that ruins so many of Brooklyn Brewery's otherwise good beers.
floral almost nutty aroma, pours with a dark cloudy-ish copper hue, moderate head, decent lacing, hoppy and fresh taste, slightl flowery, enjoyable and refreshing.
On tap, this is an all around good and easy to drink beer. Well balanced with a decent amount of hops, has a slight honey taste. Pretty good lager from a great brewery.

A fairly good beer. 
Relatively hoppy with a berrylike aroma. Tasty stuff.

Sweet malt nose, reddish amber pour with a dark white head.  Suprising amount of head for a lager.  The flavor is laden with light hops malt and fruity undertones.  Good for an american lager.  I was pleasently suprised.

UPDATED: AUG 14, 2005 Pretty ale-like for a lager, this brew matched their Pennant ales fruity esthers but has a more rounded, soft profile. A clean finish makes this a smooth drinking brew. Overall a bit boring, but certainly drinkable in a pinch.

UPDATED: JUL 15, 2003 Clear amber with medium of-white head.  The aroma is sweet, floral, some bready.  Taste is medium sweet, floral, some tart.  Finish is light grassy and floral.  Mild bitterness.  Has a medium body -- readily drinkable, and a real delight.  Great lager for an anti-lager person.

Nice copper color, very malty nose. A sweet iced tea taste. Some have commented on the hoppiness, I found it underhopped for my taste but as this is a Vienna, I guess it is to style. Not bad but doesn't knock your socks off either.

A deep red beer with a fine slightly orange head. Very lovely fruity aroma with sweet malt notes. The flavor lacks a little compared to the aroma - a little watery to start off, but then a sweet nice bitterness hits the back of the tongue and lingers for a long time. A very nice lager.
Like the Brown Ale, smooth and full, with bold head, but hoppy with little aftertaste.
Malty nose.  Cooper hue with a large head.  Dry hopped taste that is watery.  Very little after taste.  Not very inspiring at all.

Very nice maltiness and decent hops level - bit of Band-Aid. Some brown sugar and a little grapefruit. Creamy/foamy slight off-white lacing head atop orange-amber (tea), slightly hazy liquid. Medium body - not too watery. Medium carb but not lively. Not an impressive flavor profile - beats American standards but I've had better Viennas. Bit more hops/malts than Yuengling, but still kind of watery. Clean finish. I'd drink it again, but not really seek it out over some others.

not bad. can't really taste any malt, and the hops are present but not overwhelming. amber-y with a creamy head. nothing fantastic, but probably a good session beer (i'll have to report back after i drink this one all night).
Has an orange-amber color and a slightly skunky smell.  Taste is also slightly skunky and finishes with a light bitterness.  Overall I did not like this beer too much due to the skunky flavoring.

Unexpectedly caramel/orange body, moderately carbonated, with a filmy off-white head.  Sweet malt, light esters in the nose (apple and sweet potato), floral as well.  Tea-like flavors, earthy, woody, with a drying finish.  A nice effort, but I find it to be a bit too dry and lacking in the thirst quenching department.

UPDATED: FEB 2, 2003 Amber with a creamy head. The first thing I notice is a very strong floral hop presence. While this is pleasant, it overwhelms other flavors. Still, this is a very tasty and original lager. A must try if you're in NYC.

Bottled. Deep Amber, moderate head and good condition. Initial flowery hop aromas followed by a malty toast and bread note. Pine resin, hops and citrus notes in the mouth with some caramel malt and a long hoppy finish that dries toward the end.

Orangish appearance and pouring a bizarre cylindrical cream head that forms a pint sized missile. Easy malt aroma with lightly malted body and flecks of bitterness. This vienna is delicately malted with a definite hop backbone. Okay for a vienna and a bit watery over the tongue.
Dunno, its just I like my lagers not to taste like ale. Full on the palate with a sweet aftertaste. Not an unpleasant beer at all, just not to my taste...

This beer poured onto the glass a medium to dark gold color. The head was of a full consistency and the color of white. The aroma was a balance of malts and hops. The taste was exactly like the aroma, bitter hops and sweet malts balancing each other. This is a decent example of the style of beer that it represents.

UPDATED: MAR 8, 2004 Bunny Roast through the prison bars. Barely dressed, some saliva smeared fur glistens in the moonlight. Soft moans amongst the tick-tick-tick of scurrying rats. The tea is served when all have gasped their way to conclusion. Bunny Roast slips out leaving a bitter memory. But let's be honest, dry hopping a below standard Vienna makes it interesting rather than good. If only the base lager had more character then this would be one beast of a brew. [1.9]  Bottle  Head to Head with Sam Adams Boston Lager. Malt tones with a sour fruit note. Cardboard and old beer. Tastes a bit fresher than the Boston, allowing some flavours to come through: orange; honeysuckle. Interesting.
nothing special, had it a few times now.  I agree that it is very good beer to keep on tap and does seem almost like a pale ale.
Subtle malty aroma emanates from this deep copper colored brew.  The body is mellow and moderately bitter with just a hint of sweetness.  It finishes crisp with a nice balance of malt and hops.
Amber with lasting off white head. Med hop nose and taste.Long hop finish. Small bead, good lace. Hopped like Pale not Lager
Yeah, I agree with the others.  Quite a bit like a pale ale.  Extremely full bodied and complex.  So nice on tap.

"the pre-prohibition beer".  well, its held up pretty well for its age. in fact, i do
have a bottle a tad beyond the freshness date, but it has the stamina of a toyota and fired up like a champ.  color is bright fawn, almost clear, wearing a crown of creamy head well supplied with a steady stream of upwardly mobile bubbles. modest nose of office papers, oatmeal raisin cookies. lively palate, tasty dinner roll kind of flavor, hoppy as a one legged-frog, but certainly competitive for an vienna. given that ive apparently missed the big hoppiness reported by others, ill have to try this one again.
Nice floral hops, almost like a pale.  The best lager Ive had, mainly because it doesnt taste like a lager!

Tasted at the Barrelhouse Brewing Company Microbrew Fest on November 9. Honey-colored with with a minimal head. Dry hops flavor with a decent finish. Not on the same scale as the Black Chocolate Stout but decent nonetheless.
Nice ruby colour, most un-lager like!  This is the best lager I have ever had.  Mainly because it is an IPA.  Similar, but not as good as, Worthington White Shield.
whatever...its a beer...nothing special...wouldnt buy it again.
UPDATED: FEB 14, 2006 Fruity, almost bitter ale aroma.  Shockingly amber colored. Clingy foam.  Super hoppy.  Tangy with an excellent balance.  Hearty palate with long finish.  More!
One of the better known lagers made in the United States. I could drink this beer many times over. Smooth and great flavor.
This stuff is pretty kick-ass.  Well balanced, dry, hoppy, delicious.  One of my favorite lagers.  Mad props, yo.

I bought this beer cheap at the local servo when I was visiting my mates house to make sausages. Basically it was nice and cold, but nothing flashy: just a good honest beer with hints of petrol and jack-hammer fluid. There was also a hint of tar to keep you rev heads out there interested. Plenty of upholstery in the finish, well hopped and palate fresh like Judas in a Valiant. Peace.

Picked this one up for less than six for a six and was absolutly amazed at the quality of this beer. With expectations of macro-swill this stuf came straight out of the bottle suprising me with a dark amber brown color and a medium but lasting white head. Taste has a hop overtone with the maltiness hidden in the back teasing. I will buy this again anda I will be buying some for all of my friends.
Whats the deal with this beer - its hopped to all hell and is nothing like a typical vienna.  It should be called an Imperial Vienna.
A beer with a good quality taste.  I tried it in New YOrk and was pleased with the quality.

Golden copper hue.  Quickly dissipating head, but leaves a little lace.  Sweet malt aroma, slight hops.  This brew is incredibly balnced, awesome hops, very firm brew.  An awesome lager, very nicely done.

Wonderful, fruity malt with excellent hop flavor and beautifully balanced bitterness.  This beer reminds me of Samuel Adams Boston Lager circa 1991 (I believe Samuel Adams has changed its recipe).  Is this really a "Vienna"?  The hops are rather pronounced--I would call this style "East Coast Lager."
Nice lager.  Bigger bolder than normal.  Then again, normal for me is American Marcobrew, so lots is better than that.  Nice coppery apperance.  Good hoppy edge.  Very nice beer.

More powerful and flavorful than your standard lagers.  Suprises you with lots of flavor that makes you want a second sip.  Semi-dry and hoppy with a bitter aftertone.  Amber brown hue that is mildly carbonated.  Scintillating head tickles your nose hairs and tingles your taste buds.  Very good from a keg!  Try with your favorite pizza.
VERY impressive lager...dark and rich and full-bodied..very nice balance between the malt and hops in this one...highly recommneded
Dark amber color.  Strong aroma of alcohol.  Sometimes the beer has a bitter bite to it, which is unenjoyable.  Full flavored compared to a lot of lagers at the grocery store today.

Telephone poles glimpsed through the fogged window of a 52 DeSoto, the droplets of condensation turning to a golden dew.  Suddenly you are in a moonlit clearing in a deep, green forest.  Just you and the golden dew of the coming dawn, which you decide to drink. You become a worshipper of the golden dew, and join with others dancing in the moonlight and singing to the moon.  The moons name is Garrett.  It answers, worship me, for I am the Great Garrett.  I shall supply you with the Golden Dew as long as I am placated with sacrifice.  But what kind of sacrifice, oh Great Garrett? you answer.  I demand little.  Only a 1952 DeSoto, with blue simulated leather seats.  Oh Great Garret, my DeSoto has seafoam green seats, but you may have it.  Not good enough, answers the Great Garrett, I must therefore demand the ultimate sacrifice. You and all of the moon dancers must chop down the mightiest tree in the forest with a...wait, thats been done before, sorry, ok you and your fellow moon dancers must consume nothing but Smirnoff Ice for a thousand, thousand lifetimes.  Then, and only then, will I supply thee with more of the Golden Dew.  And so it was written, and so it was done.  And for a thousand thousand lifetimes, the people drank Smirnoff Ice.  Twas a dark and tasteless time, but after much suffering, it was over.  And the Great Garret joined the Brooklyn Brewery and fulfilled the destiny of the moon dancers.  The End.

UPDATED: NOV 9, 2003 Pours with a bright crisp amber body topped by a medium thick head with good lacing left on the glass. The aroma is slightly sweet and malty with caramel notes and hoppy undertones. The flavor is sweet, caramelly, and malty with a hoppy background and a hoppy finish. Smooth and light bodied.
The favorite American lager to date! Full bodied(for a lager) nice malt balnce and quite hoppier then whats out there.
Great American lager. Quite hoppy, sort of a half IPA. Great summer brew. Mellow bitter brew with a hint of roasted malt. Very drinkable with a slightly dry finish.
very hoppy for a lager. probably the hoppiest lager ive ever had. very similar to an ipa. my only complaint is it could have more malt flavor

From a bottle.  This beer is not very good at all.  The nose and the palate give off a very oxidized carachteristic, and in general the beer is completely lackluster.  It reminds me of Yeungling Lager.

(BB 11/02) Pasteurized to the point of no return. Everything out of the FX Matt brewery in Utica, NY (with the exception of BCS, because it is not pasteurized) is a well below average beer. Every beer taste cooked/oxidized. Drink Brooklyn lager on draft. The draft version comes from Brooklyn, NY and is not pasteurized.

man i dont normally drink lagers cause id rather spend my money on some knida ale but when my buddy offered me one im not gonna say  no. I was quite suprised nice full body falvor. with a little hop finish

perhaps a little too much hops in the taste for a good lager, but i dont think this would be considered a vienna.  Nice color but the head didnt last at all.  It is an overall good tasting beer and i could drink a few of these, but I would much rather have thier brown ale.

Something went wrong.  I was expecting so much when I popped the cap on this beer.  Reviews were good.  To its credit, theres a substantial hop presence, but the end product just isnt all that tasty and drinkable to me.

Pours a deep tawny golden color. Thick, frothy head lasts a long time. Aroma of  fresh hops greets the drinker (Cascades?).  Wow! Very impressive lager! Well balanced malty to hops…maybe just a bit hoppier than expected. Reminiscent of Samuel Adams Boston Lager in style and flavor but better. The bottle calls this “The Pre-Prohibition beer.” If so, they knew what they were doing back then. It’s difficult to classify this beer to a particular style though. Definitely not a Pils and the hops are too evident for a Munich, Dortmunder or Vienna. Whatever it is, it is good. The amount of hops in this beer is on par with a fine American pale ale. Excellent job. I really enjoyed it.
One of the better american lagers on the market.

I knew right off jump that I was in for a treat when I mistook the look of this with a Boylens Cream Soda Pop!...Smoooooth caramel flavor with a pleasant roasted wheat nose....drink this one chilled and enjoy...Yeah this one here is some fine beer!
user_location: Dumont (Irish Headquarters USA), New Jersey, USA

text: pretty average. tastes just like any average american lager. the flavor was very mild, but i could drink 20 of them.

a tasty lager, but I thought it was a little lighter than other Viennas that ive had (ie: Elliot Ness).  had a nice thick caramel malt taste, lightly hopped.  typical top qaulity from this brewer.  will give some of this to my macro drinking friends to try.
Damn flavorful. This beer got me addicted to microbrews from the first time I tried it. One of my favorites!
I bought this beer because I never had it before.  Ill buy it again, because it impressed me so much. For a lightish lager, you cant go wrong with this.
Deep brown color and rather oily on the palate, no doubt from the heavy addition of hops. Rather grassy aroma and a nice dense and creamy head.
Too fruity for my taste, had a decent hoppie taste to it, but the fruit was just too much for me to give this beer much of a rating. Mediocore at best, even when compared to other fruity beers.
Deep amber color and a pleasant aroma with a hint of fruityness.  An average flavor which is a bit too dry for my liking.  A light hoppy aftertaste that is good at first, but gets rather dull.

UPDATED: FEB 19, 2007 Clear amber/copper. Decent head and lace. Nose full of malt,caramel and some toasty notes. Medium bodied, some crystal malt on the palate with some caramel like toasty edges,with decent floral hop bite. Hightly drinkable  and clean. A kicking it back brew and one I always have in my fridge.
Not a bad lager.  Different than some.
NOT BAD, SOMEWHAT FRUITY LAGER, WITH A VERY FRESH AFTERTASTE. FOR SOME REASON , I WOULDNT WANT TO DRINK MORE THAN 6 OF EM, BUT A WORTHY BEER NONE THE LESS.
Well, it was late at night and a long time ago. Nothing special comes to mind.
Fruity, full of flavours, a bit sweet. Long aftertaste.
Much better out of the tap.  Good clean lager.
damn fine beer.  sure, im probably biased being a new yorker and all, but hell, its good stuff regardless.
Vienna Lager is very good, this beer reminded me of an Octoberfest brew.
It was great. Had it this past summer. Had several. Great taste, Smooth going down. Would drink again for sure.
user_location: Port Jefferson Station, New York, USA

text: Puts many American lagers to shame. Its a crisp, hoppy, smooth, brew with a slightly toasty aroma. Great brewery. Very solid beer.

A very nice amber vienna lager.  smooth and easy o drink.
at first taste it seemed sweet and overly malty but then the hops kicked in. great floral hallertau overtones here.

this would make an ideal session beer.  
maybe the  best vienna lager in the east coast. great lakes Elliot Ness is a close second.
Good regional brew.  Goes with everything
Excellent Hallertau aroma and flavor with some nice toasty/sweet malt undertones. Crisp and clean and easy drinking. A good pizza brew. Reminescent of Sam Adams Lager.
Good beer.  Great brewery!
Did several blind, side by side taste tests with this and Sam Adams and Sam Adams won everytime.  Good beer though.
Quite hoppy for a lager. Which is not a bad thing. Kinda good actually. Nothing too impressive, just a pretty good beer.

Improved greatly on my second tasting.  At first I found it a bit bland, but on a second try it had a nice, smooth maltiness to it, somewhat reminiscent of a light, nutty pale ale.  An interesting contrast, and a good flavor.

I had this one off the tap at a great bar (Sunset Grill in Allston, MA) A very nice hoppy beer but I thought it went down a little rough.  I would definitely try this one again and probably even pick up a 6 pack if I could find it.
Its a really nice, hoppy lager.  Feels great in the mouth.

UPDATED: MAY 10, 2003 As I always rail against Lager/Pilsners, I must say this is one of the few that I really like and could drink on a regular basis, if available and Ales went extinct!

A translucent deep amber to copper color on the pour, a prestigious bright white head, generous lace and a nice clean and crisp nose. Start is loaded with malt, somewhat sweet, the top is moderate in its feel to the palate, with the finish stinging in its acidity, the hops stout in their spiciness, dry aftertaste, a great drinking beer, I Like It!

Im re-rating this after a 2nd tasting and raising
the score.  It does have a strong malt presence like
a Vienna lager, but it also has more hop presence
than most Vienna lagers.  Also, had a nice firm head
and lace lasting the whole glass.  This is now one
of my favorite lagers.

Im a hophead, so naturally Im partial to ales over lagers. However, some lagers make up for their hop-inadequacy by having a real tasty yeast that exudes fruity esters. I found a little of that in this beer. It was a little more flavorful than I expected. However, it still missed the mark. Id rather have a Czech lager. It was three steps up from the traditional, American Lager though.
